The same late game renegade build can help speed run other dungeons as well.
[Ice Golem Video Guide](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SgTUEJb-2x4)

data.label: Notes:
data.desc: If you would like to see the build for Renegade click on the previous page number

data.label: Accuracy
data.desc:
Normal  50
Hard  80+
Brutal 120+
Nightmare 170+
Ultra-Nightmare 230+
Accuracy over 180+ for Nightmare clan boss and 250+ for Ultra-Nightmare clan boss won't yield additional benefits based on the tests. With Vizier can get away with the base thresholds. Note the weak hits on anti-affinity are at 35% and debuffs won't land then.

data.label: Speed
data.desc:
How much speed you need for cb: 
Normal 140+
Hard 150+
Brutal 160+
Nightmare 170+
Ultra-Nightmare 190+
Note that you can use the speed tuning for the previous tier, e.g. 170+ on unm if you skip the first two AOE attacks. Check deadwoodjedi.com for speed tunes.

This guide will feature Delver, who is not a very commonly used hero, referred by some as the Vault Guadian.

This guide will cover three areas: UNM clan boss, spider 20 run under 1 minute, and arena. 

This is a late game guide and Delver will need some specific setups to bring out her true potential as well as booking. Delver have tricky skill but essential debuff on this game: single target weaken 25% and aoe decrease defend 60%. The tricky part is (1) her A2 requires the enemy to a have heal reduction debuff to land weaken debuff but this debuff CANNOT BE RESISTED (2) her A3 places 50% increase atk 2 turns before attacking and PLACES a 60% decrease def debuff but if there is weaken debuff on enemy. A lot of conditions need to met right?

First thing we need to consider are the masteries. This Delver is built for UNM clan boss. Hence, Warmaster is out priority with a defense mastery retribution as the second choice. For spider runs her AOE skill is also helpful, because warmaster damage proc can do 123k-ish damage to the big spider.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Artifact sets depend on the team composition you are using Delver in. 

For example, if you are using her in an unkillable composition for UNM or Arena you might want to choose cruel + speed set or savage+speed. Or if you would like to focus on dungeons you might need accuracy set to get enough accuracy to land that two essential debuff. Lifesteal set for survivability could also be the answer.

Since this build is geared towards UNM clan boss and using unkillable team, 1 speed set and 1 accuracy set is sufficient.The right speed has to be reached maximum dps is a priority along with sufficient accuracy.

It will be beneficial to get high atk stat since her base damage is atk, crit rate 100% and as high  crit damage as possible. 


Glove: Crit Damage % (Preferably) or Crit Rate % (If you cannot achieve 100%)
Chest: Atk
Boots: Speed
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
1. UNM clan boss

For Clan Boss Delver can truly shine in a specific unkillable setup. This tune is called Mansalad: 2 Maneaters, Painkeeper, Ma'Shalled, and Delver. Note that without two Maneaters it would be difficult to replicate this success. They are the key element to this composition.

Delver's skills are tricky but Ma'shalled A3 can place a heal reduction debuff on the clan boss. This comp has a 2:1 ratio  of turns starting from turn 7 (if you're confused, visit deadwoodjedi.com for speed tunes). This means she can can consistently keep weaken and Decrease Def on CB, unless it's magic affinity. 

What if you dont have Ma'shalled? Theoritically you can make her work. If you use the Batman comp, Delver may be enough because her A1 can hit heal reduction debuff. However, if you want more consistency, consider using the cursed artifact set that has a 50% chance to land heal reduction debuff on one of the champions.

You can find a video of a UNM run with Delver in the following video:

https://youtu.be/09m2lNnFxYo 

2. Spider 20 run under 1 minute

Delver can help with spider 20. The featured team is: Royalguard (lead and affinity tank), Seer, Delver, Coldheart, and Renegade. Since our champion can place Decrease Defense as long as there is a weaken debuff, Seer can help enable Delver on auto. The Speed tunes for those runs are, 210 CH, 205 Seer, 203 Delver, 165 RG, and 95 Renegade. The turn order is CH A2, Seer A2, Delver A3, RG A2, CH A3, Seer A3, Renegade reduce cooldown.

Why not stag knight or tayrel for Decrease Def? What is good about this composition is that all spiderlings  are cleared so they dont get a chance to get a turn. This speeds up the runs. If stag knight or tayrel are used, they cant kill spiderlings with their skills because does not hit as hard as delver does. 

The video below demonsrates

http://imgur.com/a/sYM3EIM 

3. Arena 

Like what i explain above as long as there is weaken, her A3 will hit hard

Delver arena:
http://imgur.com/a/X9DVkNf 
http://imgur.com/a/CjlnYZm
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Miscreated Monster is a very well rounded champion that serves many roles in dungeon progress. Be it Nightmare Campaign or any Dungeon 20, he can help you complete it and inch towards the end of the Arbiter quest line. He is well worth investing books in at early to  late game stages.
 
His kit is best utilized when built with significant damage, and for this reason we will take Offense and Support masteries. We scale Miscreated Monster's damage by building crit rate and damage, so in this build Flawless Execution as the Tier 6 talent down the Offense tree was taken. The support tree will be useful for accuracy to land his AoE stun, and for the turn meter support. 

You can build with a Helmsmasher Mastery for tier 6 if your equipment is better and you can build enough HP and crit rate+damage.

Although Miscreated Monster does not require full masteries to work, he is one of the most useful epic champions in the game for progression.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Miscreated Monster works best when built for damage, because his real tankiness comes from his massive shields granted by his A2 ability Lightning Storm. 

Since he is an HP champion and his abilities scale in damage with HP, we want to focus on scaling HP with crit. Therefore, the strongest sets are going to be Speed, Accuracy, Immortal and Critical Damage, but he is quite flexible and it is important to prioritize gear with the best stats and not try to force set bonuses unless the gear pieces are good enough. 

Glove: Crit Rate % / Crit Damage % / HP%
Chest: HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: DEF
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy / Def

AoE stuns are extremely valuable for keeping waves controlled, so we want to build at least 200 accuracy so he does not get resisted too often. Speed is also important for getting more turns, and it is recommended to build about 215 speed to make sure MM is going twice for every single turn enemy waves take - a speed lead or turn meter booster can help significantly. 

The next priority is reaching 100% crit rate, and then as much HP and crit damage as possible. Gloves should be crit rate, crit damage, or HP% depending on the sub stats of your other gear. 

Chest is always HP% and boots will be speed or HP% if you have insane gear. Aim for about 60-80k HP for optimal results.

For rings and amulets, you can use Defense as his base stat is very low and this is the most efficient way to give him enough survivability against big AoE hits to teams that have his Ally Protection buff. The banner is always Accuracy or flat defense if you already have accuracy covered.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Spider 20 is the Dungeon where where Miscreated Monster can truly shine. His team shield is dependent on damage. With both the big spider and the small spiderlings he can conjure a trully massive shield for the team and save even the most squishy heroes. 

A staple for any Spider 20 team, MM can be used in almost any Spider 20 team including AOE HP burn teams, Nuke teams or Tank teams.

You can find MM in more Dungeon Runs on the next page

https://youtu.be/3r_iO8lzaVQ?t=343
data.label: Spider

data.desc:
Alure is one of the best champions in the game that can single-handedly carry your team on the Fire Knight Boss, despite being a negative affinity on FK 20. Her triple hit A1 can help bring down the shields and once the shield is down. She can permanently keep the Fire Knight’s Turn Meter down. However, she will not help you with dealing with the waves or dealing damage to the boss. You will still need your other champions in the team to carry here there. She is also very vulnerable to dying so it is advisable to have a healer and/or reviver in your team because if Alure dies, it is very likely that the run will fail.

Alure is very cheap to build because you do not need to book her at all or need masteries on her.  It is actually advised not to book her since lowering the cooldown on her other skills means she uses her A1 less. 

Although you don’t need masteries, building masteries will definitely improve her performance. If you do decide to build her masteries, I suggest the Offense and Support tree. The only important mastery on the offense tree is Crit rate to help get her to 100%. On the support tree, you want to get accuracy, Lore of Steel for extra stats and Evil Eye for additional control. She doesn’t need any T5 or T6 mastery to do her job, although Giant Slayer for additional damage can be handy in faction wars. The below mastery is the only impactful mastery for her build so, you can save your energy with minimal farming on Minotaur for her mastery.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important stats you want to build on Alure are Crit Rate, Accuracy and Speed. You need her to be at 100% crit rate because her A1 only lowers Turn Meter if she crits. At least 200 accuracy is needed to be able to lower the TM on Stage 20 dungeons. Build as much speed as possible, preferably at least 200+. You need her to be able to go faster than the enemy to lap them and keep their turn meter down. This is important since Alure is negative affinity to the Fire Knight so, she has a 35% chance to weak hit and weak hits will not crit and reduce TM. She needs to be fast enough to be able to go again before the Fire Knight takes a turn if you are unlucky with weak hits.  

The other stat you want to build on her is HP%. You need her to have as high HP as possible so she can survive. In terms of sets, you can use any  as long as you meet her stat requirements but the best sets to have on her are Speed, Accuracy, or Perception.

Glove: Crit Rate 
Chest: HP %
Boots: Speed 
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP (With Accuracy Substats)
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
The video demonstrates a FK 20 run where she is the only TM control champion and she handedly kept the Fire Knight’s TM down the entire fight. Alure is very vulnerable to dying so it is advisable to have a healer and reviver like Apothecary and Gorgorab as shown in the video to support the team.

You can see how important Evil Eye Masteries are in keeping the Fire Knight turn meter down with the initial hits and how well things start to look after Decrease Speed from Stag Knight is placed on the boss

https://youtu.be/8vJjDuEg5lM
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Late Game is the beginning of specialization for builds. This build will be focused on Clan Boss and late game dungeons.

The masteries for Skullcrusher are selected to make him survive as long as he can. There are a few masteries that are important to tacke high-end content like Nightmare Clan Boss.

Warmaster with lifesteal set is the staple for this build unless you have amazing healers, e.g. two Bad El Kazars in your team. Skullcrusher doesn't buff counterattack on himself. In later rounds of Clan Boss this becomes a problem as his health dips very low.

In Late Game having Retribution and Deterrence masteries helps him counterattack the clan boss and hard hitting enemies and get some of the hp back. It's a strong combination if utilised correctly.

Do not use any masteries with skill recharge or turn meter boosting! It will mess everything up.

Skullcrusher passive skill does not prevent the stun and breaks up the speed tune, so avoid the clan boss stun if you're using the classic speed tune (Slide 3)
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Set: lifesteal + anything. Focus on defence with enough speed. The more defence you can get, the better. Some hp is nice to have so that SC can soak up more damage with ally protection.

The main focus will be to keep the speed high enough for the speed tune

Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - def
Banner - def
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
We are now at the part where Skullcrusher lives up to his potential. A core concept for clan boss is speed tuning your team around skullcrusher counterattack.

If your SC has 171 speed and your other heroes have 172-181 speed you will be able to have counterattack up for heroes on both clan boss AOE attacks. This leads to massive damage output increase with t6 masteries and higher reliability of runs. This is conditional on no TM boosting masteries in the team and this is the classical speed tune. There are other variants of tunes discussed in Late Game+ pages. This speed can also work on UNM if the first two AOE attacks are skipped.

SC can help achieve high levels of dragon and Fire Knight. He can also be useful on Spider 20 as a tank (see the Renegade guide for reference).

The following videos showcases a simple Skullcrusher tune for Nightmare Clan Boss. 

https://youtu.be/3WrnDqIRKKY

A few takeaways for teams with counterattack in the video:

1. Always keep the counterattack cycles even. Have a dedicated champion to take the stun or something to prevent it (block debuffs of cleanse)
2. You want attack down to be on the clan boss especially in the latter rounds, get a hero with a1 attack down
3. The order in which the heroes counterattack is important and it's set up in the original screen. The first to make the counter in this example is the leader, then banshee, then bogwalker, then rhazin. Have your debuff extenders go last and important debuffers go first
4. You can see how Rhazin in Stalwart is not surviving long enough without the lifesteal set without a healer
5. Having Defence Down and Weaken considerably improves the damage
6. Rhazin, Banshee and Skullcrusher have Late Game+ stats here, so focus on at least 3 key NM first

There are more complicated variations for clan boss discussed in Late Game+ guide and combinations with other Epic and Legendary heroes that can be built to tackle the most difficult content
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
The following masteries are mainly designed for arena. Elhain in this build can be used as a dungeon wave clearer, however it is not the most optimal build for the dungeons. All masteries that provide maximum damage output were selected. Since Elhain is a multi-hit AOE champion, you want to maximize her ability to finish fight as quickly and efficiently as possible, thus on tier 4 offence tree 'bring it down' was prioritized over cycle of violence as most high end arena fights involve what is called a speed + nuke team that end in 1 or 2 turns.
 
For the defence tree, after many trials the following masteries were selected ending with cycle of Revenge to provide additional turn meter boost if Elhain is being added to the team to counter Hegemon defences (however, due to overall low base stats on defence and HP she is not the ideal damage dealer for this job). Many players will chose 'retribution' on tier 5 defence mastery, however you might run into a potential danger of triggering enemy speed/support champions cycle of revenge and/or timely intervention which might cost you speed advantage resulting in a loss. 

For tier 6 masteries, like with vast majority of end game arena AOE damage dealers 'Helm Smasher' is the highest priority mastery due to maximum potential to deal the most damage to the targets.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gear is perhaps the most important aspect of the late game+ and gearing your champions correctly for the roles they will perform is extremely crucial. In the instance of Elhain being used a heavy AOE damage dealer, most attention should be paid to her Attack value, 100% Crit Rate, as much Crit Damage as possible and of course enough Speed so she can take a turn before enemy and if any left over sub stats allow you to boost HP, DEF and Resistance. Accuracy is absolutely not needed as she doesnt apply any debuffs on any of her abilities.
  
Ideally the best results will be from Savage + Cruel sets or 3 sets of Cruel gear on her, however due to potential difficulties in obtaining pieces from these sets other sets can be used such as Attack, Immunity and lastly just 6 odd pieces from broken sets, as long as overall stats are good. However the most universal set of gear you can have on your damage dealer is Immunity. Immunity allows you to ignore enemy Tormins, crowd control Hegemons, passives from Krisks, etc. basically anything that might put debuff on your champion. For the main stats you absolutely most have the following:


Glove - crit dmg %
Chest - atk %
Boots - speed or atk % ( if enough speed can be attained from sub stats ).
Ring - atk
Amulet - crit dmg
Banner - atk

When you are gearing any arena champion the most important part to keep in mind is speed balance between your champions. If you are running a team that is designed to go first, that is where Elhain shines, all your champions have to be speed tuned, so more often than not you will be forced to use speed boots to make sure you have enough speed. So sub stats on rest of the gear are very important if the required amount of Attack and Crit Damage needs to be achieved.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Here are few videos from an actual top Platinum Arena during reset which where recorded, where Elhain is being used as a single damage dealer on a speed team. 

As you can see, having Elhain does not guarantee you are good to go in platinum. Selected masteries, equipment, reaching the required stats is absolutely essential. The featured Elhain build is specialized for dealing maximum amount of damage, but it wouldn't be possible to compete in Platinum without the other champions playing their role of turn meter boosting, buff removal and AOE defense down.

As you will see, enemy teams will feature soft teams as well as teams with Duchess, Rotos and Tormin together. Like with most AOE nuking teams one of the main requirements is to have proper support, so in this case Madame or anyone who can lay defence down or at minimum remove enemy shields is a must to have in order for Elhain to work and do her job efficiently.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l5B0q7uQIV8&ab_channel=AzzaZel
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Mid game for players usually means that the great hall is not well developed. This leads to choosing offense for maximum damage and support tree as an extra source of accuracy
 
Lightsworn lands some of the most useful debuffs on a single target in thegame. Decrease speed and decrease atk are important in almost all stages of the game after mid-game. In a speed setting without counterattack champion we want Lightsworn to make take his turns as often as possible also gain more turn meter when either his debuffs are removed or expire. His 60% increase def buff and revive on death is extremely useful in all areas of the game, so lasting gifts to extend the duration of buffs is a good bonus.

He's one of the unique champs with a 3 hit a1 so it's best to get the Giant Slayer t6 mastery. This enables Lightsworn to deal good damage to clan boss and other dungeon bosses
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
In terms of gear, the goal of Lightsworn in mid-game is to survive and be as fast as possible. Lifesteal set is a safe bet if there are no amazing heroes on the team. He can easily absorb a few hits from a high level dungeon boss this way. Being a defense hero, he can deal some good damage in most areas of the game.

Gloves- crit rate/def%
Chestplate- def%
Boots- speed
Ring- def
Amulet- crit dmg
Banner- acc

Extra sets in the mid game to go with the lifesteal can be: 
1. Accuracy 
2. Defense 
3. Speed

The benchmark for lvl 20 dungeons is up to 200 accuracy. Above 170 speed 3k+ defense and a decent amount of health with as high crit rate and crit damage is required
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Lightsworn can be useful in nearly all areas of the game for mid game accounts and higher. As a void hero he doesn't have any weak hits and can be used on any affinity dungeon level. The combination of his debuffs and defense based attacks makes him a good choice for a core team.

He can be used on dragon, ice golem, lava knight, spider, faction wars with this build.

On Clan Boss he will show the best result either in a counterattack team, where he can push the damage due to Giant Slayer or in an extremely fast speed team. In mid game that is not often easily achievable. The featured Lightsworn cannot handle attack down to reliably stick on Nightmare Clan Boss. However, if he had another debuff extender or another atk down debuffer to help, it would be a real possibility to use him on clan Boss.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In case you are missing the best meta attackers on Arena, e.g. Trunda, Foli, Skullcrown and others you can still use starter champions to take care of the damage dealer role in their stead.

Tthe following masteries are best for the arena. The main focus is on critical hits and damage as well as some survivability. Everything is focused on one goal in this build - dealing the maximum amount of reliable damage. Note that the mastery shield breaker wasn't taken because there is a buff stripping hero in this Arena composition. Furthermore, opportunist synergizes with the sleep debuff from Kymar
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Equipment is the key to make this build work on arena. You want enough attack, critical rate, damage and speed for Kael to work as a damage dealer that is not interrupted.

Gloves - Critical damage
Chest - Attack%
Boots - Speed
Ring - Attack
Necklace - Critical damage 
Banner - Attack
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The sequence of battle if you're going first is standad. Turn meter boost, buff stripping, Def Down placement, AOE Nuke.

Note that this classic strategy might not work well vs teams with Tormin, Hegemon, Valkyrie and some other team compositions.

Spider champion does not make a hit when placing Defense Down and Weaken, so it works against any affinity and it doesn't break the sleep Debuff.

https://youtu.be/IF12ijVyRrc?t=92
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Steelskull is not the smartest champion in terms of AI, but he can be tuned to work really well with the right setup.

In Late game setting he's worth booking thanks to his usefullness on Clan Boss and faction wars. In this guide we'll be focusing on the CB aspect.

The offense mastery tree is quite standard with Warmaster as the final t6 mastery for damage and for healing with a lifesteal set.

The secondary mastery tree can be either defense for extra survivability or support for extra healing power and Lasting Gifts. The latter is not a commonly taken mastery, but in this particular setting with another Def Up champion on the team it doesn't result in mishaps with stuns hitting someone else. 

Sniper is useful for the extra chance to land poisons.

Note the lack of masteries with turn meter boosts due to an AOE counterattack setting for Clan Boss
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Lifesteal is a useful set for Steelskull on Clan Boss. Despite having an AOE heal and shields from Valkyrie as protection, in later rounds you will notice that Warmaster + Lifesteal is able to prolong Steelskull life considerably and increase the overall damage from the cb run.

The second set can be anything, however the speed to 4:3 tune has to be high enough. You can use the speed calculator on deadwoodjedi.com to try and get it done perfectly.

As with most heroes for UNM having around 4200 Defense is preferred and better crit rate and damage is also most welcome. Having around 230-250 accuracy is the usual benchmark. However, in this team composition Vizier takes off a lot of uncertainty about poisons landing.

Gantlets : Defense% / Crit Rate / Crit Damage
Chest : Def % 
Boots : Speed
Ring : Def
Amulet : Def / Crit Damage
Banner : Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
You may find the showcase of the team with Steelskull on UNM below

https://youtu.be/jXghfkEAQtI

Every hero here plays their role well. Sepulcher Sentinel leads with the aura and uses her A2 skill after second clan boss aoe. This allows block debuffs to stay on the whole team during the stun and deal some extra damage. This is important as Steelskull AI is unreliable in removing the stun, especially during the earlier rounds

Stellskull pulls triple duty. He is the poisoner in this composition, though without Vizier it's usually advisable to have another secondary poisoner with him for reliability. He AOE heals the team and casts Def Up on the team increasing their survivability (and damage for Def based champions). Finally, his targeted heal becomes important around turns 30 when Sepulcher Sentinel takes too much Damage from AOE attacks.

Vizier makes the debuffs stick after a few minutes of manual runs.

Rhazin brings Def Down and Weaken in one package, enhancing the damage of the team.

Valkyrie provides AOE Counterattack and brings massive shields to the table making the whole team work well.

Guides are available for all the heroes in this composition.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Masteries are selected as a middle ground for her uses: she has to hit hard and place the debuffs. 

Her primary targets are the force affinity Clan Boss, Mountain King or other force heroes in Arena to knock out using A2 + A1 and the Fire Knight to strip off his shield.

Heart of Glory talent is selected because she is wearing a lifesteal set. Life Drinker is chosen for the Boss and Fire Knight. Blood Shield is extremely useful in Arena and in Dungeon waves, as it increases her survivability. The Support tree helps her get more accuracy and proficiency in placing the debuffs.

She could be used with a Giant Slayer on clan boss or dungeon boss, but since she is used in Arena as well, Warmaster was selected as the final mastery in order for more consistent results
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Crimson Slayer needs to be tough to survive her way to the FK20 or to 20+ turn of Clan Boss, so she has to wear a Lifesteal set. As she has to place her debuffs in a consistent manner, she needs an Accuracy set and an Accuracy banner. Boots are for Speed. Almost every artifact currently on her was farmed in early game. There may be better options, but if this build is good enough for FK20, let it be.

Glove: Crit Rate % 
Chest: ATK %
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Dmg
Banner: Acc

The glove in the screenshot was Atk %. If you can have Crit rate, it's the superior choice
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
While Mashaled and stag knight are top tier heroes for FK 20, without a coldheart a composition with Crimson Slayer is an option against force affinity dungeons and champions. This is an example of her stable performance on FK20. The a1 is extremely useful for stripping the shield and some additional contol on the dungeon waves. 

DANGER: do not rely on her A2 on Auto, more often than not it still does not work as it should.

Her A3 with heal reduction is another useful tool versus FK, however Mashaled takes care of this better than her
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
This Skullcrown guide showcases a slightly different build with Helmsmasher as the final mastery for addtional damage.

Primary tree Offense, secondary tree Defense. She is used as a high end arena nuker so that is how the masteries have been selected.

Key masteries to pick up from Offense tree for all damage dealers are Deadly Precision (5% crit rate), Keen Strike (10% crit dmg), Ruthless Ambush (8% increased dmg on first hit) and Bring It Down (6% increased dmg on higher HP targets.) As for final mastery there are three options. For arena either Flawless Execution (20% crit dmg) if you want steady damage output or Helmsmasher (50% chance to ignore 25% defense) for way more damage on chance. In this guide Helmsmasher is used because Skullcrown doesnt really have tools to deal with tanky champions, she is all about making the first hit lethal. 

If you aim was to use her in PvE content (Faction Wars, Dungeons) the obvious pick would be Warmaster.

Defense tree is picked for  Retribution (50% chance to counterattack when losing 25% HP or more). She has low base HP and her own unkillable passive, so she has a good chance of counterattacking when focused without dying immediately.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Couple of options for sets. 

Arguably the best set would be Savage + Speed. If you cannot get good Savage set, 2nd best would be 2 Cruel + Speed or just Offense + Speed. General idea behind building her is to achieve crit rate 100% and as much crit dmg as you can (preferably over 200%) with enough speed so she doesnt get cut in after your speed buffers in arena (use the Arena calculators to see what her threshold speed is). After you have worked on Crit rate, Crit dmg and Speed you can focus the on the Attack. If you aim to use her in Arena for the most part, Accuracy is not a must since she is all about her nuke.

Glove: Crit Damage (if 100% from substats)
Chest: Attack %
Boots: Speed / Atk
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Dmg
Banner: Atk
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Skullcrown on Arena in the late game is quite straightforward. Arena meta teams consist of turn meter boost, Def down, Nuke.

In the featured video the roles are taken by Arbiter, Seeker for tm boosts, Def Down by Serris and Nuke by Skullcrown. The strategy works really well if you are the fastest and if the speed tuning is done correctly so enemies don't cut in.

https://youtu.be/xIZpDNu51Yg 

Be careful or avoid teams with Tormin, Hegemon or other champions that can prevent your turn order from happening. This includes champions with massive shields, e.g. Krisk or Harvest Jack
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Hope is essentially as a mini version of Sethallia that removes buffs and has high HP so she can place big shields for some team survivability. 

This build is focused on Accuracy (ACC) to be able to have the highest chance to remove enemy buffs and to increase the strength of the shields she places. The ACC won't only be useful to remove buffs, but also to enable her to place block buffs on her A1 skill.

The choice of masteries is focused mainly in reinforcing her role of buff remover/shield placer. Eagle Eye was chosen to make the buff removing more effective and then a combination of ACC, buff extension and maximising the size of the shields with the support tree. Sniper is important for increasing the chances of landing debuffs as they are not 100% at their base. The Defense mastery tree is secondary and it's build around lasting longer and making it harder for the enemies to strip her own buffs with additional resistance. Decreasing the damage she'll receive, to make the shields on herself last longer is the goal
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The featured Hope build is focused mainly on Faction Wars and 3vs3 Arena (Serris plays a similar role).

Her high base HP allows the shields to be quite large, and Shield Set has been chosen to add an extra shield at the beggining of the battles for extra safety. Her 31% HP Aura on Faction Crypts will increase these shields even more allowing the team to make it easier through the waves. Both things are prioritised: HP, ACC and good SPD are needed if we plan on using her in arena. 

Gloves. HP%
Chest: HP% / RES (if she's used on RES compositions)
Boots: SPD 
Ring: HP
Necklace: HP with ACC and RES
Banner: ACC with HP% and SPD
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Hope needs to be fully booked to properly shine and to be able to have the highest chance to remove enemy buffs. She fills the role of an offensive buffer, that protects allies with big shield and also annoys the enemies. 

Shields of around 55k when she places her own shields on top of the shields from the set

https://youtu.be/oJfNn3SyL_0?t=544

Hope is also great for Ice Golem, since her A3 can come in handy in removing the annoying reflect damage on the second wave of Golem 20. Her shields can absorb a lot of damage if we deal damage a little too fast to the boss itself. For arena she can work very well if we have high-end gear specially on RES comps, because she can both remove enemy buffs (Sethallia and Serris will be too squishy for this) and place high shields to make the job even harder for the enemies that don't have buff removal. She has been tested against Miscreated Monster to see if she is able to absorb enough damage on Spiders 20, but unfortunately with her 71k HP the shields aren't nearly as big, so in the late game Dragon, Spider or FK aren't the dungeons where she excels compared to other champions
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Maneater (ME) is one of the most versatile and well received epic champions in the game. This is one of the few epics you want to have multiples of and he can be useful at every stage of the game. This guide focuses on Clan Boss and the currently known Unkillable combinations with Maneater.

Mastery wise, ME is not a key damage or healing champion. Therefore [Warmaster] for clan boss is the correct build, along with [Retribution] for general extra attacks with chance to debuff [Attack Down]. There are a few masteries you want to avoid when using Maneater or any unkillable compositions.

Do not use Cycle of Magic mastery on Maneater or any turn meter increase or reduction masteries. Doing so would break the sequence of Unkillable turn order and mess things up for you. Furthermore, masteries such as lore of steel are dangerous because they make the diplayed speed different from actual speed. Use the speed calculators or copy the exact masteries and equipment setups for best results
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Maneater finds itself as a support champion in FW, arena and the clan boss (CB). As the CB usually requires speed tuning, the CB team needs dictate the gear. For example, the famous Batman setup requires 2 MEs to be at 265-282 speed and 239+ speed. Both MEs can find themselves extremely useful in FW and arena at these speeds too.

Gear wise, speed matching to the rest of team is the most important consideration. I recommend going for 3 sets of speed to meet the reasonably above average late game challenge of a support champion at around 240-70 speed. This will be very suitable for many CB setups as well as Gold 4 arena tank teams. 

Despite the attack-based Maneater not being the highest damage dealing champion, improving its stats in attack, critical chance, and damage is still important in the long term. In the Batman-Eater, the MEs, maintaining near 100% chance crit and 2700 attack can do 8-10m damage on UNM. Ideally the attack and critical damage should be higher. Using the banner: 
1.        Arena and FW - recommended to increase his accuracy to steal turn meter
2.        Clan boss – recommended to increase his attack if running an unkillable composition (no need for attack down). 

Glove: CritDamage%/Crit Rate % 
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Atk 
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Atk / Acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
There are many compositions that use Maneater with a setup featured in the guide. Let's go over them (though each deserves a guide of its own):

1) The first and most budget composition is called Maneater + Painkeeper because the combination of those two heroes makes it possible to 2 key UNM, NM and Brutal.

https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/New-Budget-Maneater---3-Bosses-only-1-Comp 

2) The second composition can be build with Maneater + Another unkillable champion (Roshcard, Warcaster, Sir Nick) to 2 key UNM

https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/Slow-Tuned-Maneater-Unkillable 

3) If you are lucky enough to have two Maneaters, but don't have a Seeker to build Batmaneater, you can still 2 key UNM on any affinity

https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/Slow-Double-Maneater 

4) Finally, the best currently available CB composition that can 2 key UNM and 1 key NM on any affinity is Batmaneater. If you have two Maneaters and Seeker, it is recommended to build it.

https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/BatEater 

You can see the featured maneater in such a composition below 

https://youtu.be/qGcJppQZp5w 

5) There are other exotic Unkillable compositions available that depend on specific heroes like Mashaled, Kymar, Shazar an others. You can find them here: 

https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-1/Tune 

Overall it's definitely worth it to build Maneater into a Clan Boss hero if you have one or two.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Warlord is one of the most versatile champions in the game. His skillset allows him to be a debuff extender for clan boss with his A1, healing and protection on A2, effective AOE control on A3 and a significant resistance aura. This guide focuses on a build that is tailored for Arena and Doom Tower.

He has 2 key roles in both Doom Tower and Arena, and his masteries reflect these skills:

•        A3: Sets all enemy abilities on cooldown, effectively making them use A1 abilities until they cycle back. This ability ignores block debuffs. Cannot be dispelled or removed, can only be resisted. Has a chance on reducing Turn Meter, but this is not dependable.
•        A2: Heals all allies by percentage of Warlord’s HP, and places block debuffs.

As an offensive skill lock champion, you want Warlord to be as fast as possible to go before all enemy champions (with or without the help of a TM booster). You also want the Warlord A2 and A3 to come around as often as possible in order to repeatedly lock enemy skills out and heal your own team.

For a “debuff” build (even though skill lock is not a debuff), Eagle Eye support tree build is best to maximise the Accuracy. Other useful masteries to note are:

-        Accuracy increasing masteries [Pinpoint] [Charged Focus] 
-        Shield increasing [Shieldbearer] [Rejuventation]
-        Speed stat increasing [Lore of Steel]
-        TM reduction [Retribution] with [Evil Eye] for more TM control
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Warlord needs to be as fast as possible with a high accuracy for late game content. 

Typically, speed should be about 250 with 2 tm boosters or 300 with 1 booster, with an accuracy appropriate for the level of opponent (e.g., 400-500 for high end arena and DT). 

Prioritise the following substats: 1) speed, 2) accuracy, 3) HP%. 

Speed sets are ideal for this champion, but precision sets are a worthwhile alternative with good speed sub-stats.

Weapon/Helm/Shield: with speed, acc, HP% substat
Glove: HP%, with speed and acc substat 
Chest: Acc, with speed and HP% substat
Boots: Speed, with Acc and HP% substat 
Ring: HP, with HP% and Def% substat
Amulet: HP, with acc substat
Banner: Acc, with speed and HP% substat 

Any cooldown reset accessories are extremely favourable, which is easier for the ring and amulet items with no speed substats.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Warlord can shine in difficult content in Raid where other champions struggle. He can lock down powerful enemy combinations, such as Siphi and Rotos above floor 110, provide shields and heals against Scarab Lord, as well as other 2 spider bosses. Note that some champion secret skills cannot be locked (e.g., Peril by Mortu) or some champions have a fasts turn around for their skills (e.g. Rotos extra turn).

One of the annoying aspects of DT waves with Siphi and Rotos is their passive synergy: (Siphi removes all debuffs from Rotos the Lost Groom at the start of their turn if they are on the same team.) This renders standard Crowd Control, such as freeze, sleep, stun, or even block skill debuffs ineffective. 

Furthermore, if the enemy Siphi gets a turn, her block debuffs makes your life harder unless you strip the buffs first. Either way, putting skills on cooldown by Warlord or Basher (budget Warlord) is effective - as it is not considered a debuff and cannot be removed. If you have speed and TM buffs, your warlord can cycle around to using a3, forever denying the enemy champions to use any ability other than A1.  

Your other team members should complement Warlord. I recommend 1-2 more support/healer, and 2-3 damage champions. In this video a team of Krisk, Siphi, with Rotos and Candraphone were selected. There are many other possibilities to construct a team for those floors such as: Seer, Duchess, Nethril, Raglin, and BEK.

https://youtu.be/5ZhN7SXKHio 

[Warlord AI] Getting Warlord to prioritise A3 is tough. It seems that a Siphi lead with block debuffs helps warlord to priortise A3, otherwise you may need to manual things in Doom Tower in the first few rounds. Likewise in arena defence, it is recommended to pair a fast warlord with a fast siphi. 

You can see a more detailed guide on how the same build works in Arena on the next page of the guide
data.label: Notes:

This is build for Renegade to work with coldheart fo high level spider. It’s a specialised build to make use of her decrease cooldown abilities and make heartseeker hit more often. Works decently on speed runs in dungeons. Main point - do not use any items with speed if you’re running this with ch. ch needs to have double the speed (191+) for this to work. Take into account the speed aura lead in your composition in order to avoid messing it up.
As a budget Kymar renegade does not need investment in masteries
