tag: Weaken/Decrease DEF and Clan boss damage
title: Weaken/Decrease DEF and Clan boss damage

data.label: Warmaster/Giant Slayer
data.desc:
How weaken, defence down and giant slayer/warmaster work on ultra-nightmare cb:
1. Nothing = 34 392
2. Def. down + weaken = 67 195
3. Def. down = 53 755
4. Weaken = 42 990

How weaken, defence down and giant slayer/warmaster work on nightmare cb:
1. Nothing = 47 496
2. Def. down + weaken = 77 639
3. Def. down= 62 111
4. Weaken = 59 369

Note that savage and cruel sets that ignore defense increase the damage done by warmaster and giant slayer. 3 Cruel sets increase the damage from wm/gs to 70 525

data.label: Masteries
data.desc:
This is a late game+ build for Sepulcher Sentinel. With this build she can tank Ultra-Nightmare Clan boss pretty well. Maximum survivability is key for this build and the masteries are standard for clan boss.

Her A1 skill with attack down is her main strength in a counterattack team. Her passive can be a really nice bonus, but even if RNG is not on your side, Sentinel may help you 2 key UNM with this build.

Warmaster is the key to dealing additional damage to clan boss and lifesteal sets helps Sepulcher in this build. Accuracy is gained through the great hall, banner and substats, allowing to focus on the defence tree masteries.

data.label: Gear and Stats
data.desc:
Set: lifesteal + anything. Focus on defence with enough speed and accuracy as this is a tank build. In this case Sepulcher Sentinel has enough defence and it would be best to work on crit rate and damage for increased dps.

Her accuracy is below 230, because vizier allows to make sure atk down debuff is always in place.

Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - def
Banner - accuracy

Sepulcher Shield that provides defense up has a cooldown of 4 turns. This makes speed turning for her quite interesting and difficult to manage. The range for UNM is usually 220-240 and you need to use a speed calculator that takes into account the speed of all your heroes, not just her. 

Use -speed command to see more information about speed tuning from the bot.

data.label: Notes:
data.desc:
Sepulcher Sentinel can be set up in different ways on your runs. In Ultra-Nightmare clan boss her block debuffs can be used to block either the stun from clan boss, the debuff from the second AOE on affinity, or both.

In this build she plays a key role, providing atk down debuff, amplified by Vizier, Block debuffs, Defence Up for Valkyrie and the rest of the team, aura for additional  defense and a passive that can prolong the run.

I haven't been able to achieve the latter golden ratio and settled for 2 key on void or 3 key on any affinity on UNM and one key NM with the build you can see on the following video. However, this golden tune may be possible, so let me know if you find it!

Void CB
https://youtu.be/8DwWi3xXj5A

Spirit CB
https://youtu.be/sAUnnIrxAm8

On Nightmare clan boss Sepulcher Sentinel is not tuned perfectly - she is too fast. However, the stun from clan boss makes her go in sync with Valkyrie, providing her with the Defense Up she needs for the shields and CA

Rhazin combines both Defence Down and Weaken in one skill, and this can be key for achieving high damage numbers on UNM Clan Boss (use `-guide weaken` to see more info). His A1 is three hits and can steal buffs. This comes handy both in damage and on affinity clan bosses.

He's a highly versatile legendary and is a permanent fustion. This build will focus on clan boss, but he can be used in Arena (aura, a3) and dungeons to great effect.

It's usually a good idea to book rhazin a2 if you're using him on clan boss, especially if you do not have buff extenders.

Rhazin has a pretty standard set of ultra-nightmare mastery tree. Giant Slayer is important for damage and the defence tree allows for more survivability.

Rhazin feels right at home in a counterattack team and can get maximum dps out with masteries like this.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Sets: The more universal set for Rhazin is lifesteal + anything. However, most people only have so many good sets, so in this example he is in Stalwart and relies on Valkyrie shields to keep him alive. Another mass healer could be used with Rhazin in a stalwart set if you have one.

Glove - crit damage %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - crit damage
Banner - accuracy

For Rhazin you want to achieve at the following stats for late game+ UNM: 250+ accuracy (230+ with Vizier), 100% crit rate, 200%+ crit damage, 4200 defence. This allows for maximum dps. 

If you're using a more mid or late-game rhazin you could make do with def% gloves and less crit.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
In a counterattack team, speed tuning is key. The current slow tune allows Rhazin to feel comfortable both in UNM and NM.

There is some know-how on when Rhazin uses his a3 that decreases the turn meter on auto. It depends on the % of turn meter the clan boss has. In this example on void he never uses a3. On affinity the turn meter with Valkyrie goes awry and he starts to use his a3 on clan boss.

Defence up benefits Rhazin and he hits much harder while under the buff.

It's not unusual for him to deal 10-11 million damage in counterattack teams

https://youtu.be/8DwWi3xXj5A

On affinity, apart from spirit cb, Rhazin show excellent results. He's also a common component for UNM compositions that don't use poisoners, but achieve 2 key UNM
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Stag Knight is one of the most useful champions in the game.

It is important that Stag Knight has a fully booked a2 for a lower cooldown. Stag Knight can also be used in Arena, Clan Boss and is very good in Faction Wars but this guide will focus on him in Dungeons. 

You want to build Stag Knight with the Offense and Support tree Mastery. The most important mastery you want to have on Stag Knight is Sniper on the Support Tree since his A2 only has a 95% chance to place the debuffs fully booked. 

The 5% from Sniper Mastery will help bring it to 100%. For the other masteries, Accuracy is the focus along with Lore of Steel to improve his stats, Master Hexer to increase the Debuff duration and Evil Eye for some added Turn Meter control is a good choice. On the Offense Tree crit rate, crit damage mastery down and T6 Warmaster for some added damage.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The three most important stats you want to build on Stag Knight are Accuracy and Speed. The rule of thumb for accuracy is approximately 10 for every Dungeon level, so you need at least 200 accuracy to reliably place his debuffs on Stage 20 Dungeons. For speed, you want to build him fast enough to go before your damage dealer so that he can place his debuffs, and a follow up nuke cleans out the wave. It's a good idea to be faster than the enemies so they deal less damage to your team.

The other stats you want to have on him are HP, Crit Rate and Crit Damage. Although his main role is to debuff, Stag Knight actually has good damage multipliers. If built with 100% Crit rate, he can deal significant damage. 

Do not sacrifice his Speed, Accuracy and HP for Crit Rate and Crit Damage. Remember his main role is to place debuffs. Stag Knight is also a good candidate for Relentless set to cycle his cooldown faster. It also helps with the Fire Knight Dungeon significantly.

In terms of sets, this Stag Knight is in Relentles, but any set can work as long as the needed parameters are reached, e.g. Speed and Accuracy sets

Glove: Hp%/Crit Rate %
Chest: HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP/Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The combination of AOE 60% Decrease Defense and 50% Decrease Attack in the same skill is incredibly powerful verus dungeon waves and bosses on a 3 turn cooldown. His A1 has an added utility of placing 30% Decrease Speed that can be key in Ice Golem 20, Fire Knight 20, and Spider 20. Due to him being Spirit Affinity, it is generally not advisable to use him in Dragon 20 because of the affinity disadvantage (Warmaiden can replace him in this role). 

AOE Decrease Defense is a requirement for fast clearing of any dungeon and Decrease Attack can help your runs by increasing the overall surviability of the team

The video demonstrates Stag Knight fulfilling his role as a Decrease Defense debuffer is the three dungeons he’s best in.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VgO7Xh0zyFE
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For this build Offence and Support trees were selected for the following reasons:

[T1] - Deadly Precision, PinPoint Accuracy
Quite standard for most debuffers used against Clan boss. 5% crit rate is better than ATK and more difficult to obtain from items. Accuracy is better than HP as you need to reach a certain threshold with your total ACC in order to be able to land debuffs.

[T2] - Keen Strike, Heart Of Glory, Charged focus
10% crit damage from Keen Strike are an important boost to your overall damage.
The same applies to Heart of Glory. You will get even more benefit from it as we will be building our Coffin in Life Steal gear, so he will be at full hp for most of the run. Charged focus will just give you some additional Accuracy.

[T3] - Single Out, Life Drinker, Swarm Smiter
Single out will give us 8% additional damage when CB goes below 40% HP (will also be handy for different contests such as Fire Knight).
Life Drinker will help get some health back and stay at full hp. Swarm Smiter for more ACC (we always need more ACC!)

[T4] - Bring it down, Wrath of the Slain/Lore of Steel, Evil Eye
Bring it down for more guaranteed damage (CB will always have higher MAX HP compared to Coffin)
Here we have two different options: we can go for Wrath just to maximize our damage at the end of the run, when squishie champions start to fall down, or we can go for Lore of Steel
Evil Eye does not bring anything to CB, but useful in Dungeons (Fire Knight for instance) and there are no better options to pick.

[T5] - Kill Streak, Sniper, Master Hexer
KS is quite useless for CB but we need it in order to reach our T6 
Sniper for more chances to land our debuffs
Master Hexer for our debuffs to last longer!

[T6] - Giant Slayer
The reason for that is Coffin Smasher A1 being a 3-hit spell, which leads in higher chances to proc multiple bonus damage on clan boss. 

No turn meter boosting masteries were selected as Coffin Smasher is used in a counterattack team in this guide
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Stats-wise we need to focus on:

Speed: adjusting it according to your speed tune setup, in this team a 4:3 sepulcher sentinel in a counter attack setup, which forces me to keep the rest of the squad between 171 and 178 speed. However, if you're running a speed based team you can boost the speed as high as possible.

ACCuracy: 250+ is the optimal requirement for Ultra Nightmare CB, so make sure your Coffin is above this number!
HP: he is an HP based champion and his damage will also scale based on HP, so give him as much as you can. For UNM i recommend 50k+
DEF: another important stat when it comes to improve your survivability, you don't need to reach crazy values tho as you will compensate with high HP. So start with 2.5k+
C. Rate and C. DMG: not mandatory as he is not a big damage dealer and most of his total damage will come from Giant Slayer procs and from HP burn (A2), but it will not hurt if you can give him some.

Gear-Wise you ideally want Life Steal (or Stalwart if you have a good healer in your team.e.g. Bad-El-Kazar)

You can add a speed set or an accuracy set if you struggle to match any of the above mentioned thresholds with SPD and ACC.

Glove: HP% 
Chest: DEF %
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Coffin Smasher is currently the best rare Atk Down hero in the game for Clan Boss. His kit provides him with enough surviability and utility on clan boss unless you have epics and legendaries to fit the role.

His a1 hits three times. This allows for high damage and reliability of placing the debuff with the only exception being a force affinity Clan Boss. Counterattack amplifies it further.

The rares only deal 50k hp damage from their burn debuff as opposed to 75k hp damage from epic and legendaries, so his a2 is not the most useful skill if you have better debuffers.

However, his passive that reduces AOE damage is extremely helpful and will increase the survivability of the whole team.

Finally, note that Coffin Smasher is not the best choice to take the stun, as Clan Boss stun scales with the maximum HP of the hero

https://youtu.be/9i6nMb4tV8E
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Madame Serris is considered one of the best epic heroes in the game, you are lucky if you have her! She can be useful in nearly all areas of the game and she is well worth using books on. This guide focuses more on Arena, but this build is universal enough for other areas of the game.

Since she's not a heavy damage dealing champion and all her kit relies on removing enemy buffs and placing her own, we're going to need as much ACC and SPD as possible. 

In this build the T6 mastery is going to be Eagle Eye to get all the ACC we can. It's never too much ACC because not being able to remove enemy buffs might mean winning or losing the battle. Regarding the support masteries, Cycle of Vengeance might be useful to be able to get the cooldown of the skills faster, and Retribution is the best available option, since we can inflict fear on the enemy with the A1 skill
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
In late game there are two ways of building Serris. The top choice and the most expensive one: an Immunity set and perfect stats (600+ Accuracy, enough speed to go second after turn meter boost)

This build is more budget and uses ACC sets or Perception sets from the forge, the latter being the best in slot if you're lucky with the stats and substats. We're aiming for 3 stats, priorititising ACC,  SPD and HP in that order. If you're aiming for low gold you might get away with about 300 accuracy at the moment. Around 500 is the benchmark in gold 4 and bottom platinum. At the top of platinum it's not unusual to build 600+ Accuracy Serris and then focus on other stats.

Glove: HP % 
Chest: Accuracy
Boots: Speed 
Ring: HP / DEF
Amulet: DEF/HP (With Accuracy Substats)
Banner: Accuracy 

ACC chest and a Banner are a MUST and we'll try to get as much SPD and ACC in substats of the rest of the items. SPD is also very important because she needs to go right after our turn meter booster, but before the nuker. If we're too slow, chances are the enemies will get ahead of her. To make sure nobody cuts into your turn order you can tune your Serris speed at arena calculators, e.g. https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/wystix-calculator 

She places a shield based on her Max.HP, and hitting that shield will mean getting Fear, so the more HP the bigger the shield, so the glove is preferrable to be HP%. There's really no point in building her for damage with this build, even though her A2 can hit decently.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Serris is one of the best epics in the game

She's part of the current meta of arenas in Gold 4 and Platinum because she doesn't only remove all enemy buffs, but also places Dec.DEF and ATK, leaving the door open for our nuker to smash the enemy. Failing in doing that, will mean losing the battle in most cases, because we'll hit shields, and hitting enemies with shields and without Dec. DEF there's not a chance we can one shot the enemy, so no ACC is too much ACC on her.

The video below demonstrates how Serris works in high Gold IV.

https://youtu.be/RFTsrV6eY74?t=65
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Mortu is famous for being a challenge during the campaign as a final boss, but he doesn’t seem to hit nearly as hard and as often when he joins your collection.

This guide focuses on how you can use Mortu Maccab in the platinum arena setting. He has one major and one minor role:

•        Block Revive (A4: Peril): post-Rotos nerf, Mortu is one of the reliable block revive strikers with a powerful conditional ability that ignores defence, shields, and block damage. It is a 2 hitter that is enough to kill most champions (in particular non-magic affinity).
•        Block buffs (A2): Block buff aoe attack is incredibly powerful if it lands, as most power buffs including gear abilities (e.g., swift parry with unkillable) and passive abilities (e.g., Seeker defence up) can be a real nuisance. However, Mortu is not the fastest champion with a base speed of 94, so you are likely seeking block buffs to cut in opportunistically after several turns.

As a defensive and potentially block revive damage champion, he provides a win condition for highly defensive teams. However, it is really hard to decide how to gear and choose masteries for Mortu. 

On the one hand, you want him to survive, but still do enough damage when Peril is available to deliver the kill. For these reasons, you will want either:

•        Flawless Execution: no need for Helmsmasher as he ignores 100% defence
•        Selfless Defender: at time of writing, it is believed that this will trigger Peril

Note that Peril can be triggered when Mortu is receiving hits. Peril doesn’t need books, which also make him somewhat viable for low spenders.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
As you want to be able to deliver a one-hit KO, you will need enough crit damage, whilst keeping a high amount of Health Points (Peril scales of HP) and some resistance, accuracy and speed. 

Gear wise, he is particularly good in a shield set as he has high HP. This allows your slower team to tank damage from a variety of teams. Don’t build Mortu too slow for arena or he will never get a turn for Peril.

Glove: Crit Damage %
Chest: HP% or Resistance
Boots: Speed 
Ring: HP
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: HP / Accuracy
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Mortu needs a strong defensive team to be built around him:

1.        [Defence Up] as Mortu has high HP but low Def, he needs Defence Up buff. Champions such as Seeker, Siphi or Black Knight are excellent for this role.
2.        [Resurrect] As you build up a sustain team, a defensive resurrection champion is critical, such as Duchess, Siphi, Raglin or Maulie.
3.        [Anti-Speed] Someone to mess up the enemy speed tune is critical too, to disrupt the attack order (e.g., DPS goes before defence down), and reduce the damage your team takes: Valk, Tormin and Hegemon are popular options in platinum.
4.        [Strengthen or Ally Protect] Ally protect across the team will mean Mortu can take more damage and trigger Peril more often.

Here is a video showcasing Mortu, with a very strong team fulfilling the above roles: 1-2. Siphi, 3. Nuke Hegemon, 4. Lydia for Hegemon block revive on initial nuke. 

The idea is that:
•        If the enemy uses a speed team, Hegemon can upset them by killing a few key members or locking their skills
•        If they try to revive, Lydia kicks in. Lydia also is helpful down the line by adding the strengthen buff, AOE Defence Down and Weaken as well as block cooldown skills.
•        Siphi here is for defence up and general debuff protection.

Video: https://youtu.be/ujgvPg-ycBs
data.label: Notes:
Minotaur Energy Cost
data.desc:
It is worth it to spend 800 gems on the masteries of your campaign farmer. After that you save gems if you use energy on minotaur 15."How much energy you need to upgrade to tier 6 masteries for one hero.

stage 13: 2,268 - 3,668 energy. 
stage 14: 1,498 - 2,506 energy. 
stage 15: 1,204 - 2,086 energy.

data.label: Minotaur Energy Cost
data.desc: As you can see you can save massively by running minotaur 15 compared to others. Get your 3-4 main heroes to full masteries and you can get others ready in no time. Use the -guide mid  command to see advice on the core team.

data.label: Minotaur Energy Cost
data.desc: You can do lower Minotaur levels to get the basic and green scrolls on your main cb roster. But don’t do the red scroll grind on anything lower than 15. You need enough survivability/control and damage output to get through the waves and to farm Minotaur himself reliably. Post in #minotaur with a screenshot of your roster for help.

Altan becomes truly powerful in late game+

He is one of the most powerful heroes with Atk Down debuff and can hit for a ton of damage. He has one of the highest Def Auras in the game, and Defense Up buff.

In combination with Lanakis buff extension, Altan can provide permanent Defense Up for at himself which makes him an excellent damage source, with Warmaster being a requirement. Previously, he was equipped with Support tree masteries for Debuff/Buff extension, but better results were achieved with Def Tree (Resurgent, Retribution, Deterrence).
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Altan is the slowest champion in the team and needs high Accuracy to apply the AtkDown debuff. 

He should have close to 100% crit and as much defense and crit dmg as possible to maximize damage and survivability. He has the lowest HP of the team, so he is more likely to be hit by the stun attack (provided everyone/noone has Defense Up).

Futhermore, Clan Boss stun scales of maximum HP, so boosting this stat could be counter productive.

Glove - crit dmg %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - crit dmg
Banner - acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Altan provides a number of advantages for this team.

1. Altan provide a Defence Aura. 
2. Atk Down (requirement for non-Unkillable teams)
3. Defence Up buff
4. Serious solo DPS 
5. Tanks the stuns

You can find a video of the run on Void CB in this video: https://youtu.be/Ikrqv3l9A1w
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Tayrel was the original “Best Epic” in the game and considered better than many legendary heroes. 

Although there are newer Epic Champions that have taken his title, he is still as useful as he ever was. He is one of the best champions in the game for placing 50% Decrease Attack on the Clan Boss, especially if you have an AOE counterattack due to his A1 ability. He has a 100% chance to place AOE 60% Decrease Defense which helps a lot with Dungeon waves. On top of that, he has a solid single target turn meter reduction that can help with control.

He is worth fully booking and can help in all areas of the game.

This build features a late game Tayrel with the Offense and Support Tree Mastery. You always want to take the crit rate, crit damage and down to T6 Warmaster for the Offense Tree on Tayrel. 

On the support tree, take the accuracy masteries, avoid the TM masteries if you use him in a speedtuned CB team (Counterattack or Unkillable), Lore of Steel for more stats, Evil Eye for more control of the enemy turn meter, Master Hexer to extend the debuffs he places and Sniper to increase his chance of placing Decrease Atk.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important stats you want to build on Tayrel is Accuracy and Speed. You need at least 200 accuracy to reliably place his debuffs on Stage 20 Dungeons and NM Clan Boss. For speed, you want to build him either as fast as possible to go before your damage dealer if you are using him only for dungeons, or speedtuned with your Clan Boss Team if you have a counter attack.

The other stats you want to build are Defense, Crit Rate and Crit Damage. His main role is to place debuffs so only build Crit rate once you have enough Speed and Accuracy. He needs to be in Lifesteal set and you can use Speed, Accuracy, Perception sets or broken pieces for you remaining two slots.

Glove: Defense % / Crit Rate
Chest: Defense%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Defense
Amulet: Defense/Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy / Defense (If you can build enough Accuracy from substats)
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The video demonstrates Tayrel in a Force Affinity NM Clan Boss run.

On Clan Boss notice how reliable the Attack Down Debuff is despite being negative affinity for Tayrel. Having the Def Aura, Def Down Debuff and Attack Down in one package makes him an excellent champion in this role.

As Tayrel damage depends on the Def stat he benefits greatly from the Def UP buff. With a good crit rate, lifesteal set and Counterattack, this composition can 2 key NM clan boss on any affinity.

https://youtu.be/pTpNVo3-uDQ 

There are two more areas featured in this video. On dragon 20 Tayrel provides a good kit with AOE def down for the waves and the boss, decreases the dungeon boss damage with Attack Down and provides a decent damage output.

https://youtu.be/pTpNVo3-uDQ?t=248 

For spider 20 Tayrel provides an extra benefit of turn meter reduction with the a3. This can be crucial for Spider compositions as the big spider eating the spiderlings can break the run and prevent a victory. 

https://youtu.be/pTpNVo3-uDQ?t=336
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
There are a number of champions that can be of great help in the Mid Game and during the transition to Late Game. Battlesage is one of them.

The fantastic part of this build is that it requires almost no resources except gear. Battlesage is a commonly overlooked champion who can provide a lot of utility to the right team. Her main value is a debuff cleanse, an attack buff and a speed aura. This makes her useful in Arena and in various Dungeons.
 
Masteries arent technically required for this build but if you are going to acquire them going for Rapid response and evil eye in the support tree is recommended. These masteries will give you a turn meter boost when her buffs wear off, and an AOE TM decrease.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The great thing about this build is the only stat you care about is enough speed. 

You want her to go right after your speed booster and before your nuker, so the speed has to be calibrated accordingly. Even flat stat gear is fine as long as the required speed is reached.

If you want her to survive longer then you can focus more on HP and Def stats. Battlesage HP is kept lower than the nuker in this build so the opposing team attack her first and leave my damage dealer alone. Focus on speed as the main core of the gear build.

Gloves - HP%
Chest - DEF%
Boots - Speed
Ring - HP
Amulet - DEF
Banner - Acc

In this build flat attack gloves, flat defense chest and speed boots are used. As long as they have the right speed rolls other stats do not matter.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Battlesage is perfectly usable in an arena team even at lvl 40. It is recommended to ascend her to 3 stars to unlock her improved skill. She has a decent speed aura for mid game stages and can be used as a leader effectively.

She is used as a cleanser and Atk Up hero in this video

https://youtu.be/k1zkmczPRVE

You can see the pattern repeat in the next video too. The Aura helps the turn meter booster (Golden Reaper) go first, followed by AOE control from Umbral Enchantress. Battlesage provides the Atk Up buff and cleanse, Zargala nukes the team.

https://photos.app.goo.gl/xbxvhK5YVAYQ3pn46 

Some more videos:

https://photos.app.goo.gl/7ST4Cdx9D7K3dgyU6
https://photos.app.goo.gl/t1XXNXoqbuuDp6dU6
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
If you're lucky enough to pull Skullcrusher during your early game, congratulations! It's one of the three AOE counterattack heroes in the game and it's your fast track to good rewards.

Skullcrusher (SC) is good as a support hero for your main Starter or campaign farmer.

Your priority is to get the Starter to 60 as per the guides, while Skullcrusher can work as lvl 40 or 50. 

Ascend SC to 3 stars as soon as possible and book his a2 AOE counterattack ability. This will allow you to reap the most benefits.

Since early game if you're f2p you likely won't 6 star Skullcrusher you won't be able to utilise the warmaster and as such it's not recommended to buy the masteries for him with gems.

Prioritise getting to late game and that is where SC will truly shine
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Without warmaster and good gear, just focus on defence and speed. You likely won't have all the gear in the screenshot, especially the accessories

Set: lifesteal + anything 

Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - 
Amulet - 
Banner -
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
For clan boss early on you won't be able to utilise speed tuning and other complicated arrangements until mid and late game. You can use turn meter and speed boosters early on and still get some results.

You can use Skullcrusher in all content including the dungeons and arena. However, you should still focus on food with your campaign farmer and preparing to 6 star your core team.

Check the next page of the guide for mid-game Skullcrusher
data.label: Notes:
Late Game guide
data.desc:
You are now at the beginning of the late game stage. This will be a long road ahead unless you get lucky and pull some amazing champs!
You will want to dp the arbiter questline, try to 3 key nightmare cb, which is very achievable even with an average core team and build an arena team to farm great hall.
Great hall and arena provide bonuses in all areas of the game. A great source of accuracy and defence for this stage of the game it is worth it to try for high level arena below platinum.

data.label: Late Game guide
data.desc:
The second most important dungeon after Dragon 20 will be the Spider dungeon. It's also the most difficult one in the game if you don't have the right heroes.
If you're enough to pull Arbiter, Cardinal, Blind Seer or another mass ressurection champion in advance you might want to check out some Late Game+ strategies too.
Spider dungeon below level 15 can be farmed with AOE hard hitting heroes in equipment from dragon 20.
If you are a lucky owner of mass hp burn heroes, coldhearts, royal guards, counterattack or poison bursters you can complete the spider and all other missions.
If not, you may refer to the spider guide or seek help on discord with your hero roster

data.label: Late Game guide:
data.desc:
Once the spider dungeon is possible to complete, continue with the arbiter quest. Along the way it is now time to farm glyphs in faction wars for your heroes. Use your roster to build a stable 2-3 Nightmare clan boss team and find a clan that allow you to get two chests daily.
After a good period of time you will be able to finally get Arbiter and can now progress to Late Game+

data.label: Masteries
data.desc: As you progress to mid game and dungeons, such as Minotaur 15 and Dragon 15+ your Kael needs to be equipped differently to handle this content than Early game Kael.

data.label: Stats and equipment
data.desc:
Set: lifesteal + anything
Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def/hp
Amulet - def/hp
Banner - accuracy

data.label: Notes:
data.desc: This build makes Kael more tanky and with enough support he can find a place in nightmare clan boss and lvl 20 dungeons. In the clan boss damage screenshot Kael receives lots of support from the counterattack buff and extension from bulwark.

This Sinesha build will focus on faction wars where she acts as a form of control and healing. 

There are two different paths that Sinesha can go with masteries - one with a focus on more damage (Warmaster) and one focused on control (Fearsome Presence and a stun set). The Warmaster path is preferred due to the nature of high HP of all the enemies, but Fearsome Presence will make traversing the waves of enemies much easier. Since this Sinesha is paired with Miscreated Monster, she's a hybrid. Warmaster is used as the final mastery for additional damage, while she is wearing a Stun Set.

Helmsmasher and Flawless Execution do not shine in this type of content and it barely matters on the 21st floor. Accuracy from the support tree is useful for her to land her A2 ability. For Knights Revenant faction wars, full masteries are a strong recommendation, as this is one of the most difficult crypts.

Having books on her A2 and A3 will definitely increase survivability of the whole team, but overall not required.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For this build, we are using a Stun Set and a Speed set. 

We want to spam out those stuns as frequently as possible with her A1 and reserve her other skills for emergencies. There are many stats that are required for this build: 

45K+ HP for survivability, 200+ SPD to effectively spam stuns and use the emergency heal, 200+ ACC to land Evil-eye and her A2. Once those stats have been reached, Sinesha can be geared to have some crit rate and crit damage. The main stats for her gear: 

Glove: Crit Dmg % 
Chest: HP %
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
She is so effective that it is not uncommon to run two Sinesha in faction wars. She can be a lead with her HP aura because survivability is everything. The method for Stage 21 and all other stages is fairly simple. 

Focusing on Stage 21: for the waves, spam A1 to stun as many enemies as possible. Depending on how many are stunned and the overall tankiness of your team, choose to use her A2 to prevent the enemies from using a skill. This can be seen being done on one of the Valkyries right before the enemy's turn. Only do this if the other targets are not a threat. The main threats for the first wave would be Warlord and Martyr and Valkyries on the second wave. Since Valkyrie and Martyr are the stronger affinity, there is a good chance the skill will not land and the A2 should be thought as an emergency single target control technique.

During the boss fight, she will help control the minions until they are down. After the minions are eliminated, she will be there primarily for healing your softer champions.

You can find the full faction wars floor 21 run below

https://youtu.be/a8PoHncrG0A
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Gala is a champion that can dish out very good damage. She doesn't require ACC, so the Support tree won't be as important as the Defense one. 

This guide focuses on Gala in arena, as this is where she can show off her dps the most.

The Attack tree is a must, since Gala is a nuker and hits really hard. The T6 mastery can be 20% Crit.Dmg (for stable and regular DMG income) or HelmSmasher (if it procs it'll hit much harder, but might not always proc). In the Defense tree we'll go Retribution is the mastery of choice, since Gala is quite squishy it is very likely she'll lose more than 25% in one hit, hence counter attack can do a lot of damage.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gala is the definition of tiny but dangerous. She's a nuker that's design to hit one target really hard. If you're not one-shotting champions with her, she's not hitting hard enough.

There are several options you can use to build you Gala in terms of sets. She can use sets like Life Steal (so she'll be at Max.HP most of the times), Cruel set from CB (for the extra ATK and ignore DEF) or even Relentless for a chance of extra turns.

The sets don't matter as much if you have the correct stats, like most other Arena champions. We can go for Crit.Dmg gloves (with Crit.Chance substat) and ATK% chest (with Crit.Chance substat). It's very important that we look for Crit Chance in substats in all the items if we want to reach that 100% Crit Chance while Crit DMG gloves are equipped. 

Glove: Crit Dmg % 
Chest: Atk %
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Dmg
Banner: Atk

If you're thinking on using her in Arena, Speed boots are a must because her DEF is too low to receive much damage. She works better at full HP too. If you use her in Dungeons only (she works pretty good in Dragon, and can also be used in FK), you can go for ATK% boots to get to 6000 ATK, but she won't be able to absorb too much damage and die quickly if you're not careful.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Gala can wipe out opposing Arena teams if the setup is right. As you can see in the feature video below, Under Def Down Gala can strike down a hero and instantly bring down another one

https://youtu.be/ItWQ4z38mP4

You can find more Arena gameplay with Gala below

https://youtu.be/6s4nk0hxsOw?t=465 

For PVE Gala can also be a good damage dealer. Using her skills she can take many turns to deal damage and this can be handy if the team can carry her to the dungeon boss through the waves. See the video below for a Dragon 20 run

https://youtu.be/6s4nk0hxsOw?t=863
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Hegemon is arguably one of the best arena champions in the entire game no matter what level your account is at. He provides excellent detterence in your arena defense and has a variety of playstyles for arena offence as well. Hegemon can be built for near unrivaled crowd control and turn meter manipulation that can give you the first move in the battle even though the enemy speed booster is faster than yours.

This guide will explore the Crowd Control (CC) build catered towards late game players, however the concepts remain the same regardless of the account level.

Hegemon's strongest ability in arena offense is his A1 when combined with the Evil Eye mastery. This allows you to guarantee going first against the enemy by using a Hegemon, reducing their Turn Meter and applying Decrease-Speed on the main turn meter booster and possibly a second target depending on who the A1's second hit randomly selects. A hegemon who is built fast enough in a double turn meter boosting team can even take two turns before your nuker due to his passive, allowing you to apply evil eye and decrease speed on their turn meter booster and then cycle back around to use A2 on the enemy team and potentially lock them out further.

The masteries are all focused around landing/extending debuffs and locking out your enemy. Fearsome Presence is the T6 mastery of choice, because it increases the chance of your artifact set activating on the enemy (sets don't need accuracy). Evil eye is arguably the most important mastery for a CC hegemon because it allows you to reduce the enemy's turn meter by 20% on up to two targets. This allows you to boost first before an opponent who has a faster Arbiter. All other masteries are around maximising your accuracy, extending debuffs (Master Hexer) or adding survivability for Hegemon if he's used in your arena defense.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The primary stats of a CC hegemon are speed and accuracy. Building your Hegemon with speed allows you to fend off enemies in your arena defense if they bring their own Hegemon and aren't as fast as you. In addition to that, a faster Hegemon takes more turns throughout the fight and provides more lockout. 

It is VERY important that you do NOT build any crit rate into your CC hege. If your Hegemon crits the enemy and they have Cycle of Revenge T5 defense mastery then they have a chance of increasing their turn meter and potentially ruining your speed cut. A hybrid role (CC+nuke) Hegemon is a bad choice because it limits your options in arena offence because of this mastery.

It's also wise to build as little attack/damage as possible so that the enemy booster doesn't activate the Resurgent defense mastery that can remove the Speed Down debuff.

The best artifact sets are Stun, Taunting and Daze. Each set is situationally as good as the other and it comes down to what line up you have and what the enemy has. You may want to avoid Taunting if the enemy has a blender because it will severely hurt your team. You may also want to avoid Daze if you have a debuffer that also attacks at the same time such as Stag Knight because it will wake them up. Taunting has the highest chance of the sets to activate so if you build this then make your Hegemon as tanky as possible with HP% gloves and DEF neck/ring with HP% substat due to the scaling of his base stats. Stun provides the most versatility and complete lockout, albeit with a lower chance of activating.

Item Main Stats:
Glove: NOT Crit Rate%, use anything with speed/acc substats.
Chest: Accuracy
Boots: Speed
Ring: Any
Amulet: Any - use whatever has the highest accuracy.
Banner: Accuracy - use whatever has the highest speed.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Hegemon on auto and on defense will use his A2 first, however he really shines when using his A1 (Grave's Grasp) combined with the mastery Evil Eye (support T4). The maximum potential of this build is achieved when used in conjunction with his Fateful Arrival passive because you can reduce their speed booster's turn meter and apply a speed down debuff. This allows you to go before the enemy even though your primary speed booster is slower.

A video demonstration of this can be found below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u-dhfu5CeF0
data.label: Notes:
Early Game Guide
data.desc:
Early game goal is to make sure you can farm 3 food champions to level up the rest of your roster.
To do this you need your campaign farmer. If you're very early into the game, Kael is the most useful starter and worth rerolling into, as he will be good in more areas of the game then the rest.
An exception can be made if you were lucky and had opened a hero that is better than Kael at farming and has a good AOE attack, for example Skullcrown, Rotos, Big Un, Martyr to name a few.

data.label: Early Game Guide
data.desc:
Once your campaign farmer is selected the best thing to do is to get him as powerful as you can ASAP. To do this you want to buy masteries for 800 gems, follow the guides, 6 star and ascend the farmer.
You want to farm the Brimstone path 12-3 of the highest difficulty you can. The xp and silver there is the most optimal. If you can't farm brutal with your level 60 farmer, you need to get 5 star speed and lifesteal gear with the right main stats.
Those are crit rate gloves, atk % chest, speed boots.

data.label: Notes:
data.desc: Once you are able to farm brutal 12-3 with 3 food champions, you're now ready for the mid-game and selecting your core team.

data.label: Late Game+ guide
data.desc:
Once you have arbiter you can now put your tears from farming dragon 20 and spider 20 to good use. You can now build glass cannon teams that rely on speed, because arbiter can ressurect your glass cannons.
At first you will just build more stable team, participate in events and tournaments and progress in faction wars.
This will be the time to get the gear for end-game content and finally down Ultra-Nightmare Clan boss.

data.label: Late Game+ guide
data.desc:
The time for speed running dungeons under two minutes has come. Coldhearts and Royal Guards now take center stage along with poison bursters. Making those speed running teams makes it possible for you to farm the items that you had only seen on youtube and twitch. And it will take a lot of energy and almost certainly requires and auto-clicker.
Your roster should already be solid and you can now prepare your 3x3 arena team, complete faction wars or try to reach Platinum Arena

data.label: Late Game+ guide:
data.desc:
Once you've reached this point there is not much to do apart from helping others and complaining that there is no new content on discord or reddit.
It's a long journey, so make sure to share those flowcharts if you had liked them, and good luck!

title: Frozen Banshee Late Game Clan Boss Build

data.label: Masteries
data.desc:
This is a late game build for banshee that relies on her to tank the stuns on ultra-nightmare clan boss. She does not need the support tree because the great hall and the banner slow her to focus on survivability and boosting her base defence. Vizier allows her to skip turns while stunned.
Note that Frozen Banshee has the best synergy and poison application in a counter attack team due to her poison sensitivity requirement to land poisons. She can also prove troublesome to some compositions since she applies poisons so quickly. If you are running FB in a counterattack team, she should be the only poisoner on your team to ensure you land the other beneficial debuffs.

data.label: Stats and equipment
data.desc:
Set: lifesteal + anything. Focus on defence with enough speed and accuracy as this is a tank build. More defence would be better
Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - def
Banner - accuracy

data.label: Notes:
data.desc:
Notes: Your results may vary if you don’t have valk shield and vizier to extend debuffs. Banshee does not use her a3 in counterattack teams and does not mess up the turn order. This team is slow tuned, Valkyrie has higher base speed so banshee misses one counterattack and block debuffs buff, making her the target on void and force clan boss.
https://youtu.be/8DwWi3xXj5A

data.label: Spider 20
data.desc:
Note that cleaning out the spiderlings and dealing massive damage to the big spider is key to this build. Having defense down leads to Royal Guard using his Takedown straight away. He needs at least 4 spiderlings alive for his AI to use Takedown. Having speed decrease on the Big Spider also helps with stability of the runs.
You can find guides for the rest of the heroes here by using the bot commands
https://youtu.be/D1SAqGw4JIA

data.label: Dragon 20
data.desc:
As you can see when Royal Guard doesn't have 100% crit rate vs magic affinity he doesn't show the best results. However, he is extremely good both on waves and on the boss
https://youtu.be/zTwrbvRwGJM

data.label: Fire Knight 20
data.desc:
Even though Royal Guard is negative affinity on Fire Knight and will always have 35% chance for a weak hit and for his debuffs to miss, he can still be decent on FK.
His aura is good for dungeons his debuffs, including decrease speed and turn meter help.
https://youtu.be/MB3Do5mK1dI

Psylar is a very strong control support, and she can be amazing in a stun set. To utilise her kit to the fullest, defense and support mastery trees are good choices.  

In the defense tree we are looking for general survivability, and the first big mastery we pick up is Harvest Despair. This mastery will help a lot with sustain through the leech mechanic on the stunned targets. 

The tier 6 talent is by far the most important - Fearsome Presence increases the stun set chance of landing stuns from 18% to 23%. 

Since all of Psylar's attacks are AoE, this 5% difference adds up and gives your runs more consistency. The second tree we take on Psylar is the support tree - this just adds even more utility, turn meter increase and accuracy to help land the Leaden Legs ability. Arcane Celerity and Evil Eye help with turn meter manipulation as well, which makes a big difference in keeping dungeon waves controlled.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
This build revolves around the 4-piece Stun set from Fire Knight's Castle. Note that the stun set does not need any accuracy for the stun debuff to land. However, accuracy is needed for her skills, in particular her a3.


The actual stats on the gear pieces do not need to be perfect for this build to work, but you want to prioritize speed, accuracy, defense and hp. In this build Psylar is a control support, not a main source of damage. We want her to be fast so she gets more turns off to get more stuns and turn meter manipulation. At certain breakpoints (over 2x speed of enemy waves) that will make Psylar much more effective, and you may want to consider pairing her with a speed aura lead or turn meter booster like apothecary if that would be the difference between 185 speed to 215 speed for example.

Glove: DEF% / HP%
Chest: DEF% / HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Defense
Amulet: HP/Defense
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Once you have Psylar with full masteries and good gear she can be used on waves in any dungeon and dark elves faction wars to deal with the waves. As a void she does not have weak hits and can lock down waves anywhere.You may look at the video below to see how she works on dragon and ice golem.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0MItEijtco8  

She can also be used on lava knight and spider dungeons for control.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MTZdZmivkb0
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
The Seeker is one of the highest utility epic champions in the game. It boosts many rare abilities from different champions that are relevant from early to deep late game. This guide explains how a single Seeker build can be useful for a wide variety of game areas from Ultra-Nightmare Clan Boss to platinum arena. The key to Seeker is in the support and control abilities, turn meter boosting, attack up buff, automatic defence up that trigger when hit, and taunt on default attack. 

Mastery wise, Seeker is not a key damage or healing champion. He can be fantastic as a support and he is definitely worth fully booking in the late game.

Therefore, if you're using Seeker for clan boss [Warmaster] is the correct t6 mastery, along with [Retribution] and [Deterrence] for extra attacks. In arena this also grants a chance to taunt. In the late game builds the equipment like accuracy banners and great hall bonuses are more readily available, making it possible to switch to better survivability and team utility, like in this mastery build.

Note that this build does not have any turn meter boosting masteries or skill cooldowns. This is the selection required for unkillable and counterattack clan boss teams that must cycle the skills in a pre-determined sequence.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The Seeker finds itself as a support champion in both arena and the clan boss (CB). As the CB usually requires speed tuning, you will find that if you only have 1 Seeker, the CB needs to dictate the gear. For example, the famous BAT unkillable UNM setup requires Seeker to be at 248-263 speed. This makes the Seeker also an ideal 2nd speed booster in Gold 4 or 3x3 arena. 

Gear wise, speed matching to the rest of team is the most important consideration. I recommend going for 3 sets of speed to meet the late game challenge of a support champion at around 250 speed. This will be suitable for many CB setups as well as Gold 4 arena. In Gold 4, the typically 1st speed lead might have a speed of 300-330 speed with a 20-30% turn meter boost (e.g. Arbiter, Lyssandra, Sethallia, Kymar). This makes Seeker going second ideal, offering the attack up in the process. 

Do visit https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/batmaneater for CB guide on Seeker, as well as arena speed tune calculator. The speed of each champion in this setup is critical to making it work, and Unkillable setups have strict requirements for the heroes used in such compositions.

Despite the attack-based Seeker not being a critical damage champion, improving its stats in attack, critical chance, and damage is still important in the long term. In the Batman-Eater speed tune, a 250 speed Seeker, maintaining 100% chance crit and 3000 attack can do over 12m damage on UNM. Ideally the attack and critical damage should be higher. 


Glove: Crit Damage%/Crit Rate %
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Atk / Acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
[All Areas] [A2: Tailwind] is a combo ability that fills all ally turn meter by 30% and gives the 50% attack up. This is clearly an idea arena first or second speed boost. This ability is also crucial in clan boss teams such as the famous BAT tune, increasing team wide damage and cycling the unkillable skills of other champions faster.   

You can see how Seeker helps on UNM clan boss achieve excellent results with two Maneaters, who are the backbone of the composition. The damage can be further improved to 1 key UNM and 1 key NM with better equipment

https://youtu.be/qGcJppQZp5w 

[Arena] Second, is the [A3: Dark Blood] passive, a crucial automatic 60% defence up for the whole team when the Seeker suffers a critical damage. The long cooldown is not suitable for consistent reliance, but in arena when allies are nuked, this is a life saver – significantly reducing damage. 

[Arena] His Aura is also a hugely useful defence aura at 30%, which allows him to significantly improve the tanking ability of champions against nuke teams.

[Arena] Finally, is the often overlooked [A1: Devour], which when booked has a 50% to land provoke. This is an important crowd control as the Seeker often goes before other champions and can effectively take out the most crucial enemy champion for a turn.

The Seeker really shines against nuke teams such as blenders (arbiter, longbeard, sinesha, skullcrown for example), where it gives a 30% defence aura to the defending team and a passive defence up. It can make the difference between a wipe and staying for 2-3 turns to counter and finish the enemy off!  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bx6zUxvk8b0&feature=youtu.be
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Skullcrown is considered one of the best epics in the game, and she is better than a lot of legendaries in terms of usefulness. 

In late game the choice for Skullcrown's masteries is focused on maximum damage output. Like most nukers, she is squishy so Retribution mastery is the best option. Furthermore, this mastery synergizes with her unkillable passive. Skullcrown is not really about placing the Weaken on her A2, so we'll prioritise the extra damage for the counter attack from the Defense tree instead of anything on the Support tree. Since she's a nuker, the Attack tree is a must, and the T6 mastery is optional: if you have over 220 or so Crit. Dmg from the gear, Helm Smasher might be your best choice. If not, then Flawless execution with the extra +20% Crit. Damage can be chosen for a more sustained damage output
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
In terms of stats, we just look for maximising damage on her, so Crit.Dmg gloves (with C.Chance substat), ATK% chest (with C.Chance substat) and we can go either ATK% boots (for even more damage) or Speed if we use her in dungeons too.

Set-wise there's a few options: we can build her entirely for damage with sets like Savage or Cruel. We can use the Retaliation set from Golem for some extra surprise counter attacks, since most attacks are critical hits on Arena. Even Stun set if we only need her as a controller in Faction Wars. Or for top platinum, an immunity sets so Tormin and Hegemon teams don't impact her.

Glove: Crit Damage
Chest: Attack %
Boots: Speed / Atk
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Dmg
Banner: Atk
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Skullcrown is one of the most used epic champions in arena all the way from silver, to gold 4 and even in some comps in Platinum with the blender compositions. 

You can find some gold 4 action with her in the video below. Note that for optimal results her speed could be higher since this is not a blender composition.

https://youtu.be/1IJaZ5EvNRY?t=61 

In early / mid game she can be the main nuker in arena because the unkillable of her passive allowes her to have a turn no matter what. With the inclusion of champions like Rotos (that ignores unkillable) or Serris (that removes it) she's been used less and less in this position and more as a part of a blender comp together with Sinesha and a champion that has an ally attack skill. 

She's able to clear 12.3 in Brutal without much trouble, be a great champion clearing waves anywhere, and a reliable source of damage in FW. 

https://youtu.be/1IJaZ5EvNRY?t=30
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Reliquary Tender is a void rare from the High Elves faction. As a void champion she can be tricky to acquire, especially if you’re Free to Play, but if you pull her early you have a wonderful champion who can make your progress much smoother. As a rare champion she’s cheap to build in terms of books and ascension potions which is particularly important early in the game. She really starts to shine in the mid game when you face tougher enemies in the dungeons and can accompany you all the way through your quest to acquire your Arbiter. If you think you’ll be left with a vault guardian when Lumaya’s herald finally joins your cause, think twice. Reliquary Tender can still help you even very late into the game in areas such as faction wars.

MASTERIES

No matter where you want to use her, you can go either Defense and Support for maximum survivability and fast response or Offense and Support if you want her to deal some damage, especially on clan boss.

The most important masteries have been highlighted in this picture. Going Offense into Warmaster will allow your Reliquary Tender to contribute some damage, especially on high level enemies and bosses. Her base damage is low. so there's no point going Offense if you don't take Warmaster. The other option is to pick the Support tree Timely Intervention as it will increase your Turn Meter each time an ally is badly wounded (or killed), thus allowing you to heal them faster.

Spirit Haste and Cycle of Revenge allow you to act even faster when some of your allies are dead or suffer a critical hit. Rapid Response and Arcane Celerity (if you can land your decrease attack) will also contribute to many more turns during long fights than your speed alone would allow.

Note that due to the way her continuous healing works, there is no point taking any of the healing increasing masteries. You can also use Reliquary Tender at level 50 with nearly no masteries if you wish to, as long as she does her job well and doesn't die herself from damage.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The gear requirements are pretty straightforward: she needs high speed and HP.

As a cleanser she should be the fastest champion in your team so she can cleanse your debuffs. High HP will cause the AI to consider other targets before attacking her, especially since she’s never weak affinity, and you want her to survive in order to revive your fallen champions.To complement those main stats, a healthy Def will help her survive bosses AoEs and Acc will help her land her Decrease Attack if you care about it. %HP Gloves and Chest with %Def and Speed substats are perfect for her, especially if they also have a bit of Acc.

The best sets for her are Stalwart which will help her survive bosses AoEs more easily and Shield to capitalize on her HP if you can get those high enough. Other good options are Speed, HP, Def, Immortal and Resilience. She also works perfectly in totally broken sets as long as you can keep her fast and alive.

Gantlets : HP%
Chest : HP% 
Boots : Speed
Ring : Defense
Amulet : Defense
Banner : Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Here is a perfectly functional late game Reliquary Tender showcase an all-rare Dragon 20 team run, where she plays a key role by keeping the team alive to do the job

https://youtu.be/-BXt_tr5Mfc 

She really shines in the mid to late game until you get your Arbiter who will probably replace her in most areas where you need a healer/reviver. In the very late game, she can still find some use when you need a cleanser and if used alongside an Arbiter she makes your team extremely resilient.

Campaign. If you pull her early she can help your starter 3-star Brutal and get the progression rewards. She might even help you 3-star some levels of Nightmare.

Dungeons. This is where she shines. She’s void so she can be used in every single dungeon and will never be weak. She makes your team much more resilient. She’s useless for speed farming dungeons but she can help you reach level 20 to complete your quests and start farming end-game gear. You will eventually remove her from your dungeon teams as you develop better and faster teams but she will help you get to that point.

Faction Wars. FW is basically one big tough dungeon which means she will be great here. High level crypts can be really hard as you will typically face dangerous enemies that will debuff you often making her cleanse even better here. This is the place where she can still be useful even after you get your Arbiter, all the way to the very last crypt.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Bellower can be a 8 to 9 second speed farmer for campaign. It is something that is nice to have, but not so easily achievable for mid-game players. However, this is the perhaps the most budget build for speed farming with the exception of Queen Eva, because the requirements for it are the lowest.

The masteries are focused on on thing only: to deal sufficient and stable amounts of damage to the mobs to allow consistent farming of 12-3 or 12-6 brutal. Flawless Excecution is the t6 mastery pick to ensure stability.

Other masteries are picked to increase the speed and damage of Bellower as more mobs are destroyed
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The gear featured here is quite minimalistic. This Bellower is focused on speed and has the common grade speed sets found in campaign. You need to reach at least 189 speed to go twice before the mobs (and you gain more speed thanks to masteries on kill).

Approximately 2.5k attack, 160% crit damage and 100% crit rate are the needed parameters to replicate this build

Gantlets : Crit Rate
Chest : Atk % 
Boots : Speed
Ring : Atk
Amulet : Crit Damage

data.desc:
As you can see in this build Bellower has enough attack to one-shot the first and second wave of the mobs. However, he does need two hits on the third wave, making him slightly slower than the variant that focuses on one-shotting every wave. 

However, the alternative build provided on the next page for Late Game does require better equipment too.

data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
The Arbiter is a defining Raid champion and single-handedly seperates Late Game and Late Game+ in our classification. Obtainable through the missions she is guaranteed to enable multiple playstyles if you haven't gotten champions for them already.

This includes the ability for mass revive and allows to build glass cannon attackers for dungeons (available on the next page) and additional speed boosting for cb. However, the main use of Arbiter in Late Game+ is the Arena thanks to her kit.

It's usually a good idea to book all Arbiter skills with cooldowns, as she is one of the most useful legendaries in the game.

Arbiter has an excellent (2nd best behind Lord Shazar) speed aura in arena at 30%, two turn meter boosting abilities with a full team resurrection. Most of your efforts for masteries and equipment will be focused on having as much speed as possible, so lore of steel and all tm boosting masteries are a common choice.

There are a number of considerations for the T6 masteries. In this guide timely intervention was chosen to allow Aribter to cut in the turn order of opposing teams even if you didn’t go first or suffered a setback in arena.

If you are focusing on other content than Platinum arena you may choose to pick +50 Resistance or +50 Accuracy as your final masteries.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
If there is one thing to define Arbiter it is one word: Speed. Most of the endgame will be focused on achieving as much speed as possible from any source including Speed sets, masteries, glyphs. To achieve this, ensure that you prioritise triple to quad roll speed substat gear irrespective or other main/sub stats. It may take a huge amount of time and energy to farm it.

Given the choice, use HP/Def ring and amulet, and Acc banner for her A2. Refresh accessories would have significant benefit for Arbiter as many of her key abilities have long cooldowns.

Weapon: Speed/Divine Speed – Priority speed sub-stat
Helm: Speed/Divine Speed – Priority speed sub-stat
Shield: Speed/Divine Speed – Priority speed sub-stat
Hands: Speed/Divine Speed – Priority speed sub-stat
Chest: Speed/Divine Speed – Priority speed sub-stat
Feet: Speed/Divine Speed – Priority 6 star speed boots
Ring: HP/Def
Amulet: HP/Def
Banner: any – Priority speed sub-stat

If Arbiter is going second and your lead is not Siphi or Duchess that can give block debuffs, and you face a Tormin, your Arbiter's team is likely to get frozen. You might want 4 pieces of immunity gear, with good speed sub-stat rolls in that case.

Arbiter should be your 1st or 2nd fastest champion and the speed aura lead in 99% of arena speed teams. She pairs well with other speed boosting champions such as Siphi, Lanakis, Lyssandra, Golden Reaper, Sethallia, Kymar, Apothecary…etc. Therefore, speed matching to the rest of team is the most important consideration. 

If you aim to use Arbiter as lead, it is recommended to fo for 3 sets of speed or divine speed to meet the reasonably above average late game challenge of a support champion at around (at time of writing – end of 2020):

•        Lead: Low Gold 4 (310 speed), High Gold 4 (340 speed), Low Platinum (350 speed), Mid Platinum (365 speed).

Do visit https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/arena-calculator  for arena speed tune calculator to make sure your opponents don't cut into your turn order
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
As a speed lead, arbiter will automatically use A3 that boosts Attack by 50% and TM by 30%. This is excellent for the follow up nuke and is one of the strongest TM boosts in game. 

See example videos: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eoeWf8bVo5Q&feature=youtu.be 

On turn 2 Arbiter prioritises A4 to boost TM by 20%. This will happen even if your team is alive – so you may want to switch off AI if it's better to save A4 revive in your opinion. 

Arbiter AI will rarely prioritise A2 unless there is an AOE easy kill of multiple low HP champions, even if there is a vital buff to be dispelled (e.g. Skullcrown unkillable). Finally, don’t underestimate her A1, which is a double hit attack that places weaken. 

Here are some more examples:

https://youtu.be/fnsjuC0x8V8
https://youtu.be/RZte4nilokA 

Note the sequence. Siphi is the fastest tm booster and applies block debuffs (for Serris to use Def down), Arbiter boosts second, Serris removes buffs and applies Def Down, Foli nukes the team. Skullcrown has unkillable and arbiter is able to remove it.

There are many counters to the Arbiter go first strategy to be aware of:
•        Tormin to freeze on Turn Meter boost and buffs on other team members. Having block debuffs or immunity gear is the counter to Tormin.
•        Valkyrie with high accuracy to reduce TM due to buffs and “cut in”, allowing enemy team to take over the attack initiative
•        Hegemon to nuke first to either block skills and/or kill a key member. When Arbiter revives, the Tormin in the above strategy is more potent as any immunity gear effects are gone.
•        Cardinal team that allows you to kill all champions except Cardinal, and then Cardinal resurrects everyone to full TM and overtakes Arbiter in the TM race. (rare tactic in Platinum)
data.label: Notes:

title: Death Hound Late Game+ Platinum tank buster

data.desc:
In this interesting guide feature we look at how a common can be viable in Platinum Arena.

Note that this is more of a fun build rather than a viable f2p strategy, but it does demonstrate the capabilities of some common heroes to overcome their handicap of stats and lack of ascension.

Due to the nature of how Death Hound's A1 works, he is a superb and cheap choice to use vs heavy shielded, high resist tank teams, especially with Warlord in the composition.

The following masteries are for arena only, specifically vs high HP/DEF tanks and teams that can contain Siphi, Duchess, Valkyrie, Krisk, Warlord, etc. We mostly want to maximize the damage output from Death Hound or multiple Death Hounds, so a typical arena offence and defence tree build is the best way to go, with one major exception. 

In 95% of the cases on offence tier 6 mastery [Helm Smasher] will out perform [Flawless Execution], however in case of Death Hound since A1 will ignore 100% DEF if the champion is crit capped, you would like to stack as much crit damage as possible, especially considering that commons can not be ascended and as such can not be outfitted with necklace and banner. 

Additional note: [Blood Shield] was picked as T5 offence mastery, simply because it is the only way to reach [Flawless Execution].
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The best gear set that can be fitted on Death Hound is Swift Parry, to add that additional rng reliant factor of unkillable just in case things will go wrong. 

However, any gear will work as long as lots of attack and crit damage can be stacked. Speed is much less important as Death Hound will shine on a team with an AOE counter attack the most.

Glove: CritDamage%/Crit Rate % 
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Atk% 
Ring: -
Amulet: - 
Banner: - 


For boots and chest you want ATT% and for the gloves you would want Crit Damage, or in the worst case scenario Crit Rate or ATK%. This is fine as long as needed amount of Crit Damage or Crit Rate can be achieved from the sub stats. Another important part of the build is resistance. As much resistance as possible will help, however it should be a secondary or tertiary focus with the major one going into damage output of the champion.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
On auto Death Hound will always open up with A2, so when you are attacking, the best way is to manual. Will Death Hound be the meta on Platinum Arena? It might not be the case, but we hope you had enjoyed this unique guide.

title: Miscreated Monster Late Game Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
For dragon 20 this build offers good wave control on the way to the boss and protection for the team, two in one.

Note that the AOE Defence Down from Zargala is a key for additional damage and team shield from Miscreated Monster. Your Def Down hero has to be faster for optimal results.

On the second wave, Hordins can be problematic form some compositions that don't have ressurection team. MM allows Apothecary to tank it with the shield and ally protection.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3r_iO8lzaVQ
data.label: Dragon

data.desc:
Ice Golem is not the most popular Dungeon for farming gear due to the quality of the sets. However, MM can be the key to farming it for Arbiter missions or Tournaments.

The same principle applies as with other Dungeons. Control with the Stun, Massive Shields and Ally Protection help power through the waves and the boss.

https://youtu.be/3r_iO8lzaVQ?t=131
data.label: Ice Golem

data.desc:
Miscreated Monster is negative affinity for Lava Knight 20. This means 35% weak hit chance when the attack is not critical and the debuff fails. However, MM can still be useful there to ensure additional surviability of squishy heroes like Apothecary and Coldheart .

https://youtu.be/3r_iO8lzaVQ?t=597
data.label: Fire Knight

data.desc:
Hegemon is one of the most devestating arena champions in the game because his passive Fateful Arrival allows him to take the first turn a battle. It's worth noting that Kriks's passive will apply a shield before Hegemon takes his turn and this is the expected behaviour.

Hegemon has good base attack and crit damage and is of the void affinity. With the right gear he can completely obliterate and one shot an enemy before they even take a turn resulting in 1 second battles. A nuke hegemon should be built with as much damage as possible and in the savage artifact set combined with the cruel artifact set.

All masteries linked here are about maximising the damage of his A2 Crippling Cold. Heart of Glory, Ruthless Ambush and Bring it Down enable him to deal more damage on the first turn with his A2. Helmsmasher is the best T6 mastery for late game players who can budget a high enough critical damage percentage into their build (generally 200%+). The defense tree masteries largely don't matter but the defense T5 masteries Retribution and Deterrence can assist if you don't kill them on the A2 nuke.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The Savage artifact set is crucial as it delivers the most damage out of all the four piece artifact sets. The remaining two slots should optimally be filled with the cruel if possible. Combining the savage set with cruel and helmsmasher can produce incredibly high damage attacks during the A2 Crippling Cold.

You should aim to reach 100% crit rate for most nuke Hegemon builds. There is one exception which is lowering his crit rate to 60-70% in order to avoid the Cardinal revive strategy, however most players should avoid that build unless they are using him during the last push of Arena reset in Platinum.
Attack and critical damage are the priorities after reaching 100% crit rate and attack should not be neglected. There is no benefit to speed with a nuke Hegemon as the goal of the build is to one shot the enemy during his passive on the first turn.

Accuracy is a nice to have but should never be picked up at the cost of attack and crit. 

Glove: Crit Damage%
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Atk%
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Atk
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
If you intend to use Hegemon in arena offence, use an ATK% aura champion as the leader for the extra few hundred attack power. 

When the featured Hegemon build does work, the battles are over quite fast

https://youtu.be/7GNw7WKZwxE 

When used on defense, he pairs best with a support reviver, a shield champion who can also damage and then a wildcard spot. Hegemon pairs very well with Tormin because an Arbiter who lives and revives the other enemy champions will also likely freeze them due to the two TM boosts and attack up buff. 

Using a Hegemon to one shot an enemy in the arena is cheeky and should be done with care. Duchess Lilitu's 25% damage reduction passive will almost surely mean she lives, Seeker is also dangerous in the leader position of the team due to his passive and Sandlashed Survivor is worth avoiding due to her passive providing ally protect. Rotos will always live due to his passive

Teams with likely candidates for shield sets such as Mountain King, Harvest Jack and Skull-Lord are worth skipping because of their high health pool and the shield artifact set. Krisk teams are also worth skipping due to his shield passive and decrease attack too.

Good candidates for a nuke target is a team with primarily attack or HP based champions, double nukers, single target revivers or teams without a reviver support champion at all. 

https://youtu.be/uxF22dxX-eU 

In the video above Arbiter survives the nuke hit. However, block skills and subsequent Sethalia tm reduction prevents the opponent from a chance to come back from this.

https://youtu.be/cSaWMD-ObY0 
https://youtu.be/kEmLFp0rSwE 

Straight forward win, with Sethalia stripping the unkillable to finish the job.

A few more demonstrations of a nuke Hegemon can be found below.

https://youtu.be/nfoiBHIwsCw 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S0LEBswoElk

title: Lanakis The Chosen Late Game+ Guide

data.desc: In this setup, Lanakis requires Warmaster to do good amount of damage to the Clan boss. Her Build is focused on surviving as long as possible to deliver ally attacks and buffs, so Cycle of Revenge, Retribution and Resurgent are extremely valuable masteries from the defense tree in the latter turns.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Lanakis is the second fastest champion in the Clan Boss team to maximize the buff extension, ally attack and buffs frequency. However, Apothecary can only take care of one champion heal per cycle, so Lanakis requires lifesteal gear to keep her alive. 100% crit rate helps survivability and damage and is useful for additional DPS. Accuracy is not necessary, so the focus should be Speed>HP/Def>Crit.

data.desc:
Lanakis is the glue for this composition providing some key components.

1. Lanakis provides ally attacks that function as a additional DPS component, healing with lifesteal sets and more chances to keep the debuffs.
2. Buff extension for more speed and survivability
3. Critical Rate and Attack Up buffs for addtional DPS
4. Turn meter boosts

You can find a video of the run on Void CB in this video:

data.desc:
Late Game+ is when your team can be min-maxed and unleash it's full potential. Skullcrusher allows to reach the ultimate goals of the end game, e.g. 3 keying and 2 keying Ultra-Nightmare in a much easier manner.

Warmaster, Retribution masteries along with a lifesteal set are still a staple. You now have more options for equipment and are able to focus on dps more.


Do note that the damage from the attacks themselves are only 75% of the stated damage, but this is still very much worth it. 
At this stage it's worth it to book Skullcrusher A1 because every bit of damage counts.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Set: lifesteal + anything. Once you've reached the 4200 defense benchmark, the best skullcrusher build will have 100% crit rate and as much crit damage as you can build for extra dps.

If you've got amazing items with good crit rate and speed substats you can wear 6 star def% boots.

The main focus will be to keep the speed high enough for the speed tune or explore more exotic tunes on the next guide page.

Glove - crit rate %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed / def %
Ring - def
Amulet - def
Banner - def
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
There are many ways you can utilise Skullcrusher for UNM. Let's go over some options. 

1. You can use the slow-tune for both NM and UNM

In this case the speed would be 171 for Skullcrusher and 172-180 for the rest of the heroes. You would manual the first two cb AOE attacks then press auto. Here's an example of how a team would work:

2. You can use a fast-tune for UNM

Your Skullcrusher would have 191 speed and the rest would have 192-200 speed and would go before the clan boss in much the same manner as the video in the late game page.

https://youtu.be/3WrnDqIRKKY

3. You can use heroes that have a 4 turn cooldown with Skullcrusher, so they have a 4:3 tune.

I've been able to 2 key on Force UNM with this setup, but not on void yet. If anyone can calculate the perfect setup for speed that protects against both AOE 2 debuff and stun both on Void and affinity, please let me know! deadwoodjedi has a calculator where such speed tunes can be tested.

Skullcrusher, Vizier and Rhazin are slow speed tuned. Guides for these heroes can be found using the bot.

This covers the most classical Late Game setups for Skullcrusher. However, there are more ways to utilise the hero, so turn to the next page for more options! 


A few notes on the video:

* Skullcrusher is the slowest in this comp. The speed of each hero matters and if sepulcher sentinel casts her block debuffs and defense up before the second AOE, skullcrusher gets stunned, breaking the speed tune.

* Steelskull is not very reliable on auto. He will not cleanse the stun as a priority and will not buff defence up if it's on heroes.

* Steelskull is not sufficient as a solo poisoner unless you have a debuff extender like Vizier.

* This composition has potential to reach 2 key if the correct speed tune and better equipment with more crit rate and damage is used.

data.desc:
Paragon + Damage Dealer = 12-7 nightmare on manual. Paragon needs 171+ speed
Note: Apart from Rotos there are many heroes who can do it with Paragon. Tayrel, Miscreated Monster, Big Un, Ignatius, Skullcrown and many other can do it too. You have to complete it in 10 minutes for it to count!

Zargala can still see some play in late game+ if you don't have amazing legendaries and epic with defense down.

Having a mass ressurection hero allows you to focus on dps, speed and get enough accuracy for all the dungeons. Having high attack, crit rate and damage allows Zargala to mown down the waves.

If you want to focus late-game Zargala for Arena consider more speed and Flawless Execution for the final tier 6 mastery if having Helmsmasher results in failed runs

Set: Savage + Cruel would be best. Second best would be Savage + any. Can also be a mix without sets if the needed parameters are met.

This Zargala relies on support of other heroes to be ressurected if things go wrong. You want around 200 accuracy for dungeons 20, but may want more if you're using her in high end Arena.

Zargala can be useful for wave clearing in most dungeons. On Dragon 20 she has the added bonus of affinity advantage with extra crit rate.
