data.desc:
Maneater is one of the most wanted epic champions in the game for UNM and NM Clan Boss (see the Late Game Guide on the next page for more info)

However, he is capable of helping out in many other areas of the game, including Spider 19 and 20 Dungeons. This Midgame guide focuses on how exactly he can be of help. Maneater is worth booking at this stage. In terms of masteries he's not too picky. Accuracy masteries from the support tree will allow you to focus more on the other stats. The offense tree is a classic dungeon/clan boss tree, with warmaster as t6 to provide a bit more damage, even if he will is not the primary damage dealer.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
If you don't plan to use maneater as your Decrease Attack for early clan boss, you don't need any particular sets of gear. However, since he loses HP when he uses his A3, an immortal set is a good idea (to be sure that he does not need to be saved by your healer)

There are 3 stats that you need to focus on:

1) Enough accuracy : You want to aim for 220+ accuracy so he can be usable in all dungeons 20
2) Speed : The more speed you have, the better. I recommend 170 as minimum, but you should aim for 200+ if you can
2) Crit rate : Aim for as much crit rate as you can. The more you rely on him for decrease atk, the more crit rate you need. In this build he is at 100% crit rate

Glove: Crit Rate % 
Chest: Defense %
Boots: Speed
Ring: Defense/HP
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy

In the screenshot the speed boots have been removed to have similar stats to when spider 19 and 20 were done.

data.desc:
Meaneater kit makes him a very good champion for dungeon progression. He has an insane kit for spider but his utility is sometimes forgotten because a lot of people see it as a pure clan boss champion.

However, his AI is pretty bad: against most of the bosses he uses his A2 (which is one of the best ability in the game when in comes to single target turn meter manipulation) when he should not, and basically never uses it in spider (he spams his A1). 

For spider progression, it is very likely that you will have to play him manually (but you need to pass most of the stages only once so you should be fine). In particular, he can be helpful on Spider 19 that can be a tremendous trouble for some accounts. See the run below

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=52gx9G3Nwq8 

If you want to use him to farm spider in auto, you will have to click on the spider at the start of the round so his AI will play in a smarter way. 

In the next composition you can see how Maneater and Psylar can keep the Spider 20 locked and get the wins. Note that doing this semi-auto trick with the red mark on big spider will count towards the Arbiter mission

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cb-nRkzyVHo

data.desc:
Knight Errant is a decent solo target attacker.

This build focuses on maximized damage in the arena and low level dungeon progression. The masteries are designed to maximize damage output of Knight Errant's A3 and provide support to the team with his leech on A1 if utilized in pve scenarios. Helmsmasher is chosen above the other masteries for the increased damage on A3 which should one shot most champions encountered at this level.

Mid and Late Game are where Knight Errant shows the most potential as there are better alternatives in Late Game+ scenarios
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Cruel/Savage or Lifesteal. Lifesteal enables KE to utilize his A3 for maximum effect in the event he takes damage from a faster opponent in the arena or in drawn out matches. Cruel/Savage guarantees a one shot kill on his A3 right off the gate. Focus on building attack/critical dmg and bring crit. rate to 100%. Speed is necessary to be built to an amount that does not allow an opponent to cut in after turn meter boost from team mate. Accuracy can be built if used in clan boss for application of leech, or run with an acc lead.

Glove: Crit Damage
Chest: Attack %
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Dmg
Banner: Atk

data.desc:
Arena with speed lead/seeker boost and serris debuff. Kymar and Serris are obviously MVP of this team composition. With Kymar and Serris stripping buffs and AOE control with sleep and fear, Knight Errant can pick and one shot most opponents one by one.

If you do not have the same hero options your results may vary.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a4-mltD4YUM&feature=youtu.be

Knight Errant does not have AOE attacks, but he is still able to run the campaign if you would like to do so

data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Before we delve into the Masteries, we need to cover a few things. You are putting Souldrinker into your Arena team to die. It sounds crazy doesn't it?

However, This is exactly what we are trying to do. The reason for this is because Souldrinker is a very unique champion. Souldrinker has a passive no other champion in the game has. It puts 2 bombs on the enemy when he dies.

Thus, you our Unorthodox Arena Strategy is the following
- Souldrinker is a part of our Arena Team.
- Souldrinker gets nuked by enemy and dies.
- Souldrinker passive triggers putting bombs on enemy.
- The Enemy team is then put on a 2 turn timer.

They have 2 turns to remove the Bombs or Kill our remaining heroes. If they can't, the Bombs go off and we win! Pretty Cool Arena Strategy wouldn't you say?

The Masteries for Souldrinker are the following:

Defense Tree because the Defense tree has several Masteries which allow Souldrinker to take more damage.
T5 Defense Mastery - Selfless Defender
T6 Defense Mastery - Bulwark

These masteries are great because they reduce the damage our team takes. The damage gets redirected to our Souldrinker. This in turn helps our Souldrinker die faster to enable our Arena plan. Once the Souldrinker is sacrificed his passive triggers and places Bombs on the enemy. Support Tree has been chosen as the secondary tree. It grant us the more Accuracy that is needed to land our Bombs on the enemy. 

Finally, these Support tree masteries are of use if our Souldrinker gets a turn:
T4 Support Mastery - Evil Eye
T5 Support Mastery  - Sniper

It is unlikely our Souldrinker will survive the enemy nuke, but it can happen. Evil Eye can Decrease Enemy Turn Meter if we use Souldrinker A1 vs. them. Sniper - Can help our A3 skill if we don't have it fully booked. The good thing about Souldrinker is you don't really need to book him for him to be effective in this strategy.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important stats for Souldrinker are Attack & Accuracy. The more Attack you have the more Damage your Bombs will do when they explode. The more Accuracy you have the more likelihood of your Bombs landing on the enemy.

Gloves - Atk %
Chest - Atk %
Shoes - Atk %
Ring - Atk 
Amulet - Atk
Banner - Acc

Try to go for Accuracy, Attack % and even Flat Atk substats in all your gear. You might think this is crazy. Flat Atk in your Sub-stats? Who would do something so wild? Well, ask yourself the following question: How much damage do you think a Bomb can do? The Bombs can do over 50k+ damage to a hero. Keep in mind, This is just 1 Bomb. Souldrinker puts up 2 Bombs.

The Arena Fights look like Independence Day. Bomb Explosions & Fire Works going off everywhere. Enemy Heroes dropping left & right. It's totally awesome!

[Note from the editor: it looks like at this point the guide authors had been possessed by Souldrinker himself]
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
You can find the video showcasing Souldrinker in Arena below:

https://youtu.be/YPKQShBF4n8?t=609

There are a few caveats to running this strategy in Arena. In order for the bombs strategy to be efficient you need to watch out for a few things: High Resistance tank teams with 500+ resistance in top gold 4 platinum will be immune to this strategy and will eat you for lunch. Teams that have giant shields from the shield set, e.g. Krisk or Harvest Jack also fall into this category

The same goes for the teams that have immunity sets on them. The bombs won't be effective in this case even if you have lots of accuracy, since they won't land. 

Debuff cleansers can also be problematic, e.g. Battlesage or Hakkorn.

However, it's a fun and unique strategy to try out and it can work decently depending on the metagame you're facing!
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Tormin is the classic strong arena champion that excels in multiple roles in one package. He is incredibly versatile – serving an irreplaceable role in different arena metagame since release. He primarily serves three roles:

·      Crowd Control (CC): Freezes champions that cannot resist his passive after they get a buff or a turn meter (TM) boost. Has an active taunt and crowd control freeze on A1 and A3
·      Remove Buffs: Removes buffs from a single champion and hits the target for decent damage
·      Stall: Delays a potential loss by reviving himself
 
As a defensive and a potentially good damage champion, he can also surprise the enemy into neglecting his presence and causing havoc. The downside to Tormin is that his CC procs are not always reliable with only a low to average chance of proccing, so he is not a guaranteed speed arena farmer. His base speed is also fairly low, so he is often used mainly for his passive in the first turn. 
 
For a damage build, Helmsmasher is often preferred due to its shock damage potential. There are other builds possible with Tormin in terms of masteries including Fearsome Presence for more CC and Eagle Eye for high Accuracy. However, for Platinum arena the damage build can sometimes be the X factor to achieve a competitive edge.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
It is fairly more common now to operate Tormin as a damage champion, rather than a defensive champion (with a high resistance) or high accuracy champion in the current meta. This is because we often only want him to freeze some key champions (e.g. debuffer Madame or damager Trunda), whilst being able to dish out corresponding damage. 

To that end, around 200-300 accuracy for Platinum is enough, as most enemy attackers will not have high resist, and prioritising crit damage and defence is more important. Gear can be flexible and can include: Shield set, Swift parry, Damage gear (savage, crit damage), or broken sets. As long as you can gain a high crit rate, crit damage, defence, speed and accuracy as suggested by the screenshot you're well on your way to achieving good results
 
Glove: Crit Damage 
Chest: Def%
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Def
Amulet: Def or Crit Damage
Banner: Def or Acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Tormin can operate in a few ways:
 
1.     [Counter Speed] If your speed lead is slower than the enemy, Tormin can freeze them if they buff first. Be aware of Siphi / Duchess speed leads that can block debuffs, or immunity set teams. Operates well with a counter-attack from Valk and a defence buff. 

Video: https://youtu.be/ViHG8QqBK0w 

2.     [Hegemon Team] Hegemon opening can often kill a dps or two, but enemy Arbiter will resurrect them and Tormin can freeze them after this. 

Video: https://youtu.be/ePKxBEaUxBI 

3.     [Stall Team] At arena reset in Platinum at the last hour the race is on to stay there. Tormin adds vital seconds to your defence team game, especially with a swift parry set. Some players avoid attacking Tormin teams.

Additionally, some blender teams use Tormin instead of Sinesha to add extra control.

Justification for Damage Build: Tormin is often better in a damage build because he can do excellent damage and there is a prevalence of immunity sets or block debuffs in current meta. He has 2 AOE attacks, and a very strong single target attack, so not using him for damage is often a waste. Opponents in general are often unsure what gear Tormin uses, and generally leave him to be attacked last because he might be in a freeze set and his high defence means it is more efficient to attack a damage champion or a healer. This gives Tormin more opportunity to surprise the enemy with damage and crowd control at same time. 

More detailed references to Tormin in Damage Build from MurderInc: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qmffwPwR3Y4 
 
However, Tormin in a damage build is not without his issues and there are many challenges:

A.    Easily controlled and focused, hence swift parry is often used. This can be countered by block buffs from champions such Gurptuk.
B.    His CC procs are temperamental 
C.    His revive ability can be blocked by champions such as Lydia and Inithwe

Tormin is also useful in dungeons for Crowd Control and Faction Wars (FW), but in general he is a dedicated arena champion.

data.desc:
Valkyrie is one of the best clan boss heroes in the game. When utilized to the fullest she can survive up to turns 50+ on ultra-nightmare.

Definitely spend books until her A2 counterattack skill is booked to cooldown.

Valkyrie differs from most hero builds on ultra-nightmare clan boss. While she can be built with the standard defence tree masteries, her shields are what make her so good for her role. She pulls double duty both by putting AOE counterattack on the team and making survival possible.

Shieldbearer, Healing Savior, Merciful Aid can really boost the survivability of the team with the massive shields. Warmaster is the key on clan boss as usual for extra damage and healing if you're using the lifesteal set

A word of caution on Lasting Gifts mastery: if you have a dedicated tank that is the only one that gets targeted by clanboss to make your composition work, lasting gifts can really mess it up by extending counterattack and shields from Valkyrie, switching the target to another hero.

In the UNM comp you will see videos below, Banshee is the main tank, but Sepulcher Sentinel can also easily fit this role if Lasting Gifts extend the buffs.

data.label: Gear and Stats
data.desc:
Set: lifesteal + anything. For Valkyrie her defence is everything as her shields scale from it. This means that even in late game+ you want to focus on pumping her defence as high as possible. Lifesteal set allows her to tank UNM clan boss on Magic Affinity in this Composition. 

You can also run Valkyrie on Clan Boss in stalwart sets or simply broken sets, especially if you have a mass healer in your composition.

Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - def
Banner - def

You may want to stack enough defense based on how long your stun champion is surviving. If Valkyrie's shield isn't getting dented and your stun champion is dying you will get a significant increase in damage by dropping defense on all other champions except for the stun champion and increasing crit rate and damage on everyone to get the most dps on clan boss overall for true late game+ min maxing.

data.label: Notes:
data.desc:
Valkyrie is slow tuned in this build to allow for hitting both NM and UNM cb. this team can do about 65 mil on void NM and can 3 key any affinity of UNM. 

Valkyrie benefits immensely from Defence Up buff. Always include a hero that provides it for clan boss and most content if you're using this build

For spirit I use double counter composition for reasons explained below. You can find other heroes in the comp using the respective guide command.

https://youtu.be/8DwWi3xXj5A

Valkyrie has a serious drawback on affinity clan boss. Her passive is great for arena, but on clan boss she gets a turn meter boost every time clan boss buffs himself with attack up.

There are three ways to deal with this as far as I know:

1) Have a fast tuned Counterattack team that also has a block buffs in the comp. For example, a Vizier or Norog would go before the clan boss takes his first turn and place block buffs. This would prevent the passive from triggering.

2) Having a fast tuned Counterattack team. I've heard reports that when Valkyrie is fast tuned (192 speed) and other heroes are at 194-200 speed her passive doesn't boost her enough that she overtakes other heroes. This still needs to be tested.

3) If you're lucky enough to have another CA hero you can also run a double counter team

https://youtu.be/sAUnnIrxAm8

title: Late Game+ Seer Guide: End Game Dungeons

data.desc:
In this guide Seer needs to hit hard to clear out the dungeons waves efficiently. Offense and Support trees provide the tools that we need for this.

T6 Flawless excecution with +20% Crit Damage Mastery provides the consistent result we are looking for. The support tree is very flexible. You can give her the accuracy mastery or health if you already have enough accuracy into lore of steel. Evil Eye is a good mastery for decreasing the turn meter on some of the bosses or Cycle of Magic. Picking buff or debuff extension is also an option. You can adjust and decide based on what you need.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The three most important stats you want to build on a Seer is 100% Crit Rate, at least 200 Accuracy, and as much Crit Damage as possible. Greath Hall will play a big role in how easily you can achieve the needed parameters.

Gear sets are not very important for Seer for dungeon runs. You can use any gear set you want as long as you are able to meet the baseline stat requirement. Aside from those 3 stats, you want to mainly build her with high HP because her Karma Burn does not scale with attack and the damage from her A1 is insignificant. Build her with enough speed so that she’s tuned with the team and goes last.

Glove: Crit Damage % (Preferably) or Crit Rate % (If you cannot achieve 100%)
Chest: HP% / DEF %
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Seer is one of the best champions in the game to clear dungeon waves. She is relatively easy to gear because you don’t need any specific sets on her but in order to use her, you need to build a specific team around her. This guide will focus on how to gear a Seer and build a team to utilize her in Dragon, Ice Golem, and Fire Knight 20.

Seer’s main ability to nuke the waves is her A3, Karma Burn. This ability removes all buffs from allies and enemies, then deal damage proportional to the amount of buffs removed. If your Seer is build right, this skill almost always kills the entire wave if a Defense Down is placed on them.

How to build a Seer Dungeon team:
1) The team must consist of champions that can place at least 4 different buffs before she uses her A3. This is important because if there aren’t enough buffs, Seer will use her A2 first. The best/most easily obtainable single champion that can fit this role is Mausoleum Mage with a Shield Set (guide available on the Raid bot). 

If you don’t have him, you can use 2 different champions that place 2 different buffs each or some legendaries if you have them (e.g. Lilitu, Krisk) 

2)        The team must include a champion that places an AOE Defense Down, ideally at 100% chance, before she uses her A3. Champions that have both AOE Defense Down and Weaken would be best in slot
3)        The team should be speed tuned where Seer takes a turn only after the team Buffs and Defense Down debuff is placed.
4)        Optional: Skill Reset Champion – Prince Kymar or Renegade. Not necessary, but will definitely make the runs faster. If you do use one, the skill reset champion must go after Seer. This allows to recharge the Karma Burn and use it on the second wave to speed run the dungeons


The following Video shows Seer teams for Dragon, Ice Golem and Fire Knight 20

https://youtu.be/2ZfyFBkqIoc
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In order for Apothecary to perform his role on Ultra-Nightmare Clan Boss, Apothecary needs to be fast and boost his team speed and turn meter as often as possible, while dealing damage.

The relevant masteries are: Giant Slayer (T6) for damage, Lore of Steel for higher speed, Lasting Gifts for application of speed buff for as many turns as possible and masteries that boosts healing and turnmeter.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Apothecary needs to have as high speed as possible, so three speed sets is usually the way to go. He is the only one in the team without lifesteal, but provides his heal himself with A2.

Reaching at least 4k+ def and 300 speed is preferrable for this build. As long as you reach those stats you can have hp/def jewelry interchangably. For best results raid the crit rate to 100% for critical healing and more DPS. Note that Lanakis adds 30% crit rate chance in this composition

Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - hp
Banner - def
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
This Apothecary build demonstrates that it's possible to achieve good results and 2 keying UNM with rares and without crazy gear

Do note that the AI of Apothecary is a bit silly, later in the run (beyond turn 20) he sometimes heals someone else if they get hit by a crit. Or sometimes does not heal at all after the stun if he has the speed boost available. Hence, for best results semi-manual from about turn 20 to the end of the run.

The combination of turn meter boost and targeted healing make Apothecary a unique rare. Without block debuffs his heal is really important and he can't be replaced by heroes like High Khatun, Golden Reaper or Frostbringer in this comp.

Lanakis provides additional support to the Apothecary kit with increased crit chance and buff extenstion.

You can find a video of the run on Void CB in this video:

https://youtu.be/Ikrqv3l9A1w
data.label: Notes:

title: Krisk the Ageless Late Game+ Guide

data.desc:
Krisk is one of the most versatile and useful legendaries in game, with multiple top tier skills that are usually found in different champions. As such, you want Krisk to stay alive for as long as possible to benefit your team. 

Krisk is a monster in arena for 4 key reasons that couple very well together:

1.        AOE Taunt provides excellent crowd control and lures enemies to trigger his passive 
2.        Decrease defence and decrease attack on hit due to passive, weakening the enemy 
3.        Excellent protection with ally protect, ally healing, and defence up for himself.
4.        Excellent damage

Krisk can synergize and provide best results with:

A.        AOE Counter-attack to trigger A1 every time after a taunt in arena, landing up to 4 A1 AOEs
B.        Another ally protect to protect Krisk after he is focused after taunt
C.        Defence up to protect Krisk and get more damage out of Krisk

Krisk can do a lot of damage even in non-damage builds, and is a champion worth as much investment as you can afford. Krisk is useful for arena and clan boss, and is often used as a shield tank in dungeons, but here we focus on where he shines the greatest: arena. 

There are damage builds for Krisk, but we want to highlight him as a defensive monster to terrorize your enemies, even when solo. Build wise we go down the resistance tree and aim for retribution (A1 is an aoe with decrease speed) and +50 resistance. Lasting gifts is worth getting in support for Krisk’s multiple buffs to allies.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Krisk is excellent in a shield set for this build because his HP pool base stat is reasonable (19k) and he benefits from both the shield set bonus (30% shield for all allies) and his passive (50% shield for all allies). Coupled with a high resist team your enemy has to pass an accuracy check or face stripping a 80% Krisk’s HP shield from all your champions.

Krisk benefits from HP, Defence, Resistance, Speed, and some accuracy. You usually face off against high speed high accuracy enemies, so your own accuracy doesn’t need to be much higher than 200 (to land taunt and decrease speed). Krisk needs high resistance for high level Arena (550+, preferrably 630+), and decent defence to tank the ally protect damage (4k-5k ideally). 

Glove: Def %/ Crit Rate% 
Chest: Resist / Def%
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Def
Amulet: Def
Banner: Res / Acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Krisk in a shield set is an easy win vs even the best blender teams (Arbiter, Longbeard, Skullcrown, Sinesha). In action, Krisk often doesn’t do much in earlier rounds due to his low speed. The shield and his passive triggers from any enemy aoe, unless they are protected with an immunity set. Krisk shines in longer battles, especially in 1v1 or 1v2 situations.

Krisk in arena is weak against particular champions, and I detail the ones commonly seen. 
- Lyssandra is typically built with high speed and low resistance. When she attacks Krisk she immeditaly gets debuffed with Decrease ATK and DEF. However, Lyssandra can transfer these debuffs immediately back to Krisk with no accuracy check, meaning Krisk (even a high 700 resistance one) is effectively debuffing himself. The defence down is extremely damaging  Krisk
- Secondly buff strippers or defence down champions such as Suzerain Katonn and Ghostborn weaken Krisk and its allies without fail, followed up by a nuke from Trunda or similar high damage aoe champions. 
- Thirdly high accuracy (600+) buff stripping champions such as: Madame Serris, Gurgoh, and Yannica
- Deflection sets (sets in Raid don't require accuracy)

Krisk is a sneaky one despite his size though! When enemy AOEs come in, they hit your team in order of placement, that means not all champions receive damage at the same time. If you put Krisk 2nd (because he doesn't have an aura), that means his reduced attack-defence passive will trigger on the enemy attacker before it hits your 3rd and 4th champion. Watch as Trunda does far less damage and Valk produces a smaller shield. This  forces your opponents to use either immunity gear or have an immunity lead (Siphi, Duchess). So while Krisk does have vulnerabilties as outlined above, he also many smart strengths that can trap ill-prepared attackers.

Videos: 
https://youtu.be/INdubQO5F1g 
https://youtu.be/0J2MFIbwjaA 
https://youtu.be/FFuNvfoKDac 

You can find Krisk in action in PVE content on the next page
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Arbiter can be a core champion that enables stable speed running of dungeons. If you have just gotten her, it's unlikely you champions are able to one-shot waves due to a lack of excellent equipment. The recipe for speed running is not complicated.

* Your arbiter needs to be at least over 201+ speed to lap the speed of the mob waves. 301+ is preferred.

* Your arbiter needs to survive the nukes and the rest of the team will do the job.

* Bring an AOE Decrease Def of the right affinity for the waves to be mowed down fast

* You don't need legendaries to make this work. MAX HP nuke champions such as Coldhearts and Royal Guards will do the job splendidly.

You can see the video of a non-optimised Dragon 20 run below. Note that together with Def Down and Arbiter Weaken debuffs you don't need champions like Dracomorph, Venus or Lydia to make fast runs.

https://youtu.be/Lasw3rIMNAQ

Naturally, if you do have better champions, it will be easier for you.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The same principle for speed running applies to Fire Knight 20 as well. Since Coldhearts have a tendency to use Hearseeker straight into the shield of FK, they can sometimes be wiped.

Arbiter mass revive ensures the runs are stable, as you can repeat the sequences as long as Arbiter herself is alive. Note that speed and Turn Meter boosts are important against fire knight, as well as Decrease Def and TM reduction.

Decrease Speed is another debuff that should not be overlooked on the boss.

https://youtu.be/qFxJRWU830E

If you are not a lucky owner of Coldhearts you should consider Alure for the TM reduction role. Arbiter ensures she is alive at the start of the boss fight after the waves and a 100% crit rate, 200+ speed and accuracy Alure with Arbiter can lock FK 20 down despite her negative affinity.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
As the final showcase of Arbiter prowess in dungeons,  Ice Golem 20 is also possible to speed run.

It's likely the least popular dungeon to complete quickly due to the quality of the sets and difficulty. Unlike other bosses the counterattack can be devastating, so ensuring the boss has Atk Down debuff and the minions revives are blocked can be the key to victory during the speed runs (unless you're a lucky owner of the best poisoners in the game, e.g. Dracomorph).

Note that Arbiter with sufficient speed and survivability allows the glass cannons to perform their role admirably.

https://youtu.be/03CMKWlGIW4

Arbiter with high speed and survivability will be able to complete Faction Wars 21 for you as well as many floors in the Doom Tower. She is worth your time, books and efforts!
data.label: Notes:

data.desc: Rhazin provides the combination of DefDown and Weaken debuffs for the fight. With Master Hexer, they can persist for several turns without interruption. He also has Warmaster to ensure more consistent procs when using A2/A3 (1 hit), but it might be better with Giant Slayer now, as the damage of each attack should be sufficient to fully heal him.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Rhazin is in lifesteal in this build. He is the third fastest champ in the team. 

He is supposed to be the first of the high damage champs to ensure the Def Down/Weaken debuffs are in place for the rest of damage dealers. Therefore, high accuracy is required. As a high damage source 100% crit, a lot of CritDmg and as much Def/Hp as possible are required while maintaining high speed. 

Glove - crit dmg %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - crit dmg
Banner - acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Rhazin provides a number of advantages for this team.

1. Defence Down and Weaken in a single package 
2. High DPS

You can find a video of the run on Void CB in this video: https://youtu.be/Ikrqv3l9A1w
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Spider 20 is tricky business. Apothecary can help out in three ways. The first is, as usual the turn meter boost and speed buff. The second is targeted heal and this might be helpful for negative affinity tank strategies. Thirdly, the aura may provide a defensive boost if that is what your heroes are lacking.

In this video Apothecary doesn't play a key role, but can still be useful for some other compositions.

https://youtu.be/3r_iO8lzaVQ?t=348
data.label: Spider

data.desc:
Ice Golem is not the most popular Dungeon for farming gear due to the quality of the sets. Apothecary can be helpful here for the same reasons as in other dungeons.

The same principle applies as with other Dungeons. Control with the Stun, Massive Shields and Ally Protection help power through the waves and the boss.

https://youtu.be/3r_iO8lzaVQ?t=131
data.label: Ice Golem

data.desc:
Apothecary is negative affinity for Lava Knight 20. This means additional critical rate and damage of enemies vs Apo on both waves and the boss. 

The only reason to bring him to Lava Knight is to take advantage of the three hit A1 ability to bring the shield down during the boss fight, as there are usually better heroes to help with survival.

https://youtu.be/3r_iO8lzaVQ?t=597
data.label: Notes:
Mid-game guide
data.desc:
With campaign farmer sorted, you want to select your core team that's going to be used in most areas of your game. If you select it correctly you will have a much easier time with progression in Raid.
If you were lucky to pull Counterattack champion, you will want to base your strategy for dungeons and clan boss (cb) around them.
Most people, however, will have to use a speed based team with either Apothecary or High Khatun.
It's a very good idea to ask experienced players about your core team heroes recommendation.

data.label: Mid-game guide
data.desc:
You will now be completing content where you can't one-shot mobs. Attempting high level dungeons (15+) requires your heroes to be tanky to survive.
You need to level them up to 6 stars, equip the core team in %def gloves, %def chests and speed boots. There are exceptions to the rule if the champions are HP based or for speed heroes that can be in pure speed sets.
Importantly the gear has to be at least 5 stars

data.label: Mid-game guide:
data.desc:
Your next mid game task is to get full tier 6 masteries on your core team. Warmaster and Giant Slayer allows your heroes to deal much more damage to clan boss and dungeon bosses.
Doing so will allow you to get good chests on Brutal and even Nightmare clanboss.
This is the time to do challenges and quests, farming some arena and reaching the ultimate mid-game goal: Dragon 20.
This is where you will be able to replace some of the items you had farmed in campaign. D20 is where you will be spending nearly all your time without the xp boost.
Having a stable D20 team is generally the prerequisite for late-game

Skullcrusher makes a fine addition to your core team for mid-game in all content.

You will now want your SC at 60, ascended and booked until cooldown on A2 AOE counterattack.

Having Warmaster is now a priority, as this will allow Skullcrusher himself to heal back in a lifesteal set, especially on clan boss.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Set: lifesteal + anything. Focus on defence with enough speed. More defence would be better, but as you can see even the items farmed in campaign and low leve spider can produce decent results.

Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - def/hp
Banner - def/hp
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
For clan boss with access to campaign items and some dungeons you can now try to build towards late game. Aiming for about 171 speed towards the end game allows you to achieve okay-ish results on Brutal and Nightmare clan boss.

AOE counterattack and ally protection allows SC to boost your team survivability during the dungeon waves and on the boss fights, so he can help you even more than in the early game with warmaster and lifesteal set.

He is especially helpful in Fire Knight dungeon that can be difficult for new players. Dragon team can also benefit from skullcrusher skillset on the waves.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Torturehelm is one of the epics used to fuse Rhazin so he is quite F2P friendly. You can fuse him multiple time before Rhazin is fused. Once the fusion is complete he can only be pulled from the shards.

With the correct build he is able to solo farm dragon 20 consistently and this build is focused on dungeons. 

The 2 mastery trees that Torturehelm needs are Offense and Defense. The main focus will be on the Offense tree as it will allow him to deal reliable damage and sustain himself with masteries like Life Drinker. The secondary tree is also important as it will allow him to mitigate as much damage as possible. This allows Torturehelm to make his way through the waves more easily.

The tier 6 mastery that is needed for this build to work will be warmaster, as it will help him clear the waves and deal with the Dragon itself. This will also be paired with a Lifesteal Set so that he will be able to heal himself with the damage that he will be doing throughout the battle.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Preferable Sets: Lifesteal + Immortal/Other 2 Piece Defensive set 

The focus is on Speed, Health, Resistance and Defense. Speed is essential to the build as you need to constantly attack in order to keep your Unkillable passive up and to survive through the waves and the boss. High health and defense are needed because they allow you to stay alive for longer. On top of that, high defense and health stats also increase your damage as Torturehelm scales with HP, DEF and ATK. The resistance stat is also important because you don't want to be stunned or debuffed as that will affect your run drastically.

These are the required Stats:
- Health: Around 60 000
- Defense: Around 2 500
- Speed: 210
- Resist: Around 210 

Gear:
Gloves: DEF%
Chest: HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP
Banner: DEF
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Torturehelm is an underrated epic that can really help many accounts. The reason for why this strategy works is because of Torturehelm's 3 turn passive known as Unkillable which revives him with 50% HP when killed. By utilising it correctly you can progress quite far in terms of minotaur and dragon dungeons. This is a key for mid-game and late game, so this epic might be quite helpful.

While this strategy of solo farming with Torturehelm is not the most time-efficient and is not recommended to be kept up for too long, it's an excellent showcase in what is required for late dungeon farming. 

If you do have excess time and would like to level up some food on dragon 20, he can help you with this 

https://youtu.be/Rg7ddbw5LpQ
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Despite being an uncommon champion, Armiger can be quite useful and enable you to finish level 20 dungeons if you're looking to fill a few specific roles.

Armiger does not need to have full masteries to be useful. You get the most bang for your buck by having him with crit rate, crit damage and accuracy masteries on the first two rows. Following the support tree, Evil eye is helpful for additional turn meter decrease. Since Armiger has lower base stats compared to most rares and higher rarity champions, Lore of steel can be a good option. 

You can pick Warmaster or Helmsmasher for extra damage against dungeon bosses. If you are still struggling for Accuracy you can select Eagle Eye as the last resort

You can use copies of Armiger to book him fully from the market.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Equipment is likely more important for Armiger than the masteries. 

He has some specific thresholds that need to be met in order to be truly effective in the late game in addition to the correct team composition. Arminger NEEDS 100% crit rate to work his turn meter reduction, at least 200 accuracy for level 20 dungeons (preferably 220-240 to be sure) and around 200+ speed (the more the better). If you can reach those thresholds, the next stats to look out for would be hp%, def% and crit damage. Having lots of hp may have the benefit of waves of mobs not focusing Armiger and letting him do his job of decreasing the turn meter effectively

Glove: Crit Rate %
Chest: HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP/Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Armigers best areas are Fire Knight and Spider dungeon. With a little support he can keep the turn meter of both these bosses down permanently so they never get a turn. As the dungeon bosses have around 95 speed, it is highly effective to combine him with a hero that has a Decrease Speed debuff.

If you are not lucky enough to pull Coldheart from void shards, Armiger can be a budget replacement for her in those two dungeons. Tests on Spider 20 have shown that Coldheart hits about twice as hard as Armiger with the maximum HP attacks. An important note about the AI for Armiger on auto is that it will always use the A1 ability if the turn meter is more than 15%. 

This is a typical Fire Knight run for the Armiger build. Note that once Stag Knight places the Decrease Speed Debuff Armiger does his job splendidly.

https://streamable.com/fd6jlr

This is a link for a typical spider run with this build. Note the turn meter reduction from the A1 and that Armiger is the most squishy champion that gets targeted. You can also find some action with Armiger in the manual runs in the Paragon Guide.

https://streamable.com/clapti
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Trunda is one of the strongest champions for late game nuking and she can be quite versatile. A low accuracy Trunda currently has the strongest AOE hits in the game and is a staple in Platinum Arena.

She is definitely worth fully booking. This guide will be focused on her as an alternative crowd control (CC) champion build. It's geared towards player vs environment content more than exclusively arena. The masteries for this build focus on keeping Trunda alive and increasing her accuracy so that she can CC and apply AOE HP burn to the enemy. Throughout the support tree you want to prioritise accuracy and turn meter increases. 

The tier 6 mastery can either be Eagle-Eye or Fearsome Presence depending on what accuracy targets you have for the teams you're fighting. 

Higher tier arena requries more accuracy and so in this build Eagle-Eye was chosen, however Fearsome Presence offers more utility and increases the stun chance on her A1, A3 and the stun set and is also a viable option.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The absolutely essential gear set for Trunda is the Stun set. It's good to supplement the stun set with accuracy or speed after that. Try not to add any crit as you will give your enemies more Turn Meter increase through Cycle of Revenge in the defense tree on enemy Arbiters and other champions.

Defensive stats after that are nice to have but considering that Trunda is an excellent CC champion, we ideally want to go first in the arena and so they are not mandatory. As long as her speed is tuned to the rest of the team and she always goes first before the nuker, maximise the accuracy in your build.

You can tune your arena speed team using any of the external tools, e.g. on deadwoodjedi.

Glove: DEF%/HP%
Chest: Accuracy
Boots: Speed
Ring: Any
Amulet: Any with Accuracy
Banner: Accuracy with Speed substats
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
For the arena in almost all cases you should build your Trunda for damage, however, depending on your roster you can build one for crowd control. 

Trunda can be used in any situation where you'd utilise a CC champion in your arena team. Avoid force-heavy affinity teams, teams with cleanses and debuff removal.

In the arena you can find good synergy with other supporting freeze champions such as Gurgoh, Pyxniel and Shirimani and then find a slot in the team for Tormin. This will provide lots of CC and damage through Tormin's extra attacks if the target is under a HP burn and a freeze at the same time.

You can see short CC trunda showcases in the following videos

https://youtu.be/uYSjHof326U
https://youtu.be/27N0PzQ8X0M
https://youtu.be/BmcQlStOgN0

Arbiter leads and boosts the turn meter, Lyssandra supports and leeches turn meter to ensure the opposing team doesn't snatch the initiative. Trunda applies her stuns and foli finishes the fight.

Note that Trunda takes up a spot of a traditional AOE Defence Down champion here.

Next page of the Guide showcases her in Spider 20 and Doom Tower environment
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
This is a universal build for starters with a focus on campaign. Works well for the majority of players. Suitable for all areas of the game including the clan boss. Kael is worth 6 starring, ascending, booking. You can also buy his masteries with gems to accelerate progress.

Notes on Offense Tree: 
 
Heart of Glory - 5% extra DMG when Full HP, easier waveclear, better One-Hit potential. Whirlwind of Death - 6 flat increased Speed for each killed enemy, Double Turn potential due to leaping the mobs. Ruthless Ambush - 8% extra Dmg on first Hit, better One-Hit potential. Cycle of Violence - 30% Chance of reducing 1 Skill cooldown by 1 turn after dealing 30% max HP dmg to an Enemy, Key Mastery, quicker recharge time = quicker Clear Time, also saver since more DMG output -> more self healing.  Wraith of the Slain - Great DMG increase for Campaign Farmer. Most food dies to One-Hit on Brutal 12/3, so its a free 10% DMG Increase, also more DMG = more self healing. Kill Streak - 12% DMG Increase after clearing the first wave, better Damage output, great Synergy with t3 mastery Whirlwind of Death. Blood Shield - 15% Max HP Shield, Insane sustain, almost each round active

Tier6:
Not needed! Since he can solo Clear almost everything at lv 50 (5 Star Ascension)

Defensive Tree:

Defiant - Helps on 12/3 against Lord Shazar Bombs (High threat) and Debuffs, Campaign Champs have either 10 or 0 accuracy. Rejuvenation - Great synergy with LS Set and Offensive T5 Mastery Blood Shield, added sustain and survivability. Bloodthirst - 10% Max HP Heal after killing an enemy (EVERY round after killing an enemy), great survivability. Stubbornness - added Resist, additional survivability against 12/3, 10/7 and 9/7 bosses. Retribution - Counterattack chance on loss of 1/4 of the HP for more survivability and DMG
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gear: 

Free 2 Play Gear is sufficient to replicate this build! 4 pieces Lifesteal-Set are essential (after Login in for 4 days in a row) 

LS-Login Rewards right now ALWAYS have the same Main-stats and similar substats. 2 piece of Resistance Set are recommended (Mostly for 12/3 Brutal) - Can be replaced with ANYTHING else.

Note that on 12-3 most of the mobs are Spirit affinity. All starters are Magic affinity and have an extra 15% to deal a critical hit to monsters. Furthermore, each starter has a built in extra 15% chance for a critial hit on their AOE attack. This means that on 12-3 you want a minimum of 70% crit chance for optimal results.

4 Star Helm: Flat HP
4 Star Gloves: Mainstat - Crit% (most important piece) 
4 Star Chest: Mainstat - Attack% (good for early, quicker clear)
4 Star Boots: Mainstat - Speed 
2-3 Star Weapon - Res piece
2-3 Star Shield - Res piece

Ring from the daily login reward or campaign reward (can be anything, not essential)

Substats on those are mostly speed, crit and atk%/hp%
Gloves and Boots need to be upgraded to +16 as soon as possible. The rest should be 12+
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
It has never been easier to progress in Raid. Masteries on your Starter/1st Champ are Vital. Using 800 Gems for clearing the Campaign on normal, hard and brutal and a couple of Missions, you can massively improve your progress. Getting to this stage with minimal investment of time and resources can set you up for a comfortable mid game and late game.

Here is a link to a Brutal 12/3 lv 50 Kael solo Clear Video (Elhain is an even safer option, but any starter champion with this build will be capable of farming under a minute)

https://youtu.be/nCS3CzYLuag?t=21 

Notice that by increasing speed or critical damage along with t6 masteries it's possible to increase the farming speed to 30 seconds in mid game and 15 seconds in late game with your starter build.
data.label: Notes:

title: Vizier OvelisLate Game Clan Boss Build

data.label: Masteries
data.desc:
Vizier truly shines in clan boss (cb) battles with Counterattack (CA). Even without books on void he can keep the debuffs extended after a few runs on manual. Booking his A1 allows to keep up the debuffs even on spirit affinity cb. In some void unm builds you can even ignore an attack down hero and rely on vizier A2. However, you would also have to deal with heal reduction and block buffs then.
Note that sniper mastery does not increase the chance of extending the debuffs. You can pick retribution mastery as the last pick, but in my composition he always has CA

data.label: Stats and equipment
data.desc:
Set: lifesteal + anything. Focus on defence with enough speed and accuracy. 230-240 is enough for ultra-nightmare. An ideal build would have more crit rate and damage while keeping the defense similar.
Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - def
Banner - accuracy

data.label: Notes:
data.desc:
Your results may vary if you don’t have valk shield. Having a mass healer allows you to potentially run stalwart set. This is a slow tuned cb team and requires manual setup until the debuff line is full and approximately 4 stacks of each debuff are accumulated.
Void clan boss
https://youtu.be/8DwWi3xXj5A 
Note that you can use the a2 to block buffs on affinity to prevent valkyrie passive from triggering and messing up her speed. However, this works best with a fast tuned (191+) teams for unm that allow vizier to go before clan boss.
Finally, it's not a failsafe plan for spirit affinity cb as it will always have a 35% chance to fail.
Spirit CB unm run
https://youtu.be/sAUnnIrxAm8

data.label: How/Where to use RG
data.desc:
Royal Guard is best in late game and late game+
Having rigid requirements for the stats he needs means you can bring out the full potential only now, when you have a mass ressurection champion or a team that can ensure his survival.
Helmsmasher should only be taken only if your composition does not depend on the success of it's proc on your run. This is dependent on the composition, so if you sometimes lose because of it, take flawless excecution as the tier 6 mastery instead.
If the crit damage you can get is higher than 200-220%, helm smasher offers the best dps for coldheart on dungeon bosses.
He is a glass cannon, but he is an Epic that is better than lots of legendaries for speed running dungeons. Royal guard is a hero you don't mind having two or three of.

data.label: Gear and Stats
data.desc:
Set: Savage + Cruel would be best. Second best would be Savage + any. Can also be a mix without sets if the needed parameters are met.

Royal Guard needs the following at a minimum for late game and stable spider 20: 

Speed: 151+ to go before the spiderlings
Crit rate: 85% (due to extra 15% chance to crit vs Spirit affinity enemies)
Crit damage: 200%+
Accuracy: 200+ for the speed decrease and turn meter reduction

Note, that unlike Coldheart, Royal Guard benefits from having lots of attack when using Takedown that hits based on maximum HP.

Hp: depending on your other heroes on spider 20 he may need more hp so she doesn't get targeted or die. Normally spiderlings don't go for RG due to the affinity.

Glove - crit damage %
Chest - atk % / hp%
Boots - speed
Ring - atk / hp
Amulet - crit damage %
Banner - accuracy

data.label: Notes:
data.desc:
Composition matter for Royal Guard. He is a glass cannon and needs a team that supports him and prevents him from being targeted.

Press the following pages to see Royal Guard in action in other level 20 dungeons

https://youtu.be/AiFdOekO3bY

Ultimate Galek at the time of writing this guide is the only epic with mass hp burn. This can prove to be a key to unlocking high levels of Spider dungeon (16+), as each burning spiderling deals damage to the big spider.

You can get away with the budget version of Ultimate Galek if you're using him in conjunction with Paragon to ensure he is not targeted. Just the white scroll masteries and lvl 50 are sufficient for him to do the job. The important part will be the gearing section. You can book U Galek if he will be your main Spider damage dealer.

For tier 6 mastery you can either opt for Oppressor for extra speed and turn meter boost or Warmaster for extra damage. For U Galek on auto in my main composition there was no need for extra damage as the spiderlings need to survive to burn the big spider.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Sets: anything. In this build
Glove - Crit rate
Chest - HP %
Boots - speed
Ring - HP
Amulet - HP
Banner - Accuracy

In terms of parameters Ultimate Galek would need the following if you're running him on Auto on Spider 20:

Accuracy 200+
Crit rate 100% (this is critical if you don't have attack up buff)
Sufficient speed
Sufficient HP so he doesn't get targeted
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Ultimate Galek works well on non-Force affinity Spider 16+. With paragon it's possible to use U Galek with minimal equipment. Note the damage hp burn deals to the big spider and that this composition relies on turn meter reduction to work. More information can be found in the paragon guide (composition on spider 18 and 20).

On manual you can use U Galek to buff attack up on himself. This won't work as well on auto unless you select a mark on a spiderling on his turn.

https://youtu.be/Q4dQFjnfHv8 

On Auto U Galek works best with an Attack Up hero, in this case - Seeker. Note that he relies on the spiderlings not targeting him, courtesy of Valkyrie shield and Infernal Baronness anti-affinity tank tactic.

The spiderlings have to survive IB hits and let the hp burn do the damage, while not allowing the big Spider to consume too many of them. 

If you are already at Spider 20 stage you might want to go for Drexar in the Bazzaar to be both a tank and a mass HP burn champion.

https://youtu.be/Q4dQFjnfHv8
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Valkyrie can be one of the best heroes in Platinum Arena in the current metagame. Her passive allows her to do what most other heroes in the game cannot. She can decrease the turn meter of the opposing teams for each buff. Valkyrie passive works through buff immunity making it possible to win against teams that have crazy amounts of speed, e.g. Siphi with 360 speed.

To be effective she needs sufficient accuracy and good shields, hence the choice of Eagle Eye as the final mastery to pass 450+ accuracy mark and the rest of the support and defense masteries to make the team tankier
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Sets: anything that gets you the needed stats 

Glove - def %
Chest - def %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - def
Banner - accuracy

For top Platinum Arena you want to have at least 450-500 accuracy and 240+ speed with this Valkyrie build. 5000 Defence works nicely if you're planning to use her in other content, e.g. Clan Boss
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The main boogeyman of Platinum arena are Siphi and Aribter builds with very high speed or teams with 700+ Resistance. If you lose out on the speed contest, Valkyrie can be a solution

If Siphi is the main turn meter booster, Valkyrie passive will trigger three times. This is equivalent to approximately 30% turn meter reduction. Her A1 also decreases the turn meter by 10% for each hit if the target has buffs

This allows Valkyrie to play a key role in winning fights that would be impossible to win otherwise. Note that Lyssandra with 326 speed also plays an important role in ensuring that the enemy doesn't take too many turns and remains locked down until Serris and Trunda finish the job. 

Videos below will demonstrate a few battles vs top Platinum teams

https://youtu.be/5KUnkXChN14

https://youtu.be/2oGXHk3PLrI

This Valkyrie also works on clan boss. UNM on void 25+ mil

NM 50+ mil

data.desc:
Golden Reaper is a fantastic support champion with a very unique kit. She can be used in arena as a speed booster and is helpful in all content where a speed boost might come in handy. This build is focused on completing faction wars 21st floor. However, it can be used universally everywhere.

In the late game setting, where epic books are more readily available, booking her A3 and A2 is essential.

The mastery tree will focus on the defense and support trees to help boost her sustain and help land her ATK down debuff. Since she's all about speed, her gear might lack some accuracy, therefore Eagle-Eye was chosen to help boost it. It helps her land the A2 which is an AOE ATK down or turn meter decrease. Evil-eye will also come in handy for turn meter decrease. This has become critical to Faction Wars. 

An alternative would be to do an Offense (Warmaster) and Support tree build. If you're using Golden Reaper for arena Lore of Steel and Evil-eye is as far as you need to go and your gear and speed will be of more importance than masteries in late game.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Similar to Arbiter, you want to build Golden Reaper completely with maximum speed - so all speed gear and speed substats. 

Unlike Arbiter who has a revive and minor heal where you could possibly ignore main stats, Golden Reaper stands to strongly benefit from DEF% and HP% main stat gauntlets and chestplate. Speed should be >270 to make her truly useful. Accuracy for level 20 dungeons should always be >200.

Glove: DEF%/HP%
Chest: HP%/DEF%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/DEF
Amulet: HP/DEF
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
This is a successful Faction Wars stage 21 run. This is one of the most difficult factions to defeat without legendaries in the game. It's not often that teams with Golden Reaper are posted for the 21st floor. 

She is quite essential in allowing the team to get multiple hits in. She allows the team's buffs to expire faster before the boss has a chance to do buff/debuff swap. The ATK down on the boss that she provides is absolutely critical. More turns means more control! Be careful with wave 2. Controlling the Valkyries is important. It's not the end of the world if one of them goes off, but the raw damage from the hit is pretty high. Don't use any buffs while Valkyries are alive if it can be avoided - you see Golden Reaper's speed boost not being used.
 
Without a DEF down, the race to kill the boss before the health swap cooldown gets even more intense. On the very first attack, use only Golden Reaper's A2 to decrease ATK - the boss is going to steal everything. At Golden Reaper's speed, it's possible to cycle through a few turns which is crucial when her A1 can reset all my champ's skills. 

https://youtu.be/a8PoHncrG0A
data.label: Notes:

title: Late Game+ Rearguard Sergeant Guide Tiny Carry

data.desc:
This little dwarf lady is a valid alternative if you don't have big bois for support such as Bad El Kazar or similar. Her kit provides some useful sustain. She can also be used as a backup attack down and def down hero. Last but not least, her DMG is surprisingly high when outfitted correctly! 

Let's have a look at her masteries.
Offence-Defense recommended if you want to maximize her damage and survivability on Ultra-Nightmare, but you can also build her with Offence-Support.

Offence is standard for clan boss:
[T1] - Deadly Precision, always pick crit rate over attack!
[T2] - Heart of Glory, 5% more damage is just good although she will not always be full hp during the fight due to her Ally protect. But she will eventually be, if you use her in a CounterAttack team.
- Keen Strike, 10% crit damage is the best choice for CB, always!
[T3] - Single Out, very handy when CB drops below 40%, and no better options to choose
- Life Drinker for more heal, she needs a lot of healing after absorbing CB AoE(s) with her Ally Protect.
[T4] - Bring it Down, 6% more dmg cause CB will always have more HP than her!
- Wrath of the slain, cause no better options.
[T5] - Methodical, for 2 reasons: her A2 has very good multipliers and can proc some significative damage and we also need it in order to unlock Warmaster.
[T6] - Warmaster, easy pick as she has single hit A1.

Defence:
[T1] - Tough Skin, she scales with DEF and for sure we don't need RES against CB!
[T2] - Blastproof, 5% damage reduction agst AoE hits is HUGE, especially if you think that she will be tanking those hits with her Ally Protect
[T3] - Resurgent, cause no better options and it can be handy if for some reason the stun goes on her!
[T4] - Delay Death, will make our Rearguard more tanky and we need her to tank for days!
[T5] - Retribution, free counter attacks when she loses 25% hp, which will eventually happen when she has ally protect up.
- Deterrence, no better options and in case for some reason the stun goes on her, this will help!
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For clan boss it is recommended to use Life Steal and speed set. Stat wise in order of importance try to reach the following milestons (stats for this build within parentheses):

- SPEED (175, tune it according to your team setup)
- DEF (3.5k)
- HP (53k)
- C.RATE (99%)
- C.DMG (219%)
- ACC (122)

Rearguard Sergeant is not an easy champion to build, you have to balance DEF and HP due to her ally protect, but at the same time you want her C.RATE and C.DMG to be as high as possible because she can bring some serious damage to the table in a well-built Counterattack team. Even Accuracy is important if you don't have a consistent DEF down champ. She can also be used as attack down backup just in case your main debuffer doesn't land it.

In this build ACC has been neglected as Sepulcher sentinel is used for ATK DOWN, Rhazin for DEF down and Weakn and Martyr for some backup on both (ATK and DEF down) and so C.RATE and C.DMG became the focus. Using a speed set SPD main stat on boots was replaced with DEF% instead. This makes her more tanky and increases her damage for a double advantage!

- DEF% boots
- HP% chest
- CR. DMG% gloves

Accessory wise:
- HP ring with HP% rolls
- C.DMG Amulet
- DEF banner (ACC if you need her debuffs)
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Rearguard Sergeant is one the most underrated champions in RAID. Although there are different alternatives to her, such as Jareg  (who needs to be tuned 4:3) there are still several clan boss compositions and scenarios where she can shine an make the difference. 

On Clan Boss at UNM level the damage from AOE attacks scales up extremely fast and he hits very hard in the later rounds. In those cases Ally Protection can save the team better than even having permanent Defence Up buffs. 

Note how well Rearguard Sergeant saves the team and allows them to go past the 2 key UNM mark

https://youtu.be/Dk47HWF_Fw4 

More, she can carry your Faction Wars team as well. If you aspire to complete faction wars 21 without legendary heroes, one or two Rearguard Sergeants can be the key to this content
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
The main masteries to pick for Zargala in the offense tree are: Shieldbreaker, Cycle of violence, Kill streak, blood shield, and Helmsmasher. We want to maximise the damage she deals in most scenarios as she is going to be the main damage dealer and nuker in this Arena guide.

In the support tree you are just trying to increase your accuracy, decrease your cooldowns. We want anything that has turn meter decrease against the enemy team and Cycle of magic and Evil eye are the two main ones.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For gear you are looking to maximize 4 things in this order: Crit Rate to 100, Crit Damage, Speed and Attack.

Gloves - Crit Damage
Chest - Atk %
Boots - Speed
Ring - Atk
Amulet - Crit Dmg
Banner - Acc

If you can't get to 100% crit rate then you may need to run crit rate gloves instead. Also any extra accuracy you get is a bonus because she can still land her debuffs. That is not the priority of this build though. Damage is. Chances are you will be using mixed sets with this build but any damage or speed based set bonuses are good in the Mid Game. 

In Late game when you have access to better equipment and greal hall bonuses you will be able to push for more stats.

The ability to AOE stun and HP burn multiple enemies can be extremely effective in fights where there are a lot of enemies such as the Spider dungeon. Inversely, she doesn't shine against other dungeon bosses since she cannot stun them and therefore she can't apply a HP burn to them.

https://youtu.be/f75CPS7QrZg 

The following team is based on Turn meter control from Lyssandra and Coldheart, AOE HP burn and Crowd Control from Trunda and MAX hp nuke from Coldheart. Painkeeper refreshes the abilities and Pyxinel is an optional sacrifice.

Doom Tower floors are three sets of five enemies and so Trunda can provide some damage and CC to the team through the stuns and HP burns - just make sure you have at least one dedicated damage champion to bring in as well. 

If the waves are permanently controlled they can't hit you.

data.label: Roles in Dungeons
data.desc:
Valkyrie is one of the champions that can really help on spider 20. While reproducing this run game me Vietnam-style flashbacks of how I had completed the arbiter missions, there are a few points to be made about the setup and counterattack.

The best way valkyrie can work on spider is if her speed is much higher than the affinity tanks. This is achieved in a number of ways:

1. You can build Valkyrie with speed higher than 200 for spider missions
2. Your affinity tank needs to have no speed items (that's the case here)
3. you can have AOE decrease speed to help

Valkyries shield allows the team to tank some AOE attacks from spider and increases the survivability. Note, that the big spider permanently increases her attack each time she consumes spiderlings, so this won't work indefinitely. You need a way to either decrease the turn meter or you need a way to deal massive damage. For example, Ultimate Galek does this here with his mass hp burn.

https://youtu.be/Q4dQFjnfHv8

data.label: Fire Knight
data.desc:
The Fire knight is where Valkyrie can really advance you both on the waves and against the boss as demonstrated in this run.

While any counterattack hero will slow your runs due to animations, if what you're looking for is stable completion of the dungeon, Valkyrie is amazing for all the stages there.

https://youtu.be/iPFaG7GI4kU

data.label: Dragon
data.desc:
This dragon run showcases how Valkyrie shield in the clan boss build can help even on negative affinity Dragon runs. For best or similar results with bad gear pair Valkyrie with a Defense Up champion who goes before her.

https://youtu.be/nqeQd3f005M

Grizzled Jarl is a Defense based champion that can place a 1 turn Block Debuffs Buffs on a 3 turn Cooldown when fully booked. 

He is one of the few champions that can be efficiently used as a Clan Boss Stun Blocker. Blocking the Clan Boss stun becomes very important when you have a Speed-tuned Clan Boss team and reach Nightmare or Ultra-Nightmare. When a target gets stunned, their skill cooldown will be delayed. This will ruin the rotation on your team if an important champion that needs to use their skill every x turns gets stunned. You only need to book him until his Buff skill is on a 3 turn CD in the late game.

This Grizzled Jarl build is featured with the Offense and Defense Tree Masteries. The most important masteries you want on him are the T6 Warmaster and Retribution. He needs Warmaster to deal extra damage to the Clan Boss to lifesteal his HP back. Retribution grants a chance to Counterattack. Grizzled Jarl only places his Block Debuffs for one turn so he needs to go last in your team’s rotation (after your CA champion). This means that he will lose the Counterattack buff for one AOE from clan boss. Retribution gives him a chance to Counterattack and gain some life back. 

For Offense tree, take the crit rate, crit damage masteries. Take T6 Warmaster and on the defense tree, take the defense and damage reduction masteries.

The masteries below are the miminal masteries you need for Clan Boss.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important stats you want to build on Grizzled Jarl are Speed, Defense, Crit Rate, Crit Damage. You need to have a specific speed in order for him to place his Buffs on the right time. In a standard CA team where your CA champions are at 171 for NM or 191 for UNM, he needs 170 or 190 Speed respectively to be the slowest on the team. 

You want to build him with 100% Crit Rate and a reasonable amount of Crit Damage. You want him to be able to hit hard so that he can lifesteal even without the Warmaster procs. Since he loses CA for one AOE, he is vulnerable to dying if he doesn’t heal enough.  

You do not need accuracy on him because you don’t want to place his A1 heal reduction. His ATK down is good but he shouldn’t be your primary Atk down champion. This allows you to focus almost exlusively on Defense. Try to use Defense% instead of Speed Boots. This most likely means you will need to have good Speed substats on your gear.

He needs to be in Lifesteal set for a standard CB team. You can use a broken pieces, Speed, or Defense set for you remaining two slots. With this setup Grizzled Jarl can hit extremely well.

Glove: Crit Rate % 
Chest: Defense %
Boots: Defense % / Speed
Ring: Defense
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Defense
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The video demonstrates Grizzled Jarl in a NM Clan Boss run. The CB run needs to be manual for the first two rounds. Only use Grizzled Jarl’s Buff after the 2nd AOE (Before the stun) then the run can be set on auto.

The Defence Up buff is also relevant as it boosts the damage of all Defense based heroes in the composition.

Notice that once Grizzled Jarl dies from the stun the run is by and large over. While Grizzled Jarl has negative affinity in this video and hasn't shown his full potential, he can provide good utility for Clan Boss.

https://youtu.be/zzn6r70dbU8
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Occult Brawler is arguably one of the best Poisoner in the game for a speed based composition on Clan Boss. He can be the primary source of poison damage for your Clan Boss team until end game if you never pull any other endgame damage dealer. He is also relatively easy to build as he doesn’t need any books to be effective. 

The featured build for Occult Brawler has the Offense and Support Tree Mastery. The most important masteries you want on him are the T6 Warmaster and Master Hexer. He needs Warmaster and lifesteal set combination to stay alive as long as possible and Master Hexer to extend his Poisons on the Clan Boss.

For Offense tree crit rate, crit damage, T6 Warmaster are the choices. On the support tree take the accuracy masteries, avoid any TM masteries if you use him in a speedtuned CB team, Lore of Steel for more stats, Master Hexer and Sniper to increase the chances of placing Poisons and their duration.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important stats you want to build on OB are Accuracy, Speed and Defense. You need at least 200 accuracy to reliably place his debuffs on NM Clan Boss (230-250 for UNM without an extender). In terms of speed, you want to build him either as fast as possible for a speed comp. Or speed-tuned with your Clan Boss Team if you have a counterattack, usually 171-189 for a slow tune.

The other stat you want to build on him is Defense. If you are not using him in an Unkillable team, Defense is the only  other stat you should be prioritizing on him. Due to Occult Brawler’s low Base Defense, it can be quite difficult to build him with high enough Defense. Try to use Defense % Boots instead of Speed Boots. This means you need to have Speed substats on most of your gear. 3k Defense is a good amount to aim for on OB. 3.5k Defense on him is considered sufficient for NM CB. 

He needs to be in Lifesteal set for a standard CB team. You can use a broken pieces, Speed, Accuracy, or the new Perception set for you remaining two slots.

Glove: Defense % 
Chest: Defense%
Boots: Defense % / Speed 
Ring: Defense
Amulet: Defense (With Accuracy Substats)
Banner: Accuracy / Defense (If you can build enough Accuracy from substats and Great Hall)
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The video demonstrates OB in a NM Clan Boss run.

It is important in unkillable and counterattack teams that OB doesn't have too many poisons on him due to his passive. If he stack 5 debuffs and takes an extra turn he may mess up the rotation. Sometimes in such compositions a cleanser is included, such as Doompriest or Bad El Kazar to prevent this from happening.

His passive doesn't make a hit and this is why it works on any affinity. In this run due to being positive affinity Occult Brawler is one of the last ones to die and does a decent job of keeping the poisons up by himself in this setting. Block debuffs prevents him from poisoning himself too often.

https://youtu.be/zzn6r70dbU8
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
This build is focused for the Arena vs Hegemon and Tormin teams that are an issue in high gold 4 and Platinum.

Skytouched is a strong (and original) support. She is one of the few champions that have cleanse and block debuffs at the same time and that is why she is can be a situational but very strong support.

She has only one ability in a relatively long cooldown (4 turns), so you want her to extends her buffs and gain as much turn meter as often as she can. The support tree helps her with this.

Since the attack tree does not do much for her in arena, the defense tree is probably the most viable option for her. Her passive can synergize pretty well with masteries such as wisdom of battle, because they can give bonuses to compensate for her passive which can cast fear or her. For t5 masteries, the counter attack mastery (she can boost her TM or heal from it), and cycle of revenge (always more TM) were picked.

The t6 mastery Timely intervention is good for her to gain a lot of turn meter. If you are facing a faster team (or an hegemon team), it can allow her to go before your turn meter booster and cleanse them
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
What you have to be aware of, is that Skytouched NEEDS immunity gear. Firstly, resistance is not reliable enough. Secondly, because she can't resist her own fear debuff.

Of course, you will be limited by how good is your immunity gear, but that is what I would advice to use with speed substats where possible:

Gantlets : defense% / HP%
Chest : resist / defense % / HP% 
Boots : speed
Ring : defense/HP 
Amulet : HP/def with resistance substat
Banner : resistance/HP/defense
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The video will show case Skytouched in different situations in gold 4 arena:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mH1V2e4EOJw 

Fights vs DPS Hegemons, crowd control Hegemons, Tormins.
Multiple teams with multiple synergies, you will see her being outspeed but winning
Cancelling multiple crowd control attemps

When you are facing Tormin, you want her to go after your TM booster, to cleanse the champions that take a turn after her. It is not hard to outspeed or cut into Tormin team sequences in gold 4 and win. In that case you only care about speed for your Skytouched Shaman, so she can follow your TM booster

Against hegemon it is another story. If you know the opposite team, it should not be a problem to adapt. But, if you don't know if the Hegemon is a support or a DPS, you are risking having a hard time. The safer way is to bring a hero with a Shield Set with her, and then use skytouched Shaman to cleanse the block cooldown/decrease attack.

Skytouched can also be used against champions with a provocation debuff in gold 4. Usually, only the taunter is speed tuned with the TM booster, then there is a break def and a nuke. If you are outspeed, Skytouched can be used to cleanse the debuff as a backup plan. If you are faster, she will guarantee that the debuff will never land.
data.label: Notes:

title: Late Game+ Mausoleum Mage Guide: End Game Dungeons

data.desc:
Masteries on Mausoleum Mage are nice to have, but not very important. As you can see, in this build not all masteries are selected.  The focus of the masteries are on his survivability, extended buff duration, and TM boost when the buffs expire. The best Tier 6 Mastery for him would be Timely Intervention. On the Off-chance that your team gets low on health in the dungeons, he might be able to clutch out a heal on them.

Mausoleum Mage is an Epic that does get better with books and for late game+ runs the cooldowns on his skills are essential and need to be booked
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
This build is hardwired to be used in conjuction with Seer. You want to gear at least one champion in the team with a Shield Set for an extra buff and resilience.

Since Mausoleum Mage doesn’t have any important stat requirement such as Crit or Accuracy, he is the ideal candidate for the Shield Set. As with most support champions, you want to build him with high HP which further complements the Shield Set. You can use any set or even broken sets for the last two slots, but the best sest would be either Immortal or Speed.

Glove: HP%
Chest: HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Defense
Amulet: HP/Defense
Banner: HP/Defense

Something important to consider in a Seer team is speed tuning. A Seer team should run in this specific order, 1) AOE Defense Down 2) Buffs for the team 3) Seer. The order of Defense Down and Buff Up doesn’t matter but Seer has to be last in the rotation. So it is important to run Mausoleum Mage to be faster than Seer.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Mausoleum Mage is one of the best Epic support champions for Dungeon Progression and End Game Dungeon 20 Farming, especially with Seer. 

This following page will feature a combination with a Seer to speed farm Dragon, Ice Golem, Fire Knight and Spider 20.

Mausoleum Mage is an amazing Champion to use in combination with Seer because he is one of the few Champions in the game and the only Epic Champion that provides 3 different buffs from one skill. Furthermore, he provides a buff to crit rate, allowing the gear requirements to be a little more relaxed. In combination with a Shield Set, he alone will provide 4 different buffs for Seer to strip. Although his main role is to provide the buffs, he also has added utility in his ability to AOE heal and cleanse debuffs from your team. 

Additionally, during the course of the boss fight, his Increase Defense increases the team’s survivability and the Block Debuffs might come in clutch to block some of the debuffs.

The following video shows Mausoleum Mage and Seer + 3 other champions suitable for each Dungeon for all Dungeon 20s except for Spider where I only Mausoleum Mage without Seer as a Spider Support/Tank.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f1i08NjdLpM
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Apothecary is considered one of the best rares in the game. He is very easy to book and he can be useful in every area of the game from early to late game+

He can make good work even at level 50. However, if you want him to work well in Dungeons 20, his stats are considerably better when he is maxed. His aura is quite useful for Dungeons too.

Apothecary is pretty straightforward as far as masteries go, and quite flexible. You can take the offense tree for Giant Slayer if you want extra damage on clan boss, but generally speaking the defense and support trees are useful in all content. 

It is possible to take Iron Skin for the tier 6 talent, although Bulwark is also an option if Apothecary is tanky enough. The support tree gives solid utility, improving the effectiveness of heals, buffs, and speed sets, making it useful everywhere.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Apothecary relies on high speed to buff his team and heal them, with an emphasis on the speed buff and turn meter boost. 

His entire purpose is to give his team more turns and keep them alive, and he's very good at it - especially for a rare champion. For this reason, speed sets are by far the best option. 

Stat wise Apothecary only needs speed and defense/HP to work. Crit rate is somewhat useful as the A2 heal can crit, but it's lower priority than speed and defense. Crit damage doesn't increase the strength of the healing

Glove: DEF% / HP% / Crit Rate%
Chest: Def%
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Def 
Amulet: Def
Banner: Any with speed substat

Main stats on gloves should be Defense%/HP%, but crit rate is also an option if you have sufficient defense already. Chest should always be Defense%/HP% and boots are always speed.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Note how Apothecary keeps the team ahead of the waves of mobs and Dragon by keeping the speed increase buff and turn meter boosts.

This apothecary is built with enough Defence to tank through otherwise problematic second wave with Hordins under the Decrease Def debuff.

Apothecary does not do any significant damage to the dungeon boss, Frozen Banshee does the main job with her poisons stacking.

https://youtu.be/3r_iO8lzaVQ 

Dungeon runs for Spider, FK and Ice Golem can be viewed on the next page
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
OVERVIEW

Soulbound Bowyer is a Spirit Rare from the Barbarian faction. She’s often seen as a “poor man’s Coldheart” as she can fill the same role in some dungeons while she’s much easier to acquire than her Void Dark Elves counterpart. In practice she’s quite different and can do a number of things Coldheart can’t do, including being a superb Arena Nuker which will be the subject of another guide.

All of her attacks have an innate 25% additional chance to Crit. Her A2 attack is a single hit that ignores 75% of the enemy defense, allowing heavy damage on high Def enemies while her A3 completely depletes the enemy's Turn Meter.
