Finally she has an All Battles aura for another 17% Crit Rate that can help your entire team. Her kit and Spirit affinity make her an excellent choice to take on the Fire Knight that is often one of the toughest dungeons to farm reliably on level 20.

MASTERIES

Soulbound Bowyer is a damage dealer and this means you will go down the Offensive tree with her. For Dungeons her Offense tree will look like a typical Clan Boss tree going into Warmaster as all of her skills hit once. You can take a number of useful damage bonuses along the way, the most important being Bring it Down and Heart of Glory (if everything goes fine she won't be attacked by waves and the Fire Knight won't take a turn)

You need Accuracy to land her Turn Meter deplete making Support a useful secondary tree even thought there aren't a lot of useful masteries there for someone who doesn't place buffs or debuffs. Cycle of Magic is nice to give her a small chance to use her stronger attacks more often and Lore of Steel bonus, while small, will help you if you use any stat bonus set.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The best gear set for her is Savage as it allows her A2 to completely bypass the enemy Defense. Crit damage is decent as a secondary set. Another option would be 3 Cruel sets.

If you build her purely to lock out the turn meter of the Fire Knight you can get away with Accuracy and Crit Rate sets making gearing her with second grade gear quite easy.

If you use her as lead champion in Dungeon you can stop at 58% crit rate making it really easy. You have to find 38% Crit Rate spread in your substats and that shouldn't be hard for mid and late game players since you have 20% from your base stats and Masteries. You should then be able to put Crit Damage gloves on her for some heavy hitting. For chest you want %HP for dungeon to draw the enemies attention away from her. Even if she's strong affinity for Fire Knight 20, the enemies might target her if she looks too squishy.

On all pieces you want as much %Att, Crit damage and Speed substats as you can find without using all your best pieces on her.
Crit Damage Amulet with Accuracy substat and an Accuracy Banner will complete her build to make her a heavy hitter with a strong and reliable single target control.

Gantlets : Crit Damage
Chest : HP % 
Boots : Speed
Ring : Def
Amulet : Crit Damage
Banner : Accuracy

Only one 6-star piece here and it's Rare. Some good gear but not insane at all. The glyphs used were also mid-tier 3 to 4 star glyphs.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Soulbound Bowyer's main job is to prevent the Fire Knight from acting. Everyone who has faced high level Fire Knight knows that the best way to win in this dungeon is to prevent him from raising his shield after you drop it once. You can't stun or freeze the dungeon bosses but you can deplete their turn meter and prevent them from acting (apart from the Dragon and Clan Boss).

She won't be able to turn-lock the Fire Knight on her own, but if used along other champions who can reduce his turn meter, even the humble Armiger, she can completely prevent one of the hardest dungeon bosses from taking a single turn. One more important part of the FK lockout is the Decrease Speed debuff.  With no Coldheart in my Roster Soulbond has allowed me to finish the Arbiter quest and is still part of my regular Fire Knight team. Note that she's hitting quite hard in addition to her invaluable control.

You can find a video of a more budget run on Fire Knight compared to the screenshot below

https://youtu.be/73wjj4XuQrw?t=26 

Final Notes: she would be a wonderful champion for the another difficult dungeon, Spider 20 if her AI was coded differently. Currently she favours her A1 (which is AoE but deals little damage and has no control value) over any other skill when facing the horde of Spiderlings while she could fill the same role there and help turn-lock the big Spider. Keep that in mind before trying to use her there on auto.

She can be of great help on Faction War teams and will work there even in multiples up to and including the final 21st boss.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Krisk in the Arena setup with a Shield set can be useful in nearly all other PVE settings. There is no dungeon level or content where he is bad in the role of a superior defender.

In this example a budget Tank + Max HP nuke build with Krisk takes down Spider 20. Note that this Krisk has less than 200 accuracy and doesn't aggro all the spiderlings. However, his massive shield allows Coldhearts to take damage from poisons and survive without any problems.

The speed for the other featured champions can be found in the respective guides. Krisk will work in many other types of spider teams including AOE HP burn, poison burst, Counterattack teams and so on. He will be your reliable partner for any level of spider.

You can find the video of a run here: https://youtu.be/XemUojEV2y8
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
On Dragon 20 as the most popular dungeon for players this Krisk serves much the same role as in all others. He provides good defence for all of the team and helps control and tank the waves and the boss.

In this video you can see a non-optimised budget run that relies on Zargala and Seer for clearing waves and frozen Banshee for ensuring the poisons tick down on the Dragon to ensure his demise.

Krisk will work in many different types of teams in all dungeons at all levels.

https://youtu.be/tkgcWcvaRak
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Finally, the more difficult content in the game (Faction wars) becomes quite easy with Krisk due to the factors already mentioned previously. Krisk is amazing for the waves if you have the DPS to deal enough damage while the shield lasts.

Note that on the boss once the shield does wear off Krisk is not so amazing in saving the team. However, ally protection and buffs allow him to provide enough survivability for the team to allow obtaining 3 stars for faction wars 21 without much trouble.

The video was taken before the nerf to faction wars and your run will likely be even easier and smoother.

https://youtu.be/21201xUSM2M
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Foli can be a good arena nuker. His damage is high and he can be built in multiple ways. His A3 has block revive and this makes him viable even in platinum arena even if his nuke is not the strongest in the game.

Foli's passive gives him a good advantage against crowd control debuffs. If you're using him as your main nuker you should consider booking his main skills.

In terms of late game masteries, [Helmsmasher] is the key one for this champion (provided you can get Crit Damage over 220%), along with [Ruthless Ambush] and [Heart of Glory] for his first attack A3 nuke. 

You can choose either support tree to try and land his Defence Down and Leech debuffs or defence tree for a chance to counter attack via the retribution mastery.

At this stage of the game your equipment will matter for Foli more than most t5 masteries.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
It is most common to speed tune Foli to a speed team (see video, and see speed tune guide [1]), where 2 speed boosters boost the TM of all champions, followed by AOE defence down and Foli A3 nuke. 

For this speed tune reason, you may need a reasonably high speed. Nonetheless the default recommendation is savage set, that is best in slot for damage dealers in platinum arena in most cases.

You may need speed gear if your savage gear cannot achieve the right speed and damage stats as is the case of the featured build.

Glove: Crit Damage 
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Atk or Acc 

In terms of banner choice, if you are building a pure damage build, attack is preferred as you generally have other champions to land AOE Defence down for Foli.

[1] https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/arena-calculator has the arena speed tune calculator.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Foli can operate in a number of ways in the Arena:

1. [Speed Tune] Foli is usually the last to take his turn after AOE Defence Down is placed. His Ai will prioritise A3 in most situations, so it is safe to use him in auto. His block revives are effective if his A3 can kill all enemy damage champions. 
2. [Anti Crowd Control] His passive will remove any stun, freeze, sleep, or provoke and boost his TM by 50%, which allows Foli to get a turn very quickly. This makes him an effective counter CC champion, against Tormin for example (his A3 block revive is particular useful here). Note that the passive has a cooldown.
3. [Single Target] Foli has an extremely impressive single target damage capability, due to his 4 hit A1, 4 hit A2, and 2 hit A3, focusing a huge amount of damage on a single target if used. 

Video showcase  – Speed Nuke Team: https://youtu.be/5twAxsba2Fg 

As Foli A3 is a double hit, you should select a primary target wisely, even on auto. In the video, we show how: 

I.  [Auto Battle 1] two speed boosters (Siphi and Arbiter) boost TM and speed, Madame Serris strip buffs, and Foli uses A3 on auto with my direction to double tap Rotos (so his passive is overcome).
II. [Battle 2-3] two speed boosters boost TM and speed, madame strip buffs, and Foli uses A3 on auto with the direction to double tap Sinesha (as she is a force champion and weak hit is possible).

However, Foli is not without his issues and there are many challenges:
A. His A3 damage is not one of the highest and high defence teams or shield teams will be able to mitigate his damage. Champions that are force, have high defence, or damage mitigation (e.g., Bulwark mastery or ally protect) will easily survive the A3 nuke.
B.        Foli is extremely fragile without any significant survival capabilities, which means it is mostly a kill or be killed situation. This makes the rest of the team all the more important to make him shine

You can find more foli gameplay here:

https://youtu.be/7Hq5j0sMOeo
data.label: Notes:

title: Kantra The Cyclone Late Game+ Guide

data.desc:
Kantra The Cyclone was a Fusion Champion that many players should have access too. 

She can be quite useful in Faction Wars and her viability has risen thanks to the release of Doom Tower. One of the Doom Tower Boss, the Magma Dragon, has a weakness where it can be Provoked. Kantra is one of the few champions in the game that has a high chance to Provoke and without a cooldown. Her passive makes her viable for both the boss and any waves as long as your team applies enough debuffs.

Not only can she constantly provoke the Magma Dragon, she can reduce the damage she takes, self-sustain with her self-heals, and has affinity advantage to the Magma Dragon. This makes her one of the best champion to keep the Magma Dragon under control. This guide will cover Kantra’s build and strategy for the Magma Dragon.

Booking Kantra is not as important because her ability to Provoke comes from her passive that does not require any books to upgrade. However, booking her A2 will give a much higher chance to place debuffs and increase the consistency of having the 5 debuffs required for her passive Provoke to trigger on the boss. Otherwise, your team needs to consistently place them.

You can build Kantra in the Defense and Support tree mastery. The most important T6 mastery to have on her for this build is Fearsome Presence to increase the chance to Provoke from her Passive from 75% to 80%. Some key masteries to have on her are the single target damage reduction masteries in Improved Parry and Delayed Death since the Magma Dragon will only perform single target attacks when provoked. 

In the Support tree, the basic Accuracy masteries, Arcane Celerity to improve TM when debuffs expire, Lore of Steel for more stats, Sniper to improve debuff chance and Master Hexer to increase debuff duration.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The Highest level of Magma Dragon (Stage 110) has a resistance of 330 so, you will need to build your Kantra with at least that much accuracy. 

However, another great thing about Kantra is her All Battle Accuracy Aura of 60. If you use her as your leader, you can lower the high accuracy requirement for Hard DT from your entire team. Once you meet the accuracy requirement, you want to gear to be tanky  with as much HP, Def and Speed as possible. A good number to shoot for is about 35k+ HP, 4.5k+ Def, and 200+ Speed. 

Ideally, you want to speed tune your team for her to go last in your team’s rotation to allow everyone else to place debuffs so she can trigger her passive provoke on her turn. Artifact sets are very flexible on her. You can equip any artifact sets on her as long as you meet the stat requirement. The main stats for each artifact piece I would suggest are:

Glove: Def %/ HP %
Chest: Accuracy (If Accuracy requirement cannot be met) otherwise, HP%/Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Def
Amulet: HP/Def
Banner: Accuracy

Kantra can work with almost any set in the game. Relentless set, speed sets, perception sets, anything works.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Kantra’s main role is to keep the Magma Dragon provoked. However, her provoke does not have a 100% chance to land and is reliant on having 5 debuffs on the Magma Dragon. This leaves a lot of room for unlucky RNG to cause the run to fail. I would not suggest using her as your only Provoke champion. I recommend having another champion that can Provoke as a backup.

This is the team that can auto farm Stage 110 Hard Magma Dragon that features Kantra. 

1) Kantra: Main Provoke Champion, Provides Accuracy Aura
2) Seeker: Secondary Provoke Champion, Provides TM Boost
3) Lydia: Provides tons of Debuffs to keep the 5 Debuffs for Kantra’s Provoke. Strengthen and Inc Speed.
4) Scyl of the Drakes: Constant heals, Clutch Revives on Seeker as his kit is not as defensive to tank hits.
5) Zavia: DPS

The video demonstrates a successful Stage 110 Hard Magma Dragon run. This team is full auto and has about a 60% winrate. 

https://youtu.be/obIEZA5Ll8g 

Thankfully just like in faction wars you don't lose keys and this can be left on a clicker for farming.
data.label: Notes:

title: Scyl of the Drakes Late Game+ Guide

data.desc:
Scyl of the Drakes is a Magic Affinity Support Legendary Champion that all players will receive as a 180-day login reward. While she may be a free champion, her utility in this game is few and far in between. She can be used literally anywhere in the game. She constantly heals your team with every turn she takes with her passive, controls the waves with AOE stuns, Decreases TM and Speed of bosses, has good damage multipliers AND revives allies. 

She can slot into any dungeon team, carry you in the Barbarian Faction Wars, help you clear nightmare campaign, be part of your Arena team, and even your Clan Boss team if you don’t have any better options. On top of that, she doesn’t require books to perform her job. With books, she becomes much better of course. With the addition of Doom Tower, this usability extends even further to help take down Kuldath, the Magma Dragon and Angrath, the Nether Spider in the Hard Doom Tower.

Masteries on Scyl are flexible and can vary depending on how you want to use her. Usually the Offense and Support Mastery are selected. 

For the Offense tree, you simply want to take the Crit Rate, Crit Damage mastery, all the way down to T6 Warmaster. If you are using Scyl mostly for Arena it's advisable to pick Helmsmasher/Flawless Excecution instead for T6.

The Support tree is a more flexible. You can take the accuracy masteries if you need more accuracy on her. If you can obtain the needed accuracy through gear, taking health and healing increase masteries is an option. For T3 Rapid Response and Arcane Celerity works well since she applies buffs and debuffs allowing her to gain lots of TM to take turns quicker. For T4, Merciful Aid for more healing. You can decide between Lore of Steel or Evil Eye. Evil Eye was chose for the build as Lore of steel doesn't provide as much value with the Relentless set. Finally, Lasting Gifts to increase the duration of Increase Speed buff she places and Sniper to increase the chance of placing her Decrease Speed Debuff round up the masteries.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Scyl of the Drakes is primarily a support champion, while she can deal damage if built for it, I do not recommend it if you have to sacrifice her survivability and speed. The most important stats to get on her are Speed, Accuracy and Defense and this build focuses on her as a support. 

Around 220 accuracy is enough for regular PVE content but for Hard Doom Tower, 330+ accuracy is needed for the bosses. You then want her to be as fast as possible, ideally around 200+. Finally, try to build her with around 4k Defense. 

Scyl can be built with any set if you meet the stat requirement, but Relentless set is the best set to have her in. She benefits a lot from being able to take multiple turns as she passively heals and provides Increase Speed buffs to your team as well as lowers her cooldown. However, the stats are still important. Relentless set are hard to come by. Do not build her in a weak Relentless set as it will hinder her performance. She can work just as well with pure Speed, Perception sets or even random items if Scyl has sufficient stats. 

Glove: Def %
Chest: Def %
Boots: Speed
Ring: Defense
Amulet: Defense
Banner: Accuracy

You can use Scyl of the Drakes anywhere with this suggested build. The Scyl showed in this guide is in a Late Game Relentless build. These numbers will be difficult to achieve if you are in the early, or mid-game but can be your long term goal.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The video below shows how Scyl of the Drakes is used against Hard Doom Tower Stage 110 Magma Dragon. Her main role here is to provide constant heals to the champion that is provoking the Dragon and tanking the hits. If the provoke misses and the Dragon is able to land an AOE hit, she is able to heal everyone from the AOE hit and the HP Burn ticks. In this team specifically, she is also there to revive Seeker when he dies since he is not as survivable as Kantra in the Provoking role and often dies.

https://youtu.be/obIEZA5Ll8g

The following pages have Scyl featured in the rest of the dungeons and Raid content in a semi-budget setting
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Stag Knight is a Spirit Affinity Epic Banner Lords Champion with a simple yet effective skillset. He is extremely versatile and can be used everywhere in the game, even in end-game teams. He can place AOE 60% Decrease ATK and DEF that are crucial debuffs to increase your team’s damage and decrease the damage your team takes. He also places Decrease Speed, which is very helpful against bosses to slow them down. 

He is amazing in Fire Knight, Ice Golem, Spider and although he is weak affinity to Dragon 20, he can still be used there. He can be used in Arena as your Decrease Defense champion before your nuker (watch out for affinity). He is one of the best Banner Lords for Faction Wars and with the addition of Doom Tower, his usability extends even further to help take down Borgoth the Scarab King. Overall, he is an amazing champion to use and should be 6 starred and fully booked as a priority as you will use him everywhere even in the endgame.

This build features Stag Knight with the Offense and Support Mastery trees. The most important mastery you want to have on Stag Knight is Sniper on the Support Tree since his A2 only has a 95% chance to place the debuffs fully booked. The 5% from Sniper Mastery will help bring it to 100%. For the other masteries, select the masteries that improve his accuracy, Lore of Steel to improve his stats, Master Hexer to increase the Debuff duration and Evil Eye for some added Turn Meter control. On the Offense Tree select  the Crit rate, Crit damage masteries and go down to the T6 Warmaster mastery for some added damage.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The two most important stats you want to build on Stag Knight are Accuracy and Speed. For Dungeons, you want to have 220+ accuracy to reliably place his debuffs on Stage 20 Dungeons. For speed, you want to build him as fast as possible and fast enough to go before your damage dealer so that he can place his debuffs before they nuke, ideally around 200+.

For Hard Doom Tower, the Highest level of Borgoth the Scarab King (Stage 100) have a resistance of 330 and Stag Knight with need at least that much accuracy. Speed is much more important here and at least 225+ speed is recommended. 

The other stats you want to build are HP, Crit Rate, Crit Damage. Although his main role is to debuff, Stag Knight actually has good damage multipliers. If built with 100% Crit rate he can deal significant damage. Do not sacrifice his Speed, Accuracy for Crit Rate and Crit Damage. Remember that his main role is to place debuffs, focus on damage after you have the accuracy and speed. The Speed, Accuracy, Perception sets are ideal for him. 

He is also an amazing champion in the Relentless set to cycle his cooldown faster and this build showcases exactly how it works 

Glove: Hp%/Crit Rate %
Chest: HP%/Accuracy for Doom Tower
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Defense
Amulet: HP/Defense/Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy

The Stag Knight showed in this guide is in an end-game Relentless build. These numbers will be difficult to achieve if you are in the early, or mid-game but should be the goal. Refer to the previous page for the more accessible build.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The video below shows Stag Knight in Hard Doom Tower Stage 100 Borgoth to place Decrease Def so the team deals more damage and Decrease Speed to slow Borgoth down. 

Decrease Speed is crucial for this boss as this team relies entirely on keeping its TM down and never letting it take a turn. If you have Stag Knight in the Relentless set, you should not use this set for this boss as he needs to be in shield to attack the boss. Extra turns will cause him to lose the shield and attacking the boss with shield will lead to counterattacks from the boss and the run failing.

You can switch out one item from Relentless so that the set bonus does not apply and then you're safe as long as your champion that applies shield is the fastest.

https://youtu.be/Ew4rFOmb8eU

The next page features Stag Knight in the dungeons
data.label: Notes:

title: Stag Knight Late Game+ Dungeon Runs 2

data.desc:
Stag Knight can be useful in Ice Golem 20. This dungeon is well known for the second wave with reflect damage and the boss being able to hit extremely hard.

Stag Knight has AOE Def Down and ATK Down for speeding up the wave farming and additional protection from the Boss hits.

In this composition Norog provides protection from AOE damage.  Dark Elhain is a damage dealer that can utilise her passive to convert the Freeze debuff into additional damage on the boss stage. Gorgorab provides TM boosting and resurrection if things go South. Scyl provides CC on the waves, healing and backup ressurection.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=100
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Stag Knight can also function in the Arena. The featured build is mostly intended for dungeons, however it can still work in the current Gold IV.

The main goal of Stag Knight in this setting is to have enough Speed and Accuracy to go after the TM booster and place AOE Def Down. Note that Stag Knight Spirit affinity is problematic against Magic Affinity enemies and can result in a weak hit that fizzles out the debuff. 

In this video she is shown on an attack. The team is not fully optimised for Arena, however the basics are the same. Gorgorab TM boost, Stag Knight AOE Def Down, Scyl uses the AOE stun and Zargala finishes the job.


https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=477
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Stag Knight is one of the best champions in the Banner Lords and must be included in your FW team if you have him. The combination of the debuffs he brings are useful both on the waves and the boss. Furthermore, he can hit for a respectable amount of damage as evidenced on the FW screenshot.

The video showcases a team running Banner Lords FW 21 where Stag Knight is easily the MVP of the team. The key to this stage is to focus the right minion during the boss stage. The right minion deals a ton of damage and can easily one shot your champions. You can do this by clicking on that unit during auto and your champions will focus it or manually if you want to clear it for the first time. 

This boss can revive dead minions, but if it does, just focus it down again.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A9Noi6ehto8
data.label: Notes:

title: Late Game Skull Lord Var-Gall Guide

data.desc:
Skull Lord Var-Gall is a Force-affinity legendary that is often underestimated. He does have a role to play in multiple instances and can help in the late game setting: Dungeons, Arena, Faction Wars and Doom Tower.

He has good base stats and can function extremely well in a shield set. This allows him to play a role of a beefy character that protects the rest of the team and has some additional control with Provoke.

Var-Gall can function well enough without books. His A1 places heal reduction and this can be relevant in some dungeons, e.g. Fire Knight. A2 can provoke a single target and A3 provides AOE Atk Down boosting the survivability of your team. His passive allows to complete Faction Wars 21 easily.

The masteries are selected to keep him beefy and capable of taking damage from all sources as well as redirecting some from his allies to him. Support tree is selected for some additional accuracy, shield strength and TM reduction.

There are two a few options for the T6 masteries. Unshakable has been selected as the level of resistance due to substats allows this Var-Gall to shrug off most debuffs in PVE and should be sufficient for Gold IV.

However, you could also opt in for Bulwark as the final mastery if Var-Gall is purely built for Arena. This will allows him to take even more heat off the rest of the team.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
In terms of gear Var-Gall in the late game works best with the Shield set. This build doesn't focus on too high a Crit Rate and Dmg and only needs roughly 200+ Accuracy and Resistance for the regular Dungeons.

The main goal is to have tons and tons of HP staked up for the shield. Note the maximum HP in the screenshot. Some Defence and other substats are welcome, but not categorically required.

Glove: HP%
Chest: HP%
Boots: HP%
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP
Banner: HP

An alternative build for Platinum Arena would focus on  ~600 Resistance and enough Accuracy to place the debuffs. However, this would come at a cost of the Shield level and make Var-Gall harder to use in other content.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Var-Gall in Arena plays a role in Defence teams. Their purpose is not to win the the battles. It's to make it as long and as miserable as possible for the attacker. This becomes important for the Platinum rush about one hour before the reset to get the prizes.

Platinum-ranked players will start to attack with the fastest possible speed to gain Arena points. The usual teams can take mere seconds to defeat for well geared meta top-tier teams. Your Var-Gall can make battles take minutes instead of seconds if built and paired accordingly and help you keep your ranking.

Another group of Arena teams that Var-Gall excels against are Blender teams (e.g. Arbiter, Sinesha, Skullcrown, Longbeard). Even if you go second the shield is so massive that they will have a hard time to bypass it and nuke you in one hit.

Finally, some hard meta nukers in the game are Magic Affinity such as Trunda, Astralon and Foli. Having them weak hit against Var-Gall further complicated life for attackers. In the first video you can see how a budget Var-Gall composition fares against a team. Auto is pressed to emulate the Defence battle and it takes about 1,5 min.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bi5WGbO8vIk

The team composition is Seeker for the Aura and passive, Var-Gall for the shield, Rector for Veil and healing, Sandslashed Surviver for additional protection.

The second team is the Whale Defence team with Var-Gall. It consists of Lilitu, Nekhret, Seeker and Var-Gall.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xJKM3UERvVQ

The next slide will feature Skull Lord in dungeons and Faction Wars.
data.label: Notes:

title: Zavia Late Game+ Guide Dungeon runs 2

data.desc:
Fire Knight

For Fire Knight, you can use Zavia in a Speed run type of team or a regular team. 

For a speed run teams, the core champions typically used are Zavia, Taurus, a skill reset champion (Renegade or Prince Kymar). It is highly suggested to use Alure for the 4th spot to help with breaking the shield and keeping TM down. The 5th spot is flexible and you can use anyone that will help with your strategy like a TM Booster, Poisoner, someone who can keep the TM down like Armiger, or the best FK champion, Coldheart who helps break shield, deal MAX HP damage, and deplete TM. Decrease Defense is not necessary as Poison Explosion is not affected by Defense.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h9MdS-YZNRw&t=52s

In a regular Fire Knight 20 team, Zavia will function as your main Damage dealer. She has a distinct advantage in breaking the shield with a 3-hit A1. You then build an appropriate Fire Knight team that should include supports/healers like Gorgobrab, Apothecarry, or Scyl, an AOE Decrease Defense champion like Zargala, or Stag Knight and TM controllers like Alure or Armiger.  

The team showcased in the video is an example of a Fire Knight team with Zavia, Scyl, Alure, Stag Knight and Armiger.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZMUhfMZxhMo&t=1m56s
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Spider

Zavia is unfortunately a negative affinity to Spiders 20 so she cannot be reliably used there as weak hits will not cause the poison explosion. 

However, the combo still works on Spider 19 since it's Force Affinity. The video showcases how a Poison Explosion team can be used with Zavia for Spiders 19. The same core champions are used, Zavia, Taurus, and Renegade. We have Gurptuk to boost the damage from poison explosion, and Rhazin to decrease TM and place Weaken.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h9MdS-YZNRw&t=2m09s
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Ice Golem

Due to Zavia being weak affinity to Ice Golem, it is generally not recommended to use her there as weak hits cannot explode poison. Clearing the waves will not be consistent but should still be doable. However, it is worth noting that the side minions of the Ice Golem are Void affinity, so they can be exploded with Poison and Zavia will block them from being revived throughout the entire fight making the Ice Golem fight much easier. 

As shown in the video below, the side minion got immediately killed and blocked revived through the Taurus + Zavia combo. You can also see that weak hits during the wave will cause inconsistency in clearing them and sometimes the cooldowns on your skills will not line up properly to immediately take down the side minions when you reach the boss. Hence, Sir Nick and Scyl are in the team for protection until their cooldowns are up again and help clear the wave.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qhnYA_OtdLw

The next page will feature Zavia in other PVE content and Arena.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Gorgorab is a Magic Affinity Epic Support Champion from the Undead faction that any player progressing through the game should build and use. 

He has a skill kit that is very similar to Arbiter, essentially a budget version. He can place Increase Attack buff, Boost Turn Meter, Heal and Revive all dead allies. This combination of support abilities is very valuable for progression and will carry your teams through all dungeon content, especially if you haven’t completed the Arbiter mission yet. He also does the same job as an Arbiter in Arena, although on a smaller scale. He has the required skill set including a Speed Aura in an Arena Speed Nuke team. Finally, he is a core champion for Undead Faction Wars. He is one of the few champions in this Faction that can revive dead allies which is valuable to 3 star FW stages on the road to Lydia.

You will want to book his cooldown abilities fully. A1 is optional and doesn't matter as much.

For masteries, the support and defense tree works well for Gorgorab. He can work with little or no skill masteries. However, if built fully the most important Mastery to get on Gorgorab is Timely Intervention on T6. This mastery is core for revivers and healers as they gain a large TM boost when allies drop below 20% HP. Alternative would be to get +50 Resistance if you need to hit certain thresholds, however it's a niche choice.

Since Gorgorab doesn’t require accuracy, the support masteries to increase HP and healing are chosen. Rapid response increases his TM when his buffs expire, Lore of Steel provides more stats, Spirit haste helps with the gain speed when allies are dead, Lasting Gifts increases the buff duration. On the Defense tree, the standard damage mitigation masteries are selected for more survivability. Resurgent, Delay Death play the same role and Cycle of Revenge to gain TM when allies get crit are all relevant.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gorgorab is a faitrly easy champion to build. All you need to do it prioritize as much speed as possible on him. A 300 speed Gorgorab with no masteries is much better than a 150 speed Gorgorab with full masteries.

The Speed or Divine Speed sets are the best sets for him. Equip the pieces that have the most speed in each slot. The main stat of the pieces are less important than the speed substats. Always choose the piece with the most speed substat regardless of the main stat. However, the ideal build Gorgorab build should have high HP with a decent amount of Defense. The best main stats for him should be as follows:  

Glove: HP %/Def %
Chest: HP %/Def %
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Def
Amulet: HP/Def
Banner: HP/Def

The high Accuracy in the screenshot is a coincidence because the Chest and the Banner with the highest available speed substats had it. You can also select some pieces with Resistance main stats (Chest and Banner) to reach 200+ and resist most dungeon-20 debuffs.

Having refresh jewellery works well on Gorgorab for extra TM boosts, healing and revives.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Gorgorab excels in Arena especially when you don’t have an Arbiter yet. 

He does the exact same job as Arbiter by providing an Arena Speed Aura, Increase Attack, and Boost TM. The standard speed nuke team should also include an AOE Decrease Defense Champion and a Nuker. Even after you get an Arbiter, Gorgorab can still be used in your second Speed Nuke team in 3v3 Tag Arena. 

In this video Gorgorab is shown in such a team in Gold 4. The team consist of Gorgorab as the speed aura lead, Increase Attack and TM boost, Stag Knight as AOE Def Down, Scyl uses the AOE stun and Zargala finishes the job with her Nuke.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=477

The next page features Gorgorab in other dungeons and Faction wars
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Valla is an epic that is rarely used and is quite underappreciated. 

However, she can be a solid champion for dungeons and even the Doom Tower. The ability to apply Decrease Defense and her high HP, DEF as well as applying a shield on herself make it possible to do things other champions cannot. In this guide Valla will take on Scarab on floor 100 on normal. You will need her A3 to be booked in order for this build to work.

In terms of masteries the build goes for Warmaster as a stable source of additional damage, other offence masteries play the same role to take advantage of the grindy and long fight. The support tree is focused on increasing the efficiency of the shield buffs and on improving the healing from the immortal set
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For the purposes of this build Valla is geared in such a way that she must survive against the Scarab. This requires sustain and she needs at least 1 immortal set (2 recommended).

At least 200 resist is required in order for the scarab king not to steal the shield buff. 

In the normal doom tower Scarab doesn't require a Destroy set to defeat it.

Glove:  Crit Rate %
Chest: Resist (If Resist requirement cannot be met) otherwise, HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: Crit dmg
Banner: Resist
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Valla will use her shield for a permanent uptime, that way she will never gets provoked and will never get hit. Her shield and passive make her a strong champion for this battle, but the battle will take time to complete. 

As long as it's within 1500 turns it will count, so without further ado, here's the video of the run:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bXF15xAHsrc

Note that there are some additional champions alongside Valla to help clear out the waves for the scarab. However, the actual battle against the boss is solo.
data.label: Notes:

title: Late Game+ Shamrock Dungeon Runs and Arena

data.desc:
Shamrock has several uses on Fire Knight. His double hits on a1 gets the shield down a bit quicker. The champions are selected to be weak and to showcase our Ogryn at his best.

For the first few rounds we get unlucky with timings, but at 8:27 the fight is under control. The shield is down, Shamrock has gotten the Decrease Speed debuff on the FK, reduces turn meter and after that the run is safe. 

https://youtu.be/KvFCkYirsMU
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Shamrock can reduce TM and speed of Ice Golem and both minions. In addition, his increase speed and defence can help survive heavier hits. The composition is not overpowered here on purpose.

Note that this does require an additional Atk Down champion in the team for 100% success. His revive on death can also be useful if the boss gets two large hits back to back.

Poison procs don't cause Ice Golem to retaliate so if you're struggling with this dungeon consider using champions with this skill and taking it slow.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Shamrock can also be used in Arena even if he's not a Platinum tier legendary.

If he is built to be quick enough, he can cut in before the enemy team, reducing their turn meter and allows your buffers/debuffers/nukers to go first. In this arena team, he goes second after arbiter. 

His a3 allows blind seer to place shields/block debuffs and allows Rae to nuke the enemy team. This principle works in almost any arena set up if you have an initial speed lead / booster.

https://youtu.be/ooPEuZ9JAeA 

In 3v3 when you are facing possibly longer fights compared to standard teams, his a2 and a1 provide substantial support and buff removal/steal can be extremely effective. 

In this 3v3 video, his reduce turn meter stops maneater from going before Fu-Shan, allowing him to get a stun in before he places block debuffs/unkillable. It also allows Blind Seer to get her shield/block debuffs on the team before Kantra can place debuffs. This puts the team in a commanding position. 

Shamrock works well in almost any 3v3 arena setup for his support/revive/healing abilities and excels in speed nuke, and slower tanks builds. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4zJy71jiv8
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Coldheart is one of the best rares in the game. She is one of the few champions that you want multiples of and don't mind dupes at all.

There are a few reasons for this. 

(1) Coldheart is void affinity and she can be useful in any content and will not suffer from weak hits. 

(2) She can hit with her A3 based on Maximum HP of the target and this allows her to be one of the best boss killers in the game with the exception of Clan boss and some doom tower bosses that have a passive that prevents the full damage from going through. 

(4) Her A3 ability also fully depletes the Turn Meter of the opponent and this can be key in lots of content as well.

(5) Her A1 hits four times and this is extremely useful on Fire Knight to bring down the shield fast.

Late game and late game+ is where she shines the most as you can reach the right stats that bring out her full potential.

Her main drawback is that she is a glass cannon and requires protection to dish out her damage properly.

In terms of masteries a lot depends on your team composition. In this build the T6 mastery is Helmsmasher as it offers the best DPS. If the crit damage you have is higher than 200-220%, Helm Smasher offers the best dps for coldheart on dungeon bosses.

Helmsmasher should only be taken only if your composition does not depend on the success of it's proc. If you sometimes lose because of it, take Flawless Excecution as the tier 6 mastery instead for stable results.

There is some flexibility in the masteries you can take in the support tree. If you're aiming for  faction wars you might want to select Evil Eye mastery to control the turn meter or chamions on the A1 (e.g. the Valkyrie waves)
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Coldheart needs the following at a minimum for late game and stable Spider 20 farming:

Accuracy: 200+ for the turn meter reduction
Speed: 192 if using renegade, otherwise can be lower
Crit rate: 70% 
Crit damage: 200%+
Hp: depending on your other heroes on spider 20 she may need more hp so she doesn't get targeted or die before she does her duty

Set: Savage + Cruel would be best. Second best would be Savage + any. Can also be a mix without sets if the needed parameters are met.

Glove - crit damage %
Chest - hp % / atk %
Boots - speed
Ring - hp
Amulet - crit damage %
Banner - accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Coldheart provides a combination of useful skills for every stage of the Spider hunting. For Spiders below level 15 she provides full TM depletion. For spiders above that stage they have much higher MAX Enemy HP and Coldheart A3 scales extremely well.

In the featured video on Spider 20 the team is quite budget for full-auto late game runs.

Coldheart is the star of the show with MAX HP nuke and full TM depletion
Royal Guard is a MAX HP AOE nuker that deals with the spiderlings
Stag Knight provides AOE Decrease DEF and Speed Decrease on the Spider
Skullcrusher is a negative affinity tank that can be unkillable for two turns with Renegade
Renegade allows all champions to use their skills twice to make sure the runs are stable

Note that the turn meter reduction is absolutely key for this comp to work. Coldheart uses her A2 on auto first and then the Heartseeker. Two heartseekers and 2 takedowns are enough to take down Spider 20 comfortably even if you don't have completely optimal stats.

https://youtu.be/D1SAqGw4JIA

The following pages feature Coldheart in other dungeons and content.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Spider 20 is one of the dungeons where many player struggle. Shamrock can be used efficiently in Spider 20 and below due to his Decrease Speed / Turn meter manipulation on the main spider and spiderlings that work regardless of afinity, as well as defence up/revive on death / heal buffs on his a2. 

In this team Arbiter serves at the TM booster and reviver and places Weaken Debuff, Coldheart is the nuker with MAX HP hit and TM depletion, Tayrel provides AOE Defence Down for Miscreated Monster shields. 

Due to the difficulty of this dungeon, Shamrock does require additional support but would function well at earlier stages as well. 

https://youtu.be/eMizfOsLL7E
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
On Dragon 20 Shamrock is weak affinity and the boss has immunity to Decrease Speed debuffs and Turn meter reduction. 

https://youtu.be/9Wf7CBWele8 

However, he does provide useful support from his A2 on the boss and is useful on the waves with the full suite of buffs and debuffs. His Accuracy Aura also helps Reliquary Tender to place decrease atk on the dragon, as this can mitigate a large amounts of damage (and Reliquary Tender has about 100 Accuracy without the aura)
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
If you have Shamrock, you're lucky with Faction Wars! The kit he has is tailored towards the faction and he can be amazing in that area.

Shamrock’s main role here is as reviver. He can help during the waves as a general support as described previously. His buff removal on his a1 can be particularly helpful in the second wave. He is one of the MVPs at the boss. 

Obviously, this depends on the gear you have on your champions, but if you don’t have lifesteal or leech then you can still complete the floor. His revive on death for 2 turns from Lucky Charms (A2) is key, especially due to damage that comes from HP burns and poisons. 

https://youtu.be/-NwcjQFntTI 

We can see at the 5 minute mark that this revives 4 champions and this is key several turns later for completing the floor. He could also be paired well with Drokgul, and / or Grush for extra healing and support.

Being more careful an completing the boss stage on manual makes 3 starring this faction crypt easy with Shamrock.

You can find more showcases in dungeons and 3x3 arena on the next page
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Warlord is not going to set world records in fast farming of Platinum Arena, but it's one of the best champions in a sustain team if built with high accuracy, speed and resistance.

The key is to work with support champions to block enemy skills and grind them down slowly. All attacking champions such as Trunda and Rotos find it difficult to get through Warlord defences if they don't get to go first and have their skills locked out. Tormin has difficulties to attack through block debuffs.

The video features how a Platinum fight may look like with Warlord in the fray

https://youtu.be/dlJX7DHFmbw
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Ensure going first by using a Valkyrie and Tormin to make the enemy bring either immunity or a fast siphi, but use Valkyrie to counter Siphi speed boost and allow your own to cut in. (Credit to Hahaa of G&L for telling me about this combo, though others have used this before him). 

Recommended team: Siphi (fast, 350-370), Warlord (fast, 300-320, medium acc 400-500), Tormin (shield set with 400 acc), Valk (medium high acc 500) / Crowd Control Hege (high acc 500-600).

https://youtu.be/L6za3Q4JLYU
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Keep in mind that Warlord can be still countered in this setup: 

CC hegemon can cause a lot of issues by locking Warlord out before he gets a turn. The same applies if your team with Warlord doesn't go first and gets wiped out in one rotation of enemy attacks.

Fast buff stripping can be an issue when Warlord is defending and champions that can overtake him can be a serious issue, e.g. Serris or Rae.

Finally, some fast champions can lock out Warlord on defence that have debuffs that can't be resisted and are placed before warlord uses block debuffs. This includes Siphi and Ghostborn among others.

Overall Warlord is still one of the best champions in Raid at the moment and definitely worth building if you have him.
data.label: Notes:

title: Stag Knight Late Game+ Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
One of the areas that is problematic for Late Game players is the Spider dungeon. Stag Knight can offer help in multiple ways. Stag Knight provides AOE Def Down, Atk Down and Decrease Speed. Def Down is almost a requirement for all speed runs of the dungeons. AOE Atk down helps tank the direct damage from spider and spiderlings.

Decrease Speed Debuff on the big spider is extremely important. With a speed of about 95, under this debuff its speed is around 66.5, making it much easier to lap it with your champions and to control it's turn meter.

In this video a Late Game+ Composition is featured with Scyl as the only legendary. The main engine are the two Coldhearts that are the MAX HP Nukers and full tm depleters. Psylar and Scyl ensure the Spiderlings don't take too many turns and are stunned.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=293
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Another Dungeon that is relevant from mid-game to end-game is Dragon 20. 

Stag Knight provides AOE Def Down and ATK down. However, he is negative affinity for Dragon 20 and is not so reliable due to affinity disadvantage, so another champion takes the fore - Zargala. Relentless set build allows to offset this disadvantage somewhat.

Scyl provides healing, stuns and resurrection.

Frozen Banshee main goal is to make sure the Dragon is constantly poisoned as this is one of the mains sources of damage at the boss stage.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=359
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
On Fire Knight 20 Stag can shine. The waves become more managable under his debuffs and the shield can be broken somewhat better utilising the Relentless set.

Decrease Speed debuff on the boss make a huge difference in how reliably you can keep the turn meter down as it lowers the effective speed to 66.5

AI changes have allowed Coldhearts to fully unleash their potential in this dungeon as the don't use heartseeker once the shield is up anymore.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8

The next page shows how Stag fares in Ice Golem, Arena and Faction Wars.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Prince Kymar is one of the key champions in Dungeon speed runs due to his ability to reset the cooldown of all your champions. 

He works so well in Dungeons because there are only 2 mob waves before reaching the boss. However, in Hard DT, there are 3 waves of mobs and your “speed run” champions will most likely not survive long enough on the third wave before their skills get off cooldown again and start dying.

However, it is possible for Prince Kymar to use his reset again immediately on the third wave! This guide on Prince Kymar + Seer based comp will show you how to clear all 3 waves of some of the hardest Hard DT stages.  

For the purpose of the role of Prince Kymar (resetting the skills), Masteries are not important at all. The only mastery that adds any significant value to this build is Lore of Steel for the additional stat boost because the only stat limitation of this build is the high speed requirement. 

So any mastery you already have on Prince Kymar will be sufficient. Below is an example of Masteries used on Prince Kymar. In this case Warmaster was selected for some additional dps.

If you're using him in other content you might want to select Eagle Eye if you need additional accuracy or Timely Intervention if you're using him in 3x3 Arena
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important gear for this strategy are the new Refresh Accessories that give your champion a 5% chance per accessory for the skill used to not go on cooldown. You want Prince Kymar with as many Refresh Accessories as you have. The stats on the accessories do not matter!

Hard DT is an end-game level content and the stats requirements are much higher than any other regular content in the game. So, if you already have a Prince Kymar built, you most likely have to re-gear him specifically for Hard DT. 

The hard DT waves, especially the higher floors, have high speeds. The fastest champion in Hard DT is Siphi at 264 speed. For this build/cheese strategy you will need to build your Prince Kymar to be the fastest champion in your team with at least 265 speed. All you want is to have enough speed, so the main stats of gear don’t really matter but the following are the ideal stats you want:

Glove: Crit Rate%
Chest: HP%/Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: ANY Refresh Ring
Amulet: ANY Refresh Amulet
Banner: ANY Refresh Banner 
 
Advice: Consider taking your fastest piece of speed gear, usually from your Arbiter or speed booster so you can meet the speed requirement. You can swap it back once you use all your DT keys for the day.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Prince Kymar’s main role is to reset the cooldown of your “Speed Run” team, the featured team is: 

1)        Prince Kymar (Fastest)
2)        Psylar (2nd Fastest but still above 264 to slow the enemies down so your other champs can take a turn)
3)        Lydia (Decrease Def, Weaken, and place Buffs. Slower than 264) 
4)        Mausoleum Mage (In Shield set, places Buffs)
5)        Seer (Strip Buffs and nuke the wave)

This set-up is different from the usual dungeon speed runs with Prince Kymar where he is the slowest champion. Hard DT mobs are too fast and deal too much damage. Your team cannot afford to let the enemy take a turn and deal damage to you. 

The Doom Tower strategy:
1)        Start the run on Manual, Use Prince Kymar’s A1, then click auto. 
2)        Let your other champions do their thing and nuke the wave. 
3)        On the Next wave, leave it on auto. Prince Kymar will use his Reset and you should LOOK FOR THE ANIMATION ABOVE HIS HEAD. An animation will appear if the Refresh accessory procs and his reset ability does not go on cooldown. 
4)        If the animation does not appear, leave the run and try again until the refresh procs.
5)        Let your other champions do their thing to nuke the wave again and he will have his reset available on the third wave and your team will nuke it again.

This team is NOT auto friendly. As the first champion in the rotation, Prince Kymar will use his Reset on auto. Manually use his A1 at the start of the round first. Reset until refresh procs.
 
This strategy works on all DT stages except Stages with Tormin, since he can freeze and revive and Valkyrie stages, since she will drop your TM from her passive. This comp still works on stages with Rotos and Siphi. He will not die but you can kill him with A1s.

The video below demonstrates an example of a run on Stage 109 Hard where the Refresh accessory proc. Note the multiple resets of the run it took to achieve the perfect run.

https://youtu.be/M2MrS31kzCU
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Netrhil is an excellent legendary that is useful for many stages of the game. In the late game scenarios he is especially helpful in two areas - Spider dungeon and Faction Wars. This guide focuses on those two areas.

This build focuses on Nethril as a Crowd Control (CC) champion due to his TM decrease, Speed Decrease Debuff and Stuns. Nethril really likes the books to decrease the cooldown for his skills for maximum efficiency.

Offence with Giant Slayer T6 mastery was selected for additional damage along with Opportunist for more damage to targets under stun, Cycle of violence for cooldown decrease and Bring it down. Support tree masteries include Evil eye for targeted cooldown reduction and the extra accuracy, turn meter boosts.

For a buid in Arena you could alternatively build Nethril with Eagle eye T6 mastery for extra accuracy or Helmsmasher for damage because Nethril can hit quite hard.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
200 accuracy is the bare minimum for dungeons 20 (you would normally want 230-250) while 200+ speed is prefered so Nethril can lap the waves in the dungeons and place debuffs on the big spider. As long as you can continuosly apply the CC you can lock the enemies out of combat.

This build is more offensive and decent Crit Rate and Dmg allows Nethril to help clean out the waves and the bosses. If you want to maximise the potential you would want to reach 100% Crit Rate and 200%+ Crit Damage.

Gloves - Crit Dmg/Crit Rate
Chest - DEF%/HP%/ACC
Boots - SPD
Ring - DEF/HP
Amulet - Crit Dmg
Banner - ACC

Note that jewelery with refresh abilities from Bazaar are best in slot for Nethril.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Nethril is Excellent in Faction Wars and can work extremely well both on the waves and against the boss. In crypt 19 Sethalia and Thenasil waves can be difficult without him

On the second wave in crypt 21 Valkyries can be a particularly big problem for teams attempting to complete it. Nethril can help in keeping them stunned and under constant CC. Tt least 210 speed is recommended so he can go twice for every enemy turn

https://youtu.be/q4UuAJ6_3_o?t=147

Note the manual control to ensure that those champions that are not affected by the CC are controlled by Seeker provoke and no excessive buffs or TM boosts are made to prevent Valkyrie passives from triggering. On the boss Decrease Speed, TM reduction and poisons play a key role in dealing enough damage to complete the crypt on a budget. 3 Starring this stage is also much easier with Nethril than without him.

On the next page of the guide there are more features of Nethril in Spider, Fire Knight and Arena.

Note that he is quite weak in dragon 20 because of weak affinity. He always has a 35% chance of a weak hit vs magic Affinity and this causes the debuffs to fail, taking away from his value.

For Ice golem 20 he is quite squishy and there are better candidates for both the waves and the boss in terms of debuffers and poisoners. Bringing a champion with a big shield (e.g. miscreated monster) and revive can help overcome that weakness.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Drexthar is an amazing champion that can be useful everywhere. If you are lucky enough to have him for your midgame, he'll be of huge help. If not - make sure to aquire his fragments from 3x3 Bazaar every day. You can select a 1 champion Defence to farm enough gold bars every day and eventually get him.

All of his kit is useful. His Aura provides accuracy in all content and may be useful for mid-game accounts. His A1 has three hits, making him a good candidate for Giant Slayer T6 mastery if you need extra damage on clan boss and in dungeons. It applies the HP burn debuff and provides some healing if the burn is present on the target.

A2 features AOE provoke that has a 100% chance to land if the targets are already under HP burn. Furthermore, it places a Decrease Atk debuff and deals respectable amounts of damage.

His passive is what makes him an especially valuable asset. When hit, Drexthar has a chance to place a HP burn debuff on attacker. His resistance increases up to 50 depending on the number of enemies under HP burn.

It is especially important that the passive will work on any affinity of attackers. It's drawback is that the enemies need to actively target Drexthar. This can be used to your advantage on Spirit affinity enemies, especially in Spider Dungeon and Nether Spider in Doom Tower in the late game.

The masteries in the featured build include the usual suspects: Crit rate and crit damage, standard damage masteries in the offense tree that can benefit clan boss champions. If you are using Drexthar in clan boss you will want to select Giant Slayer as the final T6 Mastery for extra damage and healing (combo with lifesteal).

In the support tree Accuracy buffing masteries have been selected. Sniper is an especially important pick. It doesn't benefit the provocation on A2, but improves the placement of HP Burn on the passive. If you are struggling with accuracy you can select Eagle Eye as the final mastery instead of Giant Slayer.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Drexthar is quite flexible in terms of gear. He needs enough Accuracy to place the debuffs. For dungeons 15 he would need at least 150 to feel comfortable. Note that he is used as the leader with his aura in this showcase. If you are not using him as the lead you need to increase the Accuracy accordingly. 

His damage scales with DEF and benefits from having lots of it. You want him to be the target and have less HP. At the same time you want Drexthar to survive.

Lifesteal is a good set to ensure survivability in all mid-game content. Any other set combination can work for him including Perception, Immortal, Speed, Accuracy and others.

Glove: Def %/ Crit Rate%
Chest: Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Def
Amulet: Def
Banner: Acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Drexthar works best in Spider dungeon and that's where we'll start. You want spiderlings to attack Drexthar as much as possible to apply HP burn to all of them (they burn the big Spider with each individual tick). There are a few tips to keep in mind:

1. Negative and Neutral affinity are your friends. Spirit, Void and Force levels are best, Magic affinity may be a problem for this strategy.
2. Ideally the big Spider doesn't take turns and doesn't heal by consuming spiderlings. Turn Meter reduction is your friend.
3. Crowd Control has to be used carefully. Drexthar needs the spiderlings to attack him to be effective. If they're stunned or frozen they can't do so.

The video below showcases the build on Void Spider 13

https://youtu.be/QV4Bil80XSs

And here's a video on Spider 15:

https://youtu.be/6U3uns6Q6oU

Drexthar applies the HP burn and is the main damage engine in this comp.
Two armigers ensure that the Big Spider doesn't take too many turns. Note that due to being positive affinity they're not being targeted by the spiderlings.
Stag Knight provides AOE ATK Down and DEF Down for extra survivability and damage as well as Decrease Speed on the big Spider.
Finally Steelskull provides healing, cleanse and DEF increase buff for survivability.

The next page of the guide covers Dragon, Fire Knight and Ice Golem.
data.label: Notes:

title: Late Game+ Vergis solo Scarab Guide

data.desc:
Like with any champion, correct masteries are key for optimal performance. 

In case of Vergis, general dungeon tree was selected (offence and support) with a few tweaks in lower tier masteries ending with Warmaster. 

Dungeon masteries work well for Doom Tower due to similarities between the two. However in this case we have Vergis as a lone rider without support of his team, hence some modifications to his masteries needed to be made to solo Scarab. 

Since he is the solo source of damage, Grim Resolve was selected for T2 mastery due to him often dropping below 50% of his HP. Getting extra 5% damage can be crucial between failed or successful run. 

For T3, Whirlwind of Death and Life Drinker add much needed speed and additional heals when Vergis drops below 50% so he can get over 50% HP quicker for him to trigger continues heal from his passive. 

T4 and T5 are standard picks to reach Warmaster. The reasoning behind Warmaster instead of Helm Smasher is due to the fact that with Warmaster Vergis can be slotted into Dungeons or even Faction Wars and along with providing support be a decent source of damage vs very high HP opponents. 

In Doom Tower Warmaster really only kicks in as a good source of damage once Scarabs shield is broken. As for the support tree, since he doesnt need any accuracy nor provides any heals, skills that augment his stats and allow him to gain turn meter faster were selected with addition of Lasting Gifts as T5 mastery to extend any buffs that he casts on himself or allies.

As you can see, one T5 mastery is missing, it is less relevant but either Kill Streak or Spirit Haste can be selected, both will provide roughly equal bonuses in terms of benefit.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Destroy and immortal gear is needed to enable those runs. 

It is probably the best combination of the sets that are needed for lvl 100 Scarab. Extra heal on each turn will go a long way to help with sustain plus additional stats into the HP pool will help make Vergis tankier and harder to kill. 

Destroy set is a must due to mechanics of the Scarab King, you really want to decrease his overall HP and remove the shield as fast as possible or you might run into the danger of turn limit and not finish the instance.

As for stats, the key is to have a good balance between HP and DEF, here it is advisable to run Vergis as close as possible to ~50k HP and ~4k DEF. However the most important stat is resistance which should be at least 330, preferably 340+.

This will allow you do brush off any debuffs that waves and the Boss himself can throw at your Vergis. Due to strong affinity advantage, there is not need to crit cap your Vergis, however as a general practice it is advisable to have him at 100% or as close as possible. 

In terms of speed, somewhere around 200 speed is more than ok, keep in mind that you will gain additional 18 speed from Whirlwind of Death and if you chose to have Spirit Haste from your support tree and stuck in 4 pieces of food, Vergis further will gain another 24 speed. So starting speed from the artifacts can be as low as ~160. 

Due to the fact that wave one has 3 War Chiefs, if your Vergis hits too hard, his passive wont be able to keep up with return damage + additional damage from the mobs abilities and your run will fail. When it comes to crit damage, after some testing it is advisable to have somewhere from 110-135, assuming that you have roughly 4k defence, otherwise numbers can change. 

Glove: Crit Rate %
Chest: Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Def
Amulet: Def
Banner: Resistance
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
The strategy is very straightforward and works well on auto as long as you have equipped Vergis with the correct stats and fully booked him.

You do need to have high crit rate and damage in order to make sure your runs are under ~40 minute mark when the limit of 1000 turns kicks in, that could prevent your victory result from registering.

You can find this build feature in the video below

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qv8Q0dAn-Qg&feature=youtu.be
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
There are not many champions that can comfortably farm NM campaign and do it in a fast and efficient manner, while bein largely fail-safe.

Ingatius with this build is one of the champions that can farm 12-6 on NM difficulty without a problem.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bT68Q2Ffwsg
data.label: Notes

data.desc:
Ignatius can duo farm Ice Golem 20 with this build. It is preferred to have a champion that can provide enough protection for the waves and the boss. In this case Miscreated Monster is used to make sure it's safe and fast.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QshNjhpEhno
data.label: Notes

data.desc:
It is rarely recommended to so farm minotaur 15 for masteries, but this is a showcase of how well this build can perform the role. The bullies got to be ready for the final showdown!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dc0TpM8JOOU
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
While Gnarlhorn is not as versatile in Spider as Paragon, on Spider 20 he can be useful for the CC and tanking pursposes.

His aoe provoke means that your squishy damage dealers will not be targeted (TM reduction is a must to prevent too many big spider AOE attacks). At level 50, it also means he is likely to have the lowest HP, and is more likely to be the target of the attacks. 

In a freeze set he brings additional CC, effectively locking out some spiderlings for two turns. His unkillable ability lasts two turns, this means even if he does become dangerously low on health, he is unlikely to be killed by the spiderlings or the poisons straight away.

Additional support is essential here however, and MM is a perfect candidate. 

https://youtu.be/MGuqVZ12Isk

Gnarlhorn (lead, def aura, AOE provoke)
Apothecary (healing, increase speed)
Miscreated Monster (shields, ally protect, stun)
Fayne (Decrease attack/defence/weaken/poison/ TM reduction)
Coldheart (Damage dealer, TM reduction)
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Another dungeon where Gnarlhorn can be useful is the Dragon. If you're encountering problems on the waves, the provoke and unkillable combination that Gnarlhorn provides can help you with this and prevent your damage dealers from untimely demise.

This run is aimed at showcasing some semi-budget compositions. 

Gnarlhorn (lead)
Reliquary Tender
Apothecary
Coldheart
Scyl of the Drakes

https://youtu.be/y4yvztYou90
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Finally, Gnarlhorn in Fire Knight and Ice Golem 20 dungeon runs carries the waves before the boss stage with his AOE provoke and Freeze set procs.  

He brings added utility in the IG 20 boss fight as he can provoke the two minions and freeze them.

Fire Knight https://youtu.be/qSCAWlFqqGw

Ice Golem https://youtu.be/ekT7--XPN9w
data.label: Notes:

title: Siphi the Lost Bride Late Game+ guide

data.desc:
Siphi is considered one of the best Legendary champion in Raid at the moment. She has an amazing ability kit that allows her to be useful in every single area of the game with rare exceptions.

In Late Game+ setting she can show her best results and show her full utility in Arena offence and defence.

She offers synergies with many other champions and also supports diverse play styles. She has arguably the strongest A1 in game, with a conditional sleep that can't be resisted, whilst also offering a diverse range of powerful buffs on her A2 and a powerful revive A3. 

Her A2 is particularly important against some meta champions like Tormin due to her Block Debuffs that she casts first, preventing the freeze effect and many other debuffs such as stuns, provocation, etc. Furthermore, the same skill provides the Increase DEF, Increase Speed and a Turn Meter boost.

Her Revive skill on A3 does so with a full Turn Meter and provides the target with some additional buffs.

Finally, her passive heals all allies every turn, has a chance to remove Freeze and Fear from allies and completely cleanses Rotos if he's on the team.

She is definitely worth booking fully. Did we mention she has one of the highest base speed in the game and is faster than Arbiter?

The most important mastery for this build is T6 Timely Intervention (TI) for as many turn meter boosts as possible. You want her to place block debuffs, boost speed, and potentially revive someone if you suffer a setup (either at the start from an enemy Hegemon, or in later turns). Lasting gifts and Merciful Aid are natural pathways to TI that work well with Siphi's buffs and heals. Lore of Steel is needed to improve her speed.

Defence tree wise, Blastproof mastery is useful for arena given the prevalance of aoe nukers, and cycle of revenge (CoR) works really well with TI
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
You want Siphi to be as fast as possible with some survival capability (defence and resistance). 

Typically for Platinum arena, speed should be 350-70  if she is the lead booster (common build) or around 330 is she is the the second booster, with a decent defence stat (4k). 

Prioritise the following substats: 1) speed, 2) defence%, 3) HP%, 4) resist. Speed sets are ideal for this champion, but Swift Parry sets are best-in-slot with good speed sub-stats for extra survival. They can be obtained in Platinum Arena chests or crafted in the Forge.

Weapon/Helm/Shield: with speed, Def%, HP% substat
Glove: HP/Def%, with speed substat 
Chest: HP/Def%/Resist, with speed substat
Boots: Speed, with Def% and HP% substat 
Ring: HP/Def, with HP% and Def% substat
Amulet: HP/Def, with resist substat
Banner: HP/Def%/Resist, with speed substat 

Any cooldown reset accessories are extremely favourable. Ring and amulet items are easier to acquire as they have no speed substats unlike the banner.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Siphi generally has very few weaknesses, with excellent Def and Hp base stats and one of the highest base speeds.

You can see some Platinum Arena Offence battles here as a showcase (with voice over):

https://youtu.be/EHVfNLDn6VQ

Siphi since nerf, she is still an effective first booster because she places debuff immunity on your champions against Tormin. Her Defence up is also useful for defence champions (e.g. Valk or your own Tormin). She really shines if the enemy survive more than two turns, because she can apply sleep without accuracy on her A1 (and it hits hard). She can also revive champions with full TM, so they are good to go. Her revive also gives a useful attack up buff, which is great because often it is the attack champion that dies during arena battles and when it is revived with full TM they can nuke the opposing team.

Defence (top20 plat - early 2021):

https://youtu.be/1kkVvFOZEbA

Siphi on defence pairs well with warlord. To ensure she goes before enemy nukers, we use Tormin and Valkyrie to slow enemy TM and force them to bring either full immunity gear or a Siphi/Duchess in their team. 

Other pairings:
- Siphi also pairs well with Rotos (multiples if you like), so some defences or offences will still use Rotos (in particular to counter hegemon), but it doesn’t have the power it used to.
- Siphi pairs well with Valkyrie, as her Defence up empowers much stronger shields
- Siphi aura is effective for high resist defence teams
- Siphi passive is excellent for high HP champions, and provides a soft counter against freeze and fear teams

Weaknesses:
- Void affinity means she doesn't benefit from weak hits especially from magic affinity nukers, e.g. Trunda
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Venus is one of the best and most versatile legendary champions in the game. Her kit includes AOE Def Down, Weaken, Poisons and HP burn. She is Void affinity and has no weak hits.

Up to late game you would normally use her in Clan Boss with Warmaster and speed tune her accordingly. In Late Game+ setting she can take on a role of a speed runner and can even solo Dragon 20 with food champions. 

In this build the focus is on survivability, accuracy and turn meter increases. The masteries have been selected accordingly with Eagle Eye as the last mastery for extra Accuracy.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gearing for Solo Dragon 20 requires both sufficient Accuracy and Resistance along with 100% Crit Rate and as much Crit Damage as possible. Speed is required to surpass 200 in order to lap the waves. 

Lifesteal is mandatory as Venus has to survive and stay alive.

Glove: Crit Dmg % / Crit Rate %
Chest: Resistance
Boots: Speed
Ring: Defense
Amulet: Crit Dmg %
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Venus is able to survive on Dragon 20 and keep the waves under constant debuffs with this setup. AOE HP burn causes the waves to take constant damage and speeds up the runs. Note that her high Resistance in this build allows her to shrug off the debuffs on all stages.

Dragon itself is weak to multiple poisons stacks as they prevent it from using all it's Dragon breath abilities fully. It's a race against time and Venus is able to provide enough DPS to solo it.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jQ-M8Ls1UDs
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
There are multiple ways to use BEK in the Spider dungeon. One way to use him on Spider 20 is as a negative affinity tank for the spiderlings. The other is to take advantage of his Aura and the passive. 

If your Royal Guards and/or Coldhearts are built specifically for S20 and not used anywhere else, BEK can reduce the critical rate stat requirements with his Aura. A nuke team that speed runs Spiders uses max HP based skills and thus ATK aura’s are not as useful. 

Also, BEK can increase the damage your nukers do significantly with his passive. Last but not least, as he’s most likely fastest he’ll make sure the last 2 spiderlings are spawned and the champion placing defence down will also place it on the last spiderlings. The only downside is that the run may sometimes take 2 seconds longer due to relentless procs with this particular build.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
BEK is decent for Ice Golem 20 despite his weak affinity there. 

If you're using this build he'll be fast and rely on poisons for all his damage dealing. Poisons work very well at IG due to the fact that the heavy counter attack doesn't trigger when the threshold is passed due to poison damage. Note that the A2 does not deal damage and there is no problem with weak hits for this reason.

BEK will also be able to remove the occasional debuffs from your team and keep their health high with his continuous heals. 

In the featured run BEK is used in a speed run team, but that's by far the only team he can be used in. For speed teams he's just there for his passive, increasing the dealt damage when an enemy is under poison debuffs.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Doom Tower is a less ideal place for BEK due to the nerf of the poison burst damage. However, this is the showcase and can be applied to the boss DT waves with the same effect.

Together with Elenaril this can be an auto-battle. Elenaril places HP burn that can't be resisted, reducing the resistance of the boss. After that BEK can place his poisons on the spider and his adds. Once in a while Elenaril uses her poison explosion skill, dealing (capped) 10% max HP damage. 

Aside from that BEK will keep the team alive and remove the debuffs that the spider places.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Warmaiden, is one of the highest value champions in terms of usefulness in the game, helpfulness in progression, and ease of access. She is a farmable champion from campaign and a rare, meaning everyone should have early access to her. 

As a mid game player as you progress in the dungeons you will find that the waves of enemies are getting far more health and defence than you can handle. AOE Decrease Defence on a low cooldown is one of the most important roles to make your runs faster and safer. An added benefit for both PVE and Arena is that champions that scale with Defence stat hit much lower under the Decrease Defence debuff. If you are not lucky to have amazing legendaries that have this skill, Warmaiden has your back!

Her skills are great, and they determine her mastery choices:

•        A3: Attacks all enemies and has 100% chance (when booked) of landing big version 60% [Decrease Defence]. There are only  3 rare champions that can do this, and only 2-3 in the game that are force affinity. So from an affinity and early access perspective, Warmaiden is second to none. Watch out only for Spirit affinity content where her ability may have weak hits and fail.
•        She also self buffs with 50% attack up and has a minor 2.5% poison on A1, that make her excellent for early game spider and early clan boss.

It is worth noting that it is very viable to use her without any or very little masteries (Basic accuracy, crit rate, crit damage) as you are getting her to be your defence down and not main damage source. However, you must book her A3. She can also function decently at levels 40 and 50 if you do not want to max her fully and prefer to spend your resources on the main DPS.

Her masteries can be the following for PvE bosses: Her primary role is to land decrease defence, because that boosts everyone’s subsequent damage. Therefore, you should ensure she has enough accuracy. After that the most utilitarian mastery tree is Warmaster, with support tree up to to master hexer.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
You want Warmaiden to be fast and to go just before the damage/nukers land their hits. 

A combination of speed sets and perception sets is recommended that will allow her to have the right balance of accuracy and speed. If you would like her to be more tanky you can supplement her with a lifesteal set if you would like.

You need approximately x10 accuracy for the dungeon stage, so Dragon 16 would need her to have 160+ accuracy. Beyond that, you should aim to get her to 100% crit rate, then increase attack% and crit damage thereafter.

Weapon/Helm/Shield: with speed, acc, crit% substat
Glove: crit% or crit damage, with speed and acc substat 
Chest: Attack% or Acc, with speed and crit% substat
Boots: Speed, with Acc and crit% substat 
Ring: Attack, with Att% substat
Amulet: CritDmg, with acc substat
Banner: Acc, with speed and Att% substat 

You can acquire perception gear in the forge and get speed sets from Dragon or Campaign. She is not difficult to gear and provides good value in lots of content.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Even past the midgame content Warmaiden can be of use. 

In the 5th Secret Room in Doom Tower there is a rare only requirement. While one of the key strategies there is to have one of the rares in a shield set to survive long enough to deal damage, Warmaiden is important to make the dps as high as possible to complete it.  She is in very average gear and almost no masteries. Most of the other champions are same.
