Video: https://youtu.be/t-nGx3xoNu8

There are three more bonus showcases for her:

1.        [Arena Offence] Here, Warmaiden is using Defence Down before an ungeared and unmasteried Kael is used to finish the enemy team. We provide some security by going first and using warlord to lock enemy skills, but this wasn’t needed. Note that this was filmed after the Monday Platinum reset so the teams are not fully representative of the usual power level. It is done to showcase how she usually operates in that field.

Video: https://youtu.be/dkKFsKi1J4s 

Note:
A.        She is very strong against magic (blue) and force (red) affinity, but she can weak hit causing her to not land defence down against spirit (green) affinity. Therefore, do not use her in spirit majority areas.
B.        She is also effective (in many cases most valuable player) in Faction Wars, Doom Tower secret rooms that demand attack champions, or rare champions only.

2.        [Dragon 20] Warmaiden can be used for AOE Def Down to speed run Dragon dungeon. While this is late game+ exercise most of the time due to the champion and gear requirement, it illustrates how she can perform in that role

https://youtu.be/t-nGx3xoNu8?t=115

3.        [Fire Knight 20] By the same principle, she can be useful for Fire Knight to soften the waves for the DPS champions 

https://youtu.be/t-nGx3xoNu8?t=216
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Big’Un’s ability to Crowd Control (CC) is often overlooked due to his amazing Nuking ability (he is a popular Nightmare Campaign Farmer), however his ability to CC is also incredible. We will be covering those builds on the following pages.

All his abilities are AOE which makes him an amazing candidate for a Stun Set if you choose to do so. He has an AOE 50% chance to Stun on a 3 turn CD and an AOE 50% TM decrease that places the decrease speed debuff. This guide will focus on using him with a dual role of a CC and a sub-DPS champion. Booking all his CC abilities are a must and is very impactful to get the lower cooldown and higher debuff chance. Booking his A1 is not necessary as it doesn’t provide any benefit for this build, but it is nice for more damage. 

Big’Un’s Mastery for Doom Tower will be different than the standard nuke in Arena for example (you would be using Helmsmasher in that case). Some key masteries for this build are the basic accuracy masteries, Arcane Celerity to gain extra Turn Meter (TM) from Debuffs expiring, Evil Eye to decrease TM, and Lore of Steel for more stats. As you can see, this mastery route focuses more on his CC capabilities. Warmaster was selected as an the T6 mastery for the sub-DPS role

If you plan to build him in a Stun Set as an alternative, Defense and Support Trees are recommended. Get Fearsome Presence as the T6 Mastery to increase the stun chance from the stun set as well as his A2. The support tree will be the same.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Hard DT is end-game level content and the stats requirements are much higher than regular content. If you already have him built for other content, you most likely have to re-build him specifically for Hard DT. 

The hard DT waves, especially the higher floors, have high speeds and resistance. The fastest champion in Hard DT is Siphi at 264 speed and the highest resistance champion in Hard DT is Mountain King at 365 Resistance. So, you will need to build your Big’Un with at least 325 Accuracy to land his debuffs. 

If you are using him as your primary/first CC champion, you will need to build him with at least 265 speed. He is used  as a secondary CC in this build, meaning that another faster champion applies CC first, so Big Un requires less speed. He is used as a secondary DPS, so lots of Crit Rate and Attack is a priority AFTER he Accuracy requirement is met. 

Landing the CC is much more important than damage. A combination of Speed, Accuracy, Perception set is recommended to meet the accuracy requirement and Cruel, Crit Damage for damage if you already meet the accuracy requirement and have at least 200+ speed.

Recommendation for the gear main stats are:

Glove: Crit Rate %/ Crit Damage %
Chest: Accuracy (If Accuracy requirement cannot be met) otherwise, Atk %
Boots: Speed
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage %
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Big’Un’s purpose in Hard DT is to control the enemy waves and deal some damage. He decreases a large amount of TM and has a high chance to stun. Big’Un has decent damage multipliers so he is also capable of dealing damage even without being fully geared for damage. 

He is not recommended as your primary Damage dealer. He’s great to deal damage alongside someone else who has a dedicated DPS role. 

For the Hard CC strategy Nethril and Psylar are used as the main CC and Big’Un as a secondary CC. Rotos is the main DPS and Big’Un is a secondary DPS. The followign team is used to clear most of the Hard DT waves (Guides on the other champions will also be available):

Psylar: 1st CC champion. Fastest, goes first so other champion can take a turn.
Nethril: 2nd CC champion
Big’Un: 3rd CC champion. Secondary DPS.
Lydia/Venus: Debuffer
Rotos: Main DPS 

The video below demonstrates a run on one of the toughest stage in Hard DT (112) which has multiple Tormins. 

https://youtu.be/oSSn0fsKRd8

Venus is used here because of Tormin. Tormin will freeze my team if Lydia places her buffs. Lydia is used when there’s no Tormin. 

This role can be replaced with any Decrease Def champion you have. The run has to be done manually and some decision making has to be done throughout the run (I.E Don't waste the stun ability when all the enemies are already stunned. Don't waste the AOE TM decrease when the enemies are already on low TM. Focus on the enemies that are not stunned/have high TM with Evil Eye Procs. Focus DPS on the priority targets.

The next page will cover Big'Un in the dungeons.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In Dragon 20, Gorgorab supports the team by providing TM boosts, ATK up buffs, heals and revives to ensure the team survives both the waves and the boss. The video shows an example of a Dragon 20 team with Scyl as a secondary support CC and revive, Zargala and Stag Knight for DPS, and Frozen Banshee Poison as the main damage source for the Dragon boss.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cj_DDKSZoY8&t=5m59s

In Ice Golem 20, Gorgorab has the same role. The video shows an example of a Ice Golem 20 team with Scyl as a secondary support, CC, and revive, Norog provides protection from AOE damage. Stag Knight has AOE Def Down and ATK Down for further damage reduction and speeding up the runs. Dark Elhain is a damage dealer that can utilise her passive to convert the Freeze debuff into damage on the boss stage.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cj_DDKSZoY8&t=1m41s
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
In Fire Knight 20, Gorgorab as you have guessed plays the same role. He is at a slight disadvantage due to affinity and the team needs to ensure that he is kept alive. TM boosts, ATK up buffs, heals and revives are important both on  the waves and the boss. 

The video shows an example of a Fire Knight 20 team with Scyl as a secondary support CC and revive, Stag Knight for Decrease Defense and Attack, and Coldhearts as the main DPS. The AI changes to Coldheart allowed her to reliably take down the Fire Knight shield as she no longer uses her Heartseeker on the shield anymore and only uses A1 it to take it down. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cj_DDKSZoY8
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Gorgorab is a core champion in the Undead FW as he is one of the only few champions in that faction who can revive. 

Revive ability is very important to have in Faction War to achieve the 3 Star completion. Additionally, the Undead FW 21 Boss is notorious for hitting extremely hard and one-shotting your champion making revive even more important. Unfortunately, the Undead FW 21 has the hardest waves in the double Martyr and triple Valkyrie waves. Although Gorgorab is key, you will still need other good Undead Champions to be able to clear this stage. Consider running Gorgorab on manual on the Valkyrie waves to ensure his buffs and TM boosts don't trigger their passive.
 
This video shows an example of an Undead FW 21 team on full auto. As you can see, the boss easily one-shots most of the champions. It is better manual the stage to use your skills at the appropriate time and save your revive for the last moment during the boss stage to get that 3 star if you have to clear it for the first time.    

https://youtu.be/6qWk2pCUri0
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Another popular dungeon for Coldheart is Dragon 20. If your champions are fast enough and powerful enough to clear out the waves without losses, Coldheart provides great MAX HP damage on the boss, allowing you to bypass the need for damage over time with poisons.

Coupling Coldheart with AOE DEF Down champions and cooldown refresh champions allows you to start speed running Dragon.

https://youtu.be/zTwrbvRwGJM
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Recent changes to AI have made Coldheart best in slot champion for Fire Knight as long as you can keep her alive. She doesn't use Heartseeker on the boss while the shield is up.

Stag Knight and Zargala provide AOE DEF Down and some additional damage in the latter case.

Coldheart and Alure ensure once the FK shield is down the boss doesn't take a turn.

Arbiter is there for additional insurance

https://youtu.be/ZSbFd2ZjMbU 

What is better than one Coldheart? Two Coldhearts! 

In the following slides we'll have a look at how this duo be of use in the same team.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
On Spider 20 two Coldhearts can be used in multiple teams. 

We've covered one variation of the nuke team, so here's an example of a team with AOE HP Burn. While Tyrant can be built in Late Game+ to solo Spider 20, this build is just a showcase of the HP Burn and TM depletion combination for farming.

https://youtu.be/m8RH9QpbYRw

The guide continues on the next page with more Dungeons and Faction Wars.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Psylar is one of the best Crowd Control (CC) champions in Raid, especially for an Epic. All her skills attack all enemies which makes her excellent in Stun set. 

A stun set Psylar will be the focus of this guide as all forms of CC are extremely important to progress through the higher levels of Hard Doom Tower.   

Psylar’s Masteries for Doom Tower will not be different from any other regular content. You still want the Defense and Support trees. Note that the stun set doesn't require accuracy to land the stuns. Weak hits are not a problem for Psylar and this is a further case in favour of using it.

The most important T6 mastery in this build is Fearsome Presence to increase the chance to stun from 18% to 23%. Some key masteries to have on her are the Retribution mastery for a chance to counterattack, which gives her additional chance to Stun the enemies for more CC, the accuracy masteries, Lore of Steel for more stats and Evil Eye to decrease TM.  Below are the important and relevant masteries to have on her. It's not necessary to have full masteries on her to make her work.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Hard Doom Tower is end-game level content and the stats requirements are much higher than regular content. So, if you already have her built, you most likely will have to re-build her specifically for Hard DT. 

The hard DT waves, especially the highest floors have high speeds and resistance. The fastest champion in Hard DT is Siphi at 264 speed and the highest resistance champion in Hard DT is Mountain King at 365 Resistance. So, you will need to build your Psylar with at least 265 speed and 325 Accuracy to go first and land her debuffs in all the waves. Recommended main stats:

Glove: Def %/ HP % / Crit Rate %
Chest: Accuracy (If Accuracy requirement cannot be met) otherwise, HP%/Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Def
Amulet: HP/Def
Banner: Accuracy
 
Advice: Consider taking your fastest pieces of speed gear, usually from your Arbiter or speed booster, and your highest accuracy piece from your other champions so you can meet the speed and accuracy requirement. You can swap it back once you use all your DT keys for the day.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Psylar’s main purpose in Hard DT is to slow down the enemies so that your other champions can take a turn. If the enemy gets to take a turn first, your team will have a bad time. 

For a CC strategy, Psylar cannot function as your only CC champion, two or ideally 3 CC champions are needed to control the waves. this is the team used for hard DT waves:

Psylar: 1st CC champion. Fastest, goes first so other champion can take a turn.
Nethril: 2nd CC champion
Big’Un: 3rd CC champion. Secondary DPS.
Lydia/Venus: Debuffer
Rotos: Main DPS 

The video below demonstrates a run on Hard DT (112) that has multiple Tormins. Venus was used here because of Tormin. Tormin will freeze if Lydia places her buffs.This role can be replaced with any Decrease Def champion you have to ensure that damage dealers can take out the champions in the waves fast enough. 

https://youtu.be/oSSn0fsKRd8

As you can see the run entirely on manual. You have to make some decisions on when to use your champions' skills (I.E, if all the enemies are already stunned, don't waste your stun ability. If they already have low TM, don't waste the AOE Dec Turn TM ability. Focus on the enemy that's not stunned/have high TM with Evil Eye procs).

Keep in mind that the hardest DT waves are the Rotos + Siphi combination that cleanses the stun debuffs due to Siphi's passive, so in those cases you need champions like Seer that can one-shot those problematic champions.

Psylar can be used in those stages to slow down the enemies so the entire team can take a turn to perform their combo since everyones speed is below the enemies, especially on Hard stages 111+.

The video below shows this team in action and you can find the guides for the rest of the compositions

https://youtu.be/M2MrS31kzCU?t=58
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fellhound is considered one of the best Rare champions in Raid. He can be used effeciently in early and mid game content for his reflect buff on Fire Knight, for spider for his Decrease Speed and AOE A1 and nearly all content, except for Clan Boss.

In the late game Fellhound can be one of the fastest 12-3 and 12-6 brutal campaign farming champions due to his fast attack animations (5-6 seconds). However, you should be clear that this a late game build. If he doesn't have sufficient ATK and DEF along with crit rate and crit damage, the AI will consider that Fellhound is not strong enough to one-shot the waves of enemies and will instead use other abilities.

This means that the requirements discussed in the Gear section are extremely stringent. You will need to hit the thresholds, so the general advice is not to attempt this build until you have access to 6 star artifacts and jewelery. If you don't - consider making him more tanky for other content.

Fellhound works best with offense masteries. Deadly Precision, Keen Strike, Heart of Glory, Ruthless Ambush, Killstreak and Flawless Execution are essential for a campaign farming build. Picking Helmsmasher is not advised as you want consistent damage output all the time.

For the second mastery tree Defense was picked mainly for Tough Skin. Support masteries can also be used if you plan on using Fellhound's debuff for non-campaign content, e.g. FK, FW, and/or rare only floors in Doom Tower.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Fellhound should be built with maximum damage for speed campaign farming. 100% C.RATE and high C.DMG are essential. Both DEF and ATK increase the damage of Fellhound's A1 ability. You need more than 2000 ATK+DEF for a total of more than 4000 for the AI to only use A1 attack.

Fellhound only needs enough SPD to move faster than your ungeared food champions (120 should be sufficient). ACC, RESIST, and HP are only relevant if you chose to use Fellhound in non-campaign content. While stats are more important than sets in this context, any set with C.RATE, C.DMG, DEF and/or ATK will be useful. 

Best in slot artifacts would be the ones that ignore defence with Savage and Cruel taking the lead. If those pieces are not available you can build Fellhound with crit sets or simply without any special set.

Gloves - C.DMG/C.RATE
Chest - DEF%/ATK%
Boots - DEF%/ATK%/SPD
Ring - DEF/ATK
Amulet - C.DMG
Banner - DEF/ATK
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Fellhound is best used for speed farming brutal campaign. Brutal 12-3 is optimal for efficiently farming silver and XP. Brutal 12-6 is also a viable option and provides slightly more XP with less silver, but with higher stat requirements. 

Watch your energy melt away fast with this build and good luck with the tournaments and events that will now take less time!

https://youtu.be/LuKmUNOJEMY

If you are levelling champions in industrial quantitites you should also consider using an auto-clicker and count the numbers of runs it takes you to level up 3 and 4 ranked champions for maximum efficiency.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Alure is one of the best champions in the game that can single-handedly control a Boss’ Turn Meter. She is well known for her use in Fire Knight 20. Even though she is weak affinity, she is still very strong there. Her triple hit A1 can help bring down the shields and once the shield is down she can permanently keep the Fire Knight’s Turn Meter down. Furthermore, with the release of Doom Tower, her use has expanded once again. She is one of the top champions to use against the bosses Agreth the Nether Spider and Borgoth the Scarab King to control their TM and take them down before they get a turn.

However, she will not help you with dealing with the waves or killing the boss. You will still need your other champions in the team to do that. She is also very vulnerable to dying so, it is advisable to have a healer and/or reviver in your team because if Alure dies, it is very likely that the run will fail. This guide will showcase Alure in Fire Knight 20, Agreth in Hard DT Stage 90, and Borgoth in Hard DT Stage 100.

Alure is very cheap to build because you do not need to book her at all and masteries are not required. It is actually advisable not to book her since lowering the cooldown on her other skills means she uses her A1 less.

Although you don’t need masteries, building masteries will definitely improve her performance. If you do decide to build her masteries, Offense and Support trees are suggested. The only mandatory mastery on the offence tree is Crit rate to help get her to 100%. On the support tree, you want to get accuracy, Lore of Steel for extra stats and Evil Eye for additional control. She doesn’t need any T5 or T6 mastery to do her job, although Giant Slayer for additional damage can be handy in faction wars or choose to use a lifesteal set on her for extra healing. 

The below mastery is the only impactful mastery for her build so, you can save your energy with minimal farming on Minotaur for her masteries.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important stats you want to build on Alure are Crit Rate, Accuracy and Speed. You need her to be at 100% crit rate because her A1 only lowers Turn Meter if she crits. Note that 115% crit rate does not benefit her.

For Dungeons (FK20/FW), you want to have about 220 accuracy and build as much speed as possible, preferably at least 200+. You need her to be able to go faster than the enemies to lap them and keep their turn meter down. This is important since Alure is negative affinity to the Fire Knight so, she has a 35% chance to weak hit and weak hits will not crit and reduce TM. She needs to be fast enough to be able to go again before the Fire Knight takes a turn if you are unlucky with weak hits.

For Hard Doom Tower, the Highest level of Agreth and Borgoth (Stage 90 and 100) have a resistance of 330 so, you will need to build your Alure with at least that much accuracy. Speed is much more important here and I recommend at least 225+ speed. 

The other stat you want to build on her is HP%. You need her to have as high HP as possible so she can survive. You can use any sets on her if you meet her stat requirements but the best sets to have on her are Speed, Accuracy, or Perception. Lifesteal is also an option if you're lacking in healers or ressurection.

Affinity Breaker set on Alure for DT and FK is not that impactful in preventing weak hits based on testing, so although the featured Alure has it, it is nice but not required.

Glove: Crit Rate
Chest: HP %/Accuracy (For DT, if you cannot reach the required accuracy)
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The video below shows how she is used against Agreth to control TM. She is used in two different teams a “Luxury” budget team (All Legendaries can be obtained for free) and an even more budget F2P friendly team with Arbiter as the only Legendary. 

Since the big spider in DT counterattacks when its turn meter is reduced each team has a healer and reviver as Alure may die during the waves or boss hits. Decrease Attack also helps in that regard. The alternative would be to use lifesteal on Alure with Giant Slayer.

Note how it's easier to control the TM of the boss due to the Decrease Speed debuff from Scyl and Stag Knight. This is an important element for nearly all Alure teams.

Two Coldhearts that hit based on MAX HP and fully deplete the TM are MVPs as usual.

https://youtu.be/Y3zoWLr8qBo

The video below shows how she is used against Borgoth to control TM in a budget F2P friendly team. For this boss, she cannot be your only TM reduction champion as one-too-many weak hits can immediately lose you the fight. Armiger is used here as a secondary TM reduction champion.

Your shielding champion has to be the fastest and has to start the fight. Decrease Speed is important here. At least one of your Coldhearts really needs to be in a Destroy set when she uses her heartseeker at the highest levels of Scarab Boss if you want the fight to be fast. This ensures that you can break the shell of Scarab.

https://youtu.be/Ew4rFOmb8eU

The video demonstrates a FK 20 run where she is the only TM control champion and she single-handedly kept the Fire Knight’s TM down the entire fight. Alure is very vulnerable to dying so it is advisable to have a healer like Aporthecary and a reviver like Gorgorab as shown in the video to support the team. They also provide bonus speed and TM boosts. The faster Alure is, the higher the chance of success on the boss.

https://youtu.be/8vJjDuEg5lM
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Elder Skaarg is a Force Affinity Legendary Barbarian that has risen to be one of the best Spider Killers in the game.

Despite being negative affinity to both Spider 20 and the Nether Spider in the Doom Tower, the unique mechanic of Elder Skaarg’s skill allows him to place HP burn on all enemies without risking weak hits. His A2 ability only attacks one enemy and places HP burn on all enemies if the condition of having at least 3 buffs/debuffs on the enemy is met. This placement of HP Burn on all enemies does not actually hit the enemies, so a weak hit and fails cannot happen. His A3 places irresistible Fear Debuff on all enemies granting additional CC against all the spiderlings. Additionally, Elder Skaarg is very cheap to build as he does not need books or masteries to perform his job.

While it might look like Elder Skaarg can be used for the Frost Spider, it is not actually the case. He is not ideal because the Frost Spider has insanely high resistance of 500+ and the ability to prevent, remove, and transfer debuffs from itself making the requirement of having at least 3 debuffs on it to AOE HP Burn quite difficult. It is not recommended to use him for the Frost Spider. 

As mentioned, Masteries are not important at all on Elder Skaarg so you can save your energy or gems on other things. The only masteries used in this build are the basic Crit Rate, Crit Damage in the Offense Tree and Accuracy Masteries in the Support Tree.

If you are struggling to reach the required Accuracy stats you may want to opt in for Eagle Eye Mastery. Alternatively Warmaster can be useful in PVE setting for addtional damage.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The only two things that matters in this Elder Skaarg build for this role to be filled are Speed and Accuracy. 

As much speed as possible is recommended, ideally around 220+ and enough Accuracy for the content you are using him in, 220+ for Dungeons 20 and 330+ for Hard Doom Tower. 

Sets are not very important if you can meet the stats. Using Speed, Accuracy, or Perception sets are ideal to help achieve the stats requirement.

Glove: HP %/Def %
Chest: HP %/Def %/Accuracy
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Defense
Amulet: HP/Defense
Banner: Accuracy

Refresh jewelery is good for Elder Skaarg as it allows the HP Burn to be cycled more often
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
For Spider 20 Dungeon, Elder Skaarg can singlehandedly kill the Spider by placing HP Burn on all the Spiderlings. 

You need to build a team that can control the Spider’s Turnmeter and keep your team alive while the spiderlings take turns and burn down the main Spider. 

The team needs to have to be able to place at least 3 debuffs on the Spider before Elder Skaarg uses his A2 to meet his AOE HP Burn condition. Additionally, Elder Skaarg places Fear on all the spiderlings and this provides the team more control over the spiderlings.

Watch out for your team killing the spiderlings too fast and them not staying alive long enough for the burn to expire.

https://youtu.be/Qq7uMmJOWDk

With the change to the Nether Spider’s boss mechanic where TM reduction strategies are no longer viable, AOE HP Burn strategies are now one of the best strategies to deal with this Boss and Elder Skaarg is one of the few that can do this job well on Auto. 

Other well known AOE HP Burn champions like Ignatius, Tyrant, or Venus are not the best for this boss because they do not use their HP Burn on auto as the Spiderlings have counterattack. Even if you manually use the AOE HP Burn and trigger the spiderlings counterattack, they will heal the Boss rendering the HP Burn damage useless.

Elder Skaarg is unique in that he only attacks a single enemy to place his AOE HP Burn. He does not hit the spiderlings and trigger their counterattack. The team showcased in the video is built to enable the Elder Skaarg HP Burn Strategy where 2 debuff cleansers are used, Mausoleum Mage and Hakkorn Smashlord, a healer/reviver in Scyl of the Drakes, and Fayne to place enough debuffs to enable Elder Skaarg to meet his AOE HP Burn condition

https://youtu.be/rsGz-KwFH7w
data.label: Notes:

title: Zavia Late Game+ Guide Dungeon runs

data.desc:
Zavia is a Force affinity Legendary champion that is well known for specific dungeon speed run teams due to her ability to detonate poisons and nuke waves and bosses in seconds. 

Even without the specific champions needed for speed runs, she is still perfectly usable in normal teams as a damage dealer. She has 2 AOE abilities that can clear waves. She can place her own poisons and detonate them for burst damage against the boss. Zavia is also a great Arena Nuker with her 2 AOEs, and a DPS option for the Doom Tower Magma Dragon. This guide will feature Zavia in Dungeon speed run teams as well as regular dungeon teams, Arena, FW, and the Magma Dragon. Clan Boss build can be found on the previous page.

Masteries on Zavia vary depending on where you use her and she is quite flexible.

This Zavia in this build is mainly used for dungeon content so, the Offense and Support trees are chosen. For the Offence tree,  the T6 Giant Slayer is the pick because she has lots of multi-hit abilities. Standard Crit Rate, Crit Damage and damage dealing masteries are picked as well. In the Support tree the Accuracy masteries, Lore of Steel for Stats, Evil Eye to decrease TM, Sniper for added chance to place Poison are chosen along with Master Hexer to extend the Poison debuffs.
 
Arcane Celerity is great for dungeon content as she places lots of debuffs and can gain a lot of TM when they expire. However, if you plan to permanently use Zavia in CB, Arcane Celerity is to be avoided as it can mess with your Clan Boss speed tune (Unkillable and Counterattack comps). In fact, it is suggested to avoid the support tree entirely and pick the Defense secondary tree instead for NM and UNM cb. Zavia has very low base defense and the damage mitigation provided in the Defense tree helps her survive longer in the Clan Boss.

If you plan to permanently use Zavia in the Arena, Helmsmasher is advised instead for Giant Slayer for T6 as it provides the best first hit DPS. Block revive on her nuke pairs well with this mastery.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The gear and stats on Zavia will highly depend on how and where you want to use her. For a regular dungeon team, you want to build her with 100% Crit Rate, around 220-250 Accuracy and as much Attack, Crit Damage as possible with enough speed.

She needs to take a turn after you AOE Defense Down champion, ideally tuned to about 200, or after the champion that places poisons and before your reset champion for combo speed run teams. Gear sets are not important at all for dungeon team. Any combination of sets can work as long as you have the stats.

For Arena, a combination of Savage and Cruel is ideal. 100% Crit Rate, as high Attack and Crit Damage as possible with enough speed to match your arena team. She should be tuned to go after your Def Down champion. Accuracy is not important since Poison is not a big factor in Arena and Block Revive does not require accuracy.

For Doom Tower, follow the same build for dungeon but a minimum accuracy of 330 required Hard DT Bosses.

Glove: Crit Rate / Crit Damage 
Chest: ATK % 
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Attack
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Accuracy

The build shown in the screenshot is primarily used for Dungeon and Doom Tower content. Her accuracy did not meet the 330 requirement because the team used for DT has an accuracy aura to make up for it.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
For Dragon, you can use Zavia in a Speed run type of team or a regular team. 

For a speed run teams, the core champions typically used are Zavia, Taurus and a skill reset champion (Renegade or Prince Kymar). The other 2 champions are flexible. You can use TM booster, more damage dealers like Royal Guard or Coldheart, or even another poisoner like Taurus, Kael or Frozen Banshee for the boss. Decrease Defense is not necessary as Poison Explosion is not affected by Defense but can help damage dealers like Royal Guard or Coldheart if you have them in your team.

https://youtu.be/h9MdS-YZNRw

In a regular Dragon 20 team, Zavia will function as your main Damage dealer. You then build your team with support/healers like Gorgobrab, Apothecarry, and Scyl and an AOE Decrease Defense champion like Zargala, or Tayrel. 

The team showcased in the video is an example of a standard team with Zavia, Scyl, Gorgorab, Zargala and Apothecary that is slower but reliable and easy to build and replicate.

https://youtu.be/ZMUhfMZxhMo

The next page will showcase the rest of the dungeons and Faction Wars
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Zavia is a versatile legendary that can work in many Raid instances. This guide will focus on her role in a Clan Boss team, while the following guides will feature her in other content with a somewhat different build and equipment.

She is worth booking if you're using her extensively as it adds a considerable amount of dps.

Zavia’s AI has recently been changed to make her one of the best Poisoner DPS champion for Clan Boss. 

All her abilities can place multiple 5% poisons and are multi-hitters. Paired with a champion that can place an AOE Counterattack buff, she can singlehandedly keep the CB debuff full of poison and deal tons of damage through the Giant Slayer mastery. 

The only drawback to Zavia is her low Base Defense. In order to use her effectively in Clan Boss, you must focus her build entirely on defense. Completely ignore Attack, Crit Rate, and Crit Damage unless you can afford to. An exception from this can be made if you run her in an Unkillable team. Then you can build her for damage, including Ignore Defence sets. 

In terms of masteries the best T6 mastery for her is the Giant Slayer. It synergizes well with Lifesteal keeping her at full health throughout most of the fight. It is important not to pick any turn meter boosting masteries in order not to mess up the turn order if you're running her in such a team.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gear sets will become much more important if you plan to use her specifically for Clan Boss or Arena. For Clan Boss, Lifesteal set is a must for non-unkillable teams. You must prioritize building her with Defense rather than Attack. Since she has a low base Defense, it can be quite difficult to build her with high defense. You ideally want to hit around 3000 Defense for UNM, 2500 for NM, around 220-250 accuracy and with enough speed to match your CB speed tune. 

Glove: Def % 
Chest:  Def %  
Boots: Speed / Def % 
Ring:  Defense 
Amulet: Defense / Crit Damage  
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The video below shows an example of a Standard Clan Boss team with Counterattack and Zavia as the main DPS Poisoner. The CB was Magic affinity and the run unfortunately ended early due to the Decrease Accuracy debuff and ATK Down not being placed that has lead to the team wipe.

However, it was still able to achieve the 2 Key UNM damage threshold. This team will be able to perform better on Force or Void. 

Ultra-Nightmare: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9gve5-2jusM

This team works on UNM, NM and on all affinities except Spirit due to the Slow Debuff that the CB places. The 4 Force champions in this team are weak to Spirit. The video below shows this team performance on NM. 

Nightmare: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XCNhM3CBHBs

The champions used and their speeds are as follow:

Sepulcher Sentinel 227 – Atk Down debuff, Block Debuffs block Stun
Tyrant Ixlimor 172 – Secondary Ally Protection, Increase Defense
Rhazin 174 – Def Down, Weaken
Zavia 172 – Poison DPS
Skullcrusher 171 – Counterattack, Ally Protection

This Slow-tuned composition is versatile and Zavia works well there as the DPS. However, if your clan boss team is already able to achieve good results without her, Zavia can be used in other content as seen on the following pages
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Var-Gall works well on Dragon 20. The shield he provides for the team allows it to survive on the waves. Note that AOE Atk Down helps on both the waves and the boss as well. Skull Lord places aggro on Tayrel during the second wave on auto, preventing him from applying AOE DEF down on your team.

Kael is the wave nuker and poisoner.
Rhazing provides DEF Down and weaken on a single target as well as TM depletion on waves.
Warmaiden is the AOE DEF Down machine for faster waves clears
Gorgorab ensures that no champion is dead while providing TM boosts.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r0mCXbWJME4&ab_channel=DragonPaws
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
By the same token Var-Gall provides survivability on Fire Knight.

Tayrel provides AOE Def Down and some TM reduction. Note that he is negative affinity of FK 20 and not the most optimal pick if you have alternatives.

Rhazin is a 3 hit A1 champion that can help with bringing the boss shield down as well as TM depletion.

Gorgorab provides TM boosts, healing and revives in case of emergency.

Coldheart is the MVP of any late game FK team with 4 hit A1, MAX HP nuke and full TM depletion.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pSpTYeM0LDI&ab_channel=DragonPaws
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Finally, Var-Gall excels in Faction wars. In a faction that doesn't have too many healers he can be excellent on all the waves in the crypt. His ATK Down would also make him an excellent champion on the bosses. However, his passive is what makes him the easy way to 3 star Crypt 21.

Bringing a Skullsworn for Var-Gall to revive makes the boss forget his AOE Attacks and focus on the small target. Repeatedly reving the target makes it a viable strategy to complete this faction.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ajNbLXvzr7Q&ab_channel=DragonPaws
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Shamrock is an underrated champion that has been vastly improved with his buffs. He excels as a support champion with his a2, and a decrease speed / turn manipulator on his a3. 

The essential masteries are lasting gifts and rapid response. This allows for more Turn Meter (TM) boosts as a large number of buffs is placed with his A2 both above and below 50% health. 

An extra turn of Increase speed/Def up/Heal/Revive on death is invaluable. Increase of TM when these buffs expire means he cycles back to these abilities even faster. Note that rapid response means he is't well suited to scarab where he can outrun shield placement. 

The final mastery Eagle Eye is essential for making him land his a3, which is amazing particularly in the later floors (50 and above) for hard doom tower. His a3 does not attack enemies. This means that a3 can't make a weak hit and works against any affinity and doesn't break the sleep debuff.

Shamrock Accuracy Aura is also relevant in content such as Doom Tower and Faction wars as it allows you to lower the requirements for you Accuracy in the team.

Booking Shamrock skills is debatable and depends on how much your current teams need him. He works without the books, however booking his abilities to cooldown makes him stronger.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Shamrock has excellent base stats, meaning he can be built fast, tanky and with high accuracy. In Hard Doom tower specifically, it is vital that he is fast enough to be able to land his a3 before the enemies take a turn. This can be achieved through equipment, or via a speed booster such as arbiter or apothecary. Accuracy or perception sets from the forge may be needed if you can't reach the accuracy requirements from other gear. 

Anything over 260 speed is required in the later stages of hard doom tower and high levels of accuracy (400+ is ideal, including his aura)

Gloves - DEF%/HP%
Chest - DEF%/HP%
Boots - DEF%/ATK%/SPD
Ring - DEF/HP
Amulet - DEF/HP
Banner - ACC

Note that the jewelery from the Bazaar with cooldown reduction works well if you have it. 

His acc aura means you can run him in the lead and get an extra 70 accuracy, which may be critical for ensuring debuffs do not get resisted, particularly on the later floors of doom tower. 

He is NOT a damage dealer, so there is no need to build him with atk/CR/CD. Resistance is also a option, however his main function is to allow your team to get a full turn in before the enemies go, allowing you to land important debuffs. You will need other appropriate Debuff champions along side him - on his own he cannot carry a team with damage.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Hard Doom Tower at the highest levels can be problematic and Shamrock can bring you some luck and help even on floor 119!

Floor 199 is all about the second wave: Siphi, Rotos x2 and 2 mountain kings. While Siphi is alive, any debuffs on Rotos will reset on his go, and the mountain kings have very high resistance (365). 

Shamrock: Support, debuffer (decrease speed, decrease turn meter), acc aura. 
Lydia: Support (strengthen, increase speed), debuffer (dec def/weaken/block debuffs/block skill cooldowns / poision sensitivity)
Warlord: Support. Buffs (block debuffs, healer, shield), debuffer (reduce turn meter, debuff extender, reset enemy skill cooldowns) 
Blind Seer: Support. Buffs (block debuffs, shield, revive). Debuffs (reduce turn meter)
Nethril: Damage/Support. Debuffs (poison, decrease speed/stun/reduce turn meter). 

Note, because of the number of buffs he places, can work well in Seer based compositions.

https://youtu.be/AcyHS4fh2pI     

Decrease speed and tm reduction can really help to stall the TM of the enemy team. This supplements Nethril nicely because if the stun lands, it will not proc Decrease Speed. In this set up, you can get the best of both worlds, a stun and decrease speed debuffs before the 2 mountain kings take a turn.  As Lydia provides increase speed and strengthen buffs on her second ability, Shamrock does the same on his A2, except it is Increase Defence. 

Between these heroes, you should have a near permanent Defence and Damage reduction buffs, making it easier to tank the damage from Rotos and the mountain kings. Also, due to the combination of increase speed on your heroes and reduce speed on the enemy team, these buffs/debuffs should be near permanent. Obviously once Rotos takes a turn these debuffs instantly get negated until Siphi dies due to her passive, which is why she is the immediate priority to target in Doom Tower.

The following pages of the guide feature Shamrock in other areas of the game, including Faction Wars and Dungeons.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
One of the areas that is problematic for Late Game players is the Spider dungeon. Scyl can offer help in multiple ways there. She provides stun to control the spiderlings, Decrease Speed on the big spider that helps keep it's TM down, healing for the team.

In this video a Late Game+ Composition is featured with Scyl as the only legendary. The main engine are the two Coldhearts that are the MAX HP Nukers and full tm depleters. Stag Knight provides AOE Def Down, Atk Down and Decrease Speed. Psylar and Scyl ensure the Spiderlings don't take too many turns and are stunned.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=293
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Another Dungeon that is relevant from mid-game to end-game is Dragon 20. Scyl provides AOE stuns and healing. Gorgorab TM boosts, ATK up buffs and resurrection ensure the team survives both the waves and the boss. 

Stag Knight provides AOE Def Down and ATK down. However, he is negative affinity for Dragon 20 and is not so reliable due to affinity disadvantage, so another champion takes the fore - Zargala. 

Frozen Banshee main goal is to make sure the Dragon is constantly poisoned as this is one of the mains sources of damage at the boss stage.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=359
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Despite the negative affinity for Fire Knight 20, Scyl can still be useful thanks to her healing and CC kit as discussed previously. Her high base stats in this build allow her to tank both the waves and the boss if needed.

AI changes have allowed Coldhearts to fully unleash their potential in this dungeon as the don't use heartseeker once the shield is up anymore.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8

The next page shows how Scyl fares in Ice Golem, Arena and Faction Wars.
data.label: Notes:

title: Scyl Late Game+ Dungeon Runs and Arena

data.desc:
Scyl of the Drakes can pull her weight in Ice Golem 20. This dungeon is well known for the waves and the boss being able to hit extremely hard, so Scyl provides the team with healing and backup resurrection along with wave control and debuffs.

In this composition Norog provides protection from AOE damage. Stag Knight has AOE Def Down and ATK Down for further damage reduction and speeding up the runs. Dark Elhain is a damage dealer that can utilise her passive to convert the Freeze debuff into damage on the boss stage. Gorgorab provides TM boosting and resurrection if things go South.

https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=100
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
One of the areas where Scyl can also be a surprisingly good champion is the Arena. The featured build is mostly intended for dungeons, however it can still pack a punch in the current Gold IV.

For Platinum builds Scyl would normally be built differently with high resistance and speed to make sure she is hard to defeat fast on the Defence team. 

In this video she is shown on an attack. The team is not fully optimised for Arena, however the basics are the same. Gorgorab TM boost, Stag Knight AOE Def Down, Scyl uses the AOE stun and Zargala finishes the job.


https://youtu.be/Cj_DDKSZoY8?t=477
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Scyl makes Faction Wars for Barbarians quite easy. With High Khatun granted from the daily login and Warmaiden who is a farmable rare, it's not difficult to build a team that will be able to pass the 21st Crypt.

Below is an example that is not the most extreme budget, however it showcases just how much easier it is with Scyl.

https://youtu.be/fgtfgVAdtnw

The next slide will feature Scyl in Doom Tower
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon 20 has a new dimension with two Coldhearts on your team. 

Having access to multiple heartseekers and A2 wave clearing capabilities helps them speed run this dungeon. If your stats are high enough it is possible to do so even without a reviving champion like Arbiter or Gorgorab. 

The team featured below consists of the following:

Royal guard for aura, MAX HP nuke on the waves and the boss
Coldhearts for their MAX HP Nuke on the boss and wave clearing
Zargala for AOE DEF Down and cleaning up mobs
Renegade for resetting the cooldowns of abilities

https://youtu.be/206P_MdqTxQ

It is also possible to use two Coldhearts in a Dragon Tournament that restricts the factions to Dark Elves for fast and safe runs.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Two Coldhearts (at least) is a meta team for speed running Fire Knight even when you don't have Late Game+ gear. Coupled with enough speed and a Decrease Speed debuff on the boss they can prevent him from taking a turn at all.

In this team Zargala is used for her aura, AOE DEF Down and damage on the waves
Coldhearts provide full TM depletion on the boss and MAX HP damage
Stag Knight doubles up with AOE DEF Down (just one such champion is enough) and Decrease Speed on the boss
Arbiter is here to ensure the stability of the runs and additional TM boosting

https://youtu.be/ZSbFd2ZjMbU
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Mutliple Coldhearts in Late Game Gear can work well in Faction War Crypts including the most difficult ones. In the video below you can see the team tackling FW 21 before the nerfs, so you'll have an easier time then in the video.

There are two problems with the FW 21. The first one is the wave with Valkyries. You need to control their TM and prevent them from using their abilities as this team has no dedicated revivers. The second problem is the boss that also can't take many turns or this will prevent you from obtaining full 3 stars.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q0oUBxlFKyo

Note how Evil Eye mastery becomes important here to ensure control. Even though the masteries on the Coldhearts are different in the video the play style is exactly the same.
data.label: Notes:

title: Zavia Late Game+ Guide Dungeon runs 3

data.desc:
Doom Tower

Zavia can be used as a DPS champion against Hard Doom Tower Magma Dragon Boss. 

The video below shows how Zavia is used as the primary DPS against Hard Doom Tower Stage 110 Magma Dragon. Her main role is to grind the boss down using poisons and poison explosions. She also synergizes with Kantra in this team by consistently placing poison debuffs so that Kantra’s Passive can constantly provoke the Magma Dragon.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=StEqK3qPu44

Unfortunately Zavia Poison Bursts don't provide sufficient DPS for the highest floors of Doom Tower on Hard. Seer would be better for this purpose if you have her.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Faction War

Zavia can also be used in Faction War as a damage dealer. Unfortunately, the Dark Elves FW 21 is one of the toughest Faction War stages as it has Double Martyr on wave 1 and Triple Valkyrie on wave 2. 

Since Zavia is Force affinity, she can have difficulty with dealing with the Martyrs and Valkyries. Bringing other damage dealers like Coldhearts will help with this. It is also much easier to manual the run as using skills in the right order will help a lot with this stage.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZMUhfMZxhMo&t=4m23s
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Zavia is actually a very good nuker for Arena. You can use the following masteries if you want her tailored specifically for this purpose with Helmsmasher as T6: https://raidbro.com/masteries?v=v1&m=13m1w0o2sg00000

She's not often used in Arena because of how good she is in PVE content. However, she has 2 AOE abilities that has good damage multipliers. Her A3 prevent enemies killed by it from being revived which incredibly useful because a lot of the Meta arena champions have revives, like Siphi, Duchess, Arbiter or Gorgorab in lower level Arena. 

Her A2 is a double hit which is great against Rotos who has a passive that prevents him from taking more than 50% of his HP in damage per hit. The video showcases a standard Arena team with Arbiter for TM Boost and Increase Attack, Golden Reaper for a second TM Boost, Madame Serris to remove buffs and place Decrease Defense, and Zavia to nuke in Gold 4 Arena. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jpj9KWx453U
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Nethril is an amazing AOE Crowd Control (CC) champion. He has two incredible AOE CC skills, one that decreases Turn Meter by 75% and another that either stuns or places decrease speed debuff. 

This guide will focus on his role as a Hard CC champion on the Hard DT Waves. Although his 3-hit A1 and the ability to place poison is amazing for Clan Boss and Bosses, it does not have much value against the DT waves. Booking all his Crowd Control abilities are a must to get the lower cooldown and higher chance of procs. Booking his A1 is not necessary for this role but is valuable if you use him everywhere else, especially in Clanboss, dungeons and Faction Wars. 

Nethril’s Masteries include Giant Slayer for T6 for maximum efficiency and DPS on cb. You will want to use the Offense and Support tree. Some key masteries for him are the basic the accuracy masteries, Evil Eye to decrease TM, and Lore of Steel for more stats. 

However, this build uses Arcane Celerity to gain TM from Debuffs expiring. If you use him in a speedtuned CB team, do not take this mastery as it break your CB speed tune.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Hard DT is end-game level content and the stats requirements are higher than the regular dungeons. 

The hard DT waves, especially the higher floors, have high speeds and resistance. The fastest champion in Hard DT is Siphi at 264 speed and the highest resistance champion in Hard DT is Mountain King at 365 Resistance. Nethril needs at least 325 Accuracy to land his debuffs. If you are using him as your primary/first CC champion, you will need to build him with at least 265 speed, which is not recommended. Nethril has a very low base speed which makes it a little difficult to build him with that much speed. Use another champion to CC first like a Psylar and Nethril to follow up with his CC ability. 

A combination of Speed, Accuracy, Perception set to meet the accuracy requirement and have at least 220+ speed is recommended. There are other optional improvements for sets you can make if you can reach the recommended stats such as Reflex Set and Relentless sets if you have them as well as jewelery with refresh abilities from the Bazaar.

Recommended main stats:
Glove: Def %/ HP %
Chest: Accuracy (If Accuracy requirement cannot be met) otherwise, HP%/Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Def
Amulet: HP/Def
Banner: Accuracy
 
Advice: Consider taking your fastest piece of speed gear, usually from your Arbiter or speed booster, and your highest accuracy piece from your other champions so you can meet the speed and accuracy requirement. You can swap it back once you use all your DT keys for the day.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Nethril’s main purpose in Hard DT is to control the enemy waves. If the enemy gets to take a turn, your team will have a bad time. He can land a large amount of TM decreases and has a very high chance to stun. You can then focus your DPS on the target that is not stunned or is the priority target.

For the Hard CC strategy Nethril is paired with Psylar and Big’Un. Nethril cannot function as your only CC champion, your team needs to have at least 2, ideally 3 CC champions to continuously lock down the enemy waves in this strategy. The following team is used to clear most of the Hard DT waves (Guides on the other champions will also be available):

Psylar: 1st CC champion. Fastest, goes first so other champion can take a turn.
Nethril: 2nd CC champion
Big’Un: 3rd CC champion. Secondary DPS.
Lydia/Venus: Debuffer
Rotos: Main DPS 

The video below demonstrates a run on one of the toughest stage in Hard DT (112) which has multiple Tormins. This team only suffers in DT when facing against Siphi with a passive that cleanses the stuns and debuffs from Rotos (they're also negative affinity for Nethril)

https://youtu.be/oSSn0fsKRd8 

Venus here was used because of Tormin. Tormin will freeze the team if Lydia places her buffs. Lydia is used when there’s no Tormin. This role can be replaced with any Decrease Def champion you have. 

The run has to be done manually and some decision making has to be done throughout the run (I.E Don't waste the stun ability when all the enemies are already stunned. Don't waste the AOE TM decrease when the enemies are already on low TM. Focus on the enemies that are not stunned/have high TM with Evil Eye Procs. Focus DPS on the priority targets).
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Nethril can be useful in the Spider dungeon on multiple stages. His CC of the spiderlings combined with either MAX HP nukes or AOE HP burn makes him a good supporting candidate for all affinities except for Magic.

In this video you can see how Nethril uses his kit to keep the Spiderlings and the big spider under debuffs and with reduced TM. Coldheart provides the nuking and full tm depletion capabilities. Madame Serris ensures Def Down is placed and the team can survive longer due to the ATK Down debuff. Apothecary and Mausoleum Mage ensure the team doesn't crumble and can tank long enough to bring spider down.

https://youtu.be/q4UuAJ6_3_o
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Nethril's kit on the waves has already been discussed at length. Fire Knight 20 is where Nethril is good on waves not least because of favourable affinity. On the boss a 3-hit A1 has an added benefit of bringing the shield down faster and the Decrease Speed and TM reduction are always welcome when the shield is down.

Make sure you have a supporting cast for the squishy Nethril, because he needs to survive to be of use!

https://youtu.be/f2xFlH0-9LQ
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The final area of use featured in this Guide is the Arena. Right now Gold 4 is not that difficult to reach if you've got the correct gear farmed and a decent team composition.

The usual fight on the Arena starts with a TM boost, AOE Def down and Nuke. With Nethril you have a few more options including going second after the TM boost to lower the TM of the enemies. This allows you to build your damage dealers with slightly less speed and more dps.

Another option for Nethril are the stuns he can provide in more grindy battles.

https://youtu.be/-as6pstdvDw?t=18
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Gnarlhorn is a widely useful rare. He is a part of the Rhazin fusion, but can also be used in a variety of ways including Clan boss (as a stun target in Unkillable comps), Faction Wars and dungeons.

His A2 places AOE provoke for one turn, while the A3 places unkillable on Gnarlhorn for two turns. A3 has a three turn cooldown, so he is only vulnerable for one turn (note that Paragon cooldown is two turns). His A2 does not hit, so there is no danger of weak hits on negative magic affinity. Booking his A2 and A3 is important.

With healers and the correct speed he is unlikely to ever die. With the right supporting champions he can easily be the focus of incoming damage to stop your weaker damage dealers from dying. 

In terms of masteries Gnarlhorn can easily make do with only the basic Accuracy masteries (the showcase uses only them). 

The full masteries are provided only as an illustration if you were to full level and 6 star him. He would not benefit from TM increases from arcane celerity for example, as this will reduce the amount of time his unkillable buff is up. Bulwark would be a suitable T6 mastery as this will reduce the damage taken by other members of the team, but is not required. Eagle Eye would also be a good option if you are struggling with ACC.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
High Accuracy, Defence and low HP work best for Gnarlhorn as you want the mobs to target him. High defence and low HP mean he can be the target of enemy attacks even if his provoke fails to land, and be tanky enough to survive on the turn when his unkillable is down.

It is possible to use any set as long as you achieve the necessary parameters, however in this build the Frost set is used. It works when the champion is hit. Frostbite set is also a good choice.

It is recommended to 5 star ascend Gnarlhorn so the additional benefit from the ring and amulet can be realised. His accuracy needs to be over 200 for the highest dungeon levels to land his AOE provoke reliably. 


Chest: Def%
Gloves: Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP
Banner (ACC/Def)

Substats: acc/speed/def%/hp%
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
We'll start the showcase with Faction wars and the following pages will look at all other dungeons. 

In Faction wars up to crypt 21 having one or two Gnarlhorns and completing the stages manually allows to easily get the 3 stars required to fully complete FW. Bringing a healer like Steelskull is recommended. Constantly provoking the waves of enemies allows your damage dealers free reign without fear of getting targeted. In FW boss fights, Gnarlhorn is not ideal because he cannot apply to CC the bosses, and due to being a weak build by design, will die prematurely preventing you from getting full rewards. Nonetheless, he is an MVP support for all other stages.

The video will showcase the FW 18 run. 

https://youtu.be/4zEmVJDhFtY

However, it is possible to apply this strategy up to stage 20 as well. Note how safe the run is on auto.

https://youtu.be/uhPRqUNVBPk
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Rotos can be a serious firepower in most RSL content. In clan boss his passive allows him to stay alive for an extremely long time.

In this build he is the the main damage source. With his single hit skills, Warmaster is a necessity. To trigger as many additional attacks as possible Resurgent, Deterrence and Retribution are helpful masteries. The attack tree is standard for damage dealers on clan boss
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Rotos is equipped with a lifesteal set and a speed set. As the main damage source, 100% crit, high ATK and CritDmg are vital. 

Higher Accuracy would be desirable (currently 200) to ensure DefDown, but for that purpose Rhazin is sufficient, so here it is not a priority. As Rotos gains 60k HP with his A2 due to his passive, HP and Def stats in his equipment are of less relevance. He is usually the last of the team to die. 

Glove - crit dmg %
Chest - atk %
Boots - speed
Ring - def
Amulet - crit dmg
Banner - acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Rotos is the secret sauce for this composition. In a speed team without unkillable or poisons his ability to take extra turns, survivability and damage makes it possible to truly shine and make the 2 key UNM possible and stable.

Without Rotos, this composition can 3 key UNM, but 2 key will be quite challenging

You can find a video of the run on Void CB in this video: https://youtu.be/Ikrqv3l9A1w
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Drexthar can be used against Dragon dungeon waves efficiently. His provoke ability allows Drexthar to take the heat off the squishy champions during the runs. In this showcase he is paired with rares to showcase his usefullness.

Drexthar in the lead for aura, provoke on the waves. Note that his damage could have been much higher with Giant Slayer.
Warmaiden places DEF down on the mobs to speed up the runs. Being negative affinity hurts her on Dragon 15.
Apothecary provides TM boost and speed buff as well as emergency healing
Reliquary Tender removes the debuffs and revives if things go South
Frozen Banshee has just one goal - to place the poisons on Dragon to efficiently deal massive damage over time

https://youtu.be/NrgGREsWFMk
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Fire Knight is another dungeon where Drexthar feels at home. His A1 hits thrice, making him good at bringing the shield down. Some wave control is also welcome.

Warmaiden is in the composition for DEF Down that makes the enemies easier to defeat
Reliquary Tender provides debuff removal and revive
Apothecary has a 3 hit A1 and provide TM boosts and speed
Coldheart is the MVP with 4 hit A1, full TM depletion and Heal Reduction debuff

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tVAYt5wa50I
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
The final featured dungeon 15 for midgame is Ice Golem. IG is one of the less frequently farmed ones. The main key is to have as many poisons and HP burns on the enemies, because the boss doesn't counterattack if the thresholds of his HP are passed with that kind of damage.

Drexthar provides waves control and AOE HP burn
Frozen Banshee provides poison damage on the boss
Reliquary Tender removes the debuffs and resurrects
Stag Knight provides AOE DEF Down, Atk Down and Decrease speed
Athel here provides some AOE Damage, but can be easily replaced.

https://youtu.be/y5I7hzGS_08
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Spider is another dungeon where Venus can shine. There are two ways to build a team around Venus. The first one utilises her AOE HP burn ability and combines Turn Meter reduction strategies along with Crowd Control or Tankiness. This is usually the way to go about it until Late Game+.

The second focuses on her AOE Decrease Def and Weaken. This strategy allows for the faster clears compared to HP burn strategies and works best when you need to farm silver of win tournaments.

https://youtu.be/rnawwaM15yY

In this video Lyssandra control the TM, Venus applies the debuffs that Royal Guard need. Both Royal Guards use their Takedown that clears all the spiderlings and deals massive damage to the Spider. Renegade refreshes the abilities and a third (or fourth) Takedown seals the deal.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
By the same token Venus can be used on Fire Knight. Decrease Def and Weaken allow the waves to be mowed down by Coldhearts and renegade refreshes their abilities for faster runs. Note that those runs are not optimised to the fullest and serve as a simple showcase.

https://youtu.be/DbuIWGO_GiY
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
Venus feel at home on Ice Golem. In addition to her AOE debuffs her poisons help on the boss, as it doesn't retaliate with Frigid Vengeance if the threshold is crossed from Poison Damage. Normally a slower team would utilise this to slowly grind the boss down.

In Late Game+ however, the goal is simply to farm as fast as possible, so Unkillable champions are used in this run to prevent it from failing.

https://youtu.be/9F7NzIdpwoc
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Bad El Kazar (BEK) is one of the best legendaries in the game. He is useful throughout the account progression in many areas. This build is focused on Late Game+ approach with the main goal of fast or efficient dungeon speed runs.

The base attack stat and A1 multiplier for BEK are very low and therefore it's not advised to maximise the damage from his A1 skill. However, his A2 will deliver 2 poison stacks for 2 turns on a 3-turn cooldown (when booked) as well as 2 continuous heal buffs. As both parts of this skill are the main engine of BEK, it's strongly advised to focus on the support tree masteries, going for master hexer for more debuff application and lasting gifts for extra turns on the buffs. 

As BEK is not often used in arena, no crazy RES/ACC stats are required. If you can meet the required stats (gear section), go for the offence tree and get the T6 mastery Warmaster there. This helps in getting the dungeon bosses down a few seconds faster every run. These masteries can also be used for CB fights making it easier to swap between builds as it'll only cost silver. When using these masteries for clan boss battles, make sure to skip “cycle of magic” as it may throw your stun-cleanse off timing.

Note that this might not be the most optimal clan boss build, as it's not speed-tuned for counterattack teams or unkillable teams due to the relentless set and the speed requirements.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
It's important to note that BEK needs to get as many turns as possible to spam A2 and relentless gear is best in slot for this. Reflex is an alternative, but less efficient. Refresh accessories may overlap and render a reflex proc obsolete. It's important to note that without relentless/reflex gear you won't defeat the dragon in time, failing your run. Therefore 1 of the 2 of them have to be equipped. 

Stats:
- Above 250 speed 
- At least 250 RES & ACC 
- Disregard A1 damage (ATK/CD stats) 
- 3k+ DEF and 40k+ HP for survivability 

Chest: RES/ACC
Gloves: Def%/HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: DEF/HP
Amulet: DEF/HP
Banner: ACC

If you’re not using BEK for higher hard doom tower levels, this is sufficient. If you are planning to use him there 325-400 accuracy is the goal. This should allow you to land poisons on the frost spider when HP burn is active. 250-260 speed allows you to be faster than the fastest DT levels, and 2:1 against dungeon waves. 3k DEF and 40k HP are sufficient to manage all dungeons and the doom tower stage 120 frost spider.
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
This BEK is a good Dragon 20 farmer. The first issue with D20 runs are the waves. There are decrease defense and stun debuffs placed and therefore you need at least 250 resistance (300 is advised for more safety).

The Dragon deals 25-50-75-100% of MAX HP damage on each stun hit, which is why your HP and defense stats aren't very important for the boss fight. You just need to survive the dragon's A1 and A2 hits while having continuous healing active almost all the time and let the poisons make short work of the boss.

Putting your speed at 2:1 (200+ speed) is insufficient for 100% clears and therefore it has to be higher as the turn meter is reset every 3 turns the dragon takes, there are some grey areas where increasing speed is useless. This BEK is at 255 speed which means that there's some TM reduced at the first turn, but the loss is minimal at the other turn meter resets the dragon does. 

Levelling up food has never been easier in the Dragon dungeon!

The following pages will deal with the rest of the dungeons, Doom Tower and more.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Haarken Greatblade is a surprisingly good champion for the Spider dungeon, although she is rarely used and often overlooked.

She is void affinity and can work in any dungeon without weak hits. 

Hear a3 ability spreads the debuffs from one target on the rest, so she can convert a single target HP burn into AOE HP Burn. In this build she is paired with Bulwark for this purpose. However, he can be replaced.

She can work without books as her chance is already 100%. She can also work at level 50 if you've got a reliable way of keeping her alive.

Haarken doesn't needs masteries to work. However, the Support tree is useful for boosting her accuracy and Evil Eye for decreasing the turn meter.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Haarken Greatblade needs enough HP so she doesn't become the target of spiderlings attacks. Speed is needed for her to go twice before the spiderlings start to attack. Accuracy of 200+ is required for the last stages of the dungeon.

Any set combination will work on her. However, perception and accuracy sets are a good idea

Glove: HP % 
Chest: HP %
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP
Banner: Acc
data.label: Gear and Stats

data.desc:
This featured team with Haarken relies on three main principles.

The main damage comes from AOE HP Burn that is a combination of Bulwark HP burn and debuff spread from her A3. Every tick of the burn on spiderlings damages the big spider.

The tank core consists of Miscreated monster who provides massive shields. His shield is not as high as with AOE DEF Down, however it does synergise with the AOE Weaken debuff. You don't want his damage to be too high so the spiderlings die too fast without burning the main one.

Turn meter reduction is the last tenet for this kind of composition. Armigers are an excellent budget option and do a good job on both Spider 19 and 20.

You can see the manual run of Spider 19 below

https://youtu.be/VluiG8oWcb8

For Spider 20 this composition can be ran on auto, as seen in the video below.

https://youtu.be/pqf9HyH__wQ
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Early game is defined in the guides as the period until you have your campaign farmer at level 60 (usually your starter champion) that can farm 12-3 campaign solo leveling up food champions. Look up their respective guides on Raid Bot.

If you´re at this stage of the game, do not try to farm the Spider Dungeon. It’s not an efficient way for a majority of players to spend their energy. Early game you have a lot of energy and XP boosts. 

Use them for farming the 12-3 brutal campaign and don’t farm the spider unless it’s out of necessity for Missions or early Quests.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
You will usually be able to farm spider Dungeon up to level 10 with
your Starter champion. Additional Champs with useful abilities such as AOE Decrease Defence champion, e.g.  Warmaiden along with some healing and supports can help you progress faster and more reliably.

As long as you are able to clear out the Spiderlings with AoE attacks, you
should have no problems in the early game. As shown in the linked Video, an early/mid game Starter with a lifesteal set is able to solo clear Spider 10 with food champions.

Recommended Gear: Lifesteal, Speed (gear can be seen in the video in slide 3)
Stats: 85% crit rate, 160 – 180 speed, 150-180 Crit DMG, HP%
Masteries for AoE nuker(s) below.

Note: T6 Mastery Flawless execution can be swapped for Helmsmasher or Warmaster if DMG from the nuke is sufficient to clear out the spiderlings.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
It’s not that difficult to pass the first 10 levels of spider. Once you can do it and run out of XP boosts in the early game it’s not a bad idea to farm Spider a bit for at least some basic jewellery and stats.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=af1wOJzzjZo

In case you’re extremely unlucky and can’t get through the first levels, there are f2p friendly options that can be farmed in campaign or bought at the market

Warmaiden (AoE Decrease Defense, Single Target Poison)
Armiger (Max HP Damage on A2, Turn-Meter decrease A1)
Starters (Any is Viable. Kael, Athel and Elhain are superior to Galek)
Spirithost (ATK Buff 50%, Block Debuff against Poison)
Diabolist (AoE Speed Boost, AoE Turn-Meter control)

Midgame and onwards, the Spider Dungeon becomes more difficult and requires a better understanding of the game mechanics and your champion roster. Look up the Spider midgame guide for more information.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Once upon a time Dracomorph was one of the worst legendaries in the game. But everything changed when he had received a buff making it one of the most powerful legendaries in Raid. Today he is one of the most sought-after champions for nearly all content. This guide will cover him in nearly all late game+ content with three different builds: 1) Relentless Draco for Clan Boss in Unkillable comp 2) Lifesteal Draco for CB in double Counterattack comp and 3) Draco for dungeon normal runs and speed runs

This page will deal with Draco in Bateater composition that is a staple Unkillable in many top clans. Note that in order to copy this build the champions featured in this guide are a requirement and there is no flexibility regarding this as the Relentless set in other UK compositions can cause Draco to be out of tune.

This champion is definitely worth booking fully. Dracomorph has skills that combine Decrease Defence, Weaken, Poisons and damage based on the number of debuffs all in one unit. This makes him one of the best CB champions for damage.

The masteries are picked with maximum DPS in mind as Unkillable (UK) allows to ignore defence in favour of offense. Grim resolve is the choice due to how low the health will be in such a comp. The rest of the tree is standard for most poisoners with Warmaster as the T6 mastery.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Relentless set is the best DPS set for such a Dracomorph, however it works only in this composition. Ignoring defence you want to focus on reaching the required Accuracy and Speed parameters. If you are using Speed sets be sure to account for them when looking at the total speed due to rounding errors.

Everything else will be the chase for the most Crit Rate, Crit Damage and Attack. 

Glove: Crit Damage%
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy

If you are using Dracomorph in an Unkillable composition that cannot accomodate the Relentless set consider using Savage or Cruel to boost your overall damage. The sets that ignore DEF increase the damage from Warmaster and Giant Slayer each turn resulting in a good DPS increase.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
The reason why the Bateater composition has become so popular is the potential to reach one key on any major CB on any affinity. Draco composition is the easiest to gear for 1 key as you don't need anyone in toxic sets. He can keep the full debuffs slots capped with Poisons. 

Without Relentless set it may be possible to 1 key UNM, but you'd need much better gear and probably some Toxic sets on your other champions to compensate. The gear on the champions here is not too high a requirement for late game+ players and the same team with Fayne or Beleanor need much better gear to compete.

The speed ranges of the champions are the following 

ManEater                  265-282 
Seeker                      248-263 
PainKeeper               239-248 
ManEater 2               239-248
DPS                          218-227

Setup: 

A3 on Maneater 1, A2 into A1 on Seeker, A3 on Painkeeper and A2 on Maneater 2 then hit auto. If your ME2 is faster than PainKeeper you can still use the same setup.

You can find the video of the run below

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HEYfjhBsLU0&ab_channel=DragonPaws

If you choose to run Retribution on PainKeeper you’re going to have to make sure PainKeeper is at least 10 speed slower than Seeker.

DPS champion can be anyone that does not manipulate TM, including multi-hitters like Cruetraxa and Lord Shazar. 

These speeds have a lot of flexibility but there are limits:
Seeker to DPS champion maximum speed gap is 36
Maneater 1 to Maneater 2 maximum speed gap is 38
Maneater 1 to Painkeeper maximum speed gap is 39
PK can have retribution but needs to be at least 10 speed slower than seeker

You can also look up the information on this composition and the Speed calculator on https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/BatEater

If you're not lucky enough to have AOE Unkillable champions but have AOE Counterattack champions Dracomorph can also help as demonstrated on the next page.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
If you are not lucky enough to have Unkillable Champions but have AOE Counteattack (CA) champions you can also make some excellent teams for Ultra-Nightmare and Nightmare Clan Bosses that have the potential to 1 key.

Your Dracomorph will still be the best in slot champion for the DEF Down/Weaken and poisons combo on every clan boss affinity except for Force. Speed tuning will still rein supreme in your CA team if you would like to maximise your Damage per Second (DPS) and masteries that boost the turn meter can't be selected.

The Offence tree stays mostly the same with the exception of Heart of Glory since Valkyrie shields and Lifesteal set allow Dracomorph to stay at full health for a significant portion of the fight. Warmaster is the choice for the T6 mastery.

On the Defence tree we want to pick masteries that minimize the damage Dracomorph receives. Deterrence was chosen because this particular team does not fully sync with the Block Debuffs buff and the stun from CB doesn't break the tune. This can result in some additional DPS increase from champions with this mastery when they counterattack CB after the stun.

If your team always has the stun target under block buffs consider using another T5 mastery, for example Stocked to Fury.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Dracomorph for Clan Boss in Late Game+ setting requires quite a bit of gear to set up properly. Compared to the Unkillable version he needs to be able to survive for long periods of time. This leads to simultaneous requirements for UNM of around 4k+ DEF, 250+ Accuracy and sufficient speed for the speed tune. On top of that you want 100% Crit Rate and as much Crit Damage as possible.

There are two commonly used sets in such a team. The first is the good old Lifesteal set that synergizes with Warmaster to keep Draco at full health on proc. The second is the Stalwart set if you have an excellent healer like Bad-El-Kazar and Draco is not a stun target.

Glove: Crit DMG% 
Chest:  Def %  
Boots: Speed  
Ring:  Defense 
Amulet: Crit Damage  
Banner: Accuracy

If you are more mid-game consider using Def% gloves and amulet to survive longer. In Late game+ you want as much dps as possible until UNM Clan boss starts to hit extremely hard.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
There are multiple ways of building a Counterattack CB team with Dracomorph depending on your available champions. Let's make a brief overview of the options.

If you are seeking one key UNM compositions you will likely need to go the White Whale route - the combination of a persistent Speed Buff with CA is an example. 

See for example: https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/White-Whale---Ma'Shalled-v2

If you don't have the champions for those kind of comps you still have multiple options for 2 key UNM and 1 key NM. 

One such option is the double CA composition. It can work with any of such champions, however Valkyrie and Skullcrusher is one of the stronger variations and works well enough to reliably 2 key UNM on any affinity on auto.

It relies on Valkyrie shields for CB stun and AOE 1 and Skullcrusher Ally protection and Unkillable for tanking AOE 2. If built with the right parameters it will last for 40-50 turns on UNM Clan Boss. However, it does require a good DPS champion that is going to be dealing the bulk of Poison damage and the composition needs the Def Down and Weaken debuffs to reach the required damage levels.

Dracomorph fits this role perfectly and is supported by the rest of the cast. This is not a perfectly tuned composition as this Valkyrie spends part of her time on the Scarab and Arena and is not tuned. Keep in mind that her passive causes tuning problems on affinity bosses due to TM boosts anyway. 

You can see the Void UNM CB run below:

https://youtu.be/FRo09T6_-Jg 

Speed:
    
Valkyrie 249 (not tuned)
Sepulcher Sentinel 239 
Dracomorph 182
Vizier 177
Skullcrusher 173

The first turns are not as important for this the team. Synchronization at turns 30-50 is what matter most as one mistake, lack of the correct buffs or a crit from CB can spell the end of your run. First few turns can be run on manual to prevent Vizier from placing unwanted debuffs for extra dps.
