Dracomorph can also be tuned specifically for other PVE content including all dungeons, featured on the following pages.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In case you have your Clan Boss team solved, Dracomorph can be of great help in all other content as well. He works well in all dungeons both in budget teams and speed run comps. If your Draco is used in this type of content and specifically in the speed comps it makes sense to use different masteries and gearing up differently compared to CB.

The masteries are focused on maximising the first hit DPS instead of the steady gain over time with Warmaster. The offense tree is mostly standard. The blood shield is picked in order to allow Dracomorph to live for a bit longer until he is healed up when hit from AOE on some bosses, e.g. Ice Golem. If you have revivers or can consistently keep him alive feel free to use another damage mastery, for example Kill Streak.

For Late Game+ Helmsmasher provides some of the best DPS for the T6 mastery. It is important to note that this is picked based on the already high amount of Crit Rate (100%) and Crit Damage (220%+). If you cannot reach those parameters you might be better off picking Flawless Execution.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Dracomorph for dungeon wants to be quicker than it's CB counterpart, have more Accuracy for content like Doom Tower & Arena while having lots of Crit Rate and Damage.

You want AOE Def Down and Weaken placed before your nukers use their skills, so Draco has to go after your speed booster, e.g. Arbiter. 200+ Speed is wanted for that purpose. 220-250 Accuracy is required to safely place the debuffs in Dungeons 20. Crit Rate 100% and Crit Damage 200+ is nice goal to have.

Glove - crit dmg %
Chest - acc %
Boots - speed
Ring - atk
Amulet - crit dmg
Banner - acc
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Dracomorph can truly shine in the Dragon dungeon. The waves are bulky on level 20 and having both DEF Down and Weaken on them makes them much easier to get through. Draco does not have weak hits when placing those debuffs and this makes him suitable for any affinity.

The Dragon boss itself is highly susceptible to poison damage. Having the ability to rapidly fill those debuffs makes Dracomorph perhaps the best in slot champion in this Dungeon.

A slow and reliable Draco team would focus on getting safely through the waves and staying alive. In this showcase Dracomorph is the Debuffer and poisoner, Gnarlhorn take the role of AOE Crowd Control, Gorgorab provides revive, healing and TM boosting, Apothecary provides buffs and TM boosts, Kael has some AOE damage and additional poisons on the Dragon.

Note how high Dracomorph damage is and how the excess overhit helps farm the waves.

https://youtu.be/8foM0XEq7Co

If you're Late Game+ you will want to speed run dungeons and generally keep it under 1-2 minute mark. Dracomorph can help with this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=znDFnGY4OSI

In the video above you can see a speed run with Arbiter, Dracomorph, 2 RG and renegade. Arbiter buffs Atk, TM boosts. Dracomorph places the DEF Down, weaken. Royal guards use takedown, clear the wave. Renegade refreshes the skills, the cycle repeats. If built correctly this team can be fast, efficent and safe.

Let's have a look at Dracomorph in the other dungeons and content on the next page.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Spider in Late Game+ is the fastest dungeon to farm if you've got the champions and gear for it. Dracomorph brings AOE Decrease DEF and Weaken that is not affected by affinity, so he shines here with champions that can quickly deal lots of DPS

The featured budget team relies on Dracomorph for debuffs. They allows one Takedown from RG and two A2 Coldheart skills to fully wipe away the spiderlings. This prevents the Spider boss from eating them and restoring health. Coldhearts deplete the big Spider turn meter and deal MAX HP damage to finish the run

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KAJeEXM4iSs

In case you have a better roster it's possible to improve on that time and farm Spider 20 faster. Dracomorph places the debuffs, Gurptuk amplifies the damage, Septimus deals massive MAX HP damage and RG finishes the job.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=koAJGv4ADos
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Dracomorph holds his ground on Fire Knight as well. As you can see in the videos below the debuffs are placed on all the waves and soften up the boss.

In the budget run Coldheart and Rhazin are the multi-hitters that take down the shield and the rest of the cast supports them and keeps them alive. Note the damage from Dracomorph with this build done due to poisons despite being negative affinity in this dungeon.

https://youtu.be/21QKkYledO4

Speed runs with Fire Knight are not very easy. Champions that are good for fast wave farming are not always the most optimal for taking down the FK shield. Furthermore, many champions don't use their skills optimally on the boss, e.g. Dracomorph can waste his A3 if the shield is up.

In this team Dracomorph takes care of the debuffs, Lyssandra control the turn meter of the waves and the boss, Coldhearts are multi-hitters, MAX HP nukers and deplete the TM. Septimus provide massive MAX HP damage

https://youtu.be/Nrix31FAfII
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Dracomorph is one of the best in slot champions for Ice Golem 20. Apart from fast wave clearing, when Poison debuffs deal damage to Ice Golem, his Frigid Vengeance doesn't activate. This makes him valuable if your other champions don't deal lots of direct damage. It may not be that evident in the videos as all the champions deal considerable damage in Late Game+ 

In this video Dracomorph, Kael and Tayrel are accompanied by Gorgorab and Archmage Helmut to keep the team alive.

https://youtu.be/0babo5WNRP8

Speed runs can be tricky on Ice Golem. Survival is paramount for stable runs and Lilitu is the MVP in this comp that keeps the Debuffers and DPS champions alive.

https://youtu.be/S_I-eFKLMr4

Finally, Dracomorph can help on all stages of Faction Wars and Arena covered on the next page.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dracomorph can carry all the Lizardmen teams in Faction wars. Both the waves and the boss will be much easier to pass with him. 

Be sure to fuse Broadmaw if you don't have other healers and revivers in the faction. Or Krisk.

The featured team relies on epic champions to bring down the boss. Controlling the champions on manual can allow you to reach the full 3 stars in the Crypt with this composition.

https://youtu.be/0IyWVNLOCOI
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Dracomorph can be used in Arena as well. The featured team is a standard one: Arbiter speed lead, Lyssandra as a secondary TM booster that also provides TM reduction of the opposing team. Dracomorph as the debuffer and Foli is the nuker that finishes the job.

While Draco may not be best debuffer in Platinum Arena due to the popularity of Immunity type sets and high Resistance on Defence, he can still be useful if you don't have better options below that level or in low Platinum.

https://youtu.be/At1mMS-VaoE
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc: Reserved for more content. If you have a guide on Dracomorph in early and mid-game, please contact OriginMD#8577 on Discord.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fayne is a Spirit affinity Epic Skinwalker that is one of the few champions in the game who can place Defense Down and Weaken Debuff in a single ability. Additionally, she is also able to place Poison and Decrease Attack. Her kit provides all 4 important debuffs for the Clan Boss making her extremely valuable there.

Her weak Defensive base stats make her fragile, but there exist dozens of unkillable and speed tuned compositions that allow her to ignore DEF and focus on Attack and DPS. 

Fayne masteries are standard for clan boss debuffers. In the Offence tree Crit Rate, Crit Damage and standard damage increasing masteries down to the T6 Warmaster are chosen. Take the standard damage mitigation masteries of Tough Skin, Blastproof, Resurgent and Delayed Death down to the T5 mastery of Retribution and Deterrence for the rest of the content.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Fayne can shine in unkillable teams with high speed tuning. Depending on the type of unkillable teams, you can use different types of special sets for her. For example, in a 2:1 Bateater team and its derivatives, Relentless set is amazing on her for dps.

In teams where Extra Turns won’t work, Reflex set can also be great on her. Otherwise, damage sets like Savarge and Cruel would be the second best choice. In this case, you can ignore building her defensively and go all out damage with 100% Crit Rate and as high Attack and Crit Damage as possible with enough speed to match your speed tune. Finally, you can also use Toxic sets if Fayne is slow and she doesn't fill in the full debuff strip with poisons.

Glove: Crit Damage % 
Chest: Atk % 
Boots: Speed / Attack % 
Ring:  Attack 
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Accuracy / Attack
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
In an Unkillable team, Fayne provides all the necessary debuffs for the Clan Boss, allowing her to be the sole DPS for the famous 2:1 Bateater comp or to add other pure DPS champions in a standard Double Maneter unkillable comp. 

This video is just an example of a Double Maneater Unkillable team with Fayne, Fu-shan and Kreela as the DPS champions. Fayne is built entirely for offense.

The team was just shy of 1 key-ing due to the bad affinity matchup for Fu-shan who is the biggest DPS in the team but it can easily 1-key on Void UNM and NM:

https://youtu.be/UayMMT4HHWg

The speed used for this team are:

219 ME
214 ME
171 Kreela
171 Fayne
159 Fu-shan

You can find more information about the double Maneater unkillable variations here https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/Easy-Double-Maneater

As for those people who do not have any AOE Unkillable champions, Fayne in Lifesteal is another option you can use.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fayne is a Spirit affinity Epic Skinwalker that is one of the few champions in the game who can place Defense Down and Weaken Debuff in a single ability. Additionally, she is also able to place Poison and Decrease Attack. Her kit provides all 4 important debuffs for the Clan Boss making her extremely valuable there. 

All her abilities are single target making her less useful for clearing waves but she can be a powerful tool against bosses. This guide will showcase Fayne in Clan Boss, FW, Spider 20 and her niche use in Nether Spider Hard Doom Tower Boss. If you are building her for clan boss she is worth booking.

You should always take the Offense and Defense Tree Masteries on Fayne. For the Offence tree Crit Rate, Crit Damage and standard damage increasing masteries down to the T6 Warmaster are chosen. Since Fayne has low base Defense, the Defense tree is very important to help her survive just a bit longer in Clan Boss if you're not running an unkillable team. Take the standard damage mitigation masteries of Tough Skin, Blastproof, Resurgent and Delayed Death down to the T5 mastery of Retribution and Deterrence.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Fayne is a champion that has very low base hp and defense. In a standard Clan Boss team, you must prioritize building her with Defense rather than Attack. Since she has a low base Defense, it can be quite difficult to build her with high defense. You ideally want to hit around 3000 Defense for UNM, 2500 for NM, around 220-250 accuracy and enough speed to match your CB speed tune.  Once you reach this number, you can then focus on getting Crit Rate, Crit Damage and Attack. Lifesteal set is a must for Clan Boss unless you have a Leech champion in your team.

Glove: Crit Rate / Defense % 
Chest: Def % 
Boots: Speed / Def %
Ring: Defense 
Amulet: Defense
Banner: Accuracy / Defense
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Clan Boss

Fayne’s kit provides all 4 important debuffs (Decrease Attack, Decrease Defense, Weaken, and Poison) for the Clan Boss making her the perfect debuffer there. With Fayne in your team, you have a lot more room to fit your other 4 slots. 

Champions that can extend debuffs are perfect to pair with Fayne. The only drawback is her extremely low base HP and defense. In order to use her effectively in Clan Boss, you must focus her build entirely on defense. Completely ignore Attack, Crit Rate, and Crit Damage unless you can afford to. The exception is if you run her in an Unkillable team.

The video below shows an example of a Standard Clan Boss team with Counterattack and Fayne as the main Debuffer paired with a Vizier to extend her debuffs. The CB was on Magic and the combination of weak hits and decrease accuracy made it difficult for Fayne to place her debuffs early in the fight. As you can see, she is still very squishy even when built defensively with ally protection and died very early in the fight but with Vizier in the team, her debuffs still persist throughout the fight. The team comfortably hit well above the 2-key threshold on UNM.

Ultra-Nightmare: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wC-uJOvT8E4&t=6m09s

This team works on UNM, NM and on all affinity except Spirit due to the Slow Debuff that the CB places. The video below shows how this team performs on NM for a comfortable one key.

Nightmare: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wC-uJOvT8E4

If you’d like to build a similar team, the champions used and their speeds are as follow:

Sepulcher Sentinel 227 –Block Stun, Increase Defense
Tyrant Ixlimor 172 – Secondary Ally Protection, Increase Defense
Fayne 174 – Decrease Defense, Weaken, Poison, Decrease Attack
Vizier 176 – Debuff Extension
Skullcrusher 171 – Counterattack, Ally Protection

On the next page we will be covering Fayne in Spider 20, FW and Nether Spider
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In Spider 20, Fayne is an upgrade to Rhazin due to her ability to place Decrease Defense and Weaken on the Spider without the risk of weak hits. 

She is can be used in a Spider nuke team with Coldhearts. It is important for her to be faster than the Coldhearts since her AI does not use her Decrease Defense and Weaken first. This will be in line with the Coldhearts who also use their AOE ability first on full auto. The video below show an example of a Spider nuke team with Fayne, 2 Coldhearts for the MAX HP Nuke Nuke, Psylar and MM to control the spiderlings with TM reduction and stuns. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wC-uJOvT8E4&t=12m26s
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Faction War

Fayne is very useful in Skinwalkers Faction War 21. The boss on this stage is able to transfer debuffs and swap HP but this ability is on a 12-turn cooldown. After bringing the Boss low enough for it to use this swap HP ability, it becomes a DPS race where you need to kill the boss before he gets this ability again. 

The Debuffs (Decrease Defense, Weaken, Poison) Fayne places increase your DPS tremendously and the Decrease Attack lets you take less damage. This is especially important for this faction as there aren't many champions that have this sort of utility.

This video shows a Skinwalker 21 stage done on auto but if you need to complete this stage for the first time, you should consider running this stage on manual and time placing Fayne’s debuffs after the boss uses the transfers Debuffs skill. Having all the Debuff from Fayne transferred back to your team may cause your team to take too much damage and wipe before clearing.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wC-uJOvT8E4&t=13m42s
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Doom Tower

With the change to the Nether Spider’s boss mechanic where full TM reduction strategies are no longer viable, AOE HP Burn strategies are now one of the best strategies to deal with this Boss. Fayne can be used when paired specifically with Elder Skarg or Drexthar for the AOE HP Burn strategy. Elder Skarg in this feature requires the target to have at least 3 debuffs for his AOE HP Burn to work and Fayne is able to do this job on a single target which is important because champions that do it on an AOE basis will not work well on this boss. Their AI will not use their AOE abilities because the spiderlings have counterattack that will heal the main boss which will then completely nullify the HP burn damage.

The team showcased in the video is built to enable the Elder Skaarg HP Burn Strategy in Hard Nether Spider Stage 90 where 2 debuff cleansers are used, Mausoleum Mage and Hakkorn Smashlord, a healer/reviver in Scyl of the Drakes, and Fayne to place enough debuffs to enable Elder Skaarg to meet his AOE HP Burn condition

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rsGz-KwFH7w
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ghrush the Mangler is a Spirit affinity Epic Ogryn Tribe Epic champion that all players will receive as a 240-day Login reward. If you are still progressing through the game or are still in the mid-game when you get him, he can be a solid addition to your roster. 

He is a great mid-game option for Clan Boss and can help your team transition out of Lifesteal gear, a great champion in Ice Golem, and is core for the Ogryn Tribe Faction War. This is due to the Leech debuff that he can place. It allows the whole team to Lifesteal at about half the rate of the LS set.

Taking the Offense and Support trees are recommended for Ghrush. For the Offence tree Crit Rate, Crit Damage, standard damage increasing masteries down to the T6 Warmaster are chosen. On the Support tree, the accuracy masteries are selected. 

Avoid taking the TM increasing masteries (Arcane Celerity or Rapid Response) if you are using him in Clan Boss as it will ruin your speed tune, namely Counterattack or Unkillable compositions. Lore of steel is valuable on Ghrush as you generally won’t be equipping 4-piece sets like Lifesteal on him so you can gain addition stats from the basic sets, Evil Eye for some TM control, Sniper to increase Debuff chane and Master Hexer to increase the debuff duration.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gearing Ghrush is fairly simple. Focus on building Defense, Accuracy, Crit Rate, Crit Damage, and enough speed to match your team, especially for Clan Boss. 

Ideally reaching 4000 Defense, 220-250 Accuracy, 100% Crit Rate and as much Crit Damage as possible is preferred for Ultra-Nightmare clan boss. Since he doesn’t not require Lifesteal, you can gear him with any sets to reach his stats. 

The basics sets that give extra stats like Defense, Speed, Accuracy, Crit Rate, Crit Damage, etc will work and can assist you in reaching those stats.   

Glove: Crit Rate / Crit Damage % 
Chest: Def % 
Boots: Speed / Def % 
Ring: Defense 
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Accuracy / Defense
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Clan Boss

Ghrush is a solid mid-late game option for Clan Boss. He has a high chance of placing the Leech Debuff on his A1, can place Decrease Attack as a backup, and provide some heal through Continuous heal buffs. 

He is also Def based making it easier to build him to survive and he has good multipliers to deal damage. His Leech debuff and continuous heal buffs lessens the burden of requiring to build 5 different champions in Lifesteal gear as it is enough to heal your team. You should then be able to build your champions with better stats with better sets. His Leech is also unique it that he places it before attacking which means that it cannot weak hit allowing him to be used in all affinity. 

The video below shows an example of a Standard Mid-game Budget Clan Boss team with 4 epics and the legendary fusion Rhazin. The run unfortunately ended early due to Decease Attack falling off but it was still able to comfortably hit well above the 3-key threshold.

Ultra-Nightmare: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEWRz9ZwsWA&t=6m01s

This team works on UNM, NM and on all affinity except Spirit due to the Slow Debuff that the CB places. The video below shows how this team performs on NM.

Nightmare: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEWRz9ZwsWA

If you’d like to build a similar team, the champions used and their speeds are as follows:

Sepulcher Sentinel 227 –Decrease Attack, Block Stun, Increase Defense
Ghrush 172 – Leech, Continuous Heal, Back up Decrease Attack
Rhazin 174 – Decrease Defense, Weaken, 
Occult Brawler 176 – Poisoner
Skullcrusher 171 – Counterattack, Ally Protection

The other two areas where Ghrush shines are Faction Wars and Ice Golem, covered on the next page
data.label: Notes:

title: Ghrush the Mangler Late Game Dungeon runs

data.desc:
Ice Golem

Ghrush is a decent option for Ice Golem 20 if you are struggling in that area. He does decent AOE damage to help with the waves, places AOE ATK Down and provides healing for the team as well as the Leech debuff. 

The video below showcases an IG20 team with 3 of the free champions everyone receives, Dark Elhain for Damage, Scyl for  healing, Crowd Control, and Ghrush. Tayrel provides AOE Decrease Def and Gorgorab can support with TM boosting, healing and revive if things go South.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEWRz9ZwsWA&t=13m46s
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Faction War

Ghrush is an excellent addition for Ogryn Tribe Faction Wars. He provides healing which is lacking in the faction. He provides multiple Continuous Heals to the team and leech debuff on the enemy, a great Def % Faction Wars aura, and also does decent amount of damage to help with dealing with the waves. 

The FW21 boss hits quite hard and does AOE HP Burn which gradually lowers your team’s health making heals important. His Atk down, although not as reliable, can help with lowering the damage your team takes. The video below shows an example of an Ogyrn Tribe FW 21 run on full auto.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEWRz9ZwsWA&t=10m16s 

For teams that don't have Maneaters Ghrush is even better and can help secure the three stars in this Crypt.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc: This concludes the Grush guide for now. If you have more areas where you'd like to showcase this champion, feel free to submit your version of a guide at https://forms.gle/ug3RjuXjF2qoq5LX8
data.label: Notes:

title: Tyrant Ixlimor Late Game+ Clan Boss Guide

data.desc:
Tyrant Ixlimor is a Magic affinity Legendary champion from the Demonspawn faction that is best known for his AOE HP burn ability and killing Spider 20. 

He is capable of solo-ing Ice Golem 20 and Spider 20 despite those dungeons being some of the most challenging even with a full team. Aside from Dungeons, Tyrant is an extremely strong Clan Boss champion in standard non-unkillable teams. He provides Ally Protection, 60% Increase Defense Buff, and a passive that reduces damage your team takes from enemies under HP Burn (that he can place) which substantially increases your team’s survivability. 

He makes it possible to survive past turn 50 on Ultra-Nightmare even with non-Defense based champions in the team. Additionally, as one of the few champions that can place AOE HP Burn, he great against the Frost Spider Boss in Doom Tower.

Tyrant A2 and A3 are worth booking fully as you are likely to find a use for him at any stage of the game.

Masteries on Tyrant will vary depending on where you use him. For a Clan Boss build, the offense and defense trees are highly recommended. As an ally protection champion, he needs the damage mitigation masteries the defense tree provides hence Tough Skin, Blast Proof, Resurgent, Delayed Death are excellent for this purpose. Retribution and Deterrence are selected for a chance to counterattack. In the offense tree the standard Crit Rate, Crit Damage, down to the T6 Warmaster are chosen as with most Clan Boss builds.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The gear and stats on Tyrant will highly depend on where he will be used. A Clan Boss and Solo Dungeon build will be completely different from each other. 

For a Clan Boss build, prioritize Defense, Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Accuracy, HP, and enough Speed to match your CB speed tune. The ideal numbers to hit for UNM are 4k+ Def, 40k+ HP, 100% Crit Rate, 220-250 Accuracy, and as much Crit Damage as possible. 

Tyrant has in-built Lifesteal mechanic in his A1 so he does not need to be in Lifesteal gear if you are running a Counterattack Team (conditional on him not being stunned). 

In this case, Stalwart is the best gear set for him in Clan Boss. You can then complement the Stalwart set with Defense, Speed, Accuracy, or Perception depending on what stats you need.

Glove: Crit Rate / Crit Damage 
Chest: Def % 
Boots: Speed / Def % 
Ring: Defense 
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy / Defense
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Tyrant is an extremely strong Clan Boss champion in standard non-unkillable teams. He substantially increases your team’s survivability by providing Ally Protection, 60% Increase Defense Buff, and a passive that reduces damage your team takes from enemies under HP Burn.

When paired with another Ally Protection champion like Skullcrusher, your team’s survivability will increase exponentially, making it capable of surviving past turn 50 on UNM even with non-Defense based champions in the team. You need to space out their Ally Protection skill. You should not use them both in the same turn. Ideally use Skullcrusher’s in AOE 1 and Tyrant’s in AOE 2. 

The video below shows an example of a Standard Clan Boss team with Tyrant and Skullcrusher as the double ally protection duo, Fayne as the main Debuffer paired with a Vizier to extend her debuffs. As you can see, the run lasted until turn 52 and comfortably hit well above the 2-key threshold.

Ultra-Nightmare: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wC-uJOvT8E4&t=6m09s

This team works on UNM, NM and on all affinity except Spirit due to the Slow Debuff that the CB places. The video below shows how this team performs on NM.

Nightmare: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wC-uJOvT8E4

If you’d like to build a similar team, the champions used and their speeds are as follow:

Sepulcher Sentinel 227 – Block Stun, Increase Defense
Tyrant Ixlimor 172 – Secondary Ally Protection, Increase Defense
Fayne 174 – Decrease Defense, Weaken, Poison, Decrease Attack
Vizier 176 – Debuff Extension
Skullcrusher 171 – Counterattack, Ally Protection

We'll be covering the Dungeon Tyrant on the next page
data.label: Notes:

title: Tyrant Ixlimor Late Game+ Dungeon Guide

data.desc:
If you already have Clan Boss covered you may want to opt in for priority on dungeons. For the Solo Dungeon build the Offense and Support Trees are preferred. 

The offense tree will be the same with the standard Crit Rate, Crit Damage, down to the T6 Warmaster. In the Support Tree, the basic accuracy masteries are chosen with Arcane Celerity for TM when his debuffs expire (this makes the build unsuitable for speed tuned CB). Lore of Steel for additional stats, Evil Eye to reduce TM, and Master Hexer to increase the debuff duration. Spirit Haste is an important mastery for Solo Dungeon builds as you will run the dungeon with food champions and when they die, Tyrant gains 24 more speed.

This build can potentially be used in pure speed clan boss comps, but it wouldn't reach the full potential as the Stalwart set in a speed-tuned setting.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For a Solo Dungeon build, prioritize Resistance, Accuracy, Speed, Defense and HP. All his damage will come from HP Burns and Warmaster, so crit rate is not important at all. 

The ideal numbers to reach are 220-250 Accuracy, 300+ Resistance, 220+ Speed, 4k+ Defense, and 40k+ HP. There are two different types of sets that you can build Tyrant to solo dungeons, Lifesteal or Regeneration. This build showcases the former.

Note that a Solo Tyrant in Regeneration requires more prioritization in HP stats, 50k+ and is harder to build since Regeneration sets are usually harder to find and farm good pieces on Fire Knight. You can then complement the set with Speed, Accuracy, Perception, or Resistance set depending on what stats you need.

Glove: Def % 
Chest: Def %  
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Defense 
Amulet: Defense 
Banner: Accuracy / Resistance

For the Frost Spider in Doom Tower, the same build as the Solo Dungeon Build is recommended but with at least 300 accuracy. Note that this accuracy is not enough to debuff the Frost Spider as it has 500+ Resistance but it is enough to Burn the spiderlings. They are tanky and won't die easily so they'll eventually destroy the Frost Spider as collateral. Note that HP burn or block revive is needed in that case.

If you need to Burn the Frost Spider itself for your team 500+ Accuracy for Tyrant is required instead
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Tyrant is one of the strongest champions for any Spider dungeon of any affinity and level to date. He's your lucky ticket if you're progressing in the game.

Solo-ing Spider with Tyrant is very straight forward. He places AOE HP Burn on all the Spiderlings. Every time the Spiderling takes a turn, it damages the main spider. The higher the level and MAX HP of the Spider, the better this strategy works.

With sufficienty high resistance build, he will resist the poisons from the spiderlings and TM reduction from the main spider. He is also strong affinity to the Spider 20 so weak hits from them lets him take less damage. The videos show Tyrant solo-ing Spider 20 with 4 food champions.

Naturally if your Tyrant cannot reach this type of gear and parameters he'll still be amazing and paired with TM reduction champions like coldheart or with Crowd Control he can duo Spider 20 with relative ease.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=578ZNIwFu08&

On the next page we'll cover the featured Tyrant in Spider 19, Solo Ice Golem 20 and Frost Spider in Doom Tower.
data.label: Notes:

title: Tyrant Ixlimor Late Game+ Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
Tyrant can also be used in Spider 19 even though is it Force affinity. He cannot solo it, but with a few support champions, he can help you beat it if you are struggling in this stage and want to just get past it for the mission. This video show an example of a run with Rearguard Sergeant for protection and Psylar for CC. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=578ZNIwFu08&t=3m14s

Naturally if you have Coldhearts or other champions with Turn meter reduction they can help speed up the run and make it safer. This is more of a showcase of how he can fit both the role a negative affinity tank and AOE HP Burn champion. While weak hits will always be a problem in such cases, it's not a bad idea to use him once to complete a Force affinity stage.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Solo-ing Ice Golem with Tyrant is also quite straightforward. With the Solo Dungeon build, he will be able to survive the hits and resist most of the debuffs from the mobs and Boss and heal back up. 

The main source of damage will be from AOE HP Burn slowly damaging the boss, the mobs and Warmaster procs. This video shows Tyrant Solo-ing Ice Golem 20 with 4 food champions.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=578ZNIwFu08&t=1m18s
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Against the Frost Spider in Doom Tower, Tyrant will be the main damage through his HP Burns. The Frost Spider has a mechanic where it has extremely high resistance and without very good gear, it may not be possible to build Tyrant with that high accuracy. 

The spiderlings do not have as high resistance, so you can still HP burn them with around 300+ accuracy and their HP Burn ticks will also damage the Frost Spider. If Tyrant is built with Resistance, he can also resist the freeze and debuffs the Frost Spider places on him. 

This video shows an example of a Stage 120 Hard Doom Tower Frost Spider Boss fight. Tyrant provides the main damage through his HP Burns and everyone else is there to support. Mausoleum Mage and Doompriest to cleanse and heal, Arbiter to Heal, Boost TM and revive incase anyone dies, and Lydia to block the Frost Spider from Reviving due to the lack of HP burn on the boss.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=578ZNIwFu08&t=4m37s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Rotos was one of the strongest of the attack champions before he was nerfed, and remains an extremely strong contender. He can hit extremely hard when fully booked and is viable in a wide variety of late game content.

A big portion of his power comes from “RNG” extra turns (passive), and his partial ignore defence A3 ability. Rotos is a hard-hitting single target nuker and can severely damage key members of an unbuffed/unprotected enemy team in Arena – because Rotos can cut in attack sequences, e.g. from Hegemons that sit tightly in the Platinum arena spots.

Mastery wise, Rotos works best when he's maximising damage output. For a Late Game+ dps champion on Arena with more than 100% Crit Rate and 220+ Crit Damage the final T6 mastery Helmsmasher for ignoring defence provides the best results. In the defence tree Retribution is important for opportunity of extra turns on A1. 

Let’s go through the other key masteries:

•        We picked shield breaker early on over Heart of Glory or Grim Resolve because Rotos is neither likely to be at full HP (often not a go first team), nor likely to be below 50% HP often (see passive)
•        Ruthless ambush and Singled Out and Bring it Down for killing targets that are heavily injured and on first hit and those with higher HP
•        Cycle of Violence is really important as Rotos will trigger this often, bringing his devastating A2 and A3 around that have short cooldowns
•        Blood Shield and Kill Streak were selected, but Methodical and Stoked to Fury are also viable option

If you are using Rotos you might want to fully book him as the damage and cooldowns are significantly improved in that scenario
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Rotos requires high damage for best results and hence Savage set is crucial (25% ignore defence). Coupled with A3 (60% ignore defence) you have 85% ignore. You can add a further 5% via cruel set and Helmsmasher T6 is also devastatingly helpful for A1 and A2. 

For gear sub-stat reasons, Speed off-set was used in this build as it's tricky to reach the required numbers. Rotos needs to have high damage (5k+ attack, 240%+ cd) and doesn’t have to be that fast (because he can cut in with attacks of opportunity due to passive). His Accuracy is not particularly important in arena, because you should have other sources of defence down (or none needed at all against soft targets).

You are looking for items with Crit Rate, Crit Damage and Atk% substats in particular.

Glove: Crit Damage 
Chest: Attack%/Resist, 
Boots: Speed/Attack%
Ring: Attack                        Att% and HP% substat
Amulet: Crit Damage          Att and resist substat
Banner: Att/Resist              Att% substat 

Any cooldown reset accessory is extremely favourable and will increase the power of Rotos considerably. Having the proc on A3 allows to take an extra turn for Rotos for example.

Alternative gearing Builds: as speed and acc are not strict requirements, you can build Rotos to have either very high attack% or some Resistance against nuke hegemons. For example, you can drop 20-30 speed for attack boots (+500 attack) or resist chest + banner (+190 resist). There are many ways to make Rotos work for different purposes.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Offence in Arena:

Rotos in the current arena meta (post December 2020) is primarily used at the high end as a counter against Hegemon. Ideally 2 Rotos on the team can take advantage of Hegemon going first, triggering the passive of Rotos and allowing them to cut into the turn sequence and cause trouble. 

Rotos needs to be paired with Siphi if not in immunity, as Siphi’s passive can remove any attack down, stun/cc, and block skill debuffs from Hegemon on his turn. 

In this video, we show Rotos used against a variety of enemy Hegemon teams in Platinum arena: 

https://youtu.be/kAL2S3n6VhU 

The next guide page will deal with showcasing a differently built Rotos in Clan Boss
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Paragon is an oftenly overlooked champion for new players. However, he can be extremely powerful in niche settings and allow you to progress with minimal investments in areas that are hard to reach otherwise. In particular this concerns Spider dungeon on all levels.

You want to keep him as weak as possible for this purpose so spiderlings target him while he is unkillable. At three starts unascended he works the best. 

You do need to book his A2 so his unkillable is always available. He doesn't need masteries, but you need to understand the way compositions with him work.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
He needs 151+ speed for spider, 171+ speed for nightmare campaign. Needs to have his a2 unkillable cooldown booked.

The rule for targeting in the Spider dungeon is called 3x. Other heroes need to have at least 3 times more health and there should not be any negative affinity heroes on the team.

For example: paragon has 5k health. For spider 19 you want to have heroes of any affinity except magic and all heroes need to have more than 15k health.

Glove - anything except hp
Chest - anything except hp
Boots - speed
Ring -
Amulet -
Banner -

Note: Helmets have additional HP in the main stat, so avoid it or any hp and hp% substats! Any set can be used.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
The vast majority of paragon comps rely on him being on manual. On auto if he is the leader he will place unkillable on himself once. After that he puts it on someone else. Let's recap and list all the requirements for paragon and the compositions with him:

• Manual composition
• No negative affinity champions
• No shield sets or shielding abilities
• 151+ speed
• Low health, 3x hp rule for other champions
• Lots of TM reduction and depletion

Video of a manual spider 20 run with low level heroes

https://youtu.be/HTYOPJMmtmM

Video of an auto run of spider 20 with late game heroes

https://youtu.be/AiFdOekO3bY

On auto if he is the leader he will place unkillable on himself once. After that he puts it on someone else.

You can find more builds and more manual runs of spider with Paragon on the next page including Spider 19 that can be problematic for many players, as well as a 12-7 nightmare campaign run
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Kreela Witch-arm is a Magic affinity Orc Legendary champion that was part of the first Fragment Fusion event in 2020. Congratulations if you were lucky enough to fuse her or pull her as she is regarded as one of the best and most versatile champions. 

She can used almost anywhere and cab be built in multiple different ways depending on where you use her. She can be used in Dungeons, Arena and she is one of staple champions in plenty of Clan Boss teams, even ones that can achieve the coveted 1 Key UNM status. The only downside is that her A2 and A3 requires to be fully books for a 100% chance to perform the ally attack and lower the cooldowns.

For general PVE content, you want to build Kreela in the Offense and Defense Tree Mastery. In the offense tree, take the Crit Rate, Crit Damage, general damage increasing masteries down to T6 Warmaster. For the Defense tree, take the damage mitigation masteries down to the Retribution and Deterrence T5 Mastery. 

This guide page will cover Kreela in an Unkillable CB composition
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The gear and the required stats on Kreela will highly depend on where you want to use her. 

Generally, build up her Attack, Speed, Crit Rate, and Crit Damage. However, Kreela can give your team a 30% Crit Rate buff. This allows you to only build 70% Crit rate. Although her A2 ability can stun a single target, it's usually not impactful enough to build accuracy on her except for Arena. 

You can use any set to help you reach the stat requirement like Speed, Offense, Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Cruel, etc.

For Unkillable team, focus entirely on Atk, 70% Crit Rate, Crit Dmg and speed to match your speed tune. Reflex is the best set for her in unkillable teams. Lowering cooldowns allows more use of the abilities and that significantly increases the overall damage. 

Glove: Crit Rate / Crit Damage 
Chest: ATK %
Boots: ATK %/ Speed 
Ring: Attack
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Attack

Refresh accessories are highly recommended.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Clan Boss

In an Unkillable team, she provides the Increase Crit Rate and Attack buff to the team allowing everyone to be built with 70% Crit Rate and boost their damage as most unkillable DPS champions are ATK based along with the Maneaters. 

This takes advantage of the fact that defensive stats can be ignored and everyone can be built for full Attack and damage. She deals a good amount of damage herself and the ally attacks boosts the team’s damage significantly. There are many variety of unkillable Clan Boss teams with Kreela. You can build you own kind as long as you have the bases covered (Decrease Defense, Weaken, and Poison). This video is just an example of one: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QCIkogm6xw4

In this video two Maneaters are the MVPs allowing it to have permanent Block Debuffs and Unkillable
Kreela increases the Crit Rate and Atk along with Ally attack
Longbeard provides Weaken and Ally attack mechanic
Fushan provides speed Aura, Def Down and has a handy A1 with chances to proc extra hits

The speed used for this team are:

219 ME
214 ME
171 Kreela
171 Longbeard
159 Fu-shan

You can find more information about the double Maneater unkillable variations here https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/Easy-Double-Maneater

We'll be covering Kreela in Lifesteal gear on the next page for those who are unlucky and do not to have AOE Unkillable champions
data.label: Notes:

title: Kreela Witch-Arm Late Game+ LS Guide

data.desc:
This page of the guide focuses on Kreela in a Counterattack team for those who don't have Unkillable champions.

Her A2 and A3 requires to be fully booked for a 100% chance to perform the ally attack and lower the cooldowns.

Kreela in this instance needs the Offense and Defense Tree Mastery to survive longer. In the offense tree, take the Crit Rate, Crit Damage, general damage increasing mastery down to T6 Warmaster. For the Defense tree, take the damage mitigation masteries down to the Retribution and Deterrence T5 Mastery.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For regular Clan Boss, you want to focus more on her Defense rather than Attack. Kreela has decent base stats, but it's difficult to build her simultaneously with high Def and Atk. 

Ideally you want at least 3500 Defense and in Lifesteal set. Crit Rate at 70% and decent Crit Damage is preferred for Ultra-Nightmare CB. However, the core of this build is the speed requirement to the 4:3 tune and surviving long enough.

Glove: Crit Rate / Def %
Chest: Def % 
Boots: Speed / Def % 
Ring:  Defense 
Amulet: Crit Damage  / Def
Banner: Defense 

Refresh accessories are welcome
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Clan Boss

For a standard Clan Boss Team, it is recommended to build her fast enough to go 4:3 in you team. This allows her to permanently place her Increase Crit Rate and Attack buff to the team allowing everyone to be built with 70% Crit Rate. It is possible to comfortably 2 key UNM with her.

You can line it up so that she always use her ally attack when Def Down and Weaken is on the Clan Boss for maximum damage. This eases the gear requirement for your team and you can prioritize other important stats. She deals a good amount of damage herself and the ally attacks boosts the team’s damage significantly. The team shown in this video is a sample standard Clan Boss team with AOE Counterattack. 

Kreela is tuned to go 4:3 and everyone in the team is built with 70% Crit rate to take advantage of Kreela’s buff. In this team, the following champions and their speeds were used:

Sepulcher Sentinel 252: Atk Down, Block stun
Kreela 227: Increase Attack, Crit Rate Buff, Ally Attack, DPS
Skullcrusher 191: Ally Protect, Counterattack
Rhazin 175: Def Down, Weaken, DPS
Errol 174: DPS (You can use any other DPS champion in this slot)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=upRMjwTTdtA

On the next page we'll be covering Kreela in different dungeons and other PVE content if you already have your Clan Boss covered
data.label: Notes:

title: Kreela Witch-Arm Late Game+ Dungeons Guide

data.desc:
This Kreela Build is used mainly in Dungeons and Arena. She can work in these areas quite decently even in a lifesteal set or reflex set. However, for best result there are some differences if you want to get the most mileage out of Kreela.

You do want to book her A2 and A3 for a 100% chance to perform the ally attack and lower the cooldowns.

For general PVE content, you want to build Kreela in the Offense and Defense Tree Mastery. In the offense tree, take the Crit Rate, Crit Damage, general damage increasing mastery down to T6 Helmsmasher. 

It provides the best DPS if you can reach the required Crit rate 100% (after buffs) and Crit Damage 220+ in Late Game+. If you can't reach those parameters you might be better off picking Flawless Execution instead
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For Arena, there are two different builds for Kreela. An ally attacker or a nuker. As an ally attacker, you focus only on speed. Build her with enough speed to go right after your Booster so she can perform her ally attack immediately. You need to tune Kreela accordingly so no enemy champion cuts in between them. This is a common setup for blender teams e.g. Arbiter, Kreela, Skullcrown, Sinesha that rely on fast battles and ally attack to wipe out the enemy team.

As a Nuker, build her with high Attack, Crit Damage, enough speed to go after your Defense Down Champion and only 70% Crit Rate. 

Speed set is recommended for the ally attacking build and Savage/Cruel for the Nuker build. 

Glove: Crit Rate / Crit Damage 
Chest: ATK %
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Attack
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Attack/ Accuracy
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Arena

For Arena, she can be used as an ally attacker or a nuker. As an ally attacker, you want to build a team with a TM Booster that also places Increase Attack like Arbiter or Gorgorab and 2 champions with AOE A1, ideally Skullcrown and Sinesha. 

Unfortunately, her AI prioritizes using her A3 ability, so you have to manual your fights if you want to use her Ally attack ability first. This is a popular arena offense team called a “blender” team. 

As a Nuker, you build a standard team of TM Booster, Defense Down, and Kreela in the Nuker role. She is able to place Increase Attack and Crit Rate buff so, she can be more easily built with 70% Crit Rate, and you don’t require a Increase Attack Champion in the team. 

If you don’t have an Arbiter yet, using TM increasing champions like Lyssandra, High Katun, or Deacon Armstrong will be enough. 

This video showcases her as a Nuker in a standard Speed team with Arbiter, Golden Reaper, Madame Serris and Kreela in higher level of Gold 4 Arena against regular teams.

https://youtu.be/F44pLt4LN48?t=239

The next page will cover Kreela in Dungeons and Faction Wars
data.label: Notes:

title: Kreela Witch-Arm Late Game+ Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
Dragon 

For Dragon, Kreela's role is to deal damage while buffing the team. 

If you can pair champions that can benefit from the Ally Attack ability, the better, such as Skullcrown, Sinesha for their AOE A1s during the waves, or Zavia, Frozen Banshee, Kael, for their A1 Poisons debuff against the Dragon. 

This video showcases her in a budget Dragon 20 team.

Frozen Banshee provides the Accuracy Aura and A1 poisons
Zargala provides AOE Def Down and damage on the waves
Apothecary helps with TM boosts and targeting healing
Scyl with healing, revive and stuns on the waves

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F44pLt4LN48
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Fire Knight

For Fire Knight, Kreela is unfortunately negative affinity, but she is still useful in this dungeon. 

She provides the buffs to the team and deals damage. She occasionally weak hits so it is advised to bring other damage dealers along with her. Her Ally attack ability is helpful in bringing down the Fire Knight Shield quickly and A1 multi-hitters help in this regard. 

This video showcases her in a budget Fire Knight 20 team

Gorgorab for healing, revive and TM boosts
Alure for 3-hit A1 and amazing TM reduction lockdown vs the boss
Coldheart as the MVP with multi-hit, MAX HP damage and TM depletion
Stag Knight for AOE Def Down and Decrease Speed debuff

https://youtu.be/F44pLt4LN48?t=119
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Faction Wars

Kreela is an amazing champion for the Orc Faction Wars as she synergizes extremely well with the premier Orc FW champions, Seer and Vrask. Not only does she nuke and deal damage herself, she provides buffs for Seer to strip and deal extra damage. Her ally attack allows Vrask to attack an additional time to heal your team and provide a burst DPS against the FW 21 boss. This is relevant as the Orc FW 21 boss is the one that swaps health every 12 turns, and you need to be able to burst the boss down in that 12 turns or he will swap health again. 

The video shows a full auto Orc FW 21 team with 

https://youtu.be/kA93UZMxJQw

Vrask for healing
Seer for Nuke and debuff strip
Kreela to Nuke, provides buffs for Seer to strip, and ally attack for burst DPS
Zargala for Decrease Defense
Iron Brago for Increase Def, and passive that increases the team’s defense.

A more budget 3 star FW 21 team replace Iron Brago with a Veteran.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Soulless is a solid Void affinity legendary champion that can be used in a wide range of content. He is excellent for progression in all dungeons and can carry you in Faction Wars that is one of the hardest for this faction.

The featured build focuses on damage as Soulless A3 AOE ability relies on the damage inflicted and the number of debuffs on all other champions. The combination of stuns on A1, provoke on A2 and AOE Provoke and shield on A3 makes him a solid Crowd Control champion everywhere.

Booking his A3 should be a priority if you decide to invest in him.

In Late Game+ once you have access to enough Accuracy you can select the masteries that increase Soulless dps and survivability. The featured build crosses the threshold of Crit Rate 100% and Crit Damage 220%+ so Helmsmasher is selected as the T6 mastery.

You could select Flawless Execution or Warmaster as alternative masteries if you don't reach that level of gear. Defensive masteries allow Soulless to soak up more damage during sustained battles.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
In terms of gear there are a number of stats Soulless needs to achieve the best results. The sets used to do this can be any sets in the game from Lifesteal to broken sets combinations. Speed, Accuracy and perception work well as the baseline.

Accuracy 220+ for dungeons 20 and FW, Speed 200+, Crit Rate 100%, Crit Damage as much as possible. Defence is the main damage stat so aiming for 4k+ is a good goal post.

Glove: Crit Damage / Crit Rate
Chest: DEF %
Boots: Speed 
Ring: DEF
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Our first feature will start in one of the most difficult dungeons - Spider 20. In this composition Soulless functions as the tank who can take on all the Spiderling hits due to the massive shield and AOE provoke on A3.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oPfdMq7JVyk&ab_channel=DragonPaws

The team consists of the following champions:

Spider champion provides speed aura, AOE DEF Down and weaken lvl 1. Note that since those debuffs don't hit there is no weak hit on negative affinity.

Soulless provides tanking capabilities and AOE provoke. Note how high the shield is thanks to the DEF Down and Weaken.

Septimus has some of the highest MAX HP damage nukes in the game.

Renegade allows to refresh the most important skills like Holy Sword for Septimus and Reign of Terror for Soulless.

Finally, Apothecary provides TM boosts and targeted healing.

On the next pages we'll cover Soulless in other dungeons.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon 20 is one of the core farming dungeons throughout the game stages. In this composition Soulless serves his role as the Crowd Control and nuker on the waves.

Gorgorab provides TM boosting, healing and revive
Warmaiden grants AOE DEF Down that amplifies the damage of your team
Marked supplies DEF UP buff for Soulless and increases the survivability of the whole team
Kael provides the Poison debuffs for the boss stage and some nuking capabilities on the waves

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=67wXLJCTbjA
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
On Fire Knight 20 Soulless can help with the waves thanks to his CC kit.

Gorgorab grants TM Boosts, healing and revive
Warmaiden provides AOE Def Down
Coldhearts help with 4 hit A-1, MAX HP nukes and TM depletion

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B1gaOybbI0w
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Ice Golem 20 is likely the least popular dungeon in Late Game+. Soulless can provide good wave clear thanks to his kit. However, watch out and don't do too much damage to trigger consecutive retaliation from the boss if you're building for dps.

Gorgorab is the ever present epic that saves the rest of the team
Warmaiden for AOE DEF Down although she is weak affinity (champions like Stag Knight would be much better of course)
Marked provides Increase DEF and Block Debuffs for the team
Archmage Helmut provides a strong suite of buffs and TM control

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hC9nTn2GFcs
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Rounding up the PVE part of the guide, Knight Revenant is usually one of the hardest faction to complete on the way to Lydia not least due to the second wave of the 21st crypt that contain Valkyries.

There are two Legendaries that make life quite easy there. The first one is Tomb Lord as he has access to AOE DEF Down, Atk Down, Decrease Speed and Poisons that other champions in the faction lacks. The second is Soulless that doesn't suffer from affinity problems and can control Valkyries quite well.

The first video contains the run without Tomb Lord. 

Faceless is an amazing single target DPS in the faction and can help you greatly both on the waves and during the boss fight.
Wurlim has Freeze on A1 for CC and buffs that can help during all stages of the crypt
Doompriest provides healing and removes the debuffs.
Sinesha provides wave control and healing as well as A2 that can increase cooldowns of enemies

https://youtu.be/LpRZEkpdZ_Q

Tomb Lord runs are faster and safer

https://youtu.be/ms97hz_Z0nw
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
In Arena Soulless with this build can deal some heavy damage. There are requirements he needs to shine in this role. 

The video below demonstrates the performance in Top Gold 4 near Platinum tier. There are a variety of ways you can make a team with Solless work. The most common one would be

Arbiter for Speed aura and TM boost 
Madame Serris for buff stripping and applying AOE Decrease DEF
Doomscreech provides TM boost and Increase DEF 
Soulless nukes the opposing team

https://youtu.be/P8RJVB69zMM
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc: Reserved
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Runekeeper is a solid epic that can be used almost anywhere in the game. If you are lucky enough to obtain him you can build him in multiple ways.

A1 can place Leech debuff and this allows your champions to survive in mid-game even without the lifesteal sets on Clan Boss and in dungeons. A2 provides a Turn Meter boost and A3 provides healing based on his MAX HP as well as full debuff removal. Solid kit and worth spending books on as the investment is worth it.

In this build we'll be focusing on Clan Boss and dungeons-15 as the main goals of mid-game.

Using a champion in CB almost automatically means Warmaster (or GS) is the choice of T6 mastery and Runekeeper is no exception. Standard masteries on the offence tree with crit rate, crit damage on the way to WM. This build utilises the support tree masteries that provide additional healing and increase the buff duration, turn meter boosting and Sniper to increase the base chance of placing debuffs.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Runekeeper has a high base speed, HP and DEF and he heals allies of his MAX HP, so we want him to maximise those stats for the mid-game.

For dungeons 15 you usually need around 150 accuracy and as much of other stats as you can get. You can use the following set combinations

2x SPD sets + 1 immortal set for dungeons 
OR
2x SPD sets + 1 ACC set for clan boss if you lack lifesteal sets in your team

Glove : HP%/DEF%
Chest : DEF%
Boots : Speed
Ring : DEF
Amulet : HP
Banner : ACC/HP
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Runekeeper is a good healer and cleanser for any stage of the game. In Clan boss his strong heal and leech on A1. Note that none of the champions have lifesteal. The team composition is

Tayrel for DEF Down and Atk Down debuff on A1
Frozen Banshee for Poison debuffs
Longbeard for Ally attack and Weaken debuff
Grizzled Jarl for Def UP buff and block debuffs. The buff increases the survivability and damage of DEF based champions.

If you are lacking Accuracy you can place Frozen Banshee as your CB lead. Alternatively Tayrel with DEF Aura can be used. 

You can find a Nightmare CB run with this team below: 

https://youtu.be/WD_uYHSimU0

The next page will deal showcase Runekeeper in other dungeons 15
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Big’Un is an extremely versatile champion that can be used everywhere in the game. He is extremely valuable in Dungeons, especially if you are still progressing in the game as he has a 90 Accuracy Aura in Dungeons. His aura provides almost half the accuracy you need for dungeon 20s, which makes your team much easier to build if you are still lacking gear.

In Dragon 20, he can deal tons of AOE nuke damage to clear the waves and CC them at the same time with his AOE stuns, TM control, and Decrease Speed. He won’t deal as much damage to the boss, but he can clear the waves and carry your Poisoner to the boss easily. 

The video below shows an example of a budget team with Big’un as the only Legendary. 
Gorgorab and Apothecary for support
Zargala for Decrease Defense, and 
Frozen Banshee for Poisons against the Dragon.

https://youtu.be/EUxmhiIw1CY
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Although not ideal due to negative affinity, Big’Un can still be used for Fire Knight 20. He provides AOE Nuke and CC against the waves. He will not be reliable as your solo wave nuker as weak hits can heavily impact his damage and he will die quite easily if you fail to kill the mobs quickly, so having supports that can revive in the team and other DPS champions is crucial to the team. 

He can also reduce the Fire Knight’s TM and place Decrease Speed, but once again, it's not completely dependable due to the possibility of weak hits.

This video show cases an FK team with Big’Un
Gorgorab for Support and revive, 
Stag Knight as debuffer, and 
x2 CH as the secondary wave nukers, Max HP nukers and full TM depletion against the Boss.

https://youtu.be/lTVmoIpNFrM
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In Ice Golem 20, Big’un can control the waves and prevent them from placing the pesky reflect damage buff that can kill your own team on the second wave if you're not careful. 

However, using Big’Un in Ice Golem can be quite dangerous as all his damage is AOE. When attacking the Ice Golem’s side minion, he will also damage the Ice Golem itself. This may proc Frigid Vengeance passive that deals heavy damage to your team while the side minions are still alive. 

Hence you need to build your team with revivers, healers, shield providers, and/or defensive champions. 

The video below shows an example of such team. Big’un is the main DPS champion of the team, 
Gorgorab and Scyl supports the team with heals and revive incase anyone dies,
Stag Knight places decrease defense and attack and 
Mausoleum Mage Increase Defense, Block Debuffs, Cleanse, and Heals.

https://youtu.be/msrf_Nm8DWY

We'll be covering Spider 20, Faction Wars and Nightmare Campaign farming on the next page
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Big’un has AOE CC abilities and he is perfect to control the spiderlings in Spider 20. However, he needs to be geared differently depending on your strategy. 

If you are using the AOE HP burn strategy, you need to gear Big’un with low Attack and Crit Rate. Big’un deals a lot of AOE damage and he may kill the spiderlings before they take a turn and proc the HP Burn. If you are using the Max HP Nuke Strategy with Coldhearts and Royal Guards, then the Big’Un build shown in this guide works fine since killing the spiderlings doesn't negatively affect the run.

The video below shows an example of a Spider 20 team with Big’Un controlling the spiderling with his AOE Stun and TM Control. This team is primarily an AOE Hp burn strategy with Elder Skarg, so Big’un was geared with High Speed and Accuracy with low Attack and Crit Rate. Fayne is in the team to provide debuffs for Elder Skarg to proc his AOE HP Burn, Armiger and Coldheart to control the main Spider’s TM and their Max HP Nuke.

https://youtu.be/61JnNWfVDDw
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Faction War

Big’un is a very strong Ogryn Tribe FW 21 Champion. He one of the best AOE nuker in that faction and provides CC for the waves. 

The only drawback is that he is squishy so healers and/or revivers in your team are needed to keep him alive. Luckily, all players in the game will eventually get Ghrush the Mangler for free and he is one of the best healers for this Faction. Gurptuk is another decent alternative.

This video showcase a full auto Ogryn Tribes FW 21 run with Big’un as the main AOE DPS, 
Double Maneaters for Block Debuff, Unkillable and Control against the boss,
Ghrush for his continuous heal and leech, and 
Occult Brawler for poison DPS against the boss.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEWRz9ZwsWA&t=10m16s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Nightmare campaign

Big’un is one of the few champions in the game that can farm Nightmare Campaign quickly due to his kit and fast animations. 

However he requires good gear to be able to do it. The video below showcases a few run of Nightmare Campaign 12-6 with food champions. 

The Big’un in this video is geared in arena gear (Savage and Cruel shown on the next page) with the Dungeon Masteries (Offense and Accuracy) shown in the first page of the guide. 

Accuracy is needed as his debuffs are very helpful in preventing the mobs from getting a turn. Evil Eye mastery is especially helpful and provides additional TM control to prevent the mobs from taking a turn.

https://youtu.be/U6nlWzNJb0g

The next page showcases the Arena build and the Savage gear used for NM campaign farming in this slide.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Big’un can be a strong Arena Nuker with his solid damage multipliers. 

While he falls behind champions like Trunda in the damage department to vie for a spot in Platinum teams, he has an AOE that can stun and a multi-hit AOE, which is good against Rotos and reduces TM. 

For Arena, Offense and Defense Tree masteries are recommended. In the Offense tree, take the Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Arena damage increasing masteries such as Heart of Glory, Ruthless Ambush, and Opportunist since Big'Un can place stuns. T6 mastery Helmsmasher for a chance to ignore Defense is the best in slot for dps champions that are over 220+ Crit Damage, though not as consistent as Flawless Execution. 

In the Defense tree, Defiant is selected to take Improved Parry to reduce critical hits, then Bloodthirst, Delayed Death, and Harvest Despair since he can stun. Both of the Counterattack masteries are selected for T5. His A1 hits a single target decently hard and the AOEs from counterattacking is quite valuable.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The best set for Arena nukers are Savage and Cruel. 

Big’un benefits from 100% Crit Rate, with as much Attack and Crit Damage as possible with enough speed to match your team. Accuracy is not necessary but can be useful as his debuffs (stuns and TM Control) are strong debuffs to apply to your opponent and can just be the difference between winning and losing. 

Ideally at least 4k Attack, 100% Crit Rate, 200%+ Crit Damage, and 200+ Speed is prefereed. An accuracy of 200+ should be enough to stun the TM boosters, Debuffers, or Nukers since those champions are not usually built with high resistance, but this is definitely not enough against high resistance teams. Remember that his main purpose is to nuke, CC the enemy is secondary and nice if it happens.

Glove: Crit Damage %
Chest: Attack %
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Attack
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Attack
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Big’un is a strong Arena Nuker if you don’t have any dedicated one. He is good for Arena Gold 4 if built as in this showcase.

He has solid damage multipliers, multi-hit AOE that is needed against Rotos who has a passive that prevents him from taking more than 50% of his HP in damage per hit, can stun the enemies, and reduce their TM so your team will most likely be able to go a second time. 

The video showcases a standard Arena team with Arbiter for TM Boost and Increase Attack, Lyssandra for a secondary TM Boost, Madame Serris to remove buffs and place Decrease Defense, and Big’un to nuke in Gold 4 Arena.

https://youtu.be/xFpZmFobc5M
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Narma is a champion that is quite specialized and expensive to use.

She is currently the only Magic Affinity champion in the game who has debuff extension, Decrease ATK, Poisons, Poison Sensitivity and healing all in one unit. She requires a huge amount of books to maximise her potential and the question of wherever it's worth it is open ended and depends on how many resources you have. If you are in a position where you need specifically her kit on Clan Boss she may be worth it.

Narma masteries are usually fairly simple - they're geared towards single-target boss damage on the offence tree, ending in Warmaster T6 that will boost her damage for Clan Boss. 

The support tree is more flexible. Healing masteries were selected in this build to maximize the potential of her ally healing. 

Note that If you're going to run Narma in a speed-tuned CB comp (e.g. Counterattack or Unkillable), it's important to skip Rapid Response and Arcane Celerity if you decide to go on the accuracy side of the support tree because turn meter boosts will mess up the turn order and lead to worse results.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Narma is not f2p or early game friendly. Her book requirement is insane, requiring 16 books that are all very important to maximizing her potential. The stats she requires to be very effective are not easily obtained. Despite this, she does have a higher damage potential than Frozen Banshee, has better utility, as well as better base stats.

What is absolutely essential? Accuracy first and foremost, since all of her skills require accuracy to land her debuffs. The featured Narma has 310 Accuracy which is significantly higher than required for UNM CB simply because she is used in the Doom Tower to farm the Magma Dragon. 220 Accuracy will suffice if you choose to use her for only CB and dungeons. 

High HP is also necessary if you want to maximize her healing potential. At over 61k HP she can drop some very nice heals and reduce the need for lifesteal gear on other clan boss champions in the comp.

Defense is important if you're not running an Unkillable CB comp, and high Crit rate, Crit damage, and attack to boost her dps. Just a note that she only has ~70% crit rate in this build because a 30% Crit Rate Buff is available from Lanakis. If you do not use champions that provide it, aim for 100% Crit rate. 

The sets you choose aren't as important. If you're struggling to keep her alive you can run her in Stalwart or Lifesteal sets. Refresh accessories can be extremely helpful.

Glove: DEF %
Chest: HP %
Boots: Speed 
Ring: DEF
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Attack / Accuracy

Accessories are a great place to freely adjust her stats based on your individual needs. This build used a DEF ring with HP % subs, a Crit damage amulet and an Attack banner.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Narma fills the role of poisoner and single target damage dealer. While she excels against many bosses, she is not as useful in waves of multiple enemies. Her attack down mastery is rare on a poisoner and her poison sensitivity gives the poisons you can stack a little extra power. Her biggest successes will be found when combined with a counter-attack champ and ally attack champs, which will use her a1 to continue to extend debuffs to increase the damage over time.

Narma is capable of achieving two key UNM and on key NM in the right end game teams, e.g. in the video below

https://youtu.be/rb87kxG5z-c

This CB composition is not speed tuned because all of the champons are used elsewhere in the game except for Altan. It relies on good late game+ equipment and synergies to function and achieve these results. As you can see it relies on fast speed, counterattack and ally attack to deal decent damage. Tuned 2:1 teams like this have a much higher damage ceiling.

Valkyrie  265 speed
Lydia  299 speed
Altan  208 speed
Lanakis  285 speed
Narma  207 speed
data.label: Notes:

title: Runekeeper Dazdurk Mid Game Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
Runekeeper is a good choice for your Core team throughout the game. This team can be used essentially in all the dungeons. The first dungeon to tackle before others is Minotaur 15 as the T6 masteries for your Core team are the gateway to better Clan Boss damage and dungeon farming.

The waves and the boss are forgiving, but you still need to have a decent team composition and gear to take it to the end.

Runekeeper can be helpful with his kit by providing healing, removing the debuffs and providing extra healing by applying leech to targets.
Tayrel provides DEF Aura, AOE DEF Down
Royal Hunstman is a damage dealer (can be replaces with your starter for example)
Dhukk can deal decent damage and increase survivability with AOE ATK Down debuff
Grizzled Jarl can also work well in this team thanks to DEF UP buff that increases the damage for the DEF based champions 

https://youtu.be/J1QmwAXnVMs?t=306
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
On dragon 16 Runekeeper is useful for TM increase + leech. In this composition only Jarl and Frozen Banshee are in life steal and the healing is sorely needed to survive. Cleansing the debuffs from the waves and boss (Decrease Atk/Weaken/Poision) and healing is important. 

Dhukk provides Decrease Atk for waves, and this enables Tayrel to case the Sleep deubff on all enemies.
Tayrel provides AOE Decrease DEF. Reliable Decrease ATK on boss is always welcome.
Grizzled Jarl has increase DEF buff that increase dmg of the whole team except Frozen Banshee as they are DEF based. Block debuffs sometimes helps avoid debuffs.
Frozen banshee is the MVP on the boss itself as the Poisons are the most accessible way to DPS Dragon boss stage.

https://youtu.be/J1QmwAXnVMs?t=458
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice golem 15 is yet another area where Runekeeper is useful as cleansing for Freeze and other debuffs in this dungeon is most welcome.

Mass healing allows to survive damage from the waves and the boss especially in this case where the featured composition is negative affinity towards the boss.

Tayrel used for his aura and decrease ATK. 
Dhukk for AOE decrease DEF and ATK on waves as well as Provoke on minions. Chance to decrease ACC on boss on A1 can also be helpful.
Huntsman was the nuker for faster wave clears and instakill one of the minions with dead aim. Positive affinity to place decrease DEF on this stage.
Grizlled jarl for Increase DEF and block debuffs vs freeze 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QwAmzBezpEc&feature=youtu.be
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Arena can be a tough area to excel in and it’s vital for progression both in missions and in great hall. The tiers also provide stat bonuses in all the areas of the game. If you’re struggling in early game and you want to git gud, this guide will help you chart a plan on how to progress properly. This page will focus on early game that is defined as having your starter or campaign farmer solo 12-3 brutal. In arena terms it’s progressing from Bronze to Silver tier.
 
You should be able to reach Silver and we will showcase a recently started 7-day old account that does exactly that.
 
Raid is a turn-based game, and going first gives a huge advantage in arena especially in early game where champion defence tends to be low. To determine which team goes first, Raid introduces the concept of a “turn meter” race. Without going into the complex details the general speed attack team sequence is:

Be Fast: Use 1, and commonly 2 speed boosters to go first for your whole team. This means the first 1-2 champions boosts the speed of your whole team, allowing you to equip powerful slow attack champions to do the real damage and not allowing the enemy to respond!

Atk Up: this step is optional. It helps your main attacker, but step 3 is more important

Defence Down on Enemy Team: Set your nuker to succeed by reducing enemy defence (all enemies).

Nuke:  Use 1 AOE attack to kill all or most enemies, making them unable to recover. Moves 1-3 are simply there to set-up for the final nuke.
 
Short FAQ: 
• You may ask, why not just use 4 attack champions?  Because to get them to go all first, they have to be incredibly fast and will not do much damage, and if they don’t go first then the enemy will kill them easily.
• Is 1 nuker enough?  Absolutely yes if equipped with correct gear (see next slide).
• How fast do my 2 speed boosters have to be?  This depends on your opponent and it is a continuous gear race even at top level.
 
There is a handy flowchart to help consolidate the main points below
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
There are multiple champions that can fill the roles suggested above. For early game, unless you are very lucky, you will probably be using mostly rare champions with 1-2 epics at best. Here is a link to a non-exhaustive list of Epic and rare champions who fit the roles well
 
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/719094660819058739/829065965072810065/unknown.png
 
Gearing is super important. You must have focus on what you want each champion to achieve. Try not to gear them as multi-role champions and instead focus on a singular purpose (fastest champion, highest accuracy champion or hardest hitting champion). 

Speed Aura and Primary Speed Lead (fastest champion): 
Speed Boots, Speed sub-stats for all other gear. Do not care about primary and other stats. Use speed sets for bonus if possible, and Lore of Steel mastery

Secondary Booster (second fastest, generally X% slower than 1., where X is the TM boost value from 1.):
Speed Boots, Speed sub-stats for all other gear, do not care about primary and other stats. Use speed sets for bonus if possible, and Lore of Steel mastery

Defence Down AOE (third fastest, generally Y% slower than 2., where Y is the TM boost value from 2.):
 Speed Boots, Mixture of Accuracy and Speed sub-stats for all other gear, do not care about primary and other stats. Use speed/accuracy/perception (craft in forge) sets for bonus and Lore of Steel mastery

Nuke AOE (slowest 1 speed below 3.):
 [Must be 100% crit rate or 75% crit rate for Starter champions like Kael] Speed Boots, Attack % Chest, Crit rate gloves. For Weapon, Helm, and Shield: use Crit rate, Crit damage, and Attack % sub-stats.
 
Forge and campaign are your best friends to get this equipment. You can farm 5 star Speed boots in brutal campaign for your champions efficiently with your starter and forge can provide the much needed accuracy for you in all areas of the game.
 
You can see the gear on Kael is made up of the starter lifesteal set given to everyone and some perception gear.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Now, let’s put everything we’ve learned to practice.
 
Diabolist is the speed booster and has to be the fastest. You have to play her on manual unfortunately. 
Spirithost provides the speed aura.
Warmaiden provides the AOE Defence down.
Kael nukes. 
 
Note that the levels on everyone except Kael are low. The sequence of your turns and gear are much more important.
 
Note that team power is meaningless from early to late game. You can see it in the victory screenshot below. Team power calculated by favouring resistance over anything else, and since it is irrelevant to both you speed boosters and your nuker, it is actually almost completely irrelevant as an indicator. Unless the enemy team has 300k+ power, indicating they are highly geared for defence, usually it has not meaningful whatsoever. 
 
Don’t worry about legendaries or epics. If you go first and kill everyone does it matter what champion border they have? The vast majority of legendaries in Bronze are not built or utilised correctly and can’t break the sequence of the speed team. Do read up their skills and learn from both your victories and your losses though.
 
You can see the video of attacks with an F2P team below
 
https://youtu.be/JecPqfhxEUs
 
As you can see, the point was to show all battles without picking them. Many legendaries just fell easily to the team. Rotos was an exception however and had wiped out our team instead. Note for the future: avoid unless you know how to deal with his passive. The rest of the teams demonstrate how the results may vary. Refresh often and you will be in silver after you learn to pick your fights.
 
Matchmaking below gold tier takes into account your total player power and your team. This means it’s much more beneficial to follow the early game guide and focus on just a few champions rather than gearing and levelling a whole squad to 50 that you’re not going to use. Pick who will be your core champions in the mid game carefully and check out the mid game arena guide for silver tier action (WIP)

Last but not least Narma is quite good in Faction Wars as she is one of the few champions in that faction with Decrease Atk, healing and Poisons.

https://youtu.be/aS5mJk3dTaE

Tomb Lord is the ultimate carry in this faction with AOE version of Narma's debuffs and additional Speed and TM decreasing abilities to boot.

Sinesha provides mass healing, stuns if wearing a stun set and Increase skill cooldown. Unfortunately she is weak affinity against Valkyries on wave 2.
