Kael provides AOE damage on the Waves and Poisons for the Dragon. 
Frozen Banshee purely for the Poisons on the Dragon. 
Apothecary for support through increase speed and healing. 

https://youtu.be/fi_DChkN-M0?t=96
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Celestial Griffin

Doompriest is an incredibly useful champion, almost a must have against most of the Doom Tower Bosses. Since most of the Doom Tower bosses’ mechanic revolves around the debuffs that they place. Doompriest being able to cleanse them as a passive makes her a valuable champion to have on your team. 

An example of a team used for Hard Stage 90 Celestial Griffin is as follows:

1)        Scyl of the Drakes
2)        Rotos
3)        Norog
4)        Drexthar
5)        Doompriest

Doompriest provides support with constant heals and cleanse the debuffs places and transferred back to your team each turn. Scyl provides additional support to the team also with her constant heals, increase speed, and emergency revives. Norog provide passive team damage reduction and is a secondary DPS for the Boss. His passive is even more effective here at providing the full 25% damage reduction because the Griffin constantly strips buffs. Rotos and Drexthar provide DPS. 

The video below shows this team on full auto farm with 100% Win rate. As you can see, the team can sustain and doesn’t even come close to dying. The team does enough DPS to take down the even before it reaches the max Sky Bond stacks. 

https://youtu.be/68E3FSYfByE?t=517
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Nether Spider

With the change to the Nether Spider’s boss mechanic where full TM reduction strategies are no longer viable, AOE HP Burn strategies are now one of the best strategies to deal with this Boss. The AOE HP Burn strategy revolves around surviving throughout the fight long enough for the HP Burn ticks to kill the Spider. In order to survive long, Debuff cleanse is extremely important component to have in your team and Doompriest provides that.

An example of a team used for Hard Stage 110 Nether Spider is as follows:

1)        Doompriest
2)        Elder Skarg
3)        Venus
4)        Mausoleum Mage
5)        Runekeeper Dazdurk

The team showcased in the video is built to enable the Elder Skaarg HP Burn Strategy in Hard Nether Spider Stage 110. Venus is mainly in the team to provide enough debuffs on the boss to activate Elder Skarg’s AOE HP Burn. Although Venus has a AOE HP Burn herself, her AI will not use it as the spiderlings have counterattack. Doompriest is here for the same utility of providing constant heals and debuff removal. However, Doompriest only cleanses 1 debuff per turn and this Boss is notorious for placing tons of Poisons on your team. Hence, two full debuff cleansers are also used in this team, Mausoleum Mage and Runekeeper Dazdurk. Doompriest help cleanses the debuffs in between both of the full debuff cleanse champions’ cooldowns.

https://youtu.be/fi_DChkN-M0?t=17

The next page with deal with Doompriest in Faction Wars and some other DT Bosses
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Frost Spider

Against the Frost Spider in Doom Tower, Doompriest can cleanse the debuffs the Spider places, especially the Freeze on your team, and provides a constant source of healing.

An example of a team used for Hard Stage 120 Frost Spider is as follows:
1)        Arbiter
2)        Tyrant
3)        Lydia
4)        Mausoleum Mage
5)        Doompriest

This video shows an example of a Stage 120 Hard Doom Tower Frost Spider Boss fight. 

Tyrant provides the main damage through his HP Burns and everyone else is there to support. AOE damage reduction helps on the boss stage.
Mausoleum Mage and Doompriest to cleanse and heal
Arbiter to Heal, Boost TM and revive in case anyone dies, and 
Lydia to block the Frost Spider from Reviving due to the lack of HP burn on the boss.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=578ZNIwFu08&t=4m37s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Eternal Dragon.

The Eternal Dragon is a Final Boss of one of the Doom Tower rotations. He is certainly very difficult to fight for 2 main reasons : 
- your main skills are put on cooldown or blocked 
- the Boss hits extremely hard and his Guards can put Decrease Defense and Provoke on your team

To deal with this, you want champions with strong passives or strong A1. And Doompriest fits this role perfectly as she can remove a debuff on all Allies with her passive, she can cleanse the Decrease Defense from your champions, allowing them to survive and she can provide some healing.

The team showcased was picked with very particular roles in mind : 
- Ursala provides a Speed aura for the team. Built with high Resistance, she can use her skills most of the time to boost survivability with her Decrease Attack, Increase Defense, Strengthen and Revive skills
- Jareg provides a Decrease Attack, very important against this Boss. He also provides Increase Defense, Ally Protection and passively puts up Continuous Heal. He also has decent Resistance to keep his skills as much as possible. Built in Stalwart to mitigate AoE Damage
- Drexthar provides the damage needed to kill the boss with his HP Burn on A1 or from his passive application to ads. Built in Lifesteal to sustain himself against other Bosses as well
- Vrask is the main healer from the team and provides a very strong heal based on his MAX HP on his A1. Built in Stalwart to mitigate AoE Damage
- Doompriest cleanses Decrease Defense and provides a small healing ability. She is built in Relentless to take turns as often as possible.

Overall, the team keeps up Increase Defense, Decrease Attack and Healing throughout the fight to survive against the Eternal Dragon. You only have to target the Boss exclusively and he will never heal himself.

https://youtu.be/nuEJT6iH4k0

Note that this team is not 100% auto reliable and may require tinkering to pass through the hardest stage.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Faction Wars 

Doom Priest can be a decent Faction Wars addition. The healing capabilities each turn are a welcome option and cleansing of Provoke, Block Buffs, DEF Down, ATK Down is a boon on both the hard waves and the boss fight. Additional plus is the ATK Up buff for champions like Faceless that benefit from it and provide more DPS.

In the video below the team showcased consists of

Rector Drath - the ultimate new Epic that can carry the whole FW. Access to Revive and Veil along with healing is a fantastic combination that was the missing piece. Can also be built with some Accuracy for ATK Down

Tomb Lord - the best Legendary in the faction for FW. Provides access to AOE DEF Down, ATK Down along with Decrease Speed and Poisons. Key ingridient in auto runs

Faceless - One of the best single target DPS champions for the faction.

Sinesha - Healing capabilities, stun on A1 with the Stun set and Warmaster for more damage. Guide on her in faction wars is available on the bot

https://youtu.be/g2sQYTtaig8

The next page will deal with Doompriest in a Counterattack CB teams on affinities
data.label: Notes:

title: Doompriest Late Game+ Guide for Clan Boss

data.desc:
If you are using Doompriest for CB, the masteries will be slightly different. 

We will still be taking the Offense and Defense Tree. The offense tree will be the same with taking the Crit Rate, Crit Damage, and all the left CB damage increasing masteries down to T6 Warmaster. The defense tree will also be the same with taking the damage mitigation masteries in Tough Skin, Blastproof, Resurgent and Delayed Death. But for the T5 masteries, avoid Cycle of Revenge as it is a TM boosting Mastery. Doompriest will always be used in a Speed Tuned team so the TM boost will break your rotation. Instead take the CA masteries in Retribution and Deterrence. 

Note: it is suggested to take the Deterrence mastery on all your CB champions in teams with Doompriest as you will be taking the stun so, everyone in your team has a 20% chance to Counterattack for more DPS. On teams that use Block Debuff, the stun never happens so this mastery actually doesn’t do anything.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For this Counterattack CB build, Lifesteal set is a must. 

Defensive stats for the CB level you are hitting are important (3k+ Def for NM, 4k+ Def for UNM) and the speed you need for your CB team depends on your team composition. 

There are many types of CB team Doompriest can be used in but generally, she should be the fastest in your team to take her turn right after the CB so she can cleanse all the debuffs and stun the CB places on your team immediately. 

Glove: Def%
Chest: Def%
Boots: Def %/Speed
Ring: Def
Amulet: Def
Banner: Def
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Doompriest is a great champion to have in your team if you are struggling with the Clan Boss debuffs, specifically the stun and the dreaded decrease speed on the Spirit affinity CB. 

If you build a Doompriest team, a Clan Boss Calculator is recommended to ensure she goes right after the Clan Boss. The benefit of using Doompriest is that your speedtuned team will work on all affinities. A speed tuned team usually suffers when the CB affinity changes with stun targeting and the Decrease Speed debuff which breaks your speedtune during the Spirit affinity boss. The con of using Doompriest is that she doesn’t offer anything other than the debuff cleanse. She does very little damage and the heal she provides is minimal. Your CB damage will be lower than if you were to use another CB champion instead not counting the debuffs. 

The video below shows an example of CB teams with Doompriest on NM and UNM. The first half shows a NM run on Spirit affinity. This a standard CA team that uses double ally protection in Skullcrusher and Tyrant Ixlimor. 

Peydma for Decrease Attack, 
Fayne for Decrease Defense, Weaken, and Poison (Fayne is used here instead of Rhazin because of weak affinity. Rhazin constant weak hits will cause him to miss his debuff and lower the team’s damage output).
Finally, Doompriest is core in this team to cleanse the Decrease Speed and Stun debuff. 

Normally, a standard speedtuned counterattack team will fail due to the decrease speed debuff, but this team is able to function normally because Doompriest is in the team. 

The second half shows an UNM run on Magic affinity. The same team if used with Rhazin instead of Fayne. This team is almost capable of 2-keying UNM. If better CB champions were used like Altan instead of Peydma 2-key is definitely achievable.

https://youtu.be/rnvccZhG5xk

There are some niche uses for Doompriest in Unkillable teams, but you have to look up the specific compositions and gear her differently for those purposes
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ma’shalled is a Spirit affinity Legendary Champion from the Undead faction.

Once a vault guardian, he went from zero to hero after his buff. He is best known for his ability to provide a permanent Increase Speed buff to your team and enabling a variety of 2:1 Clan Boss teams dubbed the White Whale compositions. 

However, aside from his use in Clan Boss, he is also remarkably useful in all dungeon content. He provides team buffs, AOE control through True Fear, Healing through Leech and damage. Booking Ma’shalled can also be relatively cheap if you’re lucky as only his A2 needs to be booked and it only requires one book. This guide will focus on using Ma’shalled in Minotaur, Dragon, Fire Knight, Ice Golem, Arena and Faction Wars. The CB guide is covered separately due to specific speed and setup.

Masteries for Ma’shalled can vary slightly depending on where he will be used. The masteries shown in this guide are specifically for Dungeon PVE and Clan Boss. For this build, the offense and defense tree are selected. 

In the Offense tree, Crit rate, Crit Damage, and all the damage increasing masteries on the left down to T6 Warmaster. For the Defense tree, take the Damage mitigation mastery in Tough Skin, Blastproof, Delayed Death to improve survivability into both T5 counterattack Masteries.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gearing Ma’shalled for Dungeon content is quite straight forward. You want to build with fast enough to go before enemies with enough accuracy to land his debuffs and damage which means Speed, Accuracy, Crit Rate, Crit Damage, and Attack. 

220+ Speed, 220+ Accuracy, 100% Crit Rate, 200%+ Crit Damage, and 4k+ Attack are recommended for Late Game+. Sets are very flexible for Ma’shalled. You can use any stat increasing sets such as Speed, Perception, Cruel, Crit Damage, etc. 

Glove: Crit Rate %/Crit Damage %
Chest: Attack %
Boots: Speed
Ring: Attack
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy/Attack
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Minotaur 15

Minotaur is an area of the game where you can utilize your energy efficiently by farming mastery for a new champion you’re building while leveling them up. Fully Mastering a champion take ~700 Gems worth of Energy refill which is cheaper than the 800 gem to unlock masteries. Additionally, you gain the experience and silver from farming the mastery.

A lv.1 champion will be leveled to lv.53 when you fully Master it. Ma’shalled is one of few champions who can solo farm Minotaur 15 with the champion you’re farming scrolls for. The video below show’s an example of Ma’shalled solo-ing the Minotaur.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-O-aGJIe9w

The next video will cover the build in dungeons
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon

Although Ma’shalled is weak affinity in Dragon 20, he is still perfectly usable there. His CC debuff (True Fear) does not require hitting the enemy so it cannot weak hit. He provides his buffs to speed up your team and increase their damage. However, he will have difficulty dealing damage to the waves, so you shouldn’t use him as your only DPS champions. Bring other champions for the DPS role. 

This video showcases an example of a budget Dragon 20 team. 

Ma’shalled provides the utility mentioned above,
Zargala as the Decrease Def and DPS,
Kael also as DPS and Poisons, 
Frozen Banshee purely for Poisons on the Dragon
Scyl for support.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-O-aGJIe9w&t=0m59s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
With the release of Stage 25 Dungeons, Dragon 25 is now Force affinity and Ma’shalled becomes better here as he is strong affinity here. Stage 25 is much harder than stage 20 and will require better quality champion and gear to efficient farm. 

The video showcases an example of a Dragon 25 team with Ma’shalled providing the same utility as in the previous slide. 
We now have Arbiter for support, healing, TM Boost, and revives,
Stag Knight for AOE Decrease Defense and Decrease Attack,
Ithos for DPS and 
Occult Brawler purely for Poison against the Dragon. 

As you can see, the strategy is still the same, but we are using champions that are better against Force Affinity now. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-O-aGJIe9w&t=2m57s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem 20

Ma’shalled is a good champion for Ice Golem 20. He is great for the waves before we reach the boss. He provides CC debuff (True Fear) and DPS on the waves. He increases your team’s speed and damage with his buffs and places leech so your team can heal up after getting hit by the Ice Golem.

This video showcases an example of a budget Ice Golem 20 team. Ma’shalled provides the utility mentioned above.
Stag Knight provide AOE Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack and Decrease Speed.
Gorgorab and Scyl supports with Increase Attack, TM Boost, healing, and revive if things go south. 
Fenax as a damage dealer with added utility to kill off the minions and block revive. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-O-aGJIe9w&t=9m31s

On the next page we deal with some more dungeons
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fire Knight

Ma’shalled is a great champion for Fire Knight 20. Although he doesn’t have multi hit abilities to help take down the shield, he is great for the waves before we reach the boss. He is strong affinity, provides CC debuff (True Fear) and DPS on the waves. He provides increase speed buffs so your team can lap the Fire Knight and prevent him from taking a turn. 

This video showcases an example of a budget Fire Knight 20 team. 

Ma’shalled provides the utility mentioned above. 
Stag Knight for AOE Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, and Decrease Speed. 
Gorgorab and Scyl supports with Increase Attack, TM Boost, healing, and revive. 
Finally, Coldheart as the must include in all FK 20 teams with her multi-hit A1 and Heartseeker to drop TM and deal massive damage to the Fire Knight. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-O-aGJIe9w&t=5m18s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
With the release of Stage 25 Dungeons, Fire Knight 25 is now Spirit affinity so, Ma’shalled is still usable here. Stage 25 is much harder than stage 20 and will require better quality champion and gear to efficiently farm. Additionally, the Bosses have passives that halves TM reduction on them and limits Max HP Damage to 10% making CH who used the be the number one MVP for Fire Knight, no longer as auto-include here. 

The video showcases an example of a Fire Knight 25 team with Ma’shalled providing the same utility as above. 

We now have Arbiter for support, healing, TM Boost, and revives,
Stag Knight still here for the important AOE Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack and Decrease Speed,
Ithos for DPS and 
Alure to drop the Fire Knight’s TM. 

As you can see, the strategy has changed from the Coldheart Max HP Nuke back to the Alure TM control strategy. One thing to note here is that the first wave of Fire Knight 25 have Gnarlhorns who can place unkillable on themselves. If you are using Alure and your team don’t have a debuff remover, Alure will constantly lower the Gnarlhorn’s TM and you’ll be stuck. Ma’shalled can steal buffs so this team shouldn’t fall into this problem. However, right now his AI doesn't use the skill and we have to wait for this bug to be fixed.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-O-aGJIe9w&t=7m18s

A great solution to the Unkillable Gnarlhorn problem is replacing Arbiter with Gorgorab. Gorgorab provides the same utility as Arbiter and his A1 has the ability to remove enemy buffs. You will need to build Gorgorab with accuracy for this to work. Additionally, Gorgorab does not provide as much TM Boost as Arbiter, so you may need to speed up your team more, especially your Alure.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Faction Wars

Ma’shalled is one of the few champions in the Undead Factions that make Undead FW 21 much easier. The Undead FW 21 is unfortunate enough to have the hardest FW waves with double Martyr and triple Valkyrie. Ma’shalled is capable of CC-ing the Valkyries with his AOE True Fear and can steal the CA and Shield Buffs. 

Note that True Fear only has a 50% chance of proc-ing so, you may still get unlucky and the Valk does their skills anyway.

This video shows an example of an Undead FW 21 team on full auto. As you can see, despite having true fear on the Valkyries, all three of them used their abilities. You may need to restart the run if you get too unlucky and need three stars. This run was able to recover due to Gorgorab heal and revive.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6qWk2pCUri0

The next slide will feature Ma'shalled in Arena Gold IV
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
While Ma’shalled can be scary in Arena for mid-game level players this is usually due to their team setups. He is not the best arena champion because he is not specialized as a nuker or debuffer. 

He is a conditional nuker and a conditional CC champion. If you want him to nuke with his AOE, he needs to land his Leech on all enemies first, which means he needs accuracy. If you build him with accuracy, his damage stats will suffer and will most likely not do enough damage to nuke the enemies. Without accuracy, all his abilities are just single target hits with no added effect which makes him terrible for arena in Late Game+ setting and Platinum for example.

On the other hand, if you build him as a CC champion with high speed and accuracy another problem appears with his type of CC. True Fear only has a 50% chance to proc. This means that even if you land your True Fear on all enemies, you are still depending on RNG for the True Fear to proc. You may get unlucky, and the True Fear does absolutely nothing.

If you do decide to use him for Arena the following masteries are suggested: In the Offense tree Arena nuker masteries in Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Heart of Glory, Ruthless Ambush, down to T6 Helmsmasher (if you have 100% Crit Rate and over 220%+ Crit Damage). 

We then take the Support tree for the accuracy masteries, and most importantly Evil Eye. Evil eye will proc the single target version on all enemies (20% TM reduction) on Ma'shalled.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Although he is not viable at high level arena, he can still be used Pre-Gold 4 or lower Gold 4 Arena if you don’t have better champions. 

This video shows an example of a team with Ma’shalled used in Gold 4 Arena. The champions used are Arbiter, Seeker, Psylar, and Ma’shalled. The strategy of this team is to Control the enemy team and slowly chip at the enemy rather than a speed nuke. 

Arbiter TM Boosts, 
Seeker is the secondary TM Boost and provokes a priority target, usually the enemy Arbiter. 
Psylar then Decreases the enemy TM and Speed. 
Ma’shalled then uses his True Fear and asses the situation to decide whether to AOE (If all the enemies got True Feared) or A3 to single target nuke a priority target (the one that is not True Feared or their Nuker). 

As you can see, the arena fights are not auto. All battles were manual and decisions were made based on the situation of the fight.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-O-aGJIe9w&t=11m30s

If you are struggling against Ma'shalled you have a number of options. Going first against a team with him makes short work of him due to the low health pool. Having block debuffs helps mitigate most of the CC capabilities as well
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Reserved.

The next page deal with Ma'shalled in Clan Boss
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Jintoro is a Magic affinity Legendary Champion from the Shadowkin faction. 

He is a champion built for dealing single target damage and has found himself a spot among the top Clan Boss DPS champions in the game. Apart from offering damage his A3, Oni’s Rage, includes Decrease Defense and Weaken debuffs that are crucial to all CB teams. This ability has a unique mechanic where every 4th use of this ability against a single target will deal a burst of 5 hits instead of 1, making this ability the highest single target damage ability in the game! His A2, Blood Freeze synergizes with it by lowering the CD on this ability on Clan Boss allowing for more use of his A3 throughout the fight. Outside of Clan Boss, his A2 steals 100% of the target’s turn meter that is useful against certain bosses and lets him cycle his turns quicker.  

Booking Jintoro is necessary as he needs both of his skill cooldowns lowered. Additionally, Jintoro is all about dealing damage, so getting the damage increase from books matters for maximum Damage output.

This guide will showcase Jintoro in 3 different Clan Boss builds: Bateater, Easy Double Maneater, and a standard non-unkillable Counterattack teams. 

Masteries on Jintoro will be the standard CB Masteries and the will remain the same across all builds. We will take the Offense and Defense tree. In the Offense tree, take Crit Rate, Crit Damage and all the CB damage increasing masteries on the left down to Warmaster. Life drinker is an important mastery to take for lifesteal when under 50% Health so Jintoro can lifesteal and enable the counterattack mastery on the Defense Tree. In the Defense Tree, take the Damage mitigation mastery in Tough Skin, Blastproof, Delayed Death, into both T5 counter attack masteries in Retribution and Deterrence.

This set of Masteries works for both Unkillable and Non-unkillable teams.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gearing Jintoro will depend on the style of CB team you use him in. 

This first build in this guide will be for Jintoro as the main DPS champion in the Bateater team. Since Bateater is a speed tuned team, the most important stat on him is his speed. You need him to be in the Bateater DPS speed range of 218-227. Unkillable allows us to forego any defensive stats priorities.

Then as a Damage dealer, you want to build him to do as much damage as possible, which means 100% Crit Rate, 200%+ Crit Damage, at least 4k+ attack, and at least 220+ accuracy to land his debuffs. The Bateater team is unique in that it allows the use of Relentless set on your DPS champion. So, if you have the gear for it, Relentless set is highly recommended. If not, any set that will get you the stats you need will work. 

Glove: Crit Damage 
Chest: ATK %
Boots: Speed/ATK %
Ring: Attack
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Accuracy/Attack
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
These are the speeds used for this Bateater team featuring Jintoro as the DPS champion:

219 Jintoro
249 Seeker
240 Pain Keeper 
268 Maneater 
240 Maneater

This is the standard Bateater team with Jintoro as the DPS champion. The main difference with using Jintoro as the DPS is that he has a passive that increases the TM he gains so, the initial setup before going on auto is different. The setup for all champions are the same except Seeker. You need to delay Seeker’s A2 one turn, that’s it. Then the run will be full auto from there.
 
This team works on UNM, NM and Brutal on all affinities.

This video showcases this team in action and easily smashing through 1 Key in Ultra Nightmare CB

https://youtu.be/1MZF6Jwxb9A

More information about the Bateater team can be found here: https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/BatEater

The next slide will feature Jintoro in an Easy Double Maneater team

data.desc:
Easy Double Maneater Setup

The masteries for this build are covered on the previous page. 

The second build will be for Jintoro as one of the 3 DPS champions in an Easy Double Maneater unkillable team. 

The most important stat for any unkillable team is the correct speed. In this team, Jintoro needs to be between 171–175 speed. Then as a Damage dealer, you want to build him to deal as much damage as possible. This entails 100% Crit Rate, 200%+ Crit Damage, at least 4k+ attack, and at least 220+ accuracy to land his debuffs. 

The set recommended for Jintoro in this team is Reflex + Cruel. Reflex has a chance to lower ability cooldowns allowing Jintoro frequently use his A3 throughout the fight but any combination of damage dealing sets like Savage, Cruel, Offense or Crit Damage will also suffice if you do not have this set.

The build showcased here only has 70% Crit Rate because he is used in a team with Kreela who provides a constant 30% Crit Rate buff.

data.desc:
Easy Double Maneater 

This is an example of the Easy Double Maneater team that features Jintoro, Turvold, and Kreela as the DPS champions. 

The speed settings used for this team are:

172 Jintoro
170 Kreela 
153 Turvold 
216 Maneater 
214 Maneater

The is a team combination that takes advantage Kreela’s increase Crit Rate buff allowing the team to be built with 70% Crit Rate. This allows everyone in this team to be built much better with the reduced stat requirement. 

Jintoro provides the Decrease Defense and Weaken.
Kreela provides Ally Attack and Increase Attack and Crit Rate buff for the all Attack-based team. 
Turvold bring pure damage and does not need to be built with accuracy since Jintoro provides the debuffs. 
The two Maneaters provide permanent Block Debuffs and Unkillable for the team to function and are built in Toxic set for added damage.

This team works on UNM, NM, and on all affinities.

This video showcases this team in action and easily hitting 1 Key in Ultra Nightmare CB

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1MZF6Jwxb9A&t=6m03s

If you do not have a Turvold, you can find a speed tune without a Turvold (Just replace Turvold with another DPS champion) here:
https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/Easy-Double-Maneater

The next page covers Jintoro in a classic CA team
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Jintoro is a champion built for dealing single target damage and has found himself a spot among the top Clan Boss DPS champions in the game. Apart from offering damage his A3, Oni’s Rage, includes Decrease Defense and Weaken debuffs that are crucial to all CB teams. This ability has a unique mechanic where every 4th use of this ability against a single target will deal a burst of 5 hits instead of 1, making this ability the highest single target damage ability in the game! His A2, Blood Freeze synergizes with it by lowering the CD on this ability on Clan Boss allowing for more use of his A3 throughout the fight. Outside of Clan Boss, his A2 steals 100% of the target’s turn meter that is useful against certain bosses and lets him cycle his turns quicker.  

Booking Jintoro is necessary as he needs both of his skill cooldowns lowered. Additionally, Jintoro is all about dealing damage, so getting the damage increase from books matters for maximum Damage output.

This guide page will showcase Jintoro in a Counterattack team. If you unfortunately do not have the champions to build a good unkillable team, Jintoro is still perfectly usable as a DPS champion in a Standard non-unkillable Counter-attack team. 

Masteries on Jintoro will be the standard CB Masteries and the will remain the same across all builds. We will take the Offense and Defense tree. In the Offense tree, take Crit Rate, Crit Damage and all the CB damage increasing masteries on the left down to Warmaster. Life drinker is an important mastery to take for lifesteal when under 50% Health so Jintoro can lifesteal and enable the counterattack mastery on the Defense Tree. In the Defense Tree, take the Damage mitigation mastery in Tough Skin, Blastproof, Delayed Death, into both T5 counter attack masteries in Retribution and Deterrence.

This set of Masteries works for both Unkillable and Non-unkillable teams.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
In this team Jintoro will have to be built more defensively rather than full offense. In a team will Ally Protection and/or Increase Defense, it is recommend to have around 3k+ Defense before focusing on damage. Once you have achieve the recommended Defense level, focus on his damage. You want to aim for 100% Crit Rate, 200%+ Crit Damage, 4k+ attack, at least 220+ accuracy to land his debuffs and enough speed to match your team’s speed tune. 

Lifesteal set is a must for non-unkillable teams, unless you have Leech or the Bloodthirst set. You can then pair the set with any other set like Cruel, Offense, Perception, Crit Damage or Speed that will help you achieve the recommended stats. You can mix and match Attack and Defense pieces to achieve the stats you need.

Glove: Crit Damage 
Chest: Def %/ ATK %
Boots: Speed/ ATK % / Defense %
Ring: Attack / Defense
Amulet: Crit Damage

data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Standard non-unkillable CA 

This is an example of a standard non-unkillable CA team designed to make full use of Jintoro:

Sepulcher Sentinel 252: 
Kreela 229: 
Skullcrusher 191: 
Rhazin 175: 
Jintoro 176: 

The is a team combination that takes advantage of Kreela’s increase Crit Rate buff allowing the team to be built with 70% Crit Rate and Increase Crit Damage to boost Jintoro’s damage. This allows everyone in this team to be built much better with the reduced stat requirement. Sepulcher provides the Decrease Atk and block debuff. We have Kreela and Sepulcher running at a 4:3 to permanently provide the Increase Crit Rate/Attack for the team, and always block the stun. Skullcrusher for team Counterattack buff and Ally Protection. Rhazin and Jintoro provides the DPS and redundant Decrease Def and Weaken.

We have all the necessary buffs and debuffs needed for a solid CB team. As with all Standard CA teams, this team does not work on Spirit due to the slow speed debuff. However, this team can be affinity friendly if you replace Rhazin with a Buff extender like Godseeker Aniri or Sandlashed Survivor. If you make them use their buff extension ability after the stun, they will extend the block debuff to also block the affinity debuff. However, while it may block the Decrease Speed Debuff, Sepulcher is still weak affinity to Spirit, so she will weak hit a lot and may miss the crucial Atk Down causing the run to wipe.

This video shows this team in action easily hitting the 2-key threshold on UNM.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1MZF6Jwxb9A&t=11m07s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Melga Steelgirdle is an Epic HP based champion from the Dwarves faction. She was very well received when she was first introduced into Raid she enabled many people to clear Faction Wars stage 21 for Dwarves (considered one of the hardest, and the only other reviver was Maulie, a legendary with only a single target revive)

This guide will mainly cover Faction Wars and dungeons 20 (Hard Doom Tower bosses will be covered later). In these showcases, slower teams (no Seer one shot team etc)  will be used so we can see her support capabilities.

Booking her A2 and A3 for the cooldowns is needed for optimal results. Her A1 has a 75% chance to remove a random debuff from a random ally when booked is not game changing enough so if you could upgrade other skills without booking this, don't spend extra books. 

Her A2 places a 2 turn Continuous heal of 15% and a 2 turn shield equal to 20% of her max HP on a 3 turn cooldown when booked is what keeps the team alive. Her A3 revives 2 random allies with 20% HP and 20% TM, and places a 2 turn shield of 30% of their HP on a 5 turn cooldown is a very good safety net for contents such as FW.

Melga is a support that doesn't deal massive damage so in term of masteries, we can go defense and support. Defense tree to maximize her survivability and Support tree to improve her healing (Healing masteries work with continuous heal). This mastery build is more PvE focused so Blastproof is selected over Improved Parry. 

For Hard Doom Tower, you prefer 350+ resistance for higher stages, which is why Unshakeable is chosen as the T6 final mastery. If your gear allows for it Timely Intervention as T6 can be selected instead to cycle the turns more often. Finally, if the protection she provides is not sufficient you could also opt in for T6 Bulwark mastery specifically for Faction Wars as the other alternative
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
As a reviver and healer, you want to be able to keep Melga alive and allow her to use her skills often. 

Sufficient stats would be around 220+ Resistance for dungeons 20. For top floors of Doom Tower 350+ resist would be best. Spee-wise 220+ speed to cycle through her skills would be best. HP is the next priority as it benefits her shield directly and makes her less likely to be a target. Accuracy is not needed for Melga.

Shield set can be used to provide more protection for your team as the start of each round. Alternatively Immortal and/or Regeneration sets are also great to keep her HP high through out the fight. In this guide, she was tested with the new DT set, the Guardian set that provides her 10% healing when she takes a turn (a bit like the Regeneration set) with the extra 10% damage mitigation for your entire team. The effect is pretty noticeable in dungeon runs. However, Melga is not picky and can work with any set combination as long as you reach the required stats. 

As for accessories, many sets can be useful in different situation. Bloodshield from CVC acts as a fail safe against Scarab king as it does not trigger his counter attacks. Refresh accessories can allow her to spam her support skill more often. And Cleansing accessories can be great against Nether Spider.

Glove : HP%
Chest : Resistance/HP%
Boots : Speed/HP% (if good speed substats)
Ring : HP/DEF 
Amulet : HP/DEF
Banner : Resistance/HP/DEF, speed substats
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Melga is one of the best epics for Dwarves Faction Wars and enables comfortable runs on the 21st Crypt.

She is showcased in a composition without legendary champions. 

Her role here is to work in tandem with Rearguard Sergeant to keep the team topped up on HP and to protect them on waves and against boss. The Guardian set allows her to redirect some damage from Rearguard Sergeant to herself during RGS ally protection phase.

Rockbreaker provides control on the waves with his provoke and frost set.

Kurzad in a stun set gratns more CC and keeps the damage in check.

Rugnor works as the main damage dealer and was the tank in this run because the HP tuning was off. He does enough damage to heal up from his Leech, and the Guardian set on Melga kept him alive during the critical moments.

https://youtu.be/ijF88n6TGlA

The next page will feature Melga in Dungeons 20
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Melga works very well in Ice Golem dungeon. In this comp, she is the only healer of the team and provides damage mitigation to help your team get through the boss. Stag Knight and Fenax are champions very often seen in IG because of what they bring to the table. 

Stag brings AOE ATK Down and DEF Down on a very short cooldown, Def down allows you to do more damage and atk down is very important against the boss to lessen the pain. 
Fenax can provide an AOE Block buffs, very useful on the second wave to block the reflect damage buff from the Terrorbeasts. He also brings a very hard hitting A1 with block revive property, very useful on boss stage to keep him from reviving his minions.
Skullcrown's role was to deal some AOE damage and Achak works as a CC that passively boosts the TM of the team.

This composition lacks masteries such as Warmaster or Giantslayer as well as Enemy Max HP skills so it is not exactly the fastest. The goal was to showcase Melga's support capabilities during long fights.

https://youtu.be/7NqiGcoR5VY
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Melga is perfectly usable on Fire Knight 20 if you are in need of a reviver.

While her support abilities are very good and the enemies are hitting Alure or Coldheart for less she doesn't bring much to the table. Melga has no TM manipulation, no speed buff or debuff and no multi hit skill. 

However, if you have every aspect covered for FK, but your team is too squishy and need a someone to protect the team she can work well.

Stag Knight provides AOE DEF Down and ATK Down for waves and Decrease Speed for the boss
Alure keeps the TM down of the boss permanently with her A1
2 Coldhearts provide multi-hit A1, TM depletion and MAX HP nukes

https://youtu.be/VAMhvC9fMAE
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Despite being negative affinity, Melga can still work on Dragon 20 for the same purpose. 

If you can keep Frozen Banshee alive on the boss, a win is guaranteed since spamming poisons works well at that stage. 
Tayrel provides AOE DEF Down and ATK Down on the boss
Skullcrown provides AOE Damage for faster wave clearing
Achak provides crowd control and more survivability

https://youtu.be/DZbrXpXwrhY

The next page will cover Melga on Spider and in Doom Tower
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In Spider 20 Melga can heal the team, putting up a shield to mitigate some damage and offer a revive if needed. 

However, she does not provide extra utility like Scyl of the Drakes for instance so she is certainly not the best in slot for this dungeon. 

Achak here works as a negative affinity tank, TM booster and CC
Stag Knight provides AOE DEF Down for the CH and atk down to reduce incoming damage
Two Coldhearts provide TM control and a a MAX HP nuke

https://youtu.be/OKEu6JqpIQI
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Doom Tower is a new and challenging content on waves, in Secret Rooms and with special requirements or against bosses. Melga stays relevant in some of them. Two Secret Rooms on Hard difficulty are relevant for her in the first Frozen Spider Doom Tower rotation: Spirit Epics only Secret Room and HP champion only Secret Room.

Spirit Epics SR is the easier of the 2 because waves are significantly weaker. Thus you can very well bring Melga in with very fragile champions and still clear it pretty easily. 

The team showcased here is Deacon (TM manipulation and DEF Down), Melga (general support) and Fenax (damage dealer)

https://youtu.be/tJl9iuOp72s

HP SR on the other hand is much tougher if you lack options. Miscreated Monster is a very popular option but he can very well die because of his Ally Protection, and if it happens early, things will get even more difficult for you. 

The team showcased here has 

Samar and Mortu (damage)
Miscreated Monster (Stun, Ally Protection, damage)
Melga (Healing, Revive) and 
Vogoth (Provoke, Healing). 

Here both Vogoth and Melga are wearing the Guardian set to help protect the team and help Miscreated Monster during his Ally Protection phase. Note that this set is doing wonders here but you certainly don't need it, Regeneration or Immortal are enough to keep Melga alive. Revive makes it a safe auto-run in both cases.

Notice the large amount of healing Melga did during this long run (almost 2.4m)

https://youtu.be/Rr9Lnp34jMk
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Melga can be useful on some DT bosses as well. The team for Nether Spider showcased is the typical Drexthar + Cleansers team. You are basically keeping Drexthar alive to kill the Spider with the AOE HP Burn :

- Drexthar : ACC aura, HP burn. In Lifesteal to be relevant against other bosses as well. For a specific Nether Spider build, Frost + Frosbite or all Frostbite is very good to freeze the Spiderlings and less likely to get attacked by them)

- Reliquary Tender : Cleanser and Reviver. Relentless set to cleanse more often. Regeneration or Speed otherwise. Alternative : Mausoleum Mage, Hakkorhn Smashlord.

- Doompriest : Cleanser, Relentless. Else Speed set. Alternative : Mausoleum Mage, Hakkorhn Smashlord.

- Vogoth : Healer, Guardian and Bulwark mastery for the synergy with Melga to keep the team alive. Else Immortal. Alternative : Scyl of the Drakes, Vrask, Lugan the Steadfast etc

- Melga : Reviver, Healer, Guardian set. Her A1 is not hugely impactful

Cleansing accessories are very helpful.

Scyl team : https://youtu.be/dl64HY6eCaA

Vogoth team : https://youtu.be/0GORv4ZTBG8

For the Scarab King, a tanky resist comp is showcased here. It is not the preferred farming team because it is more RNG heavy, but can be used for a first clear. 

- Brogni : Resist aura, Shield, Block debuffs. Shield set.

- Melga : Shield, Heal and Revive

- Sandlashed : Buff extension, Ally Protection when they get low

- Stag Knight : Decrease Speed, Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack. Destroy set.

- Armiger : TM control, MAX HP nuke. Destroy set.

For Hard Floor 100 specifically, everyone has 350+ resist with aura and 350+ accuracy. The combination of Brogni, Sandlashed and Melga keeps shield up for most of the time. Else the team can still tank some hits.
Bloodshield accessories are very helpful for this stage.

https://youtu.be/GwdYMQk4cZU
data.label: Notes:

title: Ursala the Mourner Late Game Guide

data.desc:
Ursala the Mourner is an extremely powerful champion and a crucial addition to the Bannerlords faction. Her introduction has allowed people to safely 3 star Faction Wars crypt 21 as currently the only other reviver in the faction was Raglin, a void legendary. She can work well in a support role in other content as well.

This guide will mainly focus on PvE contents such as Faction Wars and dungeons. 

Ursala has an impressive kit for survivabillity. Her A1 can reduce Turn Meter. This can be useful but not very reliable. Her A2 offers an AOE Decrease ATK on enemies and Increase ATK on the team. Her A3 is one of the most powerful revives in the game because it combines high HP, TM and strong defensive buffs (DEF up + Strengthen) upon revival.

However, there are a few things to note for this last skill. These defensive buffs are incredibly strong for Clan Boss, but the odd cooldown does not allow her to offer 100% uptime in regular tunes. Moreover, she fills her allies' TM on revive so using her against Grythion the Celestial Griffin (Doom Tower boss) is usually not advisable as he will gain the combined TM fill as well.

For masteries, Defense and Support trees are used here for a pure support build for PvE contents other than Clan Boss. If you want to use her in CB, offense down to Warmaster and Defense or Support depending on your needs is the way to go. The Defense tree to maximise her survivability and the Support tree to add some accuracy and extend buffs. 

For Hard Doom Tower 350+ resistance is preferred for higher stages, so Unshakeable can be selected to meet that requirement. In this guide Timely Intervention was picked as T6 because the Resistance stat was achieved using gear and TI allows her to get her turns more often.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
One of Ursala's biggest weakness is that she doesn't have a skill to heal herself. 

For dungeons 20+, you want around 220+ Resistance. 350+ for higher Doom Tower stages. In terms of Speed, over 200 would be best for her to cycle through her skills and lap waves. As for Accuracy to take advantage of her TM and atk down skill, 220+ for dungeons 20 and 350+ for Doom Tower Hard is required. 

Everything else should go to her Defense and HP. As you can see, Ursala can be hard to gear on higher stages if you want to use her as a debuffer while keeping her support capabilities high. The build showcased here is for a pure support/buffer Ursala. The debuffs are usually covered by other champions.

For sets, Immortal and/or Regeneration are great on her as it allows her to keep her HP high, survive and revive. You can also opt for Speed, Perception or even Relentless if you run a healer with Ursala.

As for accessories, Refresh and Cleansing can be useful but not mandatory. With her low base DEF, using DEF main stat on her accessories is advisable to shore up this weakness.

Gloves : HP%/DEF%
Chest : Resistance/HP%/DEF%
Boots : Speed
Ring : DEF
Amulet : DEF
Banner :  Resistance/DEF/Accuracy
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
For Faction Wars, before Ursala was released everything revolved around healing and crowd controling your enemies to keep the whole team healthy as you could not allow any champion to die if you wanted to achieve 3 stars. Ursala has made it significantly more comfortable to clear this crypt including auto-runs. 

Ursala is able to revive any fallen champion and increases the team survivability. Black Knight provides extra healing and consistent Defense up for the whole team.

Stag Knight, a staple in this faction, takes care of debuffing and dealing damage alongside Baron.

Archmage Hellmut provides offensive buffs and some crowd control.

To make the run smoother and faster, we'll target the Rowan-like adds on the right of the screen. 

https://youtu.be/L6gPPx2JLF0

On the next page Ursala is featured in dungeon runs
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon 20 is still one of the most important an popular dungeons from mid-game to end-game. Ursala relevant and her kit can help supplement many types of teams. 

Ursala provides DEF Up and Strengthen buffs and an ATK down debuffs to ensure the team survives better on the waves and the boss. Revive is available as a failsafe and void affinity means she can easily ensure stable runs. She also provides an ATK up buff to help Kael hit harder.

Tayrel provides AOE DEF down and single target ATK down.

Apothecary provides the Speed buff and TM boost for the whole team

Kael provides AOE damage on waves. Working in pair with Frozen Banshee, they keep the Dragon constantly poisoned and to pass the boss with ease.

https://youtu.be/sGTlnDIgeqo
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fireknight 20 is another dungeon that is key to high-power sets like Savage and Immunity for Late Game+ 

Ursala supporting capabilities can also help in those runs and the bonus TM control is somewhat helpful at the boss stage.

Coldheart brings a 4 hit A1 and keeps the Fire Knight from taking a turn with her TM depletion and MAX HP Nuking ability.

Armiger helps keep the tm down

Stag Knight provides AOE DEF Down and Decrease Speed debuff on the boss

Apothecary helps the team cycle through their turn faster

https://youtu.be/jjPO5Qp4AFY
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem 20 is a dungeon that truly benefits from a reviver such as Ursala because your champions can easily die by killing themselves on wave 2 because of the Reflect Damage or at the boss stage when the retaliation passive of the boss activates. 

Fenax provides Block revive that is very helpful against this boss and can also prevent wave 2 from putting up Reflect Damage with his Block Active Skill or Block Buffs debuff.

Vogoth provides extra protection with his constant healing. He can also provoke the second wave.

Frozen Banshee puts poisons on the boss for extra damage.

Stag Knight provides AOE DEF Down and Decrease Speed debuff on the boss

https://youtu.be/G0IoWycyAH4

Spider 20 is covered on the next page of the guide
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ursala is useful in the Spider den, but falls off past stages 20 if you don't have extra means to protect the team such as a big shield from Miscreated Monster or equivalents. Her ATK down debuff combined with her DEF up and Strengthen significantly improve your spider tank survivability.

The team showcased here is based on a budget AOE HP Burn and TM reduction strategy as the main engines. 

Psylar provides the Speed down debuff and TM control of the Spiderlings. She also brings an ACC Down debuff to ensure your tank can resists the poisons without stacking too much resistance.

Apothecary keeps the team TM boosted and provides extra healing on the Spider tank. 

Armiger provides TM control on his A1 and an Enemy MAX HP skill on his A2.

Ultimate Galek provides AOE HP Burn (enabled by Ursala's ATK buff on him) and some extra TM control. 

Ultimately, the team kept the boss from ever taking a turn

https://youtu.be/417yw0XnDYA
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Arena is a very important part of the progress missions and often time the roadblock for many players. Ursala can work in different compositions to help you achieve victory. This part of the guide showcases her in 2 types of teams : Speed team designed to go first and a tank team designed to go second and retaliate (Resistance can be useful but not mandatory if you have a good line up for it)

Starting with go second teams, Seeker, Sandlashed Survivor and Vogoth are budget epic staples for these comps: 

- Seeker in a Shield set puts up a Defense Up buff when hit by a critical hit and makes the team take much less damage (Lead or second position because of AOE hit order is strongly preferred). He can be Replaced with any high HP champion in a shield set. 
- Sandlashed puts up Ally protection when a champion loses too much HP and prevents the team from being wiped.
- Vogoth, an incredible healer in a Guardian set to give more protection to the team. 
- Rhazin was chosen as the nuker for this composition

If you don't have Sandlashed or Vogoth, using 2 champions in a Shield set is possible and you should avoid buff removers such as Serris or Sethalia if you're running it.

A Defense based nuker is preferred because they can survive the attack from the opponents and their damage benefits directly from her defensive buffs. 

Examples :

Ursala + Vogoth : https://youtu.be/Mj0h9Q67lZ4

Ursala + Vogoth against blender : https://youtu.be/6xBbxlI14X0

Ursala + Sandlashed : https://youtu.be/qjM3tJvaN5I
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Speed teams are certainly the most common and popular choices for arena offense and Ursala can slot in perfectly too. The template for such a team is : A speed and/or TM booster, a buffer (Increase Attack or Defense, depending on what your nuker requires), a debuffer (AOE Decrease Defense) and finally a damage dealer.

The team showcase here follows that model:

- Lyssandra provides a Speed aura and good AOE TM manipulation. She can be replaced with Arbiter, Gorgorab, High Khatun etc

- Ursala is very good in this spot as she can buff either Attack or Defense, allowing her to enhance most nukers' damage. Her other skills are not wasted as she also increases your survivability in case your team has failed to finish off the opponent. Increase Defense was used here to make Rhazin hit harder.

- Uugo works as an AOE Decrease Defense. She also brings a backup revive (or heal) and a Block Buffs debuffs that is extremelt useful against Seeker, Skullcrown and any teams that rely on buffs. She should be placed in the last position to reach maximum potential

- Rhazin was the nuker here. Any strong AOE damage works. 

https://youtu.be/LDtc43CttDU

The next page covers Ursala in dungeons 25 setting
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ursala can work in a progression setting for dungeons 25. In Dragon's Lair we showcase a team where the goal is to bring Aothar to the boss and keep him alive, his poisons will take care of the rest. 

To enable this Ursala with her buffs and debuffs along with revive will ensure Aothar and any other team member survive.

Fenax takes care of the waves and Stag Knight places Decrease Defense and Attack to guarantee a good result.

Deacon Armstrong provides a back up Defense Down and slows down the enemies. 

The combination of Ursala, Stag Knight and Deacon provides constant Decrease Attack and Defense on the enemies making it a reliable, though not the fastest combination.

https://youtu.be/XcZmeoDuhDI
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem 25 can be a very difficult dungeon because the boss hits extremely hard and the adds are also tanky. 

The strategy once again relies on Aothar and his poisons to kill the boss. It's also safer because Poisons don't trigger the boss' counter attack passive.

Ursala keeps the team alive and provides the Decrease Attack that can prove crucial for this dungeon. Her revive and defensive buffs mostly shine against the boss here because the team has total control over the waves.

Tayrel provides defense down with an upside of placing an AoE sleep debuff if the enemies are under Decrease ATK (placed by Ursala)

Miscreated Monster provides ally protection and stun to add more crowd control as well as big shields for extra safety.

Achak helps with the crowd control and extends the Strengthen uptime. Additioinal Block Debuffs is also welcome.

The run is by no mean fast, but it is safe. This team will not be a viable farm team, but if you need to auto stage 25 for missions, it might be worth considering running something similar. 

https://youtu.be/O9wRbbXWxJc
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Stages 21+ have reduced TM control effects on bosses but this is still the go to strategy for the Fire Knight dungeon. 

Enough TM control is required, and the shield on the boss stage has increased from 10 to 12. With that in mind, Ursala is featured in two teams. The first one has 2 Coldhearts, and the second has Fenax instead of 1 CH. 

First team : 
Deacon Armstrong : TM manipulation, double hit a1 and defense down, he fills different roles which is always welcome especially for higher stages
Alure : TM queen, she will keep the boss from ever taking a turn once his shield is down
CH : Wave clear, TM control and damage on boss. She brings a 4 hit a1, and with her improved AI, will bring down the shield reliably
Ursala : Some TM control, atk down and defensive buffs to help the team survive. She allows us to bring very fragile champions and no crowd control.

https://youtu.be/BSEjT7PTJzE

Second team has Fenax instead of 1 CH to make wave clearing faster. However, Fenax only has double hit on his a1 if the enemy is under debuff, which is never the case for the first turn on boss. This team might be faster, but bringing down the shield is more difficult. Ursala pulled off a very critical TM reduction when the shield went down during this run.

https://youtu.be/gNaQXdxZfVo
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Candraphone is probably the most vicious go-second nuker in the current Platinum Arena metagame. 

Candraphone addresses one of the hardest issue for a go-second team: how do we balance enough defence to survive and still do enough damage to win? Whilst building strong defensive champions are a solution, Candraphone is one of the few attack champions (e.g. Rotos) that can do insane damage while having great survival skills. His abilities provide excellent potential for this:

1.     [Veiled Defence] A4 passive places Perfect Veil (cannot be targeted and receives 15% less aoe damage) when enemy TM is filled – ideal for a go second team. Furthermore, he receives +40% less damage when veiled. This is equivalent to a 49% aoe damage reduction and can’t be targeted. 
2.     [Force Affinity] Force affinity makes him better against magic nukers (Trunda, Foli, Rae).
3.     [Vicious Damager] When Candra is protected by Veil his damage is increased by 40% - this means his multipliers are: A1) double hit =12x, and A2) 7.4x. He also gains TM when damaged under veil, so his speed does not need to be too fast. He is especially effective when counter attacking using his A1 on buffed enemy champions – often hitting for 2x 120k damage on Defence champions.

Candraphone masteries are selected to boost his damage and rely on team mates and gear to provide sufficient damage reduction to survive the first volley from the enemies.

[Helmsmasher] is the key T6 mastery. In Late Game+ setting and especially when gearing for Platinum it's assumed you're able to reach at the very least 100% Crit Rate, 250%+ Crit Damage along other stats. In those circumstances Helmsmasher provides the best possible DPS increase out of all available masteries. If you're below 220% Crit Damage consider selecting Flawless Execution for more consitency.

[Ruthless Ambush] and [Bring it Down] are great for the initial A2 nuke. [Retribution] and [Deterrence] are the target defence tree masteries to maximize counter attack opportunities using his amazing A1.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
It is most common to build Candraphone for Platinum Arena in either Swift Parry for a survival go-second team (see videos) or in Savage. The secondary set should be cruel if you can manage it. 

No accuracy is required and try to not worry about speed in a go-second setup. Therefore, if no speed tuning or accuracy is needed, full damage build should aim for 5-6k attack, 260+% crit damage, 200ish speed, and of course 100% crit rate, making this build reasonably easy to achieve for end game players.

Glove: Crit Damage 
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Speed 
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Atk

Candraphone can benefit from the new jewellery that refreshes skills and reaction. However, it's not required for him and he can manage perfectly without.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Candra is largely operated as a go-second nuker because his damage comes from being under Veil. There are two ways to do so:
 
1. Go 2nd and get veil from enemy TM boost
2. Have another faster champion like Duchess veil him. 

As duchess is currently more advantageous for defensive teams in arena (good defence stats), Candra is an ideal go-second nuker with duchess or Rector. Some of the potential compositions are:

1. Defensive Go second Team: Rector/Duchess, Ursuga/Krisk, Tormin/Hegemon, Candraphone - here the role of Rector/Duchess is Veil and revive, Ursuga/Krisk are for shields and bulwark defence, and Tormin/Hegemon force the enemy to use immunity. 

2. Counter Attack Team: Kymar, Valk, Duchess, Candra - here the idea is to cut into the enemy faster team, then put counter attack on candra and enable this to happen twice with Kymar

3. Counter Nuke Hegemon Team: Arbiter, Krisk/Maulie, Madame, Candra - here the idea is to have everyone except Krisk/Maulie in immunity and then attack the enemy on the counter. Usually many nukers have survial issues against nuke hegemons but not Candra.

Video  – Candra go second team: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x_jXU_acjK8 

Here we show a strong defence team. The primary purpose of this team (popularized by MacChan https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hFTERXtExfM&t=887s) is:

I.        [Survive Turn 1] Usuga in first turn reduces damage through her passive (30%), her gear (10%) and her masteries (25%), Duchess reduces 25%, cumulating in a total 64.6% damage reduction in turn 1 from aoe critical hit.
II.        [Go Second and Win] Duchess is able to put veil and attack up usually and Candra is able to aoe down the enemy nuker, get an extra turn, and take down their reviver. 

Some more Platinum Arena footage with different champions can be found in the following video

https://youtu.be/6jUZbrdFBbs

However, Candra is easily crowd controlled by AOE – unless there is block debuffs. Watch out for champions that can remove buffs like Serris and Sethalia!

data.desc:
Dragon 20 is one of the most popular dungeons. Candraphone can work well as a wave clearer in this setting. There are two versions for consideration. The first is a more budget team in Late Game+ setting.

Candraphone for the Aura and AOE attack
Dracomorph for AOE DEF Down and Weaken as well as poisons for the boss stage

If you have a packed roster you can also speed run by replacing Quargan with a second Draco. This is showcased for entertainment purposes.

data.desc:
Visix the Unbowed is the 270th day login reward. She's a Defense based Void legendary from the Dark Elves faction. She was very lackluster on release, especially in comparison to Scyl of the Drakes who was given out earlier. Since her rework, she is certainly better. This guide showcases her in a Crowd Control build for Faction Wars, Dungeons and Arena.

Her A1 provides a 15% TM decrease, her A2 provides an AoE Decrease Speed and an AoE Ally Protection and A3 provides AoE Provoke and a Shield on herself. Visix Provoke is already at 100% so only the rest of her debuffs needs booking to reach 100%. If you value consistency, booking them help. The reduced cooldown is also good. However, she can work well enough unbooked and that is the way she is showcased in this guide.

If you want her to use her A1 for TM reduction as much as possible you can even keep her unascended because sadly her AI does not prioritize A1 when TM of the target is high.

Usually, for masteries, Offense/Defense or Offense/Support are used. T6 mastery choice depends on what you want to use her for. Eagle Eye in Support for the extra Accuracy can be a valuable pick. Warmaster on Offense for more damage against high HP opponents in PvE is a good alternative. 

However, as two of her skills are AoE abilities she's used with a stun set here, thus the Defense/Support build, and Fearsome Presence on T6 for extra chance of stun procs (Eagle Eye is an alternative). The rest of the masteries improve her survivability, accuracy or help her cycle her turns faster.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Visix is showcased in a Stun set here for more control. As with most debuffers, Speed and Accuracy are the focus so Perception and Speed sets are viable options. 

As an Ally Protection champion, she also needs a degree of sustain. Gearing Visix in either Lifesteal/Bloodthirst or Regeneration/Immortal if there is no healer in the team is a possible option.

For gear, look for as much Accuracy and Speed substats as possible. 220+ Speed and 350+ Accuracy allow you to be comfortable in Hard Doom Tower. You should then aim for around 3k+ defense and 40k+ HP.

Glove: HP%/Def%
Chest: Accuracy/HP%/Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Def
Amulet: Def/HP
Banner: Accuracy

Her A1 is viable against the Scarab King, however, as she also gains TM and in this case Visix should be at about 20 speed lower than your shielder so she does not outrun the Shield. Alternatively you can also use Bloodshield accessories. Avoid Refresh accessories if you want her to use her A1 as much as possible.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Visix is now a perfectly viable carry for her faction in the crypts. She provides good utility against waves in Crowd Control capabilities and is effective against the bosses. 

Crypt 21 for Dark Elves can be quite hard because of the Valkyries waves. However, Visix can help complete it on a reasonable budget on auto.

This Faction Wars team relies on Psylar and Visix to keep the enemies permanently controlled. They also deny boss turns as much as possible.

Kael provides damage against the waves and the boss.

Painkeeper heals Visix and reduces cooldowns for the team.

Kaiden acts as a safety net to revive champions for the 3 stars clear.

https://youtu.be/ldNUbxKb1Tc
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon is the most popular dungeon for gear by far due to the importance of Speed gear throughout the game. Visix can easily help you control the waves and keep your poisoner alive until the boss to take him down.

The team showcased here consists of:

- Deacon Armstrong for Speed aura, Decrease Defense and TM manipulation. He is fast enough to work even though he is negative affinity. Stun set allows him to provide more control on the waves.
- Visix to provide Stuns from set, Provoke and Speed Down Debuffs along with Ally Protection to keep your fragile champions alive
- Apothecary to provide more Speed and TM. He also heals Visix when she gets low on HP
- Kael provides damage on waves and Poison against boss
- Frozen Banshee makes sure the run is successful with her Poison dps output on boss

https://youtu.be/GtIQxAo-cuY

data.desc:
Visix TM control capabilities are not exactly useful against the Ice Golem 20. However, she provides enough control on waves to keep your team from killing itself on the Reflect Damage secon wave. Paired with Deacon Armstring, waves are constantly controlled. Against boss, her Ally Protection helps keep your team up and running.

The team here consists of:

- Deacon : AOE Decrease Defense, TM control and CC with a Stun set
- Visix : Wave control, Ally Protection
- Fenax : Wave damage, Block Revive skill on the adds
- Reliquary Tender : Cleanse, Heal and Revive in case Visix dies from Ally Protection. She also provides a small Decrease Attack on the boss.
- Coldheart : Damage against waves and the boss.

https://youtu.be/LE0ELjAFJYc

TM control is something needed for most successful against the Spider. The team showcased here was built with that in mind. Visix plays an important role here as she acts as a tank and slows the Spider and its Spiderlings down. 

The team uses :

- Deacon : Speed aura for the team, AOE Decrease Defense and TM control
- Visix : Provoke, Ally Protection, TM control
- Armiger : TM control, Enemy Max HP nuke
- Ursala : Revive if needed, Increase Defense and Strengthen to keep the team alive, Increase Attack to enable Ultimate Galek
- Ultimate Galek : AoE HP Burn and more TM control

The next page showcases the Fire Knight 20 and some stage 25 dungeons

Fire Knight's Castle is one of the end game gear farming spots for Late Game+ especially for Savage sets. 

TM manipulation is important for strategies here. However, Visix does not have a very good AI so she does not always use her A1 when needed. In this run, she used her other skills first, allowing the Fire Knight to take a turn. Luckily, the team survived with her Ally Protection in place.

Team comp : 

- Apothecary : TM boost, Speed boost and Healing

The strongest champion for that is still Alure, but she needs to be kept alive. Visix provides exactly this functionality on the waves on top of her extra utility against the boss.

Arena is an important part of the game as the Great Hall bonuses help in all content. 

Visix can also work in an Arena offense setup. The team showcased here is a pretty standard speed nuke comp. It relies on a double TM boost into Decrease Defense, followed up by Provoke and finished with a nuke. 

Deacon Armstrong is a very strong champion here as he provides both TM and Decrease Defense. You can bring in another Decrease Defense champion to replace him, but will need to increase Visix's Speed so she can provoke the enemy, allowing your other champions to go after her.

Deacon provides Defense down and TM boost

data.desc:
Secret Room 12 of the Frost Spider Hard Doom Tower requires you to build a Void only team. This stage is very heavy on the Crowd Control with tanky champions such as Visix, Soulless, Krisk or Khoronar and your run can go wrong pretty quickly if you do not take the initiative. If you do not have a Seer to one shot them quickly, you are left with the Crowd Control strategy.

The team showcased relies on heavy Crowd Control to allow Inquisitor Shamael, the only damage dealer, to cycle through his cooldowns and kill off the enemies. 

We have Visix in stun set, Psylar in stun set and Bellower in stun set to provide AoE Stun, Decrease Accuracy, Decrease Speed, Block Active Skill and Provoke between them. Visix also provides Ally Protection buff to make the run safer and faster as Shamael can cycle thhrough his skills safely.

Ursala provides the Speed aura along with the buffs for Shamael to hit harder. 
She's also there to revive when needed.

https://youtu.be/zWbToGvEXj0
