data.desc:
The Scarab King is a major roadblock for many players as tanking him can be difficult on high floors, and TM controling him with Alure is not always reliable. Visix acts here as a backup for Alure. The team showcased utilises TM control with Miscreated Monster as the shielder to avoid Counter Attacks fom Scarab. The boss should never be allowed to take a turn with this type of composition.

Because of her AI, Visix is not very auto friendly if you want maximum efficiency. However, with the upcoming AI adjustment options, she might be much better using her A1 most of the time on boss. She provides lots of utilitiy. Decrease Speed, Ally Protection and Provoke allow the team to get through waves and Decrease Speed is also very important against boss on top of her TM control skill.

Alure is still the main TM control of this team and doesn't provide much else. Armiger and Coldheart in Destroy set to provide extra TM control and their Enemy MAX HP nuke allows us to take the shield down faster

The run showcased below had to be on manual on the boss stage

https://youtu.be/3mLwg2_TWE0
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Wurlim Frostking is a Void Affinity Legendary Champion from the Knights Revenant Faction that could be obtained through the Battle Pass. 

Unfortunately, he was underwhelming and ended up being one of the worst Void Legendary in the game at the time. However, he was recently buffed and while he is not a top tier champion, he is more usable now. 

The core skill set of this champion did not change but was made improved by making his main debuff ability irresistible which means he no longer requires accuracy in his build and the most notable change was lowering the cooldown of his ability that places Increase Defense and Strengthen to 3 turns. This allows him to be tuned in a regular CB team. Strengthen is a rare buff and is the best damage mitigation buff in the game at the moment. Having this buff in a standard CB team can extend your team’s survivability in CB allowing more damage.

In terms of books, there are two options. You have to either book both his skills down to 3 turn cooldown making him much easier to speed tune or leave him unbooked with both skills at 4 turn cooldown. If you plan to use him in CB unbooked, you will have to tune him to go 4:3 to use his skills in the correct rotation.

This guide will feature Wurlim Frostking in PVE content of Dragon 20, Ice Golem 20, Fire Knight 20 and in a standard UNM and NM CB team.

Masteries for Wurlim is fairly simple. Since he doesn't require accuracy to apply his debuff (apart from his A1 freeze which is not worth building accuracy for in most cases) we will avoid the Support tree and take the Offense and Defense tree. 

In the Offense Tree, the standard PVE damage dealing masteries are chosen. Crit Rate, Crit Damage and all the damage increasing masteries on the left down to T6 Warmaster. In the Defense Tree, take the Damage mitigation mastery in Tough Skin, Blastproof, Delayed Death into both Counterattack masteries: Retribution and Deterrence.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gearing Wurlim is also fairly simple. Prioritize building him with Defense, Crit Rate, Crit Damage, and Speed. Ideally 4k+ Defense, 100% Crit Rate, 200%+ Crit Damage, and enough speed to fit your CB speed tune team. Since he does not require any other stats you should be able to build him with very high Defense and Crit Damage to maximize his damage.

Lifesteal set is a must for a standard CB team, unless you have Leech in your team. You can them use any 2-piece set or broken pieces to maximize his stats. 

The Wurlim build shown here is used in a slow speed tuned Clan Boss team, hence the 173 speed in Lifesteal. This exact build is used in all other content shown in this guide.

Glove: Crit Damage
Chest: Def %
Boots: Def % / Speed
Ring: Def
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Def
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Wurlim is one of the few champions in the game that provides the Strengthen Buff to your team. This is the best damage mitigation buff in the game and is extremely valuable in non-unkillable CB teams as it improves survivability allowing your team to last longer. He also provide a minor buff, Inc Crit Damage that helps increase your team’s damage.

This is an example of a CB team that is built to take advantage of Godseeker Aniri’s Buff extension.

1)        Sepulcher Sentinel (227) – Atk Down, Inc Def, Block Debuff
2)        Skullcrusher (171) Ally Protection, Counterattack
3)        Rhazin (176) Dec Def, Weaken, DPS
4)        Godseeker Aniri (173) Buff Extension, DPS
5)        Wurlim Frostking (173) Strengthen, Inc Def, Inc Crit Damage, DPS

With Godseeker Aniri’s buff extension, this team is tuned so that Sepulcher’s Block Debuff is up for the Affinity Debuff and Stun which makes this team work on all affinities. Wurlim’s Strengthen and Inc Crit Damage buff are up for both AOEs which improves the team’s survivability and damage. Skullcrusher’s Ally Protection and Counterattack is up for both AOEs on all champions. Increase Defense is up 100% of the fight. There are a few turns of manual set up for this team to line up their skill order correctly before going full auto. 

As you can see, the combination of defensive and damage mitigating buffs in an all Defense-based team allows the team to last a long time and comfortably hit well above the 2-key damage threshold for UNM and 1-key damage threshold for NM. Notice that both run ended due to missing Atk Down. The run could've lasted longer.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8CgqC0MiIbE&t=5m17s

Note that while this team’s speed tune work on all affinities there is still a factor of weak hits. While this team will not be affected by the Decrease Speed Debuff from the Spirit CB, Sepulcher and Rhazin who are the main debuffers in the team can still weak hit and not apply their debuffs. Missing the important Atk Down can end the run early.
data.label: Notes:

title: Wurlim Frostking Late Game+ Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
Dragon 20

Wurlim is fully capable of dealing damage as he has great damage multipliers. If used in a properly built team, he can perform well in dungeons as a damage dealer. This is an example where Wurlim is a part of an all Defense-based team for Dragon 20. 

We have Tayrel for AOE Defense Down
Wurlim for his buffs and dps
Godseeker for healing, revive in case anyone dies, and buff extension
Norog for 40% Defense Dungeon Aura. 

All these Champion are hard hitting Defense-based champions and synergize of each other. 

Mausoleum Mage supports the team with his Defensive Buffs to increase your Defense-based champion’s damage before they nuke, Heals, and Cleanse. 

As you can see, this team does not have any poisoners and takes down the Dragon entirely from dealing Raw Damage. Defense-based champions built with high defense for their damage also naturally increases their survivability, so they are much easier to keep alive than Attack based counterparts. They are in no danger of dying throughout the entire fight and if they do die, Godseeker can revive them.

https://youtu.be/8CgqC0MiIbE
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem 20

Similarly for Ice Golem 20, you can build a Defense-based team that can perform perfectly well here. Wurlim can deal good damage and offer the Strengthen buff to the team here to negate some of the Ice Golem’s hard hitting AOEs. 

This is an example of a team with Stag Knight to provide AOE Def Down and ATK Down for further damage reduction and speeding up the runs. 

Wurlim to provide his useful buffs to improve the team’s survivability and damage and deal damage. 
Fenax as the main damage dealer and utility of occasionally blocking the minions from reviving if he kills them. 
Mausoleum to provide his defensive buffs to improve the team’s survivability and occasionally block the freeze, heals and cleanse the debuffs placed on the team. 
Godseeker Aniri for heal, revive in case anyone dies and do damage.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8CgqC0MiIbE&t=1m13s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fire Knight 20

Fire Knight 20 requires more specialized champions, so we cannot just build a team of Defense-based champions. 

While Wurlim can help deal damage and nuke the waves, he is not actually very useful for the Fire Knight itself. He does not have any multi-hit to take down the shield and will only be useful for the buff he provides. 

This is an example of a team that takes advantage of the multiple buffs he offers. This team is built around Seer to utilize the buffs to nuke the waves and Alure to keep the Fire Knights TM down. We have Wurlim and Mausoleum Mage to provide multiple buffs for Seer to strip and Stag Knight for AOE Decrease Defense. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8CgqC0MiIbE&t=4m09s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Godseeker Aniri is a Void Affinity Epic Champion from the Sacred Order Faction that has a good support skill kit but also boasts surprisingly high damage multipliers. She can heal your team, revive your allies, and nuke enemies. 

Aniri also has a rare ability to extend your buffs which makes her extremely useful in Clan Boss buff management and speed tuning. In order to use her effectively her A2 needs to be fully booked to lower the cooldown. Her other skill cooldowns do not need to be booked for her to work.

This guide will feature Godseeker Aniri in PVE content of Dragon 20, Ice Golem 20, Spider 20, Faction Wars and in a standard UNM and NM CB teams.

Masteries for Godseeker Aniri are fairly simple. She does not apply any debuffs and her ability to lower buff duration on the enemies is irrelevant in the context of this guide so we will avoid the Support tree and take the Offense and Defense tree. 

In the Offense Tree the standard PVE damage dealing masteries are chosen. Crit Rate, Crit Damage and all the damage increasing masteries on the left down to T6 Warmaster. 

In the Defense Tree, take the Damage mitigation mastery in Tough Skin, Blastproof, Delayed Death, into both Counterattack masteries, Retribution and Deterrence.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gearing Godseeker Aniri is also fairly simple. Prioritize building her with Defense, Crit Rate, Crit Damage, and Speed. Ideally 4k+ Defense, 100% Crit Rate, 200%+ Crit Damage, and enough speed to fit your CB speed tune team. 

Since she does not require any other stats, you should be able to build her with very high Defense and Crit Damage to maximize her damage. Lifesteal set is a must if you use her in CB, unless you have Leech in your team. You can them use any 2-piece set to maximize your stats. 

The Godseeker build shown here is used in a speed tuned Clan Boss team, hence the 173 speed in Lifesteal. This exact build is used in all other content shown in this guide.

Glove: Crit Damage
Chest: Def %
Boots: Def % / Speed
Ring: Def
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Def
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Godseeker Aniri is very useful for Standard non-unkillable CB teams. She has the unique ability to extend the buff duration. This makes speedtuning and buff management much easier to accomplish. 

If correctly built, you can extend very important buffs such as Block Debuff, Inc Defense, CA, Ally Protection, and Strengthen that usually only lasts for 2 turns to 3 turns for a permanent uptime. Aside from extending buffs Godseeker Aniri also have high damage multipliers and can deal a significant damage.

This is an example of a CB team that is built to take advantage of Godseeker Aniri’s Buff extension.

1)        Sepulcher Sentinel (227) – Atk Down, Inc Def, Block Debuff
2)        Skullcrusher (171) Ally Protection, Counterattack
3)        Rhazin (176) Dec Def, Weaken, DPS
4)        Godseeker Aniri (173) Buff Extension, DPS
5)        Wurlim Frostking (173) Strengthen, Inc Def, Inc Crit Damage, DPS

This team is tuned so Sepulcher’s Block Debuff blocks the Affinity Debuff and Stun which makes this team work on all affinities. Wurlim’s Strengthen and Inc Crit Damage buff are up for both AOEs which improves the team’s survivability and damage. Increase Defense is up 100% of the fight. There are a few turns of manual set up for this team to line up their skill order correctly before going full auto. 

As you can see, the combination of defensive and damage mitigating buffs in an all Defense-based team allows the team to last a long time and comfortably hit well above the 2-key damage threshold for UNM and 1-key damage threshold for NM. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8CgqC0MiIbE&t=5m17s

Note that while this team’s speed tune work on all affinities, there is still a factor of weak hits. So, while this team will not be affected by the Decrease Speed Debuff from the Spirit CB, Sepulcher and Rhazin who are the main debuffer in the team can still weak hit and not apply their debuffs. Missing the important Atk Down can end the run early.
data.label: Notes:

title: Godseeker Aniri Late Game+ Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
Dragon 20

Godseeker Aniri has a very good damage multiplier so in a Defense-based teams, she can also double as a good dps for your dungeon team. 

This is an example of an all Defense-based team for Dragon 20. 

Tayrel for AOE Defense Down
Wurlim for his buffs
Godseeker Aniri for healing, revive in case anyone dies and buff extension
Norog’s 40% Defense Dungeon Aura. 

All these Champion are hard hitting Defense-based champions and synergize of each other. Mausoleum Mage supports the team with his Defensive Buffs to increase your Defense-based champion’s damage before they nuke, Heals, and Cleanse. 

As you can see, this team does not have any poisoner and takes down the Dragon entirely from dealing Raw Damage. Defense-based champions build high defense for their damage which also naturally increases their survivability, so they are much easier to keep alive than Attack based counterparts. They are in no danger of dying throughout the entire fight and if they do die, Godseeker can revive them.

https://youtu.be/8CgqC0MiIbE

Ice Golem 20

Similarly for Ice Golem 20, you can build a Defense-based team where she can also double as a really good damage dealer and provide support through healing and revives. 

This is an example of a team with Stag Knight to provide AOE Def Down and ATK Down for further damage reduction and speeding up the runs. 
Wurlim to provide his useful buffs to improve the team’s survivability and damage and deal damage as well.
Fenax to as the main damage dealer and utility of occasionally blocking the minions from reviving if he kills them. 
Mausoleum to provide his defensive buffs to improve the team’s survivability and occasionally block the freeze, heals and cleanse the debuffs placed on the team. 
Godseeker Aniri provides the same utility of healing, reviving in case someone dies and DPS.

data.desc:
Fire Knight 20

Fire Knight 20 requires more specialized champions, so we cannot just build a team of Defense-based champions. 

Her supportive utility of healing and reviving will shine more here but she will still offer a moderate amount of DPS for the waves. 

This is an example of a budget team with only Epics and Rares. 

Stag Knight for AOE Attack, Defense Down and Decrease Speed. 
Godseeker Aniri for heals, revive in case anyone dies, buff extension and some DPS. 
Fenax as the main DPS. 
Coldheart as the usual top champion for FK 20 with her multi-hit A1, Max HP Nuke and full TM depletion. 
Finally, Apothecary to increase speed, spot heal and multi-hit A1 to take down the FK’s shield.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8CgqC0MiIbE&t=2m47s

title: Godseeker Aniri Late Game+ Dungeon Runs 2

data.desc:
Faction Wars

Godseeker Aniri is an excellent option of Sacred Order FW 21. She provides good damage, can survive well due to being Defense based, has heals and revive that are crucial to attain the 3 star completion. This is an example of a Sacred Order FW 21 team without any Legendary champions completing the stage on full auto. The team consist of 

1)        Deacon Armstrong who provides AOE Dec Def, TM Boost, Enemy TM Decrease and a Speed Aura 
2)        Fenax as a DPS, AOE Block Buff to prevent the Maneaters from placing Unkillable, and Block revives to prevent the Boss from reviving the hard-hitting minions.
3)        Armiger for TM control and Block revive against the hard-hitting minions.
4)        Inquisitor Shamael for single-target DPS that also prevents the boss from placing True Fear or Fear on the team.
5)        Godseeker Aniri provides healing, DPS, and Revives if your team somehow dies against the hard-hitting minions on this stage.

The video below shows the run on full auto but it is highly recommended to manual the run for your first time as there are a couple areas that can make the run fail or not achieve 3 stars. 

Firstly, during the second wave, if Fenax is not able to land his block buffs, the Maneater may be able to place the unkillable buff. Armiger can constantly lower the TM of a mob with an unkillable buff causing it to never run out and failing the run. Secondly, your champions may not time their block revive ability on the mobs causing them to stay alive and revive constantly. Although the hard hitting mob attacks are random, you may get unlucky and your Godseeker Aniri might get killed right of the bat losing your only source of healing and revive.    

https://youtu.be/hzobunL6u9s

data.desc:
Deacon Armstrong is an incredibly strong Epic from the Sacred Order. His kit is unique as he fills in many roles at once allowing flexible roles in many team compositions. This guide will feature him Arena, Dungeons and FW. 

His A1 places a Leech debuff that is very efficient in dungeons as well as in a Clan Boss setting for additional healing on hits. His A2 places an AOE Decrease Defense on a 3 turn cooldown when fully booked. His A3 fills his allies TM by 15% and decreases enemies TM by 15% and grants an Extra Turn. This Extra Turn mechanic is powerful because his A2 and A3 become 2 turn cooldown skills. It also allows him to be viable in 2:1 Clan Boss teams (other options being Seeker and Mashalled). As a bonus Deacon has a Speed aura for all battles which is a nice ability to have. 

Due to the short cooldown on his A2, he is used in a Stun set here to provide more Crowd Control. Hence the masteries choices. 

If you plan on using him in CB, Offense down to Warmaster and then Defense for all the damage mitigation would be the choice. However, you should check very carefully what speed of every champion in the team compositions is and make sure not to pick any TM boosting masteries in CB teams. 

In this guide to take advantage of his gear set, Defense and Support were selected. Defense for damage mitigation down to Fearsome Presence and Support to maximise TM boost, Accuracy and Lore of Steel to boost Speed and Accuracy whenever possible. Eagle Eye is a viable alternative choice if you need to hit a certain Accuracy threshold.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
This Deacon build is using a Stun set for extra control. The secondary set can be Speed, Perception or any broken set, whichever gives the best Speed and Accuracy. 

An alternative build for a pure Speed support would be all Speed sets as this is his alternative role as a budget Lyssandra of sorts. Look for as much Accuracy and Speed as possible from the substats. You can even use flat stat for the gloves and chest. Deacon is not too picky about the sets he is using to work properly.

In terms of stats aiming for 250+ Speed and around 350 Accuracy for most PvE content is the benchmark. For Arena you can focus exlusively on speed.

Glove: Any with Speed and/or Accuracy substats
Chest: Accuracy/HP%/Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Def/HP
Amulet: Def/HP
Banner: Accuracy

Refresh accessories work very well on Deacon to maximise his TM control opportunities. Bloodshield might also be good for a Scarab farming team as his extra turns make him outrun the shield.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Arena is one of the core parts of the game. Advancing in tiers and upgrading your Great Hall provides a significant bonus for your champions in all content of the game. For arena offense, speed teams are probably the most common and efficent type when approaching Late Game.

This part of the guide showcases Deacon as a secondary booster and a debuffer for the team. Having a champion like Deacon in your team allows you to be very flexible with team building. You can bring in a Crowd Control champion, another nuker or a buff remover depending on the match up. In this team composition Visix was used to Provoke the enemy

Here, we have a pretty standard speed team :
- Arbiter : main booster, provides Increase Attack
- Deacon : secondary booster, provides Decrease Defense, Stun set provides extra CC
- Visix : Provoke 
- Fenax : Nuker

https://youtu.be/Th9aKo1ABZ0
https://youtu.be/eKAl2u9zDh0
https://youtu.be/g0-WZ_Yhg5Q

As with any speed reliant team without immunity, you should be careful of teams that have Tormin, Valkyrie and/or Hegemon as they can mess up the turn sequence of your team.

The next page covers Deacon in dungeons
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fenax is an Attack based Spirit Epic from the Sacred Order faction. Despite being a strong damage dealer, he is not well respected by newer players due to the team composition and gear requirements and has only started getting more attention from content creators recently. This guide will feature Fenax in Arena, FW and Dungeons progression.

Fenax main ability is his A1, a hard hitting skill with Block Revive property. It double hits when the enemy is under debuffs which is usually the case when you run a Decrease Defense to set Fenax up. This skill is incredibly strong, and having it on an A1 (meaning no cooldown is involved) makes him a viable option when you need this skill for content. His other skill have additional utility so some additional accuracy when possible is also advisable. His A2 has a chance to put either a Block Active Skill or a Block Buffs debuffs and his A3 has a chance to put Decrease Defense and Decrease Speed debuffs. Fenax has the potential to set himself up for his additional hits on A1.

His masteries are standard for most damage dealer in Late Game+. Offense tree with Crit Rate, Crit Damage for more dps into Helmsmasher T6. If you cannot reach 220% crit damage before picking T6, Flawless Execution is usually the preferred alternative. Support tree was selected as secondary tree to get more Accuracy when possible and Lore of Steel to boost Speed, Accuracy and Attack from the sets.

You can also opt in for Defense tree for more damage mitigation. The secondary tree does not make a huge difference for Fenax, but the gear and stats do.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
As a damage dealer, Fenax should ideally be in Cruel and/or Savage set to get the most dps. Relentless or Immunity are also viable option depending on the build. Otherwise, Speed is generally a very good option. Perception and Accuracy can be good if you want to give him some Accuracy for his debuffs. 

When building a nuker, you should aim for at least 100% Crit Rate, 200+% Crit Damage and 4-5k Attack for Late Game+. Speed should then be at 170+. When going for extra utility, 220+ Accuracy is advisable for dungeons and Faction Wars. 

Glove: Crit Damage
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy/Atk

As for the accessories, if you want him to use A1 as much as possible, Refresh accessories should be avoided. All other special accessories can be good for him.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Fenax main weakness is his affinity. Being Spirit makes him weak against most popular champions in arena, especially nukers like Trunda and Foli. However, that also means he works as an alternative to your usual nuker when they are weak affinity, for example against Force heavy teams and champions like Candraphone and Rector. 

He also finds his uses against teams with many Revive on Death champions (e.g Tormin, Cruetraxa, Brakus) or teams with many revivers and tanks. Building him with Accuracy also gives you a chance to lock their reviver out with his AoE.

Here we used team against teams in Gold IV with multiple revivers (Duchess, Aniri, Rector Drath) and Brakus, who usually can come back to take out one of your champions, but Fenax had stopped him from doing so.

The team showcased is a standard speed team with :
- Arbiter for Attack boost and TM boost
- Deacon for TM boost and Defense down
- Visix for Provoke
- Fenax for damage

https://youtu.be/eKAl2u9zDh0
https://youtu.be/g0-WZ_Yhg5Q
https://youtu.be/Th9aKo1ABZ0

The next page covers Fenax in dungeons
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem is certainly the dungeon where Fenax brings the most utility in. He serves as a damage dealer against waves, his Block Buffs and Block Active Skills are useful against the Terrorbeasts on the second wave to prevent them from putting up their Reflect Damage and his Block Revive is very handy on the boss stage to prevent the Golem from reviving his adds. 

The team composition relies on control and survival in this showcase.
 
- Deacon : TM control, CC with Stun set, Decrease Defense
- Visix : CC with Provoke and Stun set, Ally Protection
- Fenax : Damage, Block Buffs, Block Active Skill, Block Revive
- Coldheart : Damage, MAX HP nuke
- Reliquary Tender : Cleanse, Heal and Revive

https://youtu.be/LE0ELjAFJYc

data.desc:
Fenax can also serve as damage dealer for the Fire Knight Castle where your usual magic champions are not reliable enough. His Defense down and Speed down can also come in handy against the Fire Knight himself. His two hit A1 is conditional however, so you shouldn't count on it too much during the boss stage.

The team showcased here consists of :

- Apothecary : Healing, Defense aura, TM and Speed boost. three hit A1
- Visix : CC, Ally Protection and TM control
- Fenax : Damage, back up Decrease Defense and Decrease Speed
- Stag Knight : Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, Decrease Speed
- Coldheart : Damage, TM depletion, MAX HP nuke

https://youtu.be/HVDTHoitW30

data.desc:
While Dragon 20 was a bad fit for Fenax compositions because of his Spirit affinity, Dragon 25 is a positive affinity so Fenax can also serve as your damage dealer if you ever need one there. 

The goal is to bring Occult Brawler to the Dragon as poisons are still your most reliable source of damage against this boss. To successfully carry the Occult Brawler to the boss, we have :

- Deacon : Speed aura, Decrease Defense, TM control, CC with Stun set
- Visix : CC with Stun set, Ally Protection
- Apothecary : Healing, TM and Speed boost
- Fenax : Damage on the waves
- Occult Brawler : Poisons for the boss

https://youtu.be/GSitzXU_LU8

data.desc:
TM control is still relevant against the Fire Knight for stages 20+ and Fenax has access to Decrease Speed debuff that helps tremendously against the boss. He can also serve as a damage dealer against the waves.

The team consists of :

- Deacon : Speed aura, Decrease Defense, TM control and CC with Stun set
- Visix : CC, TM control, Ally Protection, Decrease Speed
- Fenax : Wave clear, backup Decrease Speed and Decrease Defense 
- Alure : TM control
- Coldheart : Wave clear, TM depletion, MAX HP nuke, four hit A1

https://youtu.be/iojCUg1EYLk

data.desc:
Fenax is naturally a solid dps option for Sacred Order Faction Wars. Stage 21 boss has a revive ability, and the Rowan like add ignores defense on its attacks. If you are not controlling it fast enough, the run can very easily end in a defeat. Fenax having a Block Revive makes things much easier as the boss will not be able to revive her allies. 

We'll target that Rowan-like add to make the run faster.

The roles are as follow :
- Deacon : Speed aura, Decrease Defense, TM control, CC with Stun set
- Armiger : TM control, MAX HP nuke
- Fenax : Wave clear, Block Revive, Decrease Speed against boss
- Aothar : Poison damage
- Cardinal : Revive for the 3 stars clear

https://youtu.be/CjDAXKeAfrc

data.desc:
As a damage dealer, Fenax can slot in any team if you have the appropriate support for him. Here is a showcase of him playing the role of a main damage dealer in the team for Doom Tower Spirit Epics only Secret Room 8 of the Frost Spider rotation. 

Deacon brings TM control and Decrease Defense 
Melga brings Shield, Heal and Revive if needed
Fenax takes care of the waves swiftly

data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Drexthar is a Force Affinity Legendary Champion from the Demonspawn Faction that all players can obtain for free through fragments from the 3v3 Bazaar. 

It is highly recommended to buy his fragment every day and eventually summon him as his usefulness has risen dramatically since the release of Doom Tower. Note that his fragment in the Bazaar have a 24 hour cooldown so you have it buy it every day for 100 days. Don’t wait until you have all the points needed to buy all 100 before buying his fragment as this is mistake made by a number of people in our experience. 

Drexthar is one of the best DPS champions for 3 out of the 6 Doom Tower Bosses: Nether Spider, Griffon and Eternal Dragon due to his ability to passively place HP burn on hit. This is important as there are many other champions who can place AOE HP Burn, but they are usually on a cooldown skill and these 3 bosses have ways to negate the effectiveness of those AOE HP Burn skills with their abilities. Nether Spiderlings have Counterattack preventing champion AI from using their AOE abilities, Griffon removes Debuffs on itself, and Eternal Dragon blocks skill cooldowns. 

Booking Drexthar is not necessary but his effectiveness will improve with books. The Drexthar shown in this guide is not booked. This Late Game+ guide will feature Drexthar as the main DPS for the three Hard Doom Tower Bosses mentioned above.

For Masteries, Offense and Support Trees are recommended for Drexthar. In the Offense Tree take Crit Rate, Crit Damage and Lifedrinker down to the T6 Giantslayer since he has a triple hit A1. In the Support Tree, take the Accuracy masteries and all the two right hand options to improve his debuff placing capabilities.

Drexthar can be flexible with his masteries should you wish to select Eagle Eye as the alternative T6 mastery or choose the Defence Tree as the secondary tree if you have enough accuracy on your gear.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gearing Drexthar for Hard Doom Tower Bosses is quite specific. 

The most important stats to have on him are Accuracy and Resistance. At least 350 Resistance is recommended to reliably resist most of the DT Bosses abilities unless you have excellent supporting champions and revivers aplenty. Similarly for accuracy at least 350 is recommended, however Drexthar has an amazing 70 Accuracy aura for all battles so if you use him as your lead, you can account for that in your build to lower the requirements. 

High HP, Defense and Speed are another priority. Around 50k HP, 4k Defense and 220 Speed are recommended. You can ignore Crit rate and Crit damage since he will not be doing significant damage through his regular hits.

For sets, the Regeneration set is useful to give him a constant source of self-healing since he needs to tank hits to proc his Passive HP Burn. You can use any other 2-piece set to achieve the recommended stats such as Resistance, Accuracy, Speed, Perception. 

Glove: Def %/ HP %
Chest: Accuracy/Resistance
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Def
Amulet: HP/Def
Banner: Accuracy/Resistance
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Nether Spider

With the change to the Nether Spider’s boss mechanic where full TM reduction strategies are no longer viable, AOE HP Burn strategies are now one of the best strategies to deal with this Boss. Unfortunately, due to this Boss’ mechanic of placing Counterattack of the spiderlings, all champions that places AOE HP Burn through an AOE attack will not use their ability here because the spiderlings’ counterattack will heal the main boss leading to nullification of the HP burn damage. Champions that place HP Burn unconventionally Like Drexthar rise to the forefront in this case as Drexthar places HP Burn when attacked through his passive

The team used for Hard Stage 90 Nether Spider is as follows:

1)        Drexthar
2)        Scyl of the Drakes
3)        Mausoleum Mage
4)        Runekeeper Dazdurk
5)        Doompriest

The team showcased in the video is built survive through the constant spider Poisons through multiple AOE Cleanses in Mausoleum Mage and Runekeeper Dazdurk, and constant heals and revive in case anyone dies from Scyl of the Drakes. Doompriest provides a little bit of both with single debuff removal and a small heal each turn. All the damage will come from the HP Burns thar Drexthar places whenever he gets attacked making it a reliable auto team for farming. 

https://youtu.be/n1FrYCx68Pk

The next page with deal with the other Doom Tower bosses
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Celestial Griffin

The team used for Hard Stage 90 Celestial Griffin is as follows:

1)        Scyl of the Drakes
2)        Rotos
3)        Norog
4)        Drexthar
5)        Doompriest

Scyl provides support to the team with her constant heals, increase speed, and emergency revives. 
Norog provide passive team damage reduction and is a secondary DPS for the Boss. His passive is even more effective here at providing the full 25% damage reduction because the Griffin constantly strips buffs. 
Rotos and Drexthar are the main DPS of the team. 
Doompriest provides additional support with her heals and cleanses the debuffs placed or transferred to your team each turn. 

The video below shows this team on full auto farm with 100% Win rate. As you can see, the team can sustain and doesn’t even come close to dying. The team does enough DPS to take down the Griffin even before it reaches the max Sky Bond stacks. 

https://youtu.be/68E3FSYfByE
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Eternal Dragon

The team used for Hard Stage 120 Eternal Dragon is as follows:

1)        Scyl of the Drakes
2)        Vrask
3)        Norog
4)        Drexthar
5)        Jareg

Scyl provides support to the team with her constant heals, increase speed, AOE stuns, and emergency revives. Scyl is built with a high enough resistance to resist all the Dragon’s Skill Cooldown affecting abilities so, she can still CC the minions and revive dead allies. 

Norog provide passive team damage reduction from the Dragon’s Hard hitting AOE and is a secondary DPS. 

Drexthar is the main damage dealer through his AOE HP Burns 

Jareg places Decrease Attack debuff on the boss to reduce incoming damage and places a Continuous Heal buff on your team after taking the Dragon’s hard hitting AOE. 

Vrask provides additional team healing since the heal from Scyl and Jareg is not enough to sustain the team. 

The video below shows this team on full auto. 

https://youtu.be/68E3FSYfByE

Reserved.

data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Drexthar is a Force Affinity Legendary Champion from the Demonspawn Faction that all players can obtain for free through fragments from the 3v3 Bazaar. 

It is highly recommended to buy his fragment every day and eventually summon him as his usefulness has risen dramatically since the release of Doom Tower. Note that his fragment in the Bazaar have a 24 hour cooldown so you have it buy it every day for 100 days. Don’t wait until you have all the points needed to buy all 100 before buying his fragment as this is mistake made by a number of people in our experience. 

If you are lucky enough to get Drexthar before your Arbiter missions he can helpful in all dungeons for progression. Booking Drexthar is not necessary but his effectiveness will improve with books. The Drexthar shown in this guide is not booked. 

For Masteries, Offense and Support Trees are recommended for Drexthar. In the Offense Tree take Crit Rate, Crit Damage and Lifedrinker down to the T6 Giantslayer since he has a triple hit A1. In the Support Tree, take the Accuracy masteries and all the two right hand options to improve his debuff placing capabilities.

Drexthar can be flexible with his masteries should you wish to select Eagle Eye as the alternative T6 mastery or choose the Defence Tree as the secondary tree if you have enough accuracy on your gear.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gear and Stats

Drexthar has a high damage multiplier on his AOE ability and can nuke waves in a Defensive style team so, you want to instead build Drexthar to do damage rather than to tank and place his passive HP Burn (Except for Spider where it will be discussed in detail in the Spider 20 slide). 

You can either build Drexthar with 100% Crit Rate, around 200%+ Crit Damage, 4k+ Defense, and 200+ Accuracy to still land his Debuffs. Finally, a decent amount of speed of at least 180+ is recommended. Alterntatively, if you don't have enough stats you can opt in for pure DEF/HP build.

You can use any sets on him that can help you achieve the recommended stats such as Defense, Perception, Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Speed, etc.

Glove: Crit Rate %/Crit Damage %
Chest: Def %
Boots: Speed
Ring: Def
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Spider 20

Drexthar is one of the best champions to use as an off-affinity Spider 20 Tank strategy. He is negative affinity in Spider 20 and as long as you don’t have any other champion that is off affinity, the Spiderlings will target Drexthar. 

With the spiderlings attacking Drexthar he can passively place HP Burn on them and the next time they take a turn, they will deal damage to the main Spider. Your other 4 champions should be entirely dedicated to support of this strategy for maximum efficiency. 

In this team, Apothecary is used to Heal Drexthar when he gets low and Speed up the team. 
Two Coldhearts and an Armiger are used entirely to control the Spider’s Turn Meter. There is no Decrease Defense or Weaken in this team so, their Max Hp Damage doesn’t deal as much damage. Most of the damage will be from Drexthar's HP Burn.

Note that the Drexthar build for Spider should be similar to the Doom Tower build (High Resistance, around 240 for Spider 20) since his purpose here is not to do damage through his regular hits.

https://youtu.be/v-Gx7NCFx70
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon 20

Drexthar has a very good damage multiplier on his AOE ability so if you build Defense-based teams, he can be a really good damage dealer for your dungeon team. Furthermore, the Provoke ability is useful for all the dungeons with waves of enemies. This is an example of an all Defense-based team for Dragon 20. 

We have Tayrel for AOE Defense Down,
Wurlim for his buffs,
Godseeker for heals and revive in case anyone dies, and buff extension. 

All these Champion are defense based and also deal a good amount of damage themselves. Mausoleum Mage for his Defensive Buffs to increase your Defense-based champion’s damage before they nuke, Heals, and Cleanse. 

As you can see, this team does not have any poisoner and takes down the Dragon entirely from dealing Raw Damage. Defense-based champions build high defense for their damage which also naturally increases their survivability, so they are much easier to keep alive then Attack based champion. They are in no danger of dying throughout the entire fight.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-Gx7NCFx70&t=1m58s

If you would like to use a more standard team you can include a poisoner of the correct affinity and keep them alive until you reach the boss stage to take the dragon down
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fire Knight 20

Similarly for Fire Knight 20, Drexthar provides the same AOE damage dealing ability in a Defense-based team, but he also provides additional utility here with hit 3-hit A1 to quickly take down the Fire Knight’s shield. This is an example of a team for Fire Knight 20. 

We have Stag Knight for AOE Attack, Defense Down and Decrease Speed. 
Godseeker for heals, revive in case anyone dies, buff extension and DPS. 
Mausoleum Mage for his Supportive Buffs which also increase the Damage of Defense Based Champions, Heal, and Cleanse. 
Coldheart as the usual top champion for FK 20 with her multi-hit A1, Max HP Nuke and full TM depletion.

As you can see, this team does not have a way to permanently keep the FK’s shield down but the combination of CH and Drexthar’s multi-hit are able to take down the shield very quickly when it gets back up.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-Gx7NCFx70&t=3m50s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc: Reserved
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Frost Spider Gear

Drexthar also has a very specific build for Frost Spider. The most important stats to have on him for the Frost Spider is Accuracy. The Frost Spider has an extremely high Resistance of 580 when it's not under an HP burn and you need at least that much accuracy to reliably place HP burn on it. Keep in mind that Drexthar has an amazing 70 Accuracy aura in all battles so if you use him as your lead, you can account for that aura in your build.

Drexthar needs to survive with HP, Defense and some Speed being the next priority after Accuracy. Around 35k HP, 4k Defense and 180 Speed are recommended. You can ignore Crit rate and Crit damage since he will not be doing any damage through his hits. All he is used for is his HP Burn.

Perception and Accuracy sets for this build are highly recommended to meet the extreme accuracy requirement as well as Eagle Eye T6 mastery.

Glove: Def %
Chest: Accuracy
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP/Def
Amulet: HP/Def
Banner: Accuracy
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Frost Spider

Drexthar is a great option for a sole DPS on the Frost Spider. His main role is to constantly apply his HP Burn onto the Frost Spider through his A1 or after getting hit from his passive. The HP Burn ticks will eventually kill the Frost Spider and prevent it's revival. This means you need to build a team that can survive the long battle until the spider burns to death. This is an example of a team used for Stage 120 Hard Frost Spider:

1)        Scyl of the Drakes
2)        Drexthar
3)        Mausoleum Mage
4)        Doompriest
5)        Lydia

We have Drexthar providing HP Burn as the main source of damage.

Scyl of the Drakes for a constant source of healing, some CC stuns for the Spiderlings, Decrease Speed and some TM control on the main Spider, and revives in case anyone dies.
Mausoleum Mage provides supportive buffs, occasionally block debuffs, with a Heal and Cleanse.
Doompriest provides a constant source of healing and a debuff removal every turn.
Lydia provides some debuffs, and buffs for the team. Lydia is actually not crucial to this team and is replaceable with any other support, healer, Cleanser or CC champion.

https://youtu.be/Q2MErNgfh-g

title: Deacon Armstrong Late Game+ Clan Boss Guide

data.desc:
Deacon does not only excel in Arena and Dungeons. He is also an amazing CB champion. Deacon is a core champion in one of the strongest Unkillable CB team at the moment the DeaconSaladEater. 

Masteries on Deacon for Clan Boss will be slightly different as we want to avoid all the TM masteries from the Support Tree as it will break the speedtune. We will instead opt for the Offense and Defense tree. 

In the Offense tree, take Crit rate, Crit Damage, and all the standard CB damage increasing masteries on the left down to T6 Warmaster. For the Defense tree, take the Damage mitigation masteries in Tough Skin, Blastproof, Delayed Death into both T5 counterattack Masteries. 

If you are unable to achieve the speed that is required you can take Lore of steel in the Support tree as long as you avoid all the TM increasing Masteries. However, the Defense tree is highly recommended as the Counterattack masteries help improve your Damage greatly.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important stat for a Speedtuned CB team is speed. In this team specifically Deacon needs to be at 203-205 speed. Once this speed is achieved, you want to meet the accuracy requirement of at least 225 if you need him to place his Decrease Defense debuff. Then you can fully focus on damage aiming for 100% Crit Rate and as much Attack and Crit Damage % as possible. 

Toxic set is a very good choice if your team doesn’t have poisons. You can then complete the build with any sets that can meet your required stat and optimize damage such as Cruel, Crit Damage, Fatal, Speed, Perception or even broken pieces with good substats.

Glove: Crit Damage %
Chest: Attack %
Boots: Attack %/ Speed
Ring: Attack
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy/Attack

data.desc:
DeaconSaladEater

This is the DeaconSaladEater team with 4 core champions (Deacon, Ma’shalled, x2 Maneater) and one DPS champion of choice. The DPS slot should ideally be able to provide Weaken as Deacon already provides Decrease Defense. Champions like Dracomorph, Fayne, Brakus, Jintoro etc can fill this role.  

The video below showcases this composition with Turvold as the DPS champion of choice. The speed settings used for this team are:

205 Deacon
271 Maneater 
271 Maneater 
219 Ma’shalled 
182 Turvold 

The is a team combination that takes advantage Deacon’s Speed Aura, TM Boost and Ma’shalled’s constant increase Speed Buff to allow the team to go at a 2:1 ratio.
Additionally, Deacon provides Decrease Defense and Ma’shalled provides DPS. 
The Maneaters’ alternate their Unkillable and Block Debuffs every turn allowing this team to be unkillable for the entire run and affinity friendly. 
Turvold brings the main DPS for this team. 

This team works on UNM, NM, Brutal and on all affinities.

Refer to this link for the DeaconSaladEater team. You can plug your own champions make sure they work: https://deadwoodjedi.info/cb/aee03dd8347f589f67e5a21cf130946fb9f7178f

https://youtu.be/dCpJLVv4uuQ

Deacon Armstrong can find a slot in any dungeon with his versatile kit as he brings 2 important skills with him : AoE Decrease Defense and TM manipulation. 

We will start off with the most popular one - the Dragon's Lair. Deacon is weak affinity here but can still stay relevant because he is fast enough to get multiple chances to apply Decrease Defense in case of weak hits. 

The team showcased focuses on controlling waves and keep the poisoners alive that will then bring down the Dragon when they make it.

This Ice Golem 20 team relies on Reliquary Tender as a single target reviver. Deacon works here with Visix to keep the waves under control constantly, allowing Coldheart and Fenax to do their job without killing themselves on the Reflect Damage second wave. 

Fenax also helps with his Block Active Skill and Block Buffs. 

Team breakdown : 
- Deacon : Speed aura, Decrease Defense, CC

Spider Den can be a hard dungeon. However, Deacon can work very well with other champions to keep the Spiders from moving. In this team composition he works with Armiger and Visix to provide as much control as possible. The goal is to allow Ultimate Galek to apply as much AoE HP Burn as possible.

- Deacon : Speed aura, Decrease Defense, TM control
- Visix : CC, Ally Protection and TM control
