data.desc:
Whisper is one of the premier single target damage dealing champions in the Knight Revenant faction and can be used in both the crypts and in Doom Tower. Void affinity allows her to avoid any weak hits. 

She is a true glass cannon, both easily killed and very hard hitting. When coupled with a team of champions who can reliably place Decrease Defense, Weaken on opponents and Increase Attack and/or Increase Critical Damage on her, she can be incredibly useful at getting through higher level Dungeon content and the highest floors of Hard Doom Tower. 

Her A2 has the ability to ignore the DEF of the target if it's under the Weaken debuff that Whisper can place on the enemy with her A1. A3 can help her cycle through her skills faster. Booking her cooldown skills for Late Game+ is a good idea. 

Whisper is best suited by masteries that help her do as much damage as possible. Standard Crit Rate and Crit Damage masteries are a good fit. For her T6 mastery the choice is debatable. If you would like all her skills to hit hard and have more than 220+ Crit Damage Helmsmasher is a good choice for most content. If you only use her for the A2 ability that ignores DEF or have lower Crit Damage Flawless Execution would be the better option. Warmaster is not recommended as it's only good for bosses and Whisper is too fragile on most hard Doom Tower floors to be used there.  

Accordingly the Defense Tree leading to Retribution is useful because Whisper is prone to taking big hits, and Blood Shield and Blood Thirst are useful to help the survivability of a fragile champion during the battles.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Whisper is best suited with gear that provide decent Attack, Crit Rate, Crit Damage and enough Speed to enable her to hit hard and often, although she is probably still going to be the slowest champion in your team. While you could build her with high Accuracy, she is more effective when there is a set up by other debuffers, especially Decrease Defense/Weaken champions such as Venus, Lydia the Deathsiren, Dracomorph or even Fayne. 

Whisper's passive effect gives her a 10% chance of an extra turn should she achieve a critical hit, and while her A2 gives her a 2 turn Increase Crit Rate buff, it's more sensible to give her 100% Crit Rate off the bat since you want every possible chance of that extra turn. Aiming for 100% Crit Rate, 220%+ Crit Damage and 200+ speed is best.

Stats are better than sets, and while Whisper can receive extra benefit from the Relentless set, Cruel set, Savage set, Fatal set and Speed set for example, but they are not required for her to work. If you're using her in the Arena, a Swift Parry set might give an opponent a nasty surprise.

Glove: Crit Damage
Chest: ATK %
Boots: Speed
Ring: ATK
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: ATK/HP/Accuracy

The banner choice depends on wherever you need the Weaken debuff from her or have the full setup from other champions, e.g. Accuracy banner may be required on Faction War crypt 21 for optimal results
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Whisper can be a bit tricky to use and is often better when used manually – as you may have to, if you’re not blessed with certain vital champions in your roster. If she is set to go last on your team, she leads with her A3. If her target has Decrease Defense and Weaken, she will immediately go to her A2, that ignores Defence and hits very hard. Both of these, if they are critical hits, have a chance of giving her an extra turn. If you can keep the debuffs up, Whisper will cycle through her abilities quickly, even if she doesn't get her extra turns and can very easily take out wave opponents – this is especially vital in those tricky higher floors of the Doom Tower where it's vital to take out the Siphis, Gurgohs, and Mountain Kings to have chance of winning. 

If you were not lucky to pull a Seer you can still pass the most difficult waves in hard Doom Tower with Whisper as showcased in the video below

https://youtu.be/JuvAb9YOfZk

In this team Psylar decreases the Turn Meter of all enemies and places Decrease Speed on them to allow slower champions to take their turns.
Lydia applies AOE Decrease DEF and Weaken on the enemies and some useful buffs on the allies
Visix controls the enemies with her AOE Provoke ability
Ursala casts ATK UP
Whisper takes out Siphis and other champions with her abilities

The next page will feature her in Faction Wars, Dragon dungeon and Arena.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Faceless is one of the premier damage champions in the Knight Revenant faction. With the ever growing list of targets that have a high amount of DEF or massive shields both in PVP and PVE environment his A3 skill that ignores Shield, Block Damage and DEF completely is highly sought-after.

His A1 has a 15% chance to proc an extra turn, allowing to cycle through his other abilities quickly. It is preferrable to book at least the A3 for optimal results. Faceless shines in areas where high single target damage is required such as Faction Wars, Doom Tower and Arena. Now that the AI patch is available, selecting A3 as the priority skill will help greatly.

Standard damage dealing Offense tree masteries are handy such as Crit Rate and Crit Damage. However, you should not pick Helmsmasher because Faceless ignores 100% DEF on his main skill. Flawless Execution is the way to increase his DPS the most. Opportunist mastery was picked because he is used primarily in hard Doom Tower with good CC champions that provide the conditions for it.

Defense as the secondary tree is preferred over Support to get some survivability in and a chance to clear debuffs and counterattack. Faceless doesn't need any Accuracy that could be preferred for many other champions
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Unlike most other damage dealers, Savage set is not best in slot. Best in slot gear for PVE would be the Relentless or Reflex sets with 100% Crit Rate, 3-5k ATK, 240+ Crit dmg and enough speed (~190 or higher).

However, Faceless can work with any broken set pieces as long as the stats are good. Some ATK could be beneficial from the sets, but not required

Glove: Crit Damage
Chest: Atk%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Atk

Faceless benefits from Refresh gear that can be bought on the Bazaar for more frequent usage of A3
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
One of the big challenges of the hard Doom Tower Frost Spider rotation are the waves on 114 and 116 with multiple Siphi and Rotos in them. Without the currently commonly used Seer Nuke strategies there are few champions that allow for the same level of AOE or individual nuking capabilities, not least because her passive removes all the traditional debuffs from Rotos.

Faceless can help those without Seer in the roster coupled with TM control and CC to get Faceless going without interruption to nuke down Siphi. He is tough to keep alive and his A1 and A2 are mediocre at best, but he can get the job done as showcased in the video below

https://youtu.be/N-oBM8br8kU

This team features 

Lilitu for the Block Debuffs, ATK UP, Perfect Veil to hide our dps and revive
Faceless as the main dps
Psylar for AOE TM Control and Decrease Speed Debuff
Scyl of the Drakes for AOE Stuns, additional passive healing and emergency revive
Rhazin for DEF Down, Weaken and AOE TM Depletion.

The next page will feature Faceless in Arena and Faction Wars 21.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In Faction Wars, Whisper struggles because of the absence of multiple AoE Decrease Defense champions in the Knights Revenant faction. She needs around 220+ Accuracy to land her Weaken debuff, since so few of the Knights Revenant can place Decrease Defense and Weaken. If you don't have Tomb Lord, you might find that she is best supported by such counterintuitive choices as Crypt Witch or Necrohunter. 

However, the featured team beat level 21 of the Knights Revenant crypt, without having  Tomb Lord, Sinesha, Skullcrown or Rector Drath, all of whom are typical choices for 3 starring the crypt. 

https://youtu.be/U3QND0gWfbA

Here, Miscreated Monster is in a Stun set that increases the chance of stunning opponents with his A1 or A2 and provides Decrease Defense. 
Wurlim Frostking brings a small amount of crowd control and some protection via the buffs.
Narma the Returned throws out a large amounts of poisons and her substantial AoE heals coupled with a Decrease Attack debuff are in fact more important here. 
Doompriest provide healing, debuff removal and ATK Up buff. 

Without many of the usual epics or legendaries, this is is not a fast team, it needs to be run manually, and depends on RNG. Whisper is key, as the other champions control the waves while she does the job of killing them, and then comfortably drops the boss within the 12 turn deadline following the health swap. Building Whisper with more HP than the team tank (Wurlim) drastically increases her survivability.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In this Dragon team 20, Whisper is set up with Venus bringing AoE Decrease Defense and Weaken, and Ursala the Mourner increasing Attack. With the mobs already softened up by her companions, Whisper is able to one-shot the wave champions with her hard hitting A3, and then take an extra turn with her A2 to kill a second. 

This gives two chances for her passive to proc and if it does, meaning she can nearly take out a third opponent. Due to the Cycle of Violence Mastery, Whisper often gets to use the A3 to A2 in successive turns. By the time the team gets to the Dragon, Whisper's damage bonus against bosses kicks in. 

Coldheart and Husk in this team do almost comparable damage to Whisper, but their numbers are skewed by one or two Enemy Max HP hits against the Dragon, which is the reason for using them there. Whisper, meanwhile, lays out consistently large hits against every opponent, even if it's single target.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dA5t3x3coXQ
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In the arena, Whisper is a solid choice for a directed single target hitter. While she may not be the fastest farmer her ability to ignore DEF with her A2 and Helmsmasher mastery allows her to be dps if you have no better alternatives. This is not generally recommended if you have the usual meta champions and the ceiling for Whisper compositions is Gold IV.

Team composition is crucial and she works best paired with champions who can decrease Defense and Weaken opponents, allowing her to take multiple turns and take out two or even – if her passive kicks in – three opponents on her turn.

The team featured in the guide is a Speed comp:

Lyssandra lead for TM boost and control
Lydia for both DEF Down and Weaken as well as defensive buffs and block ressurection
Serris for removing the nasty buffs from opponents
Whisper as the DPS

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lPtLBFsOCFU

Note the third battle here: the opposing team locks Whisper out of A2 and A3, but Whisper still hits hard enough with her A1 to be able to remove the threats anyway
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Achak the Wendarin is a Force Epic from the Demonspawn faction with a strong support focused kit and has excellent Crowd Control capabilities. This guide will focus on Achak's role in dungeon stages 20 and 25.

When booking, you should try to book the A3 fully as it offers either a Freeze debuff or a HP Burn debuff on all enemies on a 3-turn cooldown. For higher stages of dungeon (16+) you will mostly proc Freeze so Achak can be your dedicated Crowd Control there. Note that the skill is only booked to 90% so the masteries choices allows us to maximise it with Fearsome Presence. The passive is what makes this champion so unique. When enemies are under HP Burn your champions get healed and a TM boost when enemies are frozen.

A2 provides a Block Debuffs and Strengthen buff. They are both useful but the 4-turn cooldown does not allow you to keep them up permanently easily.

In terms of masteries Defense and Support tree for Achak have been selected in this build. In the Defense tree, you want to pick damage mitigation and most importantly Fearsome Presence for T6 for the extra chance to freeze. In the Support tree Accuracy masteries and Lasting Gifts to get a chance to extend those buffs are useful along with Arcane Celerity. 

However, if you cannot get high enough Accuracy, Eagle Eye is also a viable alternative option for T6.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The build showcased here allows Achak to duo the Spider's den stages 24 and 25 with Tyrant Ixlimor (credits to MacChan for the idea) : Achak is using a Relentless set. If your Relentless set is not good enough, you should use Speed or Perception as hitting decent stats are more important than the set bonus from Relentless to give you more chances to cast A3.

As a support, you want to prioritize Speed, Accuracy and Def/HP. You should aim for 220+ Speed and 220+ Accuracy for general PvE use outside of the Doom Tower. For Hard Doom Tower, you would want to get 350+ Accuracy. 

Glove: HP%/Def%
Chest: Accuracy/HP%/Def %
Boots: Speed
Ring: Defense/HP
Amulet: Defense/HP
Banner: Accuracy

As for the accessories, Refresh would be the most interesting for Achak as you want to keep the enemies frozen as often as possible.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
With the introduction of Dungeons stages 20+ Achak has gained more popularity than ever as it is now harder to just nuke everything in seconds with enemy MAX HP abilities. 

Spider's den is Achak's main slot most of the time. Achak allows you to duo Spider with Tyrant Ixlimor. The TM and Healing received from the passive is important for your runs as it keeps them alive and significantly boosts your TM. Against Spirit affinity, the comp still works the same way. It is however suboptimal as Achak is weak affinity and will miss Freeze more. His skill priority will also change a little.

Achak + Tyrant duo against the Spider on stage 25 :
https://youtu.be/4ZaCcugUwL8

Here is a comparison between S24 and 25 : 
https://youtu.be/xSC0n1k4YWo

Against stage 24, Achak opens with A2, placing a Block Debuffs buff and a Strengthen first.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dungeons 25 require more Crowd Control than their level 20 counterparts if you don't have enough damage to kill the waves fast. Achak can work perfectly fine in Dragon dungeons as a Crowd Control and a TM booster with that passive. The largest downside to Achak in dungeons 25 is that Freeze reduces the damage taken by the enemies, and with their high HP and Def stats the fight can take longer.

The team showcased here allows you to keep Occult Brawler alive so he can kill the Dragon with his poisons. 

Achak : Defense aura, Freeze, TM boost, Strengthen and Block Debuffs
Dhukk : Defense down, Attack down, Provoke
Fenax : Damage
Occult Brawler : Poison
Ursala : Defense up, Strengthen, Attack up, Attack down, Revive

https://youtu.be/gPHbJTChArEw
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
HP Burn and Poisons are very effective against the Ice Golem 25 as it does not trigger his Frigid Vengeance. Moreover, with Achak having very good synergy with Freeze and HP Burn, the team showcased brings out her full support capabilities as a TM booster and a healer on top of all the Crowd Control provided.

Achak : Defense aura, Freeze, TM boost, Healing
Dhukk : Defense down, Attack down, Provoke
Ursala : Defense up, Strengthen, Revive, Attack down, Attack up
Tyrant : Ally Protection, Defense up, HP Burn
Sicia : Weaken, HP Burn, Damage

Sicia and Tyrant here provide the HP Burn needed to activate the other half of Achak's passive, turning her into a complete support with Crowd Control, TM boost and Healing to help sustaining the team on top of all the damage mitigation provided by other champions. This makes this team very safe.

https://youtu.be/S6MWtSt0Ekc
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For Dragon 20, Achak also provides Crowd Control to keep your more fragile champions such as your wave nuker or poisoner alive, or at least, to allow your healer to get have more time if the healing ability is on cooldown. She works here with Dhukk the Pierced to keep the waves under control.

Achak : Defense aura, Freeze, Strengthen, TM boost
Dhukk : Defense down, Attack down, Provoke
Apothecary : TM boost, Speed up, Healing
Kael : Damage and Poison
Frozen Banshee : Poison

Achak's aura also helps Dhukk do more damage as she is a Defense based champion.

https://youtu.be/T_f7eKu0Y4k
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Despite being weak affinity, Achak stays relevant against the Ice Golem and can help you take on Stage 20. AoE Freeze provides a strong Crowd Control and Block Debuffs, although not always up, can help you block some of the dangerous debuffs thrown your way such as Decrease Defense, Heal Reduction or Freeze. That allows your cleanser to get their ability off cooldown in the mean time. 

The budget team showcased here relies on Reliquary Tender as the only cleanser and reviver of the team with Apothecary helping her keep the team healthy.

Achak : Defense aura, Freeze, Strengthen, Block Debuffs
Apothecary : Increase Speed, Increase TM, Heal
Kael : Damage, Poison
Reliquary Tender : Heal, Cleanse and Revive
Dhukk : Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, Provoke

https://youtu.be/5MCp5SOp5vA
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Stage 20 of the Spider's Den is another instance where Achak is weak affinity and this can be useful. 

She serves as a Spider tank here and helps with the TM boost to keep the team going fast, cycling through their abilities. Taking all the damage from the spiderlings, your more fragile champions such as Coldheart can safely cycle through their skills to use Heartseeker again, allowing you to take down the boss safely.

This team features : 
Deacon : Speed aura, TM control and Decrease Defense
Achak : Freeze, Strengthen, Block Debuffs, TM boost
Scyl : Stun, Heal, Revive
Coldheart : Enemy MAX HP nuke and TM control

https://youtu.be/EP-MZExr8XY
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Demonspawns stage 21 of the Faction Wars is quite difficult as its second wave is the infamous Valkyries wave. If you do not have the burst power to nuke through everything or the defensive capabilities to tank through waves, you are left with the Crowd Control strategy. The team showcased has exactly that in mind, even with 3 weak affinity champions against the Valkyries.

The whole team was built to bring out Achak's full support potential and Sicia's damage potential, but we will be focusing on Achak's performance here. 

Roles : 
- Drexthar : Accuracy aura if needed, HP Burn for Sicia and Achak activation, Provoke and Decrease Attack
- Alure : Decrease Defense, Sleep, TM control. She is the most important champion against the boss
- Umbral : Provoke, Block Buffs. Main source of Crowd Control against waves. She is in a Frost set as it also benefits Achak
- Sicia : HP Burn, Decrease Defense and Weaken, general damage
- Achak : HP Burn, Freeze, Strengthen, Block Debuffs, TM fill, Healing. The complete support. All in one unit, you have Block Debuffs that is very important against boss as you can get frozen, Strengthen to reduce damage taken, Healing and TM fill to keep your team going.

https://youtu.be/oLabXz9KWaQ

For the last round, we will target the boss so Alure can consistently reduce the TM, making the run smoother.

Note that because of the high Defense here, Achak does not freeze all enemies and being weak affinity makes this champion unreliable as the only Crowd Control.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Faceless can be a key damage dealer in Faction Wars for Knight Revenant if you are missing the best in slot options such as Tomb Lord for poisons or Whisper with the proper setup.

On the first wave, focus the Martyrs and make sure to use A1 in the end to have all skills off cooldown. It's important not to use buffs too much on the second wave because Valkyrie passives will trigger and will be detrimental to your run. You need to be able to kill one Valkyrie before they get a turn. In this run ATK up from Doompriest is needed to 1-shot a Valk.
Ideally, debuff the Septimus with ATK Down since he's the scariest damage dealer and CC the Warcaster, if possible.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Maw6xlVeAfQ

On the boss focus the adds first, especially the left one since he applies Taunt for 2 turns. Make sure to only apply crucial buffs and debuffs after the Mirror Universe skill of the boss, especially if you bring Miscreated Monster into the fight. Stolen ally protection can mean the end of 3 star run. Getting some other buffs stolen is not a dealbreaker and getting debuffed can be cleansed by Doompriest easily as well. Keep the health swap in mind and pay attention to the cooldown of Mirror Universe after the health swap. After that it's a straight forward fight with Faceless as a DPS.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pM1oQpnIK-4
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Faceless is a possible single target DPS for your arena team as he can nuke even extremely high DEF champions with one hit. Unfortunately he is mainly limited in his use and slow marking Gold IV arena as the ceiling for his efficient use.

In the featured team composition:

Psylar leads with AOE TM reduction
Duchess provides targeting protection with Perfect Veil and ATK up buff
Astralon removes the opposing team's Veil
Faceless one-shots opponent's Lilitu

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j6_Sw4-2eac

In the second showcase the opponent's beefy Lilitu is also one-shot and ignore shields ability of Faceless is even more relevant against enemies with massive shields and teams that contain Krisk.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6-hbO7Lm_J8
data.label: Notes:

data.desc: Reserved
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ithos is a Void Legendary champion from the High Elves that is one of the best nukers and damage dealers in game, with 2 AOE abilities and a strong A1 skill. He is an old champion that has been around for a while but remains one of the best for a large number of areas of the game. Ithos has a very high base attack with high damage multipliers and Void affinity so he can never weak hit, making him an incredibly consistent nuker and damage dealer. In the Arena, he is often a preferred choice against force enemies or mixed affinity enemies and in the Dungeons, he is a very consistent DPS since he can never weak hit.

Booking Ithos is not necessary but is highly recommended as his main purpose is to deal damage and the damage increase gained from book will significantly improve his damage potential. Lowering the Cooldowns on his AOEs will be very relevant in Dungeon content. 

For Masteries, we will select the standard Nuker Offense and Defense tree masteries. We will take the standard Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Heart of Glory and the two right masteries on T3 and T4. Whirldwind of Death, Cycle of Violence, Kill Streak, Methodical are great masteries for a PVE nuker as they allows Ithos to scale throughout the run. Finally T6 Helmsmasher is a good option if you can achieve the required 220+ Crit Damage.

In the Defense Tree, take Improved Parry for damage reduction against Crit, Bloodthirst for healing with each kill, Delayed Death for survivability and the T5 Retribution for chance to Counterattack.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The best set for Ithos as a DPS Nuker are Savage and Cruel. Although Ithos has an ability that guarantees a Crit, it is still highly recommend to build him with 100% Crit Rate if you use him in other content and not just Arena. 

If you only use him in Arena, 100% Crit Rate is not necessary. An arena specific build will be covered later on the pages of the guide dedicated to it. The next focus is to get as much Attack and Crit Damage as possible with enough speed to match your team so your turn sequence doesn't get cut into. Ideally at least 4k+ Attack, 200%+ Crit Damage, and 200+ speed. If you are unable to build him in Savage, the next best sets are Triple Cruel. If neither is an option any other combination that can help you achieve the recommended stats will work.

Glove: Crit Damage %
Chest: Attack %
Boots: Speed/ Attack % (If you have enough Speed substats)
Ring: Attack
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Attack
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Nightmare campaign

Ithos is currently the best and fastest Nightmare Campaign Farmer in the game due to his kit and extremely fast animations. However, he requires good gear to be able to do it. Great news is that the gear requirement is no different than any other content you use him in. However, it is important to note that you need at least 206 Speed so that Ithos can go twice before the mobs take a turn. The video below showcases a few runs of Nightmare Campaign 12-6 with food champions.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k2R1pedGtdQ&t=7m11s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon 20

On Dragon 20, Ithos can play the role of a DPS Nuker. Paired with an Increase Attack buff and AOE Decrease Defense debuffs on enemies, he can single handedly clear both waves easily. He also deals significant damage to the Dragon so you don’t have to rely entirely on a Poisoner for damage.

This video showcases an example of a budget Dragon 20 team. 

Ithos provides the DPS as described above. 
Warmaiden for AOE Decrease Defense. 
Gorgorab supports with Increase Attack, TM Boost, healing, and revives. 
Mausoleum Mage supports with his Buffs and Cleanse. 
Frozen Banshee as the Poisoner against the Dragon.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k2R1pedGtdQ&t=3m48s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon 25

Dragon 25 will be tougher as the mobs and boss boast much higher HP. Ithos still performs his role as a DPS Nuker but he cannot do it alone if you want fast runs. We need the help of secondary DPS to speed up the run. 

The video showcases an example of a Dragon 25 team with Ithos in the same DPS role. 

Ma’shalled providing his Buffs and CC against the waves and Leech on the Dragon so the team can heal.
Gorgorab in still in the team to support with Increase Attack, TM Boost, healing, and revives. 
Venus for AOE Decrease Defense, Weaken and Poisons against the Boss. 
Cruetraxa as Pure single target DPS against the Dragon. 

Venus is replaceable with any other Decrease Def champion and Cruetraxa can be replaced with any Poisoner.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k2R1pedGtdQ&t=4m47s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fire Knight 20

In Fire Knight 20 Ithos can take on the same role as a DPS Nuker. Paired with an Increase Attack and AOE Decrease Defense, he can clear both waves easily. Ithos can also help take down the shield charges. He has a triple hit A2 and his A1 can proc extra turns.

This video showcases an example of a budget Fire Knight 20 team. 

Ithos provides the wave DPS mentioned above. 
Stag Knight for AOE Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, and Decrease Speed.
Gorgorab Increase Attack, TM Boost, healing, and revives. 
Finally, 2 Coldheart as the must include in all FK 20 teams with her multi-hitter to take down the shield and Heartseeker to drop TM and deal massive damage to the Fire Knight. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nMbB8k4Hq8I&t=5m29s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Fire Knight 25

Fire Knight 25 will be tougher as the mobs and boss here have much higher HP. The Fire Knight also has more shield charges (12) than FK 20. Ithos can still performs his role as a DPS Nuker on the waves, but he cannot do it alone if you want fast runs. We need the help of secondary DPS to speed up the run. Ithos can also help take down the shield charges due to triple hit A2 and his A1 can proc extra turns.

The video showcases an example of a Fire Knight 25 team with Ithos in the same DPS role. 

We now have to include Alure in the team as Coldhearts are no longer as effective in Stage 21+ dungeons. Alure will control the Fire Knight by constantly decreasing his TM. 
Stag Knight still provides AOE Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack and Decrease Speed which is crucial against the Fire Knight now that TM reduction effects are limited. 
Ma’shalled providing his Buffs, namely Increase Speed and CC against the waves and Leech so the team can heal. 
Gorgorab is still in the team to support with Increase Attack, TM Boost, healing, and revives. Gorgorab is also useful here against the Gnalhorns who are occasionally able to place Unkillable on themselves which cause a loop from Alure constantly reducing it's TM so it never runs out. Gorgorab's A1 can remove buffs if he is built with enough accuracy. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k2R1pedGtdQ&t=5m45s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem 20

In Ice Golem 20 Ithos takes on the same role. If you build a team with an Increase Attack and AOE Decrease Defense, he can single handedly clear both waves easily. The important thing to note for Ice Golem is that there is a problem with Ithos where he does too much damage and constantly triggers the Ice Golem Big Retaliation Slam so you need to build a team with supports that can heal, revive and provide a Decrease Attack as you will be constantly be taking hits. 

This video showcases an example of a budget Ice Golem 20 team. 

Ithos provides the DPS as described above.  
Stag Knight provide AOE Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack and Decrease Speed. 
Gorgorab and Scyl supports with Increase Attack, TM Boost, healing, and revive if things go south. 
Doompriest for additionally healing and debuff cleanse. 

https://youtu.be/k2R1pedGtdQ
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem 25

Ice Golem 25 will be tougher as the mobs and boss here have much higher HP. Ithos still performs his role as a DPS Nuker but he cannot do it alone, at least not quickly. We need the help of secondary Nukers to make the run faster. Additionally, we need a lot more survivability in the team to survive the hard-hitting mobs and boss. 

This video showcases an example of an Ice Golem 25 team. 

Ithos has the same DPS role with Stag Knight provide AOE Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack and Decrease Speed (Stag Knight is negative affinity here so, he is not ideal but still works. A better champion would be Dhukk the Pierced for this role). 
Gorgorab supports with Increase Attack, TM Boost, healing, and revives. 
Sir Nick for his Shields, Continuous Heals and Unkillable to improve the team’s survivability. 
Rotos for additional DPS and to Block the minions from Reviving. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k2R1pedGtdQ&t=1m25s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For Arena, there are two different ways to build a Ithos. The masteries remain identical to the ones covered in the main Late Game+ Guide page. You might want to make small adjustments depending on your team, e.g. pick Stoked to Fury if you are using Gurptuk. However, the gear can vary depending on your team composition and needs.

If you are using Ithos in all other content as well, the Savage and Cruel sets with 100% Crit Rate as shown in the guide earlier are recommended as it will also function very well in a standard Arena team as well. This team will usually be the standard Speed team with TM Boost, Decrease Defense and Nuke strategy. You want to build Ithos with enough speed so you don't get speed cut by your opponents (see speed tune guide [1] to make sure your arena team is speed tuned). Selecting A2 priority in the AI setting can be helpful for maximum DPS output.

Another build is a specialty Arena build with Immunity or Untouchable set. In Immunity type sets, it is most common to build for a high crit rate (65-85%) but not 100% with high attack (5.5k+) and crit damage (250%+) as his A3 guarantees a crit. The 3 hit A2 does more damage and is good against targets that require multiple hits (Rotos) though. This build is mainly used against the popular Arena nuisance defences like Hegemon and Tormin. You can use the AI setting to prioritise A3 usage on arena.

As this type of Ithos is used often against slow annoying enemies of mixed affinities, not a speed team, speed tuning your team is not always necessary, but you usually want him with at least around 210-230 speed. 

Glove: Crit Damage 
Chest: Att%
Boots: Speed, or Att% with high speed sub-stats 
Ring: Att
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Att 

[1] Do visit https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/arena-calculator  for arena speed tune calculator.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
G4 Arena (Non-Immunity Build)

Ithos is one of the top and most consistent Arena Nuker in the game. Due to being Void Affinity, he doesn’t have the weakness of a chance to weak hit that all other affinity nukers do. He has 2 AOE abilities with high multipliers and one of them being a triple hitter which is very relevant against Rotos and the new Reaction Accessories.

The video showcases a standard Arena team with Arbiter for TM Boost and Increase Attack, Lyssandra for a secondary TM Boost, Madame Serris to remove buffs and place Decrease Defense, and Ithos to nuke in Gold 4 Arena.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k2R1pedGtdQ&t=7m51s
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Platinum Arena (Immunity Build) 

Immunity Ithos is necessary to counter Hegemon and Tormin teams. As with a standard Ithos, you want high attack (5.5k or more) and reasonable crit rate for A2 against Rotos.

An Immunity Ithos is most commonly paired with an Immunity Kymar, a Shield Set Champion for protection like Krisk or Maulie, and a Decrease Defense Champion that does not wake up the enemies from Sleep like Madame Serris. 

This team functions with Prince Kymar being the fastest in the team and sleeping the Enemies. Since this team is usually used against slower teams, a well built Prince Kymar will usually go first. 

Then, Madame removes buffs on any that resisted Kymar's strip and places Decrease Defense without waking the sleeping enemies before Ithos Nukes. A Shield champion is in the team for protection against Hegemon Nuke. This team has the disadvantage of not having an Increase Attack Buff but benefits by having attack down and a safer 2-3 turn victory through Kymar resetting skill cooldowns so your team can go again. 

Arbiter Madame is also quite good if you have an extra Arbiter to build in immunity to replace Prince Kymar, but there are risks of a speed gap between Arbiter and Ithos since there is no AOE sleep to CC the enemies so Ithos can safely take a turn.

https://youtu.be/1tIzX2WAWJE
data.label: Notes:

title: Dhukk the Pierced Late Game Guide

data.desc:
Dhukk the Pierced is a Defense based Epic from the Orcs faction. He's an alternative to Zargala and Robar as an AoE Decrease Defense for this faction. This guide will focus on his performance in Faction Wars and dungeons.

Dhukk is often compared to Stag Knight as he also offers an AoE Decrease Defense and Decrease Attack in one skill on a 3 turn cooldown. Unlike Stag, this ability is booked up to 100%. However, you need Dhukk to have 100% crit rate to ba able to place all the debuffs so he might be more difficult to build early on. His Decrease Accuracy can be useful in some boss situations and his Provoke provides extra Crowd Control on waves. 

For masteries, Offense and Support tree were picked. Offense tree down to Warmaster T6 is a typical dungeons build if you want to deal more damage against high HP opponents like bosses. These masteries also work for a Clan Boss scenario. 

Support tree is selected to boost Accuracy when possible to meet Hard Doom Tower's requirements (350+ Accuracy ideally). If you can reach those numbers with just your gear or don't plan to use him for that content, Defense tree for damage mitigation is advisable. 

Eagle Eye can also be picked if you struggle to reach higher Accuracy levels. Note that Sniper only works for his Decrease Accuracy on A1.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
As a debuffer, the most important stats for Dhukk to aim for are Accuracy, Speed and Crit Rate. 

You should aim for 220+ Accuracy for PvE contents other than DT, 350+ Accuracy for higher DT stages. For Speed, he should be as fast as possible and faster than your nuker for dungeons unless speed tuned for Clan Boss. Being as consistent as possible with debuffs requires 100% Crit Rate. The rest should go to Defense and HP.

For Clan Boss, without Leech, he should be in Lifesteal. For other content, Speed, Perception or Accuracy are very good sets to reach the stats needed, but not mandatory as long as your stats are sufficient. 

Glove: Crit Rate
Chest: Defense%/HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Defense/HP
Amulet: Defense/Crit Damage
Banner: Accuracy

As for the special accessories, they can help but certainly not mandatory, he works well without them.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Decrease Defense makes clearing contents faster, and Faction Wars are no exception. 

Dhukk provides a very solid Defense aura for the crypts, a Decrease Defense and Attack and last but not least a form of Crowd Control with his Provoke. A versatile champion like him is valuable for team building as he provides you with more flexibility and allows you to bring other utility champions if needed.

This team features :

Dhukk : Aura, CC, Defense and Attack Down
Iron Brago : Damage, Defense up, Attack down and Provoke
Seer : Damage and Weaken
Vrask : Healing
Old Hermit Jorrg : Revive, Attack up, TM boost

https://youtu.be/nT-hsXohgC4

The next page covers Dhukk in other dungeons

title: Dhukk the Pierced Late Game Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
This slide shows Dhukk and Achak working together to control waves in Dragon 20. The strategy here is to keep your fragile damage dealers alive, and carry them to the Dragon. Once your poisoner reaches the Dragon they will be able to kill the boss by themselves. 

Dhukk plays an important role here as he provides Decrease Defense to make Kael hit harder, Decrease Attack so your team takes less damage and Provoke to tank for your weaker champions. 

Achak provides extra control and damage reduction through Freeze and Strengthen.

Apothecary provides Increase Speed, Increase TM and Healing to make the run smoother

Kael provides AoE damage on waves and Poisons with Frozen Banshee to kill the Dragon quickly

https://youtu.be/T_f7eKu0Y4k

data.desc:
Dhukk helps greatly with survivability against the Ice Golem in various ways. His Decrease Attack allows the team to survive against the boss for most hit, his Provoke can prevent the Terrorbeasts from putting up Reflect Damage on wave 2, his Decrease Accuracy allows you to avoid dangerous debuffs (Decrease Defense, Heal Reduction, Freeze) and his Decrease Defense makes the runs faster, meaning less chance for bad RNG. 

Team breakdown :

Apothecary : Defense aura, Increase Speed and TM, Healing
Dhukk : Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, Decrease Accuracy and Provoke
Reliquary Tender : Cleansing, Healing and Revive
Kael : Wave damage and Poisons
Ghrush : Healing, backup Decrease Attack, Wave damage

https://youtu.be/ozAiWM8iX1Q

data.desc:
Dhukk also finds a place on Spider's Den Stage 20. His most important skill there is the AoE Decrease Defense and Attack. This allows your champions to hit harder against the boss (Heartseeker from Coldheart), allows Miscreated Monster to put up a bigger Shield but also makes the Spider and spiderlings hit for less against your team, making Miscreated Monster's shield even more durable. Overall, his kit also improves your team's survivability considerably against the Spider

The team showcased features :
Miscreated Monster : Shield
Drexthar : HP Burn, Spider tank
Dhukk : Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack
Coldhearts : Enemy MAX HP nuke, TM control

https://youtu.be/kJuiLQpiZ-g

The next page will deal with Dungeons 25
data.label: Notes:

title: Dhukk the Pierced Late Game Dungeon Runs 2

data.desc:
Dhukk brings a Decrease Attack debuff that is very valuable for the Ice Golem's Peak as the boss there hits extremely hard. That's also the reason why Stag Knight is so often seen in this dungeon rosters. As Stage 25 is Magic affinity, Dhukk has an edge over Stag Knight here. His other utility such as Decrease Defense and Provoke are also very important to make the run faster or to help control the waves to lessen the burden on Ursala. The team showcased uses HP Burn to bring the boss down :

Achak : Defense aura, Freeze, TM boost, and Healing here
Dhukk : Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, Provoke, Decrease Accuracy
Ursala : Increase Defense, Increase Attack, Strengthen and Revive
Tyrant : HP Burn, Increase Defense and Ally Protection
Sicia : HP Burn, Weaken, Damage


https://youtu.be/S6MWtSt0Ekc

Despite being negative affinity against the Dragon on Stage 25, Dhukk can still work as a debuffer. He also naturally acts as a tank there on top of his Provoke skill (no hit so not subject to weak hit either). For a reliable Decrease Defense and Decrease Attack, he is certainly not ideal, but can very well help you tackle this dungeon. The goal here is to bring your poisoner to the Dragon, as it is still your most reliable source of damage to take down that boss.

This team features :
Achak : Defense aura, Freeze, TM boost
Dhukk : Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, Provoke
Fenax : Wave damage
Occult Brawler : Poison

https://youtu.be/gPHbJTChArE

data.desc:
The Fire Knight's Castle is a difficult dungeon because of multiple role requirements. You want to survive waves, have enough TM control against boss and enough multi hit to bring the shield down quickly. Dhukk provides some of those with his 2 hit A1 and his Provoke on waves. Decrease Defense helps your damage dealer do more damage. 

This team relies on Alure to keep boss from moving completely and Seeker allows Alure to go more often for maximum efficiency. 

Team breakdown :
Dhukk : Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, Provoke debuffs
Alure : TM control; 3 hit A1
Seeker : TM boost, Increase Attack, 2 hit A1

If you want to deal with the boss even faster, you should pick Giant Slayer at T6 for Foli
https://youtu.be/DipQNl_NGaM
data.label: Notes:

title: Ma'shalled Late Game+ Guide White Whale

data.desc:
Ma’shalled is a key champion in enabling various 2:1 ratio CB compositions (both Unkillable and non-Unkillable kind) due to his ability to provide a permanent 30% Increase Speed buff to the team and Leech debuff skill on the CB that allows to forego Lifesteal gear for non-unkillable teams.

If you are using Ma'shalled for CB booking him fully is required for best results. The following sections of the guide will cover him in various such compositions. This Guide focuses on one of the few non-unkillable teams that can reach 100+ million damage on UNM CB.

For Masteries, the Offense and Defense trees are the ideal choice. Support tree is usable if you are unable to achieve the required speed but as with all speed tuned teams, the TM boosting masteries should be avoided. 

In the Offense tree choose the standard CB damage masteries in Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Heart of Glory and all the left masteries down to T6 Warmaster. In the Defense tree, choose the damage mitigation masteries in Tough Skin, Black Proof, and Delayed Death. These masteries are extemely important for non-unkillable teams to last until rounds 50+ on UNM CB. Then we take both T5 Counterattack masteries that will be relevant for unkillable teams that don’t have CA buffs permanently in the comp.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For non-unkillable teams, Stalwart gear is essential for Ma’shalled. Since Ma’shalled is an Attack-based champion with low base Def, it is impossible to raise his Defense to an optimal amount without sacrificing a lot of his damage, so we achieve this Damage Mitigation through the Stalwart set. 

As for stats, the most important stat to achieve is speed. You need to hit the speed number depending on the type of 2:1 speed tune you are using. In general, aim for at least 225+ Accuracy, 2700-3200 Defense, and 40k HP to achieve optimal survivability. If you are using Iron Brago in the same team that provides additional Defense, you can lower the Defense stat requirement in his build. For example, if Brago provides 500 Def, you can reduce Ma’shalled Def to about 2200-2700. 

Once you achieve the optimal defensive stats, you can finally build him to do damage. Build him with 100% Crit Rate or as close as you can, with as much Attack and Crit Damage as possible. Ma’shalled can deal significant amount of damage due to his high damage multipliers. 

Depending on the team comp you use him in, if Ma’shalled is always the first to die while your other champion are still healthy and not close to dying, you should re-organize your stats distribution and increase Ma’shalled’s survivability by sacrificing his damage so he can last as long as your other team members. Lasting longer into the fight will usually allow the team to yield significantly more damage over time. 

The following will list Best / Second Best / Third Best alternatives to gearing but you can use any combination of gear stat % to reach the recommended stats.

Glove: Crit Damage / Crit Rate/ Defense %
Chest: Attack % / Defense %
Boots: Attack % / Speed / Defense %
Ring:  Attack / Defense 
Amulet: Crit Damage / Defense
Banner: Attack / Defense / Accuracy
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
2:1 Budget/Affinity Friendly White Whale Comp

This a budget and affinity friendly variation of the 2:1 While Whale comp with Ma’shalled which is also capable of hitting 1 Key UNM with the right affinity. Instead of the Legendary champions we have Skullcrusher for Counterattack, Doompriest for the debuff cleanse to make this team affinity friendly and two fusion champions in Iron Brago and Rhazin. Rhazin will be the best DPS champion since he is Def based but can be replaced with other Decrease DEF/Weaken champion like Fayne, Venus, or Dracomorph.

Team makeup (UNM Void setup in parenthesis):
Rhazin - 226 speed (No delay)
Iron Brago - 204 speed (Delay A3 2 turn, A2 1 turns)
Ma'Shalled - 253 speed (Delay A2 1 turn)
Skullcrusher  - 251 speed (No Delay)
Doompriest - 188 speed (No Delay)

NM void delay:
Same of everyone except,
Ma’shalled (Delay A2 2 turn)

You can find the speed tune calculator here: https://deadwoodjedi.info/cb/cfec1b2d8c1870f0c1a076694079874f7c9e585b

This team works on all affinities but due to the nature of this comp, the 2:1 does not sync up until the later rounds so the slow debuff from the Spirit CB can still interfere with this team. A different set up has to be used and a detailed explanation can be found in the linked video below which also showcases this team in action on Spirit Affinity. This team did not hit a 1 key on Spirit due to the weak hits from 3 Force champions but is capable for 1-keying on Void. It can still 2 key in this situation.

https://youtu.be/2mbamUoIPcE

The next page goes into detailed of a less budget White Whale team
data.label: Notes:

title: Ma'shalled Late Game+ Guide White Whale 2

data.desc:
Ma’shalled is a key champion in enabling various 2:1 ratio CB compositions (both Unkillable and non-Unkillable kind) due to his ability to provide a permanent 30% Increase Speed buff to the team and Leech debuff skill on the CB that allows to forego Lifesteal gear for non-unkillable teams.

If you are using Ma'shalled for CB booking him fully is required for best results. The following sections of the guide will cover him in various such compositions. This Guide focuses on one of the few non-unkillable teams that can reach 100+ million damage on UNM CB.

For Masteries, the Offense and Defense trees are the ideal choice. Support tree is usable if you are unable to achieve the required speed but as with all speed tuned teams, the TM boosting masteries should be avoided. 

In the Offense tree choose the standard CB damage masteries in Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Heart of Glory and all the left masteries down to T6 Warmaster. In the Defense tree, choose the damage mitigation masteries in Tough Skin, Black Proof, and Delayed Death. These masteries are extemely important for non-unkillable teams to last until rounds 50+ on UNM CB. Then we take both T5 Counterattack masteries that will be relevant for unkillable teams that don’t have CA buffs permanently in the comp.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For non-unkillable teams, Stalwart gear is essential for Ma’shalled. Since Ma’shalled is an Attack-based champion with low base Def, it is impossible to raise his Defense to an optimal amount without sacrificing a lot of his damage, so we achieve this Damage Mitigation through the Stalwart set. 

As for stats, the most important stat to achieve is speed. You need to hit the speed number depending on the type of 2:1 speed tune you are using. In general, aim for at least 225+ Accuracy, 2700-3200 Defense, and 40k HP to achieve optimal survivability. If you are using Iron Brago in the same team that provides additional Defense, you can lower the Defense stat requirement in his build. For example, if Brago provides 500 Def, you can reduce Ma’shalled Def to about 2200-2700. 

Once you achieve the optimal defensive stats, you can finally build him to do damage. Build him with 100% Crit Rate or as close as you can, with as much Attack and Crit Damage as possible. Ma’shalled can deal significant amount of damage due to his high damage multipliers. 

Depending on the team comp you use him in, if Ma’shalled is always the first to die while your other champion are still healthy and not close to dying, you should re-organize your stats distribution and increase Ma’shalled’s survivability by sacrificing his damage so he can last as long as your other team members. Lasting longer into the fight will usually allow the team to yield significantly more damage over time. 

The following will list Best / Second Best / Third Best alternatives to gearing but you can use any combination of gear stat % to reach the recommended stats.

Glove: Crit Damage / Crit Rate/ Defense %
Chest: Attack % / Defense %
Boots: Attack % / Speed / Defense %
Ring:  Attack / Defense 
Amulet: Crit Damage / Defense
Banner: Attack / Defense / Accuracy

You cannot use Refresh jewellery as Ma'shalled with this build as he needs to cycle his abilities in a certain sequence
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
This is one of the earlier variations of a 2:1 White Whale comp with Ma’shalled that is capable of hitting 1 Key UNM. With the addition of new Defensive champions, it has evolved into a team that’s capable of hitting 100m. This composition with Iron Brago, Altan, Rhazin, Valkyrie and Mashalled can hit 100m on UNM and works on UNM, NM, and Brutal. 

This team still follows the same principle of a non-unkillable team where;

1) We have an Atk Down from Altan
2) Decrease Def/Weaken from Rhazin,
3) CA and shields from Valkyrie
4) Permanent Inc Def and Passive Def Stat to the team from Iron Brago
5) Ma'shalled enables the 2:1 ratio with his permanent Increase Speed buff.

Team Speed and Setup (UNM Void):
Altan - 226 speed (delay A2 0 turn)
Iron Brago - 204 speed (Delay A3 2 turn, A2 0 turns)
Ma'Shalled - 252 speed (Delay A2 1 turn)
Valkyrie  - 251 speed (Delay A2 0 turns)
Rhazin - 189 speed (Delay A2 0 turns)

NM void delay:
Same for everyone except,
Ma’shalled (Delay A2 3 turn)
Brago (Delay A2 3 turns A3 1 turn)

Brutal void delay:
Same for everyone except,
Ma’shalled (Delay A2 1 turn)
Brago (Delay A2 3 turns A3 1 turn)

You can find the speed tune calculator here: https://deadwoodjedi.info/cb/211116ad261c36b6e8b67be947ca255ee450716a 

This team is unfortunately, not affinity friendly. Adjustments in the setup needs to be made for different affinities and this team does not work on Spirit affinity. This comp breaks down due to the slow debuffs causing it to desync. The CB will also target Rhazin and weak hits will hurt the overall damage that may still be in the 2 key territory despite this. 

For RED affinity you run the same void affinity setup

For BLUE affinity UNM AND NM:

Altan - A2 1 turn
Iron Brago - Delay A2 2 turn, A3 1 turns
Ma'Shalled - Delay A2 5 turns

You can find the video of this team in action here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SBGKdIUklb0

The next page will cover Ma'shalled in an Unkillable team setting

title: Ma'shalled Late Game+ Guide 2:1 Unkillable Clan Boss

data.desc:
Ma’shalled is a key champion in enabling various 2:1 ratio CB compositions (both Unkillable and non-Unkillable kind) due to his ability to provide a permanent 30% Increase Speed buff to the team and Leech debuff skill on the CB that allows to forego Lifesteal gear for non-unkillable teams.

If you are using Ma'shalled for CB booking him fully is required for best results. The following sections of the guide will cover him in such compositions. This Guide focuses on Ma'shalled in an Unkillable CB setting and a team called DeaconSaladEater that requires this specific combination of champions to function.

For Masteries, the Offense and Defense trees are the ideal choice. Support tree is usable if you are unable to achieve the required speed but as with all speed tuned teams, the TM boosting masteries should be avoided. 

In the Offense tree choose the standard CB damage masteries in Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Heart of Glory and all the left masteries down to T6 Warmaster. In the Defense tree, choose the damage mitigation masteries in Tough Skin, Black Proof, and Delayed Death. These masteries are extemely important for non-unkillable teams to last until rounds 50+ on UNM CB. Then we take both T5 Counterattack masteries that will be relevant for unkillable teams that don’t have CA buffs permanently in the comp.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For an unkillable team, Gear sets are much more flexible for Ma’shalled. There are no specific gear sets required. You can gear him with any gear that helps your achieve the desired stats such as Cruel, Perception, Speed, Crit Damage, etc.

As for stats, the most important stat to achieve is the correct speed. You need to reach the speed number depending on the type of 2:1 speed tune you are using. You may or may not need to build him with Accuracy but it is highly recommend to do so as Ma'shalled is still usable in other content in the game in this case. Additionally, his A3 does increased damage if he is able to steal the buff from the CB on affinity and his Leech Debuff helps your allies heal enough to trigger the CA mastery. So, aiming for at least 225+ Accuracy is useful.

Once you have achieved the required Speed and Accuracy stats, you can finally build him to do damage. Build him with 100% Crit Rate or as close as you can, with as much Attack and Crit Damage as possible. Ma’shalled can deal significant amount of damage due to his high damage multipliers. 

Glove: Crit Damage %
Chest: Attack %
Boots: Attack % / Speed 
Ring:  Attack 
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: Attack / Accuracy

You cannot use Refresh jewellery as Ma'shalled with this build as he needs to cycle his abilities in a certain sequence

data.desc:
This is the DeaconSaladEater team with 4 core champions (Deacon, Ma’shalled, x2 Maneater) and one DPS champion of choice. The DPS slot should ideally be able to provide Weaken as Deacon already provides Decrease Defense. Champions like Dracomorph, Fayne, Brakus, Jintoro and others can fill this role.

The video below showcases this composition with Turvold as the DPS champion of choice. The speed settings used for this team are:

205 Deacon
271 Maneater
271 Maneater
219 Ma’shalled
182 Turvold

The is a team combination that takes advantage Deacon’s Speed Aura, TM Boost and Ma’shalled’s constant increase Speed Buff to allow the team to go at a 2:1 ratio.

Additionally, Deacon provides Decrease Defense and Ma’shalled provides DPS.
The Maneaters’ alternate their Unkillable and Block Debuffs every turn allowing this team to be unkillable for the entire run and affinity friendly.
Turvold brings the Weaken and is the main DPS for this team.

This team works on UNM, NM, Brutal and on all affinities and can 1 key any of them.

Refer to this link for the DeaconSaladEater team. You can plug in your own champions make sure they work: https://deadwoodjedi.info/cb/aee03dd8347f589f67e5a21cf130946fb9f7178f

data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Basher is a unique CC champion in the Skinwalkers Faction who can be played in a variety of late game content such as FW, Doom Tower and high G4/Platinum arena. The reason this champion is so desirable is due to his ability which locks out the enemy team - preventing them from using most of their cooldown abilities against you. 

His A2 being able to increase the cooldowns of all enemy skills by 2 turns gives you enough breathing room to allow the rest of your team to set up and take out the enemy team safely or create a very tedious to beat tanky defence. This form of CC also bypasses block debuffs and cannot be 'cleansed' by conventional methods. The only way this form of CC would fail is if Basher did not meet the accuracy requirements. This skill is highly valuable and very similar to another ability possessed by Warlord - arguably one of the best arena champions in the game, thus making Basher earn his spot as a worthy late game void epic.

As an offensive arena champion that can lock enemy skills, you want your Basher to be as fast as possible to be able to go before the enemy team and lock them out. He can cycle through his abilities quicker and get back to his A2 which is why it is advisable to book his A2 to reduce the cooldown by one turn. Booking his A3 isn't particularly necessary for arena but can come in very clutch for PVE. Book this ability if you want to (somewhat) reliably depend on the block buffs for PVE content. His A1 does not need books.

For an arena Basher that is the focus of this guide select masteries that help aid in increasing his accuracy, provide some extra form of CC or give extra survivability. This is why as seen below, the Defence and Support trees have been chosen with Eagle Eye as the T6 mastery for sufficient accuracy in Arena.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Basher needs to be quick to ensure he can go before the enemies take their turn. He also needs a high level of accuracy to ensure that when he does attack, the skill locking ability of his A2 does not get resisted. 

Therefore, you would be looking at around 240-250 speed if you are using 2 TM manipulators. Otherwise, you will need to aim around 300+ speed if you only use 1 booster. You will also need to have a high level of accuracy to compete in end game arena. 450-500 acc will suffice for both Gold IV and low Platinum arena and DT. If you can squeeze additional HP% in then that's an added bonus. 

Reaching these stats can be difficult but the most optimal sets to use would be Swift Parry. An alternative would be Immunity-type sets when battling against Tormins or hegemons, followed by either Speed or Perception sets with as much speed and accuracy rolls possible.  

The Swift Parry set allows for an annoying defence and even if you lose the speed race, Swift Parry can save your basher and allow him to use his A2 which might swing the fight in your favour.

Gloves: HP% with acc and speed substats
Chest: ACC with speed substats
Boots: SPD with acc substats
Ring: HP 
Amulet: HP with acc substats
Banner: Accuracy with speed substats

Basher benefits from Refresh gear that grants a chance for the skills not to go on cooldowns as repeated A2 procs can lock down opposing teams longer.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Basher is a versatile champion, able to allow you to create a decent tanky defence for Platinum defence or a Speed offence team. His A2 is able to bypass Immunity sets and will also be able to hit every champion. This includes those hiding behind veils such as Candraphon. It is important to note that Hegemons and Tormins can be problematic if you don't have a cleanser of your own. 

In the video below the team comp is as follows:

Arbiter lead for TM boost
Basher for Cooldown increase
Madame Serris for debuffing
Astralon for nuking

Unfortunately, the Astralon went before my Serris due to Cardiel resisting Basher's A2. This allowed Astralon to gain TM due to his passive from the incoming ally attack, otherwise Serris would have debuffed and Astralon would have cleaned up. 

https://youtu.be/hl2ShKaaKj8

Another showcase of the same team

https://youtu.be/enxdlL-EB14

In this next video, Basher is shown to be effective in a late game defensive arena team. Note that the goal of this team is not to win. It is to stall as long as possible. With the same stats, Basher is paired up with 3 revivers to ensure a long and tedious fight for the opponent. In most cases for Platinum arena (near reset) if Basher can manage to land his A2 before the enemy takes a turn, most tend to leave as it takes too much time to try and win the fight.

The revivers are as follows:

Arbiter Lead
Siphi the Lost Bride
Duchess Lilitu

https://youtu.be/ehNYsynHihk 

One more showcase: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bmfYgNvXqK8

The next page covers Basher in Faction Wars

data.desc:
In this Dragon team 20, Genbo does pretty well as a Wave Nuker with hard hitting A1s against the Dragon. With his buffs stacked he can also hit upwards of 50k with each hit of his A1 and 100k Nukes against the waves. His passive is also helpful to prevent the Decrease Attack debuff applied by the Dragon boss.

This is an example of a Dragon 20 team with 

1) Venus bringing AoE Decrease Defense and Weaken as well as Poisons against the Dragon
2) Archmage Helmut for his Buffs and CC against the waves
3) Brogni for Increase Attack and Defensive Buffs

This is an example of a Fire Knight 20 team showcasing Genbo as the sole DPS champion in the team.

We also have:

1) Venus bringing AoE Decrease Defense and Weaken
2) Arbiter for Increase Attack, TM Boost, and Revives in case anyone dies
3) Lyssandra for TM Boost and TM Control against the Waves and Fire Knight
4) Nethril to CC the Waves and some TM Control against the Fireknight

data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Do you find yourself waiting upwards of 30 seconds to defeat teams with unkillable champs in them? Do you cringe when you attack a Skullcrown team? Well, if you have Genbo fear no more! Genbo is great to help speed up those arena battle because he ignores the unkillable buff.

Genbo is a Void affinity Epic from the new Shadowkin Faction that has a unique ability to igore the annoying unkillable buffs that are prevalent in the Arena Meta right now. As a Nuker, it is highly recommend to at least fully book his A2 and A3 to get the full damage percent increase from books and lowering cooldown.

Masteries are in the Offense and Defense trees as none of Genbo's skills need accuracy. In the Offense tree, take the Crit Rate, Crit Damage, Arena damage increasing masteries like Heart of Glory, Ruthless Ambush, Killstreak and into T6 Helm Smasher for a chance to ignore Defense and it is the premier mastery for Arena Nukers. Note that capped Crit Rate and 220%+ Crit Damage is recommended when selecting it, otherwise you can opt for Flawless Execution.

In the Defense Tree, Defiant is selected to take Improved Parry to reduce critical hits, into Bloodthirst, Delayed Death, and both of the Counterattack masteries.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Savage and Cruel set are the best combination for Genbo's role as an Arena Nuker. 

Ideally, at least 4k Attack, 70% Crit Rate, 200%+ Crit Damage, and enough speed to match your arena speed team without getting cut. Genbo is unique as a nuker in that he has an ability to place a 30% Increase Crit Rate buff on himself which allows him to be built with only 70% Crit Rate opening up more options for gear. If you are unable to build the recommended stats in Savage and Cruel set, any combination of offensive sets such as Offense, Crit Damage, Cruel, Fatal, etc can be used instead. This is example of such build. The reason this build has a low speed is due to the Arena team where a double TM Booster in Arbiter and Lyssandra is used. 

Glove: Crit Damage % 
Chest: Attack % 
Boots: Speed / Attack % 
Ring: Attack % 
Amulet: Crit Damage % 
Banner: Attack %
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Genbo is a great nuking option in the current arena meta where the annoying Swift Parry sets and unkillable are popular. He can self buff to increase his Crit Rate and Crit Damage but must be under an Increase Attack Buff to ignore unkillable buffs, so he must be paired with any champion that can provide that buff like Arbiter, Gorgorab, Seeker, etc. 

He is also immune to Decrease Attack that might be applied to him. While he can hit hard, he is not among the top Arena Nukers so, he might not always hit hard enough for the tankiest of teams, as you can see in the YouTube video linked below. He also does a single hit AOE so you should be careful using him against Rotos. His main utility is his ability to ignore the unkillable buffs.

Additionally his AI does not work as well on auto as he occasionally does not use his A3 self buff before attacking. Most likely due to the AI thinking that it'll get the kills regardless, so make sure you either set the AI overrides correctly to A3 in the first round or manually play him in arena.

Video showcase:
https://youtu.be/s-dfkZhDogQ

Note that the masteries in the guide are better suited for Genbo compared to the ones featured in the video.

The next page will cover him in PVE setting
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Blind Seer is an underestimated Void Legendary champion. She can be highly useful in many areas and can work well in nearly all content in the support role. She excels against teams with persistent debuffs placement such as Tormin and has a nice DEF Aura that works everywhere in the game.

This guide will cover her in the Late Game+ Setting with a focus on Resistance. Blind Seer benefits from nice base parameters and has one of the highest base speed stats in the game making gearing her easier.

Skill Overview:

A1: Inferior version to Alure's A1 Turn Meter manipulation. Random targeting and random chance of landing a low percentage turn meter decrease. Not worth booking.

A2: Superb HP shield and Block Debuffs. Fully worth investing in.

A3: Provides a full team Revive and Block damage on all champions except herself. This gives the team time to heal or use their skills off without worry for the most part. The Block Damage can however backfire - enemy AI will begin focusing on Blind Seer because she’s the only one without it. Tormin also has a chance to freeze on revive because of the buff.

Masteries for this build are focused mainly on increasing the shield potential and Resistance. Defense tree travels the path of maximising Resistance and ends with [Unshakeable] as a T6 mastery for the +50 Resist. Support tree highlights include [Lasting Gifts] to potentially get a 3-turn Block Debuffs and shield. [Rapid Response] is also a good option because Blind Seer places a good number of buffs on the team.

If you are not able to reach high resistance levels you may consider selecting Timely Intervention as the alternative T6 mastery instead.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Blind Seer is effective at around 250+ speed and 350+ resist for most PVE situations, in particular Hard Doom Tower. 

For PVP situations, Blind seer with 500+ resistance should be able to handle most unprepared arena teams. You also want to aim for 55K+ HP to receive a sizable shield buff. This might change in the future if the metagame switches to using AOE Accuracy buffs in Platinum Arena.

Resistance, Immortal and Speed sets are desired. However, the most important part is reaching the stats mentioned above.

Substat priority: 1) Speed, 2) Resist, 3) HP%, 4) DEF%

Glove: HP% 
Chest: HP% / RES
Boots: Speed 
Ring: HP/DEF 
Amulet: HP/DEF with RES
Banner: RES with speed, HP%
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Blind Seer can excel against arena teams that rely on landing debuffs and slowly chipping away at you. Her Defense aura can allow your team to survive a Hegemon nuke. Her high Resistance can shrug off Tormin's freeze or Lyssandra's turn meter manipulation. 

Her main use in Arena is conditional on the survival of the team and you need to watch out for teams that are much faster than her and have buff removal and AOE DEF Down like Serris. Blind Seer has her place up to Gold 4 arena in a possible “Go second” type of team. The shield and block de-buffs can be amazing for tanking a couple of hits.

At the moment Blind Seer is usually not used in Platinum and is relegated to Gold IV and 3x3 team where she can be used against teams that are debuff heavy.

https://youtu.be/0lsq_a4Vj9c

The featured team consists of

Nekhret for protection of the main dps and Ally Attack
Rotos as the main dps that get stronger by leeching enemy HP
Tormin to apply Freeze to enemy speed teams that do not have immunity capabilities
Blind Seer for extra shield, block debuffs and revive.

With this team, the extra shield on Rotos makes him much harder to kill. The team is not fast but can survive lots of hard hitting attacks from many teams on Arena. It is less efficient in Platinum and especially near reset where nearly everyone has access to immunity type sets or high enough resistance to shrug off Tormin.

You can find some more footage of Blind Seer on 3x3 Arena below against an enemy stall team with Duchess Lilitu, Tormin, Khoronar and Minaya where Blind Seer showcases the importance of Block Debuffs against heavy debuffers.

https://youtu.be/xVIk_qXq1uc?t=93

On the next page we will be covering her in a range of PVE scenarios
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Husk is a Force Affinity HP Champion in the Undead Hordes faction, and this well-upholstered zombie is one of the handful of champions who have an ability that does damage based on Enemy Max HP. 

As a HP-based champion, he can be built to be quite tough, and brings some useful debuffs to the table. Husk has a reasonable chance of provoking opponents with each of the two hits of his A1, especially when booked, which makes him an effective control against wave opponents and especially useful against the Magma Dragon. His AoE A2 not only hits based on Enemy Max HP (doing a bit less damage then Royal Guard's similar ability), but also has a 60% chance of stunning opponents when booked out, which means that he can be useful against both waves and bosses. Even in Doom Tower and level 21+ dungeons, where Enemy Max HP damage is capped, Husk can be a decisive factor in boss battles. 

Most of the time Husk has been completely eclipsed by Royal Guard due to affinity issues with the most popular dungeon for MAX HP Nukes - Spider 20. However, nowadays Husk has his own niche in PVE content.

Husk benefits from all of the Masteries that maximise damage. At Tier 6, he can gain the largest benefit from either Warmaster, Helmsmasher and Flawless Execution. 

Warmaster allows him to do more damage against bosses with his A1 and his A3 at a slight cost of A2 damage. 
Helmsmasher and Flawless Execution favour the A2 slam and allow him to do more damage against waves. 
It is generally recommended to use Helmsmasher if your Crit Damage is higher than 220%+ for maximum benefit.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Husk can be a little tricky to build – his A1 does damage based on Attack, while his A3 does damage based on his current HP. He is one of the rare champions who is better served by his A1 and A2 being improved by books than his A3, which does respectable damage at best and unless you build him specifically with his A3 in mind, does not have the utility of either of his other abilities. 

Critical Damage and Crit Rate should be high and Husk needs a decent level of Accuracy for his debuffs to land. Essentially, you need to decide whether to concentrate on Accuracy, Attack or HP, or to fall somewhere between them. It is easier to build Husk with high HP than high ATK, and with enough HP, Husk’s A3 can be deadly, but it is still not one of the biggest damage dealing abilities in the game. You might find that in a preset team you prefer not to use the ability at all, since the A1 Provoke is so valuable.

You can build him as an all–out damage doer, but there are many other champions, especially if you're in the late game, who do a better job of that, and you may find that his crowd control abilities are too useful to be wasted. 

The build featured here is a hybrid build, intended to work in as wide a range of venues as possible.  It has a reasonable amount of HP, and enough Speed and Accuracy to be viable in dungeons and the Doom Tower. In preset teams, this Husk's AI is set not to use his A3. Stats are better than sets, and Husk benefits as much as any other champion from Speed and Divine Speed, Perception, Relentless, Lifesteal, Resilience and so on. Stun, Retaliation and Reflex sets can be very effective on Husk. If built with a lot of HP, a Shield set can defend Husk's entire team. With a Destroy set he can be a viable DPS option against the Scarab King. 

Gloves: Crit Damage
Chest: HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: ATK, with HP% substats
Amulet: Crit Damage
Banner: ACC

Husk can benefit from refresh jewellery if you have any spare ones
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
While he is off-affinity against Spider level 20, Husk is positive affinity against Spider 25. 

https://youtu.be/XzFXTYzur8o

In the showcased team, he is with Achak the Wendarin, Visix the Unbowed, Venus and Miscreated Monster. 

Venus drops Defense and burns the spiderlings, while Achak freezes them. 
Visix is set to only use her A1 for Turn Meyer Control and 
Miscreated Monster helps keep everyone alive with his shields, although his Ally Protect is disabled in this setup. 
Husk's A1 and A2 offer a little more control if needed, but primarily he's here to do damage. 

Although the spider does get a turn, the combination of the AoE HP burn and Husk's slams kill the spider. Husk's damage is the second highest after Venus's burn damage. 

On the next page Dragon 20, FW and Doom Tower are covered

data.desc:
Husk has always been a great champion to farm Dragon 20 with, as he can help to control waves and does sizeable damage against the Dragon. Most of the time Dragon is considered to be an easy dungeon for Late and Late Game+ players so Husk was rarely used for farming and speed running.

https://youtu.be/8k47uh8MSCg

Venus for AOE Decrease Defense, Weaken and HP Burn for faster wave clears 
Ursala the Mourner for Decrease Attack, defensive buffs and revives 
Coldheart for MAX HP Nuke

It can be seen that with his combination of control and damage, Husk matches the other two DPS champions easily.
