data.desc:
In Crypt 21 of the Undead Hordes Crypt in Faction Wars, Husk does much the same job he does in dungeons.

https://youtu.be/a3qdFV3lcHU

In the video, he isn't by any means the primary damage dealer, but in a solid team he is still an effective control of waves (even though he is largely off-affinity for the difficult Valkyrie wave) and can do a lot of damage to the boss. 

The team shown here also features 

Gorgorab, who brings heals and revives
Seeker, who increases Attack and Provokes 
Bloodgorged, who brings DPS, Decrease Defense and some cooldown control
Ma'Shalled, who controls the waves and provides a fantastic suite of buffs, as well as dps 

Here, Husk is a solid member of the team whose contribution helps make for a convincing win.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In the Doom Tower, Husk's use cases are situational. He can be part of winning teams in the Secret Rooms for Epic Undead Champions, Force Champions and HP Champions, bringing control and decent damage. In auto strategies, he is generally best served by having his A3 disabled in the team setup. 

As a PVE fighter, Husk can come in against several of the Doom Tower bosses, including the Frost Spider, Eternal Dragon, Celestial Griffin and Scarab King. However, his very best place in the Doom Tower is in a team fighting Kuldath the Magma Dragon. 

https://youtu.be/kxKqBQhUaFI

He is positive affinity against Kuldath in the Frost Spider rotation and neutral affinity in the Eternal Dragon rotation.

In the team shown here Husk is partnered with 

Ursala the Mourner with Decrease Attack, Increase Attack, Increase Defense, Strengthen buffs and Revive
Venus for AOE Decrease Defense, Weaken and Poison – her AI defaults to not using HP burn against Kuldath
Ma'Shalled for several important debuffs and buffs, control of waves and secondary DPS. 
Team lead is Kantra the Cyclone, whose Accuracy aura allows Husk's debuffs to land on the boss even at the highest levels. 

The strategy is simply to keep enough debuffs on the boss that Kantra’s passive Provoke procs most turns and for Husk to give another chance of provoking the boss with his A1 should Kantra’s provoke (75% chance only) fail. This allows the team to wear him down quickly. 

Even though Husk's A2 damage is capped, his damage output still outstrips that of a top-tier legendary DPS champion in the final tally. The Husk/Kantra team-up works for both rotations, regardless of who else comes along for the fight.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Necrohunter is considered to be one of the worst champions in the game. If you look for the statistics, he is possibly one of the most used 4 star chickens. However, there is one area of the game where he can be useful indeed and that is Faction Wars Crypts. With sufficient stats and masteries you can make a team that will be able to complete this crypt to get Lydia without legendaries or void epics! It is important that you don't want to build him too well and waste resources on the one hand. On the other he can do his job on minimal investment and that will be the focus of this guide.

His most important ability is a Decrease DEF on the A1 default skill that will help reduce the damage dealt by the Valkyries on the second wave and kill the boss quickly. It is also an ability that currently only a few champion in this faction posses. The base chance is 50% probability which is sufficient and there is no need to book Necrohunter. The other 2 abilities are simple dps skills and have decent multipliers. 

This skill sets along with Warmaster T6 mastery makes it possible to kill the boss before it uses the ability to exchange life in 12 turns resets cooldown. Gravestorm has only a 50% chance to attack twice which makes it unreliable for consistent damage and is the mainly reason why this champion doesn’t have many uses outside of the faction.

The rest of the masteries are a semi-classic defense build with Retribution and Deterrence that focus on damage dealing and survival capabilities.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The most important stats is ACC then a balance between Crit Rate, Crit Damage and Speed. Although he does not need 100% Crit Rate it is recommended as well as 250 acc. 

Stats for Necrohunter can vary greatly depending on the accompanying champions. In the featured composition four support champions were used and he was the one that did most of the damage. 

It is recommended to build him with 100% crit rate and at least 200% crit damage along with at least 3000 atk without forgetting the ACC so that you can place Decrease DEF which is its his most important ability. For Faction Wars ACC of between 200 and 250 is recommended, with an advanced GH. 

Gloves: Crit Damage with crit rate substats 
Chest: ATK% / ACC 
Boots: Speed 
Ring: ATK 
Amulet: Crit Damage with acc substat 
Banner: ATK / ACC

It is important to keep a balance and if you have more offensive champions on the team and less support then it will be necessary to give him more HP and DEF and less damage so that he is able to survive.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
The video featured here shows a full team of non-void epic champions defeating one of the toughest factions on auto.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aESoPSFwF_0

Rector Drath is the key here that makes auto possible. She has Veil buff, healing and revive along with ATK Down debuff on A1. Rector does not need any special masteries and can be built in a generic way, trying to make her as tanky as possible (regen, immortal, reflex sets for example). If you are going to try manual, make sure not to use the heal with Rector just before the boss steals the buffs.

Bergoth needs to be booked to increase the chances of applying the provoke, but you can do it without it if you are patient and ready for rng to keep the Valkyries on wave 2 in stun and provoke. It is important not to build Belgorth with high Crit Rate because the boss can steal the Continious heal buffs that he applies on A1. 

Sinesha can be used for healing and works well in a stun set to keep the waves under stuns. 

Doompriest with Relentless set can be utilised to remove the debuffs from the waves and from boss skills. Additional passive healing is a nice bonus.

Finally, Necrohunter is the main dps of the team and provides Decrease DEF that is a key dps enabler for the whole team especially if they have Warmaster as their T6 mastery.

Beyond the Faction Wars, Necrohunter usage is not generally recommended, but perhaps he will be the key to your goal of 3 starring this Knight Revenant Faction and getting Lydia!

Note that the same team will work in hard Doom Tower Secret Room 10 of the Eternal Dragon rotation that requires Knight Revenant Epics
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Sicia Flametongue is a Force Attack Legendary champion from the Demonspawn faction. She is currently the only champion with the AOE HP burst ability that activates all HP Burn on her enemies, making her the best champion to Speed Farm Spider 25 in the game. This guide will focus on Sicia as a damage dealer for dungeons, Faction Wars, Arena and Doom Tower secret rooms.

Her main skills are her A2 and A3 and those skills should be booked for best results. Her A3 places an AoE HP Burn then grants an extra turn if the HP Burn is placed on all enemies. This works even if she kills the enemy with the skill. Her A2 deals damage from the HP Burn and also places Decrease Defense and Weaken on all enemies. This means she can work alone especially if you use the AI presets to select skill priorities for using her AOE burn first. 

However, it is advisable to run her with another AoE HP Burn if you want her to be your reliable Decrease Defense and Weaken champion. This HP Burn detonation is very strong against the Spider as the damage is not capped at the moment unlike MAX HP and Poison burst strategies, making her the most important champion for speed farming this dungeon. Her A1 can extend the HP Burn keeping at least 1 enemy constantly under this effect.

Sicia is used here as a Debuffer/Nuker so Attack and Support trees were selected. Support tree gives her extra Accuracy and gives a chance to extend her Decrease Defense or Weaken. Attack tree down to Helmsmasher T6 to maximise her damage as a nuker especially in Arena. This build is good for most content except for the Spider's den as you actually don't want her to deal too much raw damage there.

When used as a pure Debuffer, against the Frost Spider for example, going down Support to Eagle Eye T6 can be a good choice to reach the Accuracy needed (about 600 Accuracy). If you want to use her exclusively for Boss fights, Giantslayer is the mastery you should pick, especially against the Clan Boss for maximum sustained DPS.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The build showcased here is a hybrid build with an emphasis on her role as a debuffer, therefore, Perception set was used. If you plan on using her mainly as a nuker, Savage and Cruel would be ideal. Overall, any set can work on her as long as you can hit the target stats depending on the role. Perception and Speed are usually good sets to build hybrid stats.

For a nuker build, you want 5k+ Attack and 250+ Crit Damage mainly, then enough Speed to be Speed tuned in your team and around 200 Accuracy to be relevant for dungeons. 

For a pure debuffer build/Spider build, you'll want her to deal as little damage as possible. You'll then focus on Accuracy (350+ for Hard Doom Tower, 600+ for Frost Spider 120), HP and Defense to keep her alive and enough Speed to go before your damage dealer.

Gloves: Crit Damage for damage else HP%
Chest: Atk%/HP%/Accuracy
Boots: SPD 
Ring: HP/Atk
Amulet: Crit Damage/HP
Banner: Accuracy/Atk

As for accessories, she doesn't need any of the special sets to work better.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Sicia provides a very strong skill for speed farming Spider with her A2. This skill detonates one stack of HP burn on all enemies, dealing massive damage quickly. Its damage is not capped for now, making her the best champion for this dungeon in a speed farming scenario. 

However, the build required to get the best time out of her is vastly different from her regular build. You actually don't want her to deal raw damage so Attack and Crit stats have to be as low as possible. You also don't want her too fast to lap the Spiderlings, making the fight longer. Her passive makes her faster the more enemies are under HP burn and it's noticeable when so many targets are burning.

She should be slightly above 150 Speed to allow the HP Burn to tick before activating it on the spiderlings. As we are using another HP Burn to enable Sicia in this composition, her AI was set to open with her A2 and use it as soon as it is available. This other champions makes the run faster and more reliable as Sicia can get resisted on her HP Burn, preventing her from taking an extra turn to deal damage.

Gurgoh can be replaced with any AoE Freeze or Stun. His long animation did slow the run down here. Other AOE Freeze champions are an excellent fit for speed run teams on Spider as the spiderlings under Freeze debuff don't die prematurely

Team : 
- Sicia : HP Burn nuke
- CH : Enemy MAX HP nuke, TM control. Set AI to use her A3 first
- Kymar : Skill reset. Can be replaced with Renegade
- Gurgoh : AoE Freeze to make the run safer
- Ignatius : AoE HP Burn that cannot be resisted

https://youtu.be/VA-io7_eZ4A
data.label: Notes:

title: Avir the Alchemage Late Game Guide

data.desc:
Avir is one of the decent rares that can be helpful and viable in late game content including Faction Wars that is one of the most difficult stages to 3 star and ultimately get Lydia for the efforts. Upon his release, the Dwarf faction lacked healers as well as Turn meter/speed controllers outside of a few hard to acquire legendaries. Avir played an important role as an easily obtainable champion that provided a lot of utility. While his importance has somewhat waned with more than 8 new champions added to the faction, he remains a great option for free-to-play and mid-late game low spenders to use.

His kit has three main uses. He is a great debuffer with access to Poisons on A1 allowing him to be a good dps on the bosses. His A2 provides an AOE small Decrease ATK debuff and his A3 grants AOE TM increase and healing. Together this makes him a solid support even though his skills scale in damage with ATK.

Avir's masteries are based around helping keep other champions on your team alive using a combination of his heal and the bulwark T6 mastery. Bulwark will help absorb some of the damage other champs are receiving to keep them alive and the support tree is mostly focused on the healing and the debuff aspect of his kit.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
One of the exciting parts about Avir is that he's one of the few champs in the game that greatly benefits from the toxic set. The way his A2 works is that the Decrease Speed debuff is placed on targets under poison debuffs, but the toxic set places the poison before the move occurs, which allows you to get decrease speed debuffs a lot more often. 

Another great aspect of Avir is that his heal is based off Avir's MAX HP, so one of the two most important things about his build is providing a high HP pool to make the heal bigger. Having enough accuracy to land debuffs is important, and the rest of the stats should go into speed and defense.

Gloves: HP%
Chestplate: HP%
Boots: Speed
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP
Banner: HP/ACC

If you have spare refresh jewellery it can benefit Avir for more frequent healing usage

Fodbor the Bard - Debuffer - His AOE Defense Down helps the DPS champs kill the waves and the boss much quicker
Melga Steelgirdle - Shielder/Reviver - Her AOE shield and revive capabilities are almost a must if you hope to 3* on auto
Avir the Alchemage - Healer/TM - heals the allies, slows the enemies and provides DPS with poisons

https://youtu.be/xc2x0-RXgXc

Avir can also support comfortably in the Dragon dungeon. In this budget setting for Dragon 24 

Avir Bulwark mastery, healing and TM boost along with debuffs help on the waves, even if the progress is slow. Poisons help during the boss stage.
Scyl provides healing, AOE stun on waves and emergecy revive
Frozen Banshee shines the most on the boss stage by quickly stacking Poisons
Stag Knight applies AOE DEF Down and ATK Down

title: Sicia Flametongue Late Game+ Dungeon runs

data.desc:
We will begin the overview with dungeons 25 where Sicia works best as well as Faction Wars and then cover some budget Dungeon 20 runs on the next page.

Since the Enemy MAX HP damage reduction on stages 20+, it takes much longer to farm Ice Golem without Seer and AoE Poison burst. Sicia provides a useful source of damage against the boss in HP Burn burst on top of her damage against waves and her Decrease Defense and Weaken debuffs.

The team is built to utilise Achak's full support capabilities, however, Tyrant also helps setting up Sicia so she can be our Decrease Defense enabler and damage dealer.

Team breakdown : 
- Achak : Defense aura, TM boost, Healing, Block Debuffs, Strengthen, AoE Freeze
- Dhukk : Decrease Defense, Decrease Attack, Provoke, Decrease Accuracy
- Ursala : Increase Defense, Increase Attack, Strengthen, Decrease Attack, Revive
- Tyrant : AoE HP Burn, Ally Protection, Increase Defense
- Sicia : Damage, AoE HP Burn, Decrease Defense, Weaken

data.desc:
Sicia works decently as a damage dealer for Dragon 25 where she is neutral affinity. In the featured team:

Deacon provides a Speed aura, TM control, AoE Decrease Defense and Leech on boss stage for the team to heal up. He is in a Stun set for extra CC
Sicia provides AoE Decrease Defense, AoE HP Burn and Weaken on top of her dps
Sinesha provides CC through her Stun set and a pseudo Healing ability
Ursala provides Increase Defense, Strengthen and Decrease Attack AoE for survivability, Increase Attack for Sicia to deal more damage and a revive if needed
Occult Brawler provides Poison to kill the boss.

https://youtu.be/zxnJvHvDgRU

data.desc:
Demonspawn Faction Wars stage 21 has the infamous Valkyries second wave. It makes tanking this stage head on or going for a drawn out fight without Duchess very difficult for the faction. Sicia can provide the damage to bring down the enemies quickly. The shorter the fight, the less likely you are to get hit by bad RNG. 

The team showcased brings out Achak and Sicia potential. You may need to manual to ensure the 3 star clear.

- Drexthar provides an Accuracy aura, AoE Provoke and Attack Down and HP Burn when hit
- Alure provides TM control, she keeps the boss from taking too many turns as the team is pretty fragile
- Umbral provides an AoE Provoke and an AoE Block Buffs, particularly useful against the Valks

The fight was done on auto, only intervention needed was on Boss round to make Alure target the Boss for extra TM control

Dragon 20 is a very important dungeon to farm because Speed set is generally useful, and other sets such as Stalwart or Destroy can be important for Boss fights.

Sicia being strong affinity here makes her a strong damage dealer and enabler.

She has a chance to nuke twice (watch out for affinity as she needs to place her HP burn on everyone) and usually hits hard enough to take out the enemy damage dealer.

data.desc: Reserved
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In Faction Wars, Basher thrives with both his A2 and A3 on all Crypt stages. Being able to put the enemy skills on cooldown for 2 turns helps massively, allowing you to progress through the waves smoothly. Coupled with those skills, Basher's A2 can also come in clutch with the Block Buffs, stopping the enemies from setting up if the fight takes longer than the initial 2 turns from the A2. This can come in especially handy during the Valkyrie waves.

Basher's PVE masteries can remain the same for FW and DT. The Offence Tree is taken for the additional damage from Warmaster. Extra damage masteries are also selected such as Deadly Precision for ease of building high Crit Rate, Keen Strike for the additional Crit Damage, and Bring it Down for extra damage on bosses. 

The Support Tree is chosen for the extra accuracy. Notable masteries include: Evil Eye for the TM depletion, Cycle of Magic for the potential of getting the A2/A3 back quicker and any of the Accuracy increasing masteries.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For FW, you want to make your Basher as fast as possible (ideally 230+ Speed) whilst also allowing for 220-230 Accuracy. This will ensure that he passes the Acc vs Res check and also cycles his skills as fast as possible - ensuring that the enemy stay locked out. For higher stages of Doom Tower you would want the accuracy to be 350+ to ensure he lands his A2/A3. You would also want him to keep that same level of speed if not higher.

Once these stats are achieved you can look into trying to make your Basher do extra damage with any extra form of Crit Rate/Crit Damage. Be careful however, as using the extra stats to allow your Basher to do more damage can cause him to be targeted if he doesn't have enough HP.

These stats can be quite difficult to achieve so speed and perception sets are optimal for Basher here. If you can achieve these stats without these sets then an offensive based set such as Crit DMG or cruel would work well for Basher. 

Gloves: Crit Dmg or Crit Rate 
Chest: HP% / Atk% 
Boots: Speed  
Ring: HP 
Amulet: Crit Damage 
Banner: Accuracy 

Refresh accessories would also benefit Basher allowing him to get back to his main abilities but not at the expense of the required stats.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Basher plays an integral part of this FW comp. His main role is to allow the team to be able to get to the boss smoothly as there are no revivers in this comp. His A2 gives the rest of the team enough time to set up and slowly but surely take the enemies down. 

Norog is used for damage as well as extra CC through block buffs. 
Longbeard is used as a replacement for Fayne in terms of damage especially against the boss. His ally attack can remove an ad from the game, synergises quite well with Reinbeast's continuous heal buff and makes the boss' 12 turn time limit more bearable. 
Steelskull and Reinbeast are there to keep the team healthy and topped up against the boss

Everyone in this comp has been built above 200 speed for the simple fact that this boss can be quite troublesome if the damage is lacking. Mirror Universe essentially puts you on a 12 turn time limit which failing to beat almost 'resets' the fight as the boss gains a massive amount of health.

Once you do reach the boss, Basher's job is done. From this point on Basher will be used simply to help with damage. His A2 and A3 don't affect the boss but his A1 does. Landing the weaken can be helpful in getting the extra damage in.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IbYmImn0rFE
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Rector Drath is a Force Epic from the Knights Revenant faction. She is currently the only reviver of this faction and her addition to the game helped the playerbase tremendously to 3 star stage 21 on auto. She is also known as budget Duchess as she can perfom similar to Lilitu.

She is a strong champion in lots of content but has a drawback for Late Game+ PvE runs: her passive healing at the start of her allies turn triggers an animation making the runs much longer than needed. This guide will focus on her performance in Arena, Faction Wars, Doom Tower Secret Room and Dragon 20 in a pure support build (no accuracy for her A1).

Her A2 is a powerful healing ability based on her MAX HP, her A3 is a single target Revive with 60% HP and fills the TM to 60%. Both skill can place Perfect Veil which is a a powerful buff for AOE damage mitigation. Booking her cooldown abilities is worth it for her to perform optimally.

For masteries, Defense and Support tree were picked to maximise her support capabilities. Defense tree provides damage mitigation and Cycle of Revenge allows her to go faster in a go second situation. Support tree boosts her HP, healing capability and allows her to cycle through her turns faster when allies are down or low. Timely Intervention in T6 was picked for this reason.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
The build showcased here is mainly aimed at Arena, but it also works for other PvE content other than Clan Boss as her heal is so strong that she basically works with any set. For Arena Defense, she is built in Swift Parry. 

This build did not focus on Resist and you want about 3k Defense, 200+ Speed and as much HP as possible. Decrease Defense can heavily lower your defensive capabilities otherwise. Frost or Frostbite are also good options in an Arena defense situation. 

For PvE, you can build her in Speed, Stalwart, Reflex or even Relentless. You want her to heal and revive constantly so the more turn she takes, the better. 

Gloves: HP%/Def%
Chest: HP%/Def%
Boots: SPD
Ring: Def/HP
Amulet: Def/HP
Banner: Def/HP

For accessories, Reaction is best in slot for Arena to mitigate incoming damage, while Refresh and Cleansing can also be good for different situation, in PvE or PvP.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Rector being Force affinity with a passive Resistance boost for allies under Veil makes her a very strong champion for Arena defense or in a go second team as most popular nukers are Magic affinity and are have a 35% chance to weak hit against her, giving you a chance to make a comeback. Swift Parry and Reaction give you even more chances to survive. 

The teams showcase have Candraphon, Rector and Vogoth as the core, and the last spot is a flex spot. 

Candraphon is the most popular nuker for Arena defense as he is Force affinity and is tanky for an Attack based nuker. He also benefits directly from Rector's Perfect Veil here with his abilities.
Vogoth allows you to have better chance at surviving AoE nukes. 
The last spot was for Seeker or Doompriest for Increase Attack, Cleansing, TM boost or Increase Defense, depending on the context. Alternatively, a second reviver is used here.

Against Serris and Trunda : https://youtu.be/x5R-Fs_Jed4

Against blender :

- https://youtu.be/VoyrBgFLvJo

The next page will cover Rector in FW, DT and Dragon 20

Rector is the best epic and very important element for Faction Wars stage 21 at the moment as she offers a Revive, allowing you to make some mistakes and still be able 3 star the Faction. As stated before, Rector is not really a dungeon champion for farming as she slows things down significantly with her extra animations. However, she can work in a progression setting. It is important to note that she is more of a healer than a reviver for dungeons if you have many fragile champions who keep dying, her single target revive won't be enough. Team breakdown :

data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Umbral Enchantress is a Void Epic from the Demonspawn faction. She is quite unique as she offers a reliable 2-turn AoE Provoke allowing you to control enemies for an extended period of time. She is usually key to Faction Wars stage 21 clear on auto due to her effectiveness on the Valkyrie waves. This guide will cover her role in Arena, Faction Wars, Doom Tower Secret Room and Dungeons. 

Umbral's A2 and A3 are both highly prizes skills. A2 places an AoE Block Buffs debuff and A3 puts up an AoE Provoke for 2 turns. Both should be booked to get 100% chance for maximum efficiency. Her A3 also places an Unkillable buff on herself allowing her to tank even more comfortably. Being Void affinity, she does not weak hit and places the debuffs reliably. However, A3 also places a Block Active Skill on herself for 5 turn and it cannot be removed.

For Masteries, Offense and Support trees were picked here. Umbral does decent damage so selecting Offense tree can help with the dps. As for the Support tree, you want to pick the extra Accuracy, TM boost or Evil Eye for some extra TM control. 

Umbral has different builds so the choice of T6 can vary. If you want to build her full on as a nuker, Helmsmasher can be picked for T6. If you want her to have some sustained damage against Bosses, Warmaster T6 is the natural choice. If you want her to be your debuffer for high end content like Arena and struggle with the Accuracy requirement, Eagle Eye T6 is the way to go.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Umbral's builds are very flexible and diverse. It all comes down to what you need to achieve the end goal. For sets, you can use Speed or Perception as they are useful sets all around. As she provokes the enemies, Frost or Frostbite are also great options. Lifesteal or Regen/Immortal can bring more self sustain. The build showcased here is using Regen set mainly for the Secret Rooms in the Doom Tower.

As for stats, for a control build, you want enough Speed to be tuned with your booster, then enough Accuracy (220 for dungeons, 350 for hard Doom Tower and as much as possible for Arena). If you plan on giving her some damage, Crit Rate and Crit Damage are always nice to have. Having some Resist is also useful as you might encounter enemies who can remove her Unkillable with their A1 : around 300-350 Res is comfortable for PvE. 

Gloves: Crit Damage/Crit Rate for damage else HP%/Def%
Chest: Def%/HP%/Acc
Boots: SPD
Ring: Def/HP
Amulet: Crit Damage/HP/HP
Banner: Accuracy/Def/HP

For accessories, no special set is particularly useful for her
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Umbral is a popular choice in Arena for speed nuke teams up to Gold IV. Both her A2 and A3 can be useful, but the Provoke is really the best debuff here as it allows you to run your nuker at a lower Speed, allowing you to focus on damage. Her being Void makes it even more reliable.

The team showcased is a standard Speed nuke team :
- Arbiter provides Speed aura, TM boost and Increase Attack
- Deacon provides more TM control, Decrease Defense
- Umbral provides Provoke
- Skullcrown provides DPS

The Provoke debuff also allows your team to cycle through a turn safely, to prepare for a second nuke if needed.

Her A2 can be used to counter Skullcrown or Swift Parry, and also Seeker if you didn't build her with Crit. 

https://youtu.be/BU80o7IEUAo
https://youtu.be/p8SEFitczTs

We will be covering Faction Wars and dungeons on the next page
data.label: Notes:

title: Umbral Enchantress Late Game Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
Demonspawn stage 21 can be quite difficult indeed due to the infamous Valkyries second wave. The huge Shield, Counter Attack buffs combined with Warcaster's block damage can make fighting that stage very frustrating. 

Umbral brings 2 important abilities to fight that : AoE Block Buffs on her A2 and AoE Provoke on her A3. Both of theses skills allow you to control the waves safely, letting your other champions do their job. Umbral is universally the go to control champion for this in the Faction regardless of the other champions.

The team showcased has : 
- Drexthar for Accuracy aura, HP Burn for Achak and Sicia, and Provoke
- Sicia for DPS, HP Burn, Decrease Defense and Weaken
- Achak for TM boost, Block Debuffs, Strengthen, Freeze, HP Burn and Healing
- Alure for TM control
- Umbral for Provoke and Block Buffs

We'll target the Boss so Alure can control his TM more reliably with a mark on auto. The run is full auto otherwise so it is possible to select the AI presets for Alure to avoid any skill other than A1 if you would wish to so.

https://youtu.be/oLabXz9KWaQ
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon 20 one of the most popular dungeons to farm and the best strategies to use against this Boss is lots of Poisons. However, those poisoners are quite weak on waves and can get killed easily by Hordin. Umbral is here to keep the threat away from those fragile champions with her Provoke.

The goal here is to bring the poisoners to the Boss alive:

Hoforees provides Increase Attack and Revive
Umbral provides AoE Provoke
Tayrel provides a single target Decrease Attack on boss and an AoE Decrease Defense
Kael provides DPS on waves and Poisons against the Dragon
Frozen Banshee provides Poisons

https://youtu.be/iPOIPX3jNvY
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem stage 20 has one of the most problematic waves in Raid with the Terrorbeasts on wave 2. Once they buff the team with their Reflect Damage, your champions can kill themselves easily on the waves. Umbral provides different solutions to this problem with either her Provoke or her Block Buffs. 

Here the featured team consists of: 

Hoforees for Increase Attack and Revive
Dhukk for Decrease Attack, Decrease Defense and Decrease Accuracy
Umbral for Provoke and Block Buffs
Apothecary for TM boost and Healing
Kael for DPS

https://youtu.be/vEXkTouePXU

On the next page we will be covering Umbral Enchantress in Dungeons 25 and Doom Tower.
data.label: Notes:

title: Umbral Enchantress Late Game Dungeon Runs 2

data.desc:
Umbral is not a champion for end game speed farming teams. However, she can be very important for you in a progression setting when you are not strong enough to kill waves fast. She is showcased here in Dragon 25 to help you control waves so your nuker can have time to cycle through their skills.

In this team, Deacon provides TM control and Decrease Defense and Hoforees provides Increase Attack and Revive. These two champions allow Abbess, the main damage dealer here, to hit harder against waves.

Umbral provides AoE Provoke to keep any threat away from Abbess and Occult Brawler.

Occult Brawler doesn't bring a lot against waves but is very important against the Dragon himself as his Poisons allow you to kill the Boss fast and safely.

https://youtu.be/oro8wS-O9vQ
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Similarly to the Dragon's Lair, Umbral brings Crowd Control against waves that can be of paramount importance in a progression scenario even when she doesn't bring much against the Boss. 

The key components here are Umbral and Hoforees for a guaranteed clear. The other spots are more flexible and will only impact your clear time. Umbral ensures your more fragile champions survive the waves so they can kill waves faster. Hoforees will then survive against the boss to bring back champions if needed to slowly kill the Boss.

Dhukk brings Decrease Attack and Decrease Defense to help with wave clear and make enemies deal less damage
Tyrant brings extra protection and HP Burn to slowly kill the boss
Trunda brings DPS on the waves

https://youtu.be/NxRz0snfrFk
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For the Hard Doom Tower of the eternal Dragon rotation, Secret Room 8 requires you to use only Defense based Epics. Umbral is very valuable once again with her precious AoE Provoke ability. Once the enemies are under control, the rest of the team can slowly kill them safely. Her Block Buffs is also quite precious as this stage opponents are buffs intensive with Counter Attack and Block Damage making fighting them very frustrating. 

In this team :
Tayrel provides a Defense aura, an AoE Decrease Defense and a conditional AoE Sleep
Dhukk provides an AoE Decrease Attack and AoE Decrease Defense
Umbral provides AoE Provoke
Seeker in Guardian set provides Ally Protection, TM boost and single target Provoke
Ghrush provides healing and DPS

https://youtu.be/fuJKH3laHkk
data.label: Notes:

title: Bergoth the Malformed Late Game Guide

data.desc:
Bergoth the Malformed was a relatively easy fusion back in November 2020 so many have access to him one way or the other. Despite this, most people keep him as a vault guardian and don't use him. In this guide we are going to demonstrate that he has a kit that can be very useful in various content in Raid. Specifically he can shine in a team of epic champions that can fully auto-complete one of the most difficult factions in the game - Knight Revenant.

Bergoth has a decent skill kit that can come in handy in various game content. His A1 has a 50% chance of applying a Continuous Heal if the attack is critical, which allows him to maintain this buff periodically, especially in CA compositions. This ability is complemented by his passive that heals his allies for 20% of the damage he receives. Although he requires 100% Crit Rate to place the continuous heal on the A1, it is not recommended to build him to do damage because his multipliers are quite poor. 

His last ability is the main reason he is useful especially in Faction Wars. He has a 30% chance to apply AOE Provoke, that can be booked to 60%. This ability is very useful against the waves of Valkyries in the FW. As he does not have a 100% chance, it is not recommended to use this champion in the Arena since this is not reliable enough for CC.

To complement these abilities, the Fearsome Presence mastery is recommended  as the T6 mastery to maximise the chances of placing the Provoke debuff and Sniper for the continuous heal placement. Otherwise the usual Accuracy and TM boosting masteries are selected for more frequent skill application.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Bergoth can be built in several ways depending on the content you want to use him in. In this build for FW, it is necessary to have a low crit rate because the Crypt 21 boss steals the buffs and you don’t want him to steal Continuous Heal and suddenly gain his health back. 

It is also recommended to build it in Stun Set to increase the chances of CC against the Valkyries. The most important stat is the Accuracy which is recommended at a min of 250 for FW and around 350 for hard Doom Tower. The rest of the effort is focused on making him as tanky possible to be able to heal the allies when receiving the attacks of the enemies caused by his A2. A decent set of stats would be around 60k HP and 2.5k DEF.

Gloves: HP% / DEF%
Chest: HP%/DEF% / ACC 
Boots: Speed 
Ring: HP/DEF
Amulet: HP/DEF with acc substat 
Banner: ACC / DEF / HP
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
The video featured here shows a full team of non-void epic champions defeating one of the toughest factions on auto. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aESoPSFwF_0 

Rector Drath is the key here that makes auto possible. She has Veil buff, healing and revive along with ATK Down debuff on A1. Rector does not need any special masteries and can be built in a generic way, trying to make her as tanky as possible (regen, immortal, reflex sets for example). If you are going to try manual, make sure not to use the heal with Rector just before the boss steals the buffs.

Bergoth needs to be booked to increase the chances of applying the provoke, but you can do it without it if you are patient and ready for rng to keep the Valkyries on wave 2 in stun and provoke. It is important not to build Belgorth with high Crit Rate because the boss can steal the Continious heal buffs that he applies on A1. 

Sinesha can be used for healing and works well in a stun set to keep the waves under stuns. 

Doompriest with Relentless set can be utilised to remove the debuffs from the waves and from boss skills. Additional passive healing is a nice bonus.

Finally, Necrohunter is the main dps of the team and provides Decrease DEF that is a key dps enabler for the whole team especially if they have Warmaster as their T6 mastery

Note that the same team will work in hard Doom Tower Secret Room 10 of the Eternal Dragon rotation that requires Knight Revenant Epics.
data.label: Notes:

title: Ruel the Huntsmaster Late Game+ Guide

data.desc:
Ruel the Huntsmaster is a new breed of nukers that sets-up high burst damage over more than one turn and is directly suitable against Reaction Accessories that can be obtained through Clan vs Clan tournaments and have proliferated in Platinum Arena. Reven though there are other methods to combat such defensive teams Ruel has his own niche and can be built to nuke well even if it's not an easy task in terms of gear requirements.

As a vicious 2nd turn nuker, Ruel has advantages in that: (1) he is spirit affinity effective against current Spirit (e.g. Duchess) and Force (e.g. Rector and Candraphon) meta and (2) has a number of passive and active techniques to boost his TM and reduce enemy TM in order to ensure he can go twice in a timely manner.

In terms of masteries

•        [Helmsmasher] is the key T6 mastery for arena given 220+ Crit Dmg
•        [Ruthless Ambush] and [Bring it Down] are great for the A2 nuke
•        [Pin Point Accuracy], [Charged Focus] and [Swarm Smiter] are the crucial Support tree increased accuracy masteries you need. Remember some of these get buffed by +50% with his A3.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Ruel is hard to build and gear correctly. He requires high damage, high accuracy and high speed. In the featured build the main way to build Ruel is to match the enemy. Ruel must land all 4 Hex debuffs on each of the 4 enemies if he is to get the full benefit of his A2 nuke. Two things can stop this: (1) Resistance (2) they have Block Debuffs on.

Typically, you would use Ruel against slow reaction gear champions and therefore his speed needs to be around 210-230 only. Next, the current meta in high Gold 4 and Platinum in Summer 2021 will see some 500-600 resistance to counter Kymar or Warlord. Therefore, Ruel needs around 400 accuracy in order to get to 600 for the Hex debuff thanks to the Accuracy Up. 

In this build Ruel is built in Savage with Perception or Speed Set, granting him around 224 speed, 4200 attack, 234 crit damage, and 400 acc.

Glove: Crit Damage% 
Chest: Acc with Attack% sub stats or Attack % with Acc sub-stats
Boots: Speed  
Ring: Att
Amulet: Crit Damage%
Banner: Acc with speed and attack% sub-stats
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Ruel has the potential to do huge damage (2x 100-120k AOE on high defence targets without Defence Down) but his setup requires careful planning and is only suitable against certain teams: Defensive spirit and Force/Void champions, such as: Duchess, Ursuga, Nekret, Vogoth, Rector, Siphi…etc. The key to using Ruel are as follows.

1.        [Control] You must try to control the enemy, especially if they are fast. A Sleep from Kymar or Stun or Provoke or even Freeze are very important. Here, Kymar serves this role well because he has speed aura, removes buffs, boosts TM, and can reset skills. But other and less high-end options include Maulie and Astralon and other epic provoke champions. Alternatively, a skill lock by Warlord or Basher are also viable.
2.        [Attack Up] You need attack up here, by Arbiter, Brogni or other champions (effective against Tormin).
3.        [Defence Down or Block Buffs] You can choose a variety of champions here. I have tested Ruel to do 220-240k aoe without Defence Down in savage, so there is no need to think Madame Serris is mandatory, but perhaps she is desirable more to strip buffs in case Ruel A3 is prevented from landing by Block Debuffs. Arbiter, Brogni, Gurptuk, Uugo, or even Ghostborn combining 2. and 3. are helpful.
4.        [Vicious Damager] When Ruel has placed A3, he receives a massive 50% TM boost which will put him high up on the list of champions that take a turn. He will also give Accuracy Up buff to all allies which can help any further control and also weaken the enemy a bit.

https://youtu.be/S2XTLz5LXdk 

Possible Ruel teams: 
-        Against Tormin: Kymar (sleep) > Brogni (attack up and block debuffs and shield) > Madame (against high resist block debuff heavy teams) or Gurp (against SP) > Ruel (A3 Hex) > Kymar boost TM > Ruel (A2 Nuke).
-        Arbiter (attack up and boost TM) > Maulie or Krisk (provoke) > Madame (against high resist block debuff heavy teams) or Gurp (against SP) > Ruel (A3 Hex) > Kymar boost TM > Ruel (A2 Nuke).
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Umbral Enchantress is a great champion for progression because of her 2-turn AoE Provoke skill with 100% chance to apply when booked. She can also deal good damage if built for it, making her a very flexible and generally useful champion to build. For the purposes of Mid-game she can work in any dungeons to keep the waves under provoke and help your squishy champions survive.

Consequently, there can be 2 different builds for her masteries. For a debuffer build, Defense and Support trees are preferred to go down to Eagle Eye on T6. Eagle Eye gives the Accuracy needed for Dungeons if your gear is not strong enough to grant enough Accuracy and is generally useful for Arena where you want as much Accuracy as possible. Defense tree offers damage mitigation and can help removing debuffs on her with Resurgent, very useful against enemies with debuff on their auto attack. 

For a nuker build, Offense and Support trees are picked, Support tree provides the Accuracy so she remains functional as a provoker. Helmsmasher T6 on offense allows you to deal more damage if you can build her with enough Crit Rate and Crit Damage (220+).
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
As a debuffer, the most important stats for Umbral are Speed and Accuracy: you want her speedtuned with your booster to go first and provoke the enemies. Therefore, in terms of gear sets, Perception and Speed are generally useful and very good on her. Accuracy set is also an option. However, at this stage of the game, you should focus more on stats than on the sets themselves, this build here has two broken sets because the final stats are good enough.

For a nuker build, you'll need Crit Damage or Crit Rate and Defense to deal damage.

Gloves : Def% / Crit Rate
Chest : Def%
Boots : Speed
Ring : Def
Amulet : C.Dmg / Def with Accuracy substats
Banner : Accuracy with Speed substats

For accessories, she doesn't need any special set. However, Cleansing accessories can be good to remove extra debuffs on her.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Umbral's role in Arena and Dungeons is to tank all the damage for your damage dealers such as Coldheart and to give your damage dealer more time in arena. 

This video showcases her Crowd Control capability for Dragon 20 : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ND9Y6oAqjE4&ab_channel=Endlife

Runekeeper provides an Attack aura, Increase Attack and TM fill. He acts as a Healer and Cleanser as well
Dhukk brings AoE Decrease Defense and Attack
Umbral provides Crowd Control against waves
Coldheart provides damage and Enemy MAX HP nuke to kill the Dragon quickly

For Arena, she allows you to run your nuker slower than in a typical speed tuned comp, allowing you to build more damage.

This video showcases Umbral in Spider 20 and in Arena : 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n7__U-PRtC4&ab_channel=Endlife

For Spider, Umbral tanks the Spiderlings for the first rotation, allowing your other champions to cycle through their abilities. Renegade reduces cooldown, Madame Serris provides Decrease Defense and Attack, Coldheart provides Enemy MAX HP nuke and TM control.

For arena, in a typical speed nuke team : 

Skullcrown brings a Speed aura and DPS
Seeker provides a TM boost and an Increase Attack for your nuker
Madame Serris removes buffs and applies Decrease Defense
Umbral bring Provokes. 

Skullcrown was slower than the enemy team here but they were provoked so there was no threat.

The next page covers Umbral Enchantress in a Late Game setting.
data.label: Notes:

title: Dhukk the Pierced Mid Game Guide

data.desc:
Dhukk is an excellent champion for progression during the mid game stage when you have to tackle minotaur 15 and dungeons level 15+. His primary role is to land AOE Decrease DEF and Decrease ATK on enemies. 

His A2 and A3 are worth booking as they provide invaluable debuffs that will help on waves and during boss fights. To land the debuffs sufficient ACC and Crit Rate are needed because Decrease DEF will only be placed on his A2 if the skill scores a critical hit. This can be problematic at this stage as you may not have access to ACC banners and good substats to reach sufficient amount of ACC or Crit Rate. 

For this reason Support tree is really important for additional accuracy substats. The T6 mastery depends on where you're planning to use him. The featured Dhukk was used in Clan Boss setting so Warmaster was selected as the final mastery that works in all mid game content. However, if you're only using him in dungeons and can't reach the Accuracy requirements Eagle Eye is also a viable option.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
For dungeons up to stage 20 and for Faction Wars, rule of a thumb for required Accuracy is to multiply the stage by 10. So for dungeons 15 you would need about 150 ACC. In terms of equipment any sets will work as long as you get high Speed (to go before your damage dealer, or speed tuned in a Clan Boss setup), 100% Crit Rate and sufficient ACC.

If you're using Dhukk on Clan Boss with Warmaster Lifesteal set would be best in slot but this also means the requirements for the correct main and substats are high as you might lose the Accuracy or the Speed bonus from different sets.

In the featured case Dhukk is paired with Runekeeper that provides the Leech Debuff and his main use was in dungeons. Perception sets from the Forge help greatly as the provide the stats that are sought-after by this champion.

Gloves - Crit Rate
Chest - Def%
Boots - Speed
Ring - Def
Amulet - Def
Banner - ACC
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Here, we have a showcase of his performances in Brutal Clan Boss, Dragon 16 and Mino 15 :

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lNdSfTqboRA

For Clan Boss, the team showcased features : 
Tayrel for Defense aura, Decrease Attack A1, Decrease Defense
Dhukk for Decrease Defense and Attack
Runekeeper for healing, cleansing, Increase Attack and Leech
Frozen Banshee for Poison
Longbeard for Weaken and Ally Attack, particularly interesting for Frozen Banshee and Tayrel to apply their debuffs. 

This video was recorded before the AI customization patch so Dhukk lost a lot of damage here using his Provoke (no effect on Boss, and no damage). Now, it is advisable to completely lock that skill in a Clan Boss scenario.

Dhukk is generally useful in Doom Tower and Dungeons like Dragon or Minotaur 15 as well. He synergises very well with Tayrel as showcased here in Dragon and Minotaur as he places AoE Decrease Attack first, when Tayrel places his AoE Decrease Defense, he also puts Sleep on all enemies to provide extra control.

The next page will feature Dhukk in a Late game setting that will allow him to unleash his full potential.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Martyr is an incredibly unique and strong legendary champion. Her versatile kit allows for her to be used in most content such as: FW 21, DT hard, UNM Clan Boss, Arena, and most dungeons. The main aspect to Martyr's kit is that she is one of only three champions in Raid that provides the AOE Counter Attack (CA) buff to the team making her an incredibly sought after champion in the game. In this section of the guide we will be covering her in Clan Boss.

On Clan Boss her A2 skill provides both Counterattack and Defence up. Furthermore, Martyr alone can consistently ensure that Defence Down is on a 100% uptime due to her A1. Due to Martyr counterattacking with her A1, you would be very unlucky for Defence Down not to land or your Accuracy is insufficient/CB is negative affinity. 

When picking Martyr's Masteries, you can choose the following:

• If you want her Decrease DEF and Decrease ATK and you can reach 230 Acc with your gear choose Offence and Defence trees for extra DPS and survivability
• If your other 4 champions can consistently land Atk/Def down debuff on the CB can also pick Offence and Defence trees and ignore Acc
• If you need her debufs and can't get enough with her gear you can select Offence and Support trees to make up for the Accuracy deficit.

Offence and Defence trees were chosen for this Late Game+ showcase. Martyr will be used mainly for her A2 to enable Counterattack and Def up on the entire team. Warmaster is a must as it ensures champions gets fully healed when going in for an attack or counter attack with a lifesteal set. Notable masteries leading up to Warmaster include: Deadly Precision and Keen Strike for extra damage, Single Out, Bring it Down and Methodical for extra damage against higher hp targets and longer fights.

For the Defence tree, Tough skin, Blastproof and Delay Death were taken for extra defence and survivability as well as Retribution and Deterrence for extra chance to counterattack.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Against the Clan Boss, Martyr and the rest of the team work well in Lifesteal to ensure health is regained through counterattacks if there is no Leech debuff in the composition.

Due to Martyr being a Defence based champion, not only do you want to stack defence for survivability against the clan boss, but you also want enough Defence to allow her to reach the top potential of her damage. 4200 Defence is what you should be aiming for to be able to tank hits. Aside from Defence, Crit rate and Crit dmg also play a role in delivering a lot of damage to the clan boss so ideally you would want to pump these numbers as high as possible. 220+ Accuracy is also needed if martyr is your only Def Down champ

In a classic 1:1 clan boss team, Martyr would need to be the slowest on the team (ideally 191 or 171 speed) to ensure that everyone gets 2 turns of Counterattack and Def up. This allows all champs to attack an extra 2 times per rotation allowing for more damage, and survivability through Warmaster/Giantslayer + Lifesteal. 

Gloves: Crit dmg/Crit rate
Chest: Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Def/HP
Amulet: Crit dmg
Banner: Acc/Def
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
This video shows a Late Game+ CB affinity friendly composition for Martyr working in an unconventional 2:1 team due to the Increase Speed buff provided by Krisk. The team is called Endless Buffs with Krisk and an overview is available here: https://www.deadwoodjedi.com/speed-tunes-4/Endless-Buffs-Krisk-21 

https://youtu.be/Lk0Dby72KCc

This team works for a comfortable 2 key UNM and 1 key NM if tuned correctly and with enough upgrades. Including a champion with Weaken debuff can also help this composition further increase the dps and reach one key on all affinities.

Champions such as Lydia the Deathsiren can take Krisk's place provided you have another form of buff extension such as Godseeker Aniri. Martyr's job is the same as usual, applying the Counterattack and Def up buff, and then having those buffs extended. Note that this comp is affinity friendly due to Brogni applying the Block Debuffs. However, any champion with a block debuffs buff such as Sepulcher Sentinel can be used to replace Brogni.   

This comp features:

Martyr - AOE Counterattack and Def Down
Frozen Banshee - Poisons
Underpriest Brogni - Shield and block debuffs. Giant Slayer for additional damage for the whole team based on the shields buff.
Sandlashed Survivor - Buff extension and passive ally protect
Krisk the Ageless - Permanent Increase speed, Buff Extension and Ally protection

Speed setup:

Brogni 269 
Sandlashed 244
Krisk 239
Fb 227
Martyr 195

Manual setup:

Brogni A1
Sandlashed A2
Krisk A2
Dps Auto
Martyr A1
Cb turn
Brogni A1
Auto

The next page will feature Martyr in the dungeons and other areas of the game
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Martyr has lots of utility outside of CB and is not so picky about masteries and gear when used in other areas. In particular, she does not need to be speed tuned and this allows to build her faster and lap the waves of enemies fo increased efficiency.

Martyr's A1 has a 75% chance to land Decrease Def when fully booked. As her A1 is single target, Martyr will not be your primary Dec Def debuffer for waves and wave ads. Her A1 will however, ensure that Decrease Def is on a 100% uptime against bosses because of the high debuff chance followed by a Counterattack. 

Martyr's A2 is where she truly shines. Counter Attack is an incredibly valuable buff to have due to allowing your team to ensure debuffs from A1's land. Not only that, but counterattacking can trigger Warmaster/Giant Slayer procs which will also increase damage potential and ensure that your champs get fully healed (if wearing lifesteal). Martyr also provides a 60% Increase Def buff for your entire team ensuring high rates of sustainability.

Martyr's A3 locks enemies out with Provoke and AOE Dec Atk. Ideally, you want Martyr to use her A2 first as these abilites synergise. It is advisable to book her A2 and A3 to get her on a consistent cycle of abilities. Her A1 doesn't require booking but can be very useful. Only book A1 if you need consistent Def Down on a single target.

For a dungeon focused Martyr, the Offence and Defence trees have been chosen - Warmaster for the T6 mastery, Retribution and Deterrence for the defensive T5 masteries. The route down to these masteries are all taken to increase Martyr's damage and survivability. If you are struggling with meeting the Accuracy requirements then going down the Support tree instead of the Defence tree would be advised for the extra accuracy.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Due to the nature of Martyr's kit, she has some specific requirements that should be met when building her. Martyr needs a good level of speed, ideally, 191+ if achievable, as this will save you the hassle of speed tuning her for clan boss. It also is a good baseline for high level dungeons as she wont be too slow to be overwhelmed. 200+ speed is preferrable to lap the waves and go twice if you're not using her on CB.

Accuracy and Defence also need to be taken into account. Purely for CB and dungeons, you would be aiming for 230+ accuracy and 4000+ defence to ensure she lands her debuffs and doesn't immediately get taken out since she'll often be targeted thanks to her Provoke. Martyr can also hit quite hard, so if you can reach these stats, 100% Crit Rate and as much Crit Damage as possible is wanted. 

Martyr's Aura of 33% DEF in all battles can help massively in helping reaching the 4000 mark for her Defence as just this aura allows her to gain slightly over 420 DEF. 

The most universal set for Martyr is Lifesteal. Paired with the Warmaster mastery, she can keep herself alive in most situations. Speed, Accuracy and Perception are good alternatives if she can meet the stat requirements. There is another set that works quite well on Martyr outside of clan boss. The Frost set has some good synergy with Martyr's A3 meaning every attacker has a chance of being frozen for a turn just after they were forced to attack Martyr due to Provoke. This set has uses across the dungeons and Doom Tower, however Martyr will need additional support to ensure she is kept topped up in health if she is not using lifesteal.

Gloves: Crit Rate
Chest: Def%
Boots: Speed
Ring: Def with Def% subs
Amulet: Crit Dmg or Def 
Banner: Accuracy with speed subs

As the gear is very def orientated, reaching a healthy amount of hp can prove to be difficult. Aim for around 35,000 health. If this can't be achieved then the amulet may need to be changed to hp to accompany this.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Martyr can be used as a consistent 20 second campaign farmer in brutal 12-3 due to her raw damage and tanking abilities and makes for a good choice for a 6 star if you were lucky enough to pull her after your starter. While it is not recommended to use her for this purpose in Late Game+ it shows just how versatile she can be for progression. 

For the first wave Martyr is to use her A3 to one shot the entire wave. Wave 2 requires for Martyr to use her A2 followed by her A1 multiple times to clear this wave. As Martyr can one shot the enemies with her A1 she will have her A3 back in time for wave 3. Once she reaches wave 3 she will one shot them again with her A3 similar to wave 1. Martyr does have strong multipliers on her A3 and A1 but it is still recommended to give her enough Crit Damage to be able to consistently one shot all of the enemies. In terms of speed, she only needs to be faster but not necessarily double speed as she won't need to go twice.

https://youtu.be/vkhw0b893eM

The next pages will explore Martyr's role in other dungeons
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
As a versatile champion, Martyr has uses both for waves and bosses with her abilities. While Martyr is negative affinity for Dragon 20 she can work well enough as the tank. As a general rule AOE Counterattack slows down the runs making them not speed runs by default. This section of the guide will focus on progression with Martyr and making sure the runs are nice and stable.

Her job on Dragon 20 is to ensure ally Counter Attack buff is applied to make wave clearing easier. Martyr can pair particularly well with an A1 aoe champion in a stun set such as bellower which was showcased in both videos below. Not only that, but Martyr's A3 ensures that the enemy waves won't be attacking your other champions. If you don't have a reviver then this ability is particularly helpful in ensuring that Martyr takes the heat. For the boss, Martyr's A1 ensures that defence down is on a 100% uptime as well as having the Counterattack and Def up buffs.

Dragon 20 features the following team:

Martyr 
Scyl of the Drakes for healing/revive
Warmaiden for AOE Def down 
Frozen Banshee for Poisons against the boss
Bellower for AOE stuns and pairing with Martyr

https://youtu.be/9l794UxTRMk
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For Spider 20, Martyr's main job is to provoke the enemy spiderlings so that the rest of your team can carry out their roles without running into any issues. Between having AOE HP burn and TM decrease, you'll find your champions having an easier time when they aren't being targeted. 

Martyr is mainly used for her A3 provoke, however, her A2 also comes in handy for taking down the spiderlings before the big spider uses its consume and healing ability. TM decrease champion was not used in this composition, otherwise you would want to keep the spiderlings alive as long as possible to ensure as much HP burn damage to the main spider as possible. 

The team is as follows:

Martyr
Venus - AOE HP burn
Scyl of the Drakes - heals/revive/stuns
Miscreated Monster - Shields/stuns
Apothecary - Heals/speed inc

Venus can be replaced with any champion that has aoe HP burn to emulate this composition.

https://youtu.be/9GRMXdhODXc

There are other alternative builds you can use with Martyr on Spider 20, e.g. using one of the negative affinity tanks with AOE A1. A working example would be Sinesha or Infernal Baronness for this stage. The constant Counterattack coupled with lifesteal and Warmaster on your tank can be the key for victory if you have no better alternatives.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For Fire Knight, players tend to have a difficult time being able to break through both the shield and cause damage and Martyr shines on the boss stage. Martyr's counterattack is incredibly useful in making sure the the Fire Knight shield is low just after he's had his turn. This is because the counterattacks from the entire team will cause the shield charges of the Fire Knight to go down considerably before even having their actual turns. This is amplified if the other champions have multiple attacks on their A1.

For the waves, Martyr also helps ensure the waves are provoked to stop the rest of your team suffering too much damage. 

For FK 20 the featured team is as follows:

Martyr
Scyl of the Drakes
Stag Knight
Apothecary
Coldheart

Scyl is used for extra stuns as well as healing and revive the team. 
Stag Knight helps against both waves and the boss by ensuring both Atk and Def Down are applied. 
Apothecary has a 3 hit A1 which helps against the FK shield as well as providing inc speed and heals. 
Finally, Coldheart is used mainly for TM depletion, heal reduction and MAX HP nuke. 

https://youtu.be/MogwcIygoUk

The next page will feature other dungeons and FW
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For Ice Golem 20, Martyr's primary job is to ensure smooth wave clears. For 20 specifically, Martyr can use her A3 to stop the shriek ability from occurring on wave 2 which is known to be an issue for many players as reflect can be problematic. 

Martyr can also be useful against the Ice Golem himself but has a difficult time due to Counterattack being able to proc the Ice Golem's Frigid Vengeance. For Ice Golem 25 specifically it may be a good idea to turn off Martyr's A2 so that Martyr can be used for def down and atk down on the boss. 

IG 20 featured team:

Martyr
Scyl of the Drakes - Heals/revive
Stag Knight - AOE Atk and Def down
Apothecary - Inc speed buff and heals
Kael - Poisons

https://youtu.be/5Ewy4CSZq7s
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Before we continue with the dungeons 25 we can dedicate a slide to Faction Wars.

Martyr is very useful in FW and can play a pivotal part in ensuring you complete the Sacred Order faction. Her kit can allow for CC and may be your consistent source of DEF Down for this faction. With all this in mind, Martyr can help carry your team through the waves with all of her abilites and also ensure that the boss gets taken down quickly and efficiently with the Counterattack buff. 

In the video below the team is not very budget but allows for sufficiently fast clears in Late Game+: 

Martyr 
Venus 
Inquisitor Shamael 
Astralon 
Godseeker Aniri 

Venus and Shamael were mainly there for extra damage against the waves and the boss so they can be replaced with any crowd control champions. 
Astralon is used mainly for the stun and Aniri is used to revive if necessary. She can also be replaced by another form of CC. 
Martyr does most of the heavy lifting with all of her debuffs and actually hits harder than other dps slots of the team. The counterattack allowed for the boss to be taken down quickly whilst the A3 ensured the team could carry out their jobs against the waves seamlessly. 

https://youtu.be/hphgUgxlhbo
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Similar to Dragon 20, Martyr's job on Dragon 25 remains the same. For the waves, Martyr uses her A3 to CC the waves and force them to only use their A1's as well as placing a decrease atk debuff for sustainability allowing the rest of your team to set up if need be. Martyr's A2 is used to buff up the team and apply extra damage from counterattacking - this works especially well with a champion that has an aoe on their A1 as stun set will see a lot of enemies being stunned. Bellower is used in this example. 

It is important to note that she is not a speed runner as the CA animations slow down the runs. However, she can be useful to clear for missions or to improve the consistency.

For Dragon all of Martyr's abilities see use. Her A1 ensures def down is consistenly landing on the dragon and her A3 places atk down stopping any losses from occurring too early. Lastly, Martyr's A2 allows for extra damage through counterattacking and def up. This ability pairs especially well with an A1 poisoner such as Frozen Banshee. 

Dragon 25 feature the following team:

Martyr 
Scyl of the Drakes for healing/revive
Warmaiden for AOE Def Down 
Frozen Banshee for Poisons against the boss
Bellower for AOE stuns and pairing with Martyr

https://youtu.be/ixvxElsJ9o4

The guide continues with more dungeons on the next page
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For Spider 25, the same principle from Spider 20 applies. Martyr is used for provoking the spiderlings whilst the rest of the team either helps with CC against the spiderlings or takes down the main spider through HP burn and TM decrease. Martyr will also help in killing the spiders before the main Spider heals.

The team is as follows:

Martyr
Venus - hp burn
Scyl of the Drakes - heals/revive/stuns
Miscreated Monster - Shields/stuns
Coldheart - TM manipulation and damage

Venus can be replaced like in spider 20 for any champ that offers aoe hp burn. Coldheart is mainly there to stop the main spider from using it's healing ability and so, can be replaced with any champ that offers TM decrease. Note that all the bosses have TM depletion efficiency halved and so AOE HP Burn becomes the weapon of choice for Spider stages 21.

If you're unlucky and haven't pulled any consider focusing on normal Doom Tower for Akoth fragments.

https://youtu.be/FsbOvHHUkYU
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For FK 25, the shield has an extra 2 charges compared to FK 20 which makes breaking through the shield that much more difficult. This is why Martyr's Counterattacking buff is in turn much more useful. Having champs with multi hitting A1's also works very well with the Counterattack buff. Martyr's kit works well against the waves leading up to the Fire Knight as she can keep the mobs provoked and then Counterattack with the rest of the team.

For FK 25, the same team from FK 20 is used as the idea is the same as previously mentioned. It does however take longer as the FK does get a few extra turns and due to the Counterattack animations.

Martyr
Scyl of the Drakes
Stag Knight
Apothecary
Coldheart 

Scyl is used for extra stuns as well as healing and revive the team. 
Stag Knight helps against both waves and the boss by ensuring both Atk and Def Down are applied. 
Apothecary has a 3 hit A1 which helps against the FK shield as well as providing inc speed and heals. 
Finally, Coldheart is used mainly for TM depletion, heal reduction and MAX HP nuke. Note that her effeciency is reduced on stages 21+ However, she remains a solid choice for her overall kit on FK.

https://youtu.be/cZCwLoaRJVk
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
For Ice Golem 25, Martyr's primary job is to ensure smooth wave clears. Martyr can be useful against the Ice Golem himself but has a difficult time due to Counterattack being able to proc the Ice Golem's Frigid Vengeance. For Ice Golem 25 specifically it may be a good idea to turn off Martyr's A2 so that Martyr can be used for def down and atk down on the boss.

IG 25 features:

Martyr
Seer - Wave clear
Lydia the Deathsiren - Buffs for Seer and Decrease DEF/Weaken. 
Duchess Lilitu - Reviving and buffs
Renegade - Cooldown reset

A team like this would not be necessary if you use champions that can block revive against the IG side ads such as Armiger and Fenax.

https://youtu.be/kBmLWlGb0WI

The next page covers Martyr in Doom Tower
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Against the Magma Dragon, Martyr is particularly useful due to her provoke and atk down debuffs that stops the boss from attacking the entire team. Pair this with Martyr's A2 and she'll be ensuring that the team has a higher survivability along with taking the boss' health down with ease. 

The main idea for using Martyr is to stop the boss from landing his debuffs on the entire team which eventually enables the boss to deal massive amount of damage against you, so to avoid this, the Magma Dragon needs to be provoked as often as possible. 

In the video below you will see the following featured comp:

Martyr
Maulie Tankard
Scyl of the Drakes
Tayrel 
Vrask

https://youtu.be/dkxHeGNDPCA

Between Martyr and Maulie, the Dragon is provoked for most of the fight which allows for breathing room for the rest of your team. Maulie can be replaced with another champ that ideally uses provoke (or uses the provoke artifact set). 
Scyl is used for additional healing. 
Tayrel is there to benefit from Martyr's Inc Def to increase his damage output and has aoe def down for the waves before hand.
Finally, Vrask is used for extra heals.

data.desc: Reserved
data.label: Notes:

data.desc: Reserved
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Elegaius is a Magic Support Legendary from the Undead Hordes. She was a fragment fusion and is quite unpopular because she is in a faction with many extremely powerful champions. However, she can be powerful to lockdown enemies if used correctly and can be the key to completing Faction Wars if you have not been blessed with alternative legendary pulls. This guide will showcase her in Faction Wars, Arena and Ice Golem 20.

Her kit is pretty unique but also impratical due to the conditions on her HP lost and is sadly outclassed even by some Epics. Her A2 put champion's skills on cooldown and also affects any duplicates of that champion on waves. This makes Elegaius very powerful in Faction Wars stage 21 with multiple Valkyries. Her A3 removes 2 random buffs and also decreases TM of all enemies by 20%. This skill is also very strong against the Valkyries and useful in arena to remove Shields. Her passive is also interesting, preventing her from getting killed in one hit and is used in this showcase to tank the last Boss of Faction Wars.

As a support champion you have 2 different possible builds : one purely for debuffing, especially in arena and one more for the boss fight. The build showcased is of the first category. If you plan on building Elegaius for her debuffs, Defense and Support trees are picked. Defense tree provides general damage mitigation and as a HP based champion, she can be built tankier to take some damage from her allies hence Selfless Defender on T5 of Defense tree. Support tree provides extra Accuracy, with Evil eye being very useful for extra TM control and Eagle Eye T6 very important for more Accuracy.

For a more hybrid build, you should go for Offense and Support, with T6 Warmaster if you need that extra damage against waves and bosses.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
Gearing Elegaius is pretty straight forward as you only need Speed and Accuracy for her main utilities. That's why, Speed and Perception are very good sets for her. For high end arena, if you plan on facing Tormin or Hegemon (where she can be pretty useful because she cannot be one shot by a nuke Hegemon) you should consider gearing her in Immunity-type sets.

In this build she is wearing Regeneration set for her specific role in Faction Wars. Her HP is also lower than the typical build to work as a tank so mobs and bosses target her. For stats, aim for 220+ Speed, ideally speed tuned with your booster and as much Accuracy as possible. For Dungeons and Faction Wars, you want 220+ Accuracy, for Arena you want as much as you can get. 

Gloves: HP% (Crit Rate on this build to lower the HP to make enemies target her)
Chest: Accuracy/HP%
Boots: SPD
Ring: HP
Amulet: HP
Banner: Accuracy/HP

For accessories, Refresh accessories are very strong on her as she will be able to use her skills more often to lock out and effectively control TM of the enemies
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Undead Hordes Faction Wars stage 21 is very tough as it has a very difficult waves with the Valkyries and an Ignore Defense Boss with damage based on enemy MAX HP. Elegaius offers a solution to both of these problems.

The team showcased has : 

- Vogoth for AoE Provoke, Leech, Healing and offers protection with his Guardian set
- Harvest Jack has AoE True Fear, Block Buffs and offers protection with his Shield set
- Rotos offers DPS
- Gorgorab offers Increase Attack, Increase TM and a Revive to ensure you get the 3 stars
- And last but not least, Elegaius, the staple of this team. She can remove the Counter Attack from the enemies or prevent the Valks from using that skill altogether with her kit, making this wave fairly easy. On Boss, her passive prevents her from getting one shot, making her a viable tank to buy you time to kill the Boss. Regeneration set allows her to heal up in order to take more hits.

https://youtu.be/8h239pQy7Ug

The next page features Elegaius in Arena and Ice Golem 20
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
In Arena Elegaius is showcased as a third TM champion, allowing your nuker to be slower and have more damage built. She is featured in a speed team against teams with buffs or shields (e.g. Krisk).

Elegaius' main weakness is that she only removes 2 random buffs, so against heavy buffing teams, you cannot be sure you are removing the correct ones (Shield and Block Debuffs are the most important ones). If you're running a speed offense team, this is not very problematic as the enemies would usually have Immunity and Shield at most with Immunity phasing out of defenses. However, Nekhret has changed this a bit with his passive protection that applies before the start of the round.

The team has : 
Arbiter for Speed aura, TM boost and Increase Attack so your nuker hits harder
Deacon for more TM control and Decrease Defense
Elegaius for Buffs Removal and Decrease TM
Skullcrown for AoE damage

https://youtu.be/K5PUe0x0_i0
https://youtu.be/XbYBBuR3rLY
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
While Elegaius doesn't offer much against Bosses, she is absolutely viable in Ice Golem stage 20 as the second wave has 2 Terrorbeasts. This wave can be a big problem once Reflect Damage is up, making your damage dealers kill themselves and prolonging the runs. 

Elegaius can either prevent this with her A2 (sadly the AI does not target the Terrorbeast first) or remove those buffs with her A3. However, overall, she does not offer a lot of Crowd Control and Buffs Removal skills are not very useful in Dungeons content for the most part, making her use very limited in that area.

The team showcased has :
- Ursala for Increase Attack, Increase Defense, Strengthen, Decrease Attack and Revive
- Deacon for Speed aura, TM control and Decrease Defense
- Ghrush for DPS, Leech, Continuous Heal and Decrease Attack
- Fenax for DPS and Block Revive
- Elegaius for Block Active Skill, Increase Cooldown, Decrease TM and Buffs Removal

https://youtu.be/6582RAoCeVQ
