data.label: Notes:

title: Late Game+ Blind Seer Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
Dragon 20

There are many variations of Dragon 20 teams featured with on @RaidBot . Blind Seer can safely carry any damage dealers through this level of content accompanied with suitable de-buff champions. 

This is an example of a  Late Game+ speed run team where Blind Seer serves as back up in case things go wrong and can be used on Dragon 25 with minor changes.

Zavia serves as the main DPS on the boss with her Poisons
Blind Seer provides Revive, Block Debuffs and Shields
Lydia is the AOE Decrease DEF and Weaken champion and has additional buffs 
Seer provides the superior wave clearing capabilities
Prince Kymar resets the skills enabling fast refresh of skills
 
The only difference between the showcased run and Dragon 25 run is that Zavia has her Deadly Catalyst skill enabled under Team Setup.

https://youtu.be/2LNRDgTXilI
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
This Fire Knight 20 build is very similar to the Fire Knight 25 build that will be featured in the following slides.

Blind Seer is capable of holding the boss just long enough for Coldheart to completely deplete FK turn meter and/or finish him off. Povides buffs for Seer.
Lydia applies AOE Decrease DEF and Weaken for increased dps potential along with extra buffs for Seer.
Seer provides superior waves clear based on the amount of buffs
Coldheart provide MAX HP nuke and full TM depletion of the boss along with 4 hit A-1
Prince Kymar refreshes all skills for other champions

https://youtu.be/yeyzVnzdFK4
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Dragon 25

This featured speed run consists of a Seer nuke team and a poisoner.

https://youtu.be/sU2ewQu0cf8 

This team relies on Seer to nuke waves. Seer in a savage set can handle the enemies easily with a simple DEF DOWN de-buff and enough ally buffs. Seer’s A2 is disabled because her A1 can give her extra turns to help her cycle faster to Karma Burn. Although capped at 10% damage at the boss, this is one of the fastest ways to defeat Stage 25.
Lydia provides debuffs and buffs that enable Seer to do her job. The strengthen buff can also help the survivability of the team when the dragon inevitably gets a turn.
Prince Kymar resets the skills to make Wave 2 run smoothly. He is the fastest one on the team, so skill AI needs to be adjusted. His opener can be set to either A1 or A2, so that he properly resets on the second wave. His normal AI should kick in and he should do his A3 reset skill cooldowns. Weak affinity means he will not land too many poisons.
Blind Seer provides two buffs per ally during the waves for Seer. If DEF DOWN gets resisted by the enemy, Blind Seer can shield and revive the team. At the boss Blind Seer’s BLOCK-DEBUFFS and SHIELD help protect whenever the dragon does get a turn. 
Zavia is a good Poisoner for Dragon 25. High Poison rate and can multiple applications with both her A1 and A3. Since the poison nuke is not effective and is capped at Dragon 25, her A2 is disabled in the AI Team Setup. Her default AI uses A3 during the waves, which is a much faster animation than her A1.

Note for alternative poisoners.

Nethril and Occult Brawler are good alternatives as they are strong affinity. Nethril has a higher chance to apply poisons than both Zavia and Occult Brawler, but his animations are much slower. If you use Nethril to do his A3 as an opener set “Don’t Use” under Team Setup. Under normal circumstances (no skill resets), Zavia and Nethril will have similar clear times. 

In the next slide we'll continue to explore Blind Seer in other PVE scenarios.
data.label: Notes:

title: Late Game+ Blind Seer Dungeon Runs 2

data.desc:
FIRE KNIGHT 25

https://youtu.be/wSztxwYOUC0 

Blind Seer was destined to take on Fire Knight at any level. The linked video features a speed run team build where Blind Seer provides buffs to enable Seer to melt waves and turn meter control on the Fire Knight. 

Chances of failure are low because Blind Seer can always revive teammates if they die from the waves or Fire Knight. At the boss, her A1 provides decent control but needs additional turn meter reduction support from Alure. In case, Alure and Blind Seer get resisted, Blind Seer’s shield cancels out most of the damage or can pick the team back up. 

Lydia applies AOE Decrease DEF and Weaken for increased dps potential along with extra buffs for Seer.

Seer provides superior waves clear based on the amount of buffs

Alure provides superior TM reduction on the boss and 3 hit A-1. It is advisable to disable all her skills except for A1 for best results. She is used here due to the decreased efficiency of Coldheart nuke and TM depletion for FK 25.

Prince Kymar refreshes all skills for other champions enabling fast wave clearing
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
FACTION WARS 21

https://youtu.be/WgaVu3GxxYk 

The Dark Elves faction has plenty of good champions. This video features an under-geared, un-booked, 5-star Blind Seer with no masteries. This run shows off that her skill set alone can help carry your team through this faction. 

The block de-buffs protects the team from the HP burn that the boss applies when hit and also revives the glass cannon team with just enough health for the boss to be killed and to 3 star the stage.

If you are struggling in any way in this Crypt Blind Seer will make your journey that much easier at any stage up to and including the final stage with Valkyries and hard-hitting boss.
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Hard Doom Tower Tormin waves.

In hard DT Blind Seer provides excellent coverage for your team. When facing multiple Tormins and other nasty debuffers and you don't want your team to Freeze while stacking buffs or getting TM boosts. Blind Seer should go first. She provides 2 buffs that are fewer than Mausoleum Mage, but she also has a full team revive in case things take a turn for the worst.

https://youtu.be/3mlmYPsPNwo

In Floor 112 of Frozen Spider rotation,  there are three Tormins on the second wave. 

On Wave 1, begin with Prince Kymar sleeping the enemy. Blind Seer immediately goes next and puts Block Debuffs and a HP shield on the team. Lydia will then apply her AOE Weaken and Decrease DEF. At this point, enemies will be woken up. For some later waves, enemies might be faster than Lydia and wake up from their sleep and waste their turn. Ma’Shalled will go immediately after Lydia. At this point, Seer will perform her AOE nuke and wipe them out. 

On Wave 2, we have the challenge of dealing with three Tormins. Kymar will reset skill cooldowns and boost turn meter. Your lower resistance team might get frozen, but Blind Seer will not. Lydia is built with high resistance on this team and will put up Strengthen and Increase Speed. This will help the rest of the team get their turns back if they are Frozen.   The Tormins have a large amount of health so Lydia can reapply her debuffs and still be able to cycle by the end of the wave. Make sure the team has fresh skills to use on the next wave.

On Wave 3, we only deal with one Tormin again. The safer method is for Kymar to sleep the enemies and continue as normal and reset the skills for any enemies that have survived. The other method is to take advantage of the turn meter boost and reset skills if necessary.

Note: When trying to revive with Blind Seer, her block damage might trigger Tormin to freeze all other team members.
data.label: Notes:

title: Hoforees the Tusked Late Game Guide

data.desc:
Hoforees is a recent addition to the Skinwalker faction and a tremendous help to clearing the Faction Wars as he is a very reliable reviver for this faction. This guide will showcase him in Faction Wars stage 21 and Dungeons (Dragon and Ice Golem) stages 20 and 25. While Hoforees is not a champion suitable for speed runs he can work well in a progression setting.

For his skill kit, his A1 offers a small chance to Stun. It's good to have, but this was not the focus of the build. His A2 provides an Increase Attack and Increase Crit Rate. This works well if you have Attack based damage dealers in your team and worth booking along with the A3. His A3 provides a strong Revive skill on a 5 turn cooldown : He revives 2 random allies with 50% HP and fills their TM to 50%, then places a Strengthen buff on the whole team. Strengthen is a strong defensive buff that improves your team's survivability significantly.

For Masteries, there are many possibile routes. If you want Hoforees to provide some extra damage, Offense tree down to Warmaster is the standard choice. The secondary tree will depends on your needs (improved survivability with Defense tree or Accuracy and Buff extension from the Support). 

In this build a Support build is featured, thus the Defense + Support choice. Defense tree increases his survivability for PvE content, Support tree provides more Accuracy, Buff extension and TM boosts. Lasting Gifts T5 and Timely Intervention T6 are very important for this role to ehance the buffs and allows him to cycle back the revive faster. If you want more Resistance, Unshakeable T6 from the Defense tree is also a viable alternative choice.
data.label: Masteries

data.desc:
As a reviver, Hoforees' main weakness is his lack of self sustain. If you want to keep him alive to ensure he can revive your team, there are 2 options : bring in a healer as an extra support or give him some form of self heal. With that in mind, Hoforees is using an Immortal set and a Regeneration set in this build. 

If you are using a healer alongside him, Speed, Relentless or Reflex can be a good alternative to cycle through his cooldowns faster. For stats 200+ Speed, 2.5-3k Defense and as much HP as possible are wanted. Having some Resistance is also nice to improve survivability. Aim for 300-350 for PvE content.

Gloves : HP%/DEF%
Chest : Resistance/HP%
Boots : Speed
Ring : DEF/HP
Amulet : DEF/HP
Banner : Resistance/HP/DEF

For accessories, Refresh can be good if you want him to have A2 and A3 off cooldown more often, Cleansing can be good if your Resistance is not high enough.
data.label: Gear and stats

data.desc:
Hoforees allows you to beat and farm Faction Wars crypt 21 safely even with a fragile team as showcased here. His revive not being conditional like Reinbeast's makes him a reliable Reviver against the Boss. 

The team consists of:

- Basher for HP aura, Block Buffs debuff and Increase Cooldown 
- Fayne for DPS, Poison, Decrease Defense, Weaken and TM control
- Steelskull for healing, Increase Defense, Poison and single target Cleanse
- Brakus for DPS
- Hoforees for Increase Attack (ideal for Fayne and Brakus) and Revive, especially important against the Boss.

Hoforees allows you to run on full auto, you no longer need to worry about timing Buffs and Debuffs against the boss as you will still clear it regardless.

https://youtu.be/YPnGx_0lGuQ

The next page covers Hoforees in other dungeons
data.label: Notes:

title: Hoforees the Tusked Late Game Dungeon Runs

data.desc:
Hoforees can work perfecly fine for Dungeons stage 20 in a progression setting as showcased here in Ice Golem and Dragon. With his Revive ability having a cooldown of 5 turns and only reviving 2 allies, running him with a Crowd Control champion like Umbral Enchantress is not a bad idea. The rest of the team is pretty typical. Dhukk or Tayrel for Decrease Defense, Kael for AoE and Poison damage and Apothecary for TM and Speed buffs to ensure your team clear these stages comfortably.

The champions are generally interchangable as long as they fit the same roles and can fulfill them well. Kael is usually the first one to be replaced with a better poisoner like Frozen Banshee. DEF Down role can be filled in with budget options like Warmaiden. Hoforees can serve the role of the core enabler and and a safety net in any of those situations.

Dragon 20 : https://youtu.be/iPOIPX3jNvY

Hoforees being strong affinity against the Dragon makes the runs even safer

Ice Golem 20 : https://youtu.be/vEXkTouePXU

Despite being weak affinity, Hoforees still performs his revive role well
data.label: Notes:

data.desc:
Ice Golem 25 is very hard to tank through as the Boss hits very hard. However, being strong affinity against the Boss makes Hoforees an even more outstanding reviver here. He allows the team to clear stage 25 reliably.

The showcased team has :

- Hoforees for Resistance aura, Increase Attack for damage dealers and Revive. In this run, Hoforees had to survive against the Boss many times to revive the team. He is the win condition here.
- Dhukk provides Decrease Defense and Decrease Attack, allowing Hoforees to survive more easily
- Umbral provides AoE Provoke, very needed against waves
- Tyrant provides HP Burn and Ally Protect. HP Burn provides consistent damage against Boss
- Trunda provides DPS and can be replaced easily here

data.desc:
Hoforees also work against the Dragon on stage 25. His Increase Attack and Revive skills are generally useful, allowing him to slot in many different teams. The team showcased is there to support Occult Brawler who will kill the Dragon with his Poisons.

Deacon provides a Speed aura, TM control and Decrease Defense
Abbess provides AoE damage
Occult Brawler provides Poisons
Umbral provides AoE Provoke to keep the enemies from attacking your damage dealers
Hoforees provides an Increase Attack for Abbess. He also revives other champions if needed.

https://youtu.be/oro8wS-O9vQ
